Job Description:
As a Digital Project Manager at Thinkwell Studio Montreal, your role will be to integrate and promote PMI standard project management processes and best practices throughout projects and the company. You will create, maintain and update detailed project plans to drive projects and ensure all of the deliverables are satisfactorily delivered on time and within budget . By collaborating with the product owner, technical leads, development team and clients, the Digital Project Manager will maintain clarity among stakeholders, prevent scope creep, assess risks, implement change requests and ensure the overall success of projects.You will have an in-depth understanding of how technology can help Thinkwell and our clients to achieve our business goals.

Responsibilities
Provide end-to-end project management
Integrate PMI standard project management processes and best practices
Create, maintain and update detailed project plans and artifacts
Scope project requirements, prepare budget and monitor progress
Support the Product Owner on all aspects of the project
Work with the Technical Lead and Technical Director to develop and support project management plans that reflect the technical aspect of projects
Achieve milestones on time and ensure quality standards are met
Maintain organizational process assets including lessons learned register, historical information, risk matrix, etc.
Develop trusted relationships with clients and listen actively to their concerns and questions.
Proactively identify and mitigate project risks
Anticipate and address potential scope creep internally and with client
Facilitate change requests
Regularly communicate project progress with relevant stakeholders
Seek opportunities to improve project management processes within the company via feedback
Lead by example and exemplify the company's Core Values in actions and behaviors
Requirements
5+ years of experience as a web/digital/interactive project manager, ideally in an agile/scrum environment.
Bilingual oral and written (English/French)
PMP Certification
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field
Excellent technical documentation skills
Advanced skills in spreadsheet creation (Excel, Google Sheets)
A working knowledge and/or understanding of new technologies and audio/ video technology in general is an advantage.
Web savvy with a working understanding/experience in SDLC including strategy, requirements definition, design, usability, content development, web development and QA.
Experience with Content Management Systems (CMS)
Able to communicate effectively with programming, test, IT, analysts and architecture personnel.
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal skills.

JOB SUMMARY
Responsible for developing new housing projects, ensuring the sustainability and growth of affordable housing within the Niagara region. Provides oversight on the administration of new developments and providing advice & guidance to housing developers, management, municipal officials and other related stakeholders on program specifics, including compliance with federal & provincial requirements.

EDUCATION
• Diploma from a 3-year college program or University Certification in Construction, Project Management or other related fields

KNOWLEDGE
• 3 years in project management and construction or architectural design, or related field
• 5 years in project management and construction or architectural design, or related field is preferred
• Knowledge of Housing Services Act, Occupational Health & Safety Act, Ontario Fire Code, Ontario Building Code
• Knowledge of budgetary and financial processes, including development of construction budgets
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Project Management, Excel, Word, PowerPoint or other similar software

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Conducting site inspections and providing general project management with general contractors for new developments to ensure quality assurance throughout the life of the project, including but not limited to:

• Monitoring all aspects of new development to ensure compliance with plans, specifications, and Ontario Building Code while ensuring the ongoing cleanliness and safety of the project
• Completing change orders on design plan as needed, escalating to the Manager Housing Programs when required
• Updating the Board and Development Committee through progress reports and inspections assessments at various intervals, ensuring all phases of the new developments are completed on time and on budget
• Ensuring invoices are reflective of the agreement and work completed to-date by managing progress billing
• Project managing & coordinating the general contractor, including, scheduling of meetings & inspections, managing the budget, and negotiating for appropriate resolutions, as required

2. Managing the administration of new developments, such as conducting the necessary research and building the business case for Niagara Regional Housing and provincially funded projects, including but not limited to:

• Conducting the necessary research to build a successful business case, including a thorough needs analysis to identify appropriate location for new build, ensuring the appropriate criteria is met with accessibility by public transportation, zoning, and other requirements
• Developing a business case per the required guidelines for the Board to make an informed decision, including the project budget with build and operating costs, zoning and environmental assessment, building plan, timeline, and an assessment of client/developer eligibility
• Creating RFPQ (RFP qualification) from architectural firms to assess the project feasibility followed by an RFP for the architect firm to be selected; repeating the process for contractors, ultimately ensuring approval from the Development Committee and the Board
• Finding key players for the Development Committee (i.e. planning specialist, finance specialist, and other stakeholders) from each required department
• Maintaining the Ministry system (GOS) and ensuring it is up-to-date with the required documents, milestones and other necessary information
Advising and monitoring new developments of affordable housing with external parties such as Not-For-Profit organizations, agencies, and private developers, including but not limited to:
• Reviewing the administrative process required for the new development and advising to ensure program compliance
• Ensuring the program is sensible in terms of agreements with general contractors, plan specifications, budget and timeline for the parties respective Board approval
• Providing advice and guidance to clients (i.e. housing developers), management, municipal officials and other related stakeholders on program requirements as the program expert , including liaising in the resolution of challenges and issues
• Measuring project milestones to ensure project progress to receive the next round of funding
• Monitoring of all aspects of new development projects to ensure continued compliance with plans, specifications, and Ontario Building Code, and ensuring cleanliness and safety of the project

We are proud to be one of North America’s largest integrated master-planned community homebuilders having built over 15,000 new homes and condominiums. Position Overview

The Quality Assurance Technician will be responsible for inspecting all Low-Rise Projects to ensure it meets with the design and construction elements in compliance with drawings, quality and contract specifications. The Quality Assurance Technician inspects the works at five stages during the build; 1) Foundation 2) Framing 3) Drywall 4) Finishing 5) Final. They will ensure that quality control is carried out according to Empire’s quality standards and practices.

Key Functions & Duties

Responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
• Maintain Empire’s quality standards on all projects.
• Accountable for a thorough inspection from foundation through to final stage. Responsible for the completion of reports, data entry into Newstar and for the updating of construction schedules based on the five inspection points.
• Confirms O&E’s and validates work against any upgrades. Ensure the workmanship is prescribed as in scope of work.
• Inspect the overall conditions of the home and note any damages that need to be addressed.
• Provides clear documentation of findings and results. Submit documentation and communicates results as directed by the Quality Assurance Manager
• Responsible for conducting a thorough final inspection in preparation for the Pre Home Delivery with to the homeowner.
• determine if home has passed inspections at all stages and issue a completion certificate.
• Other duties as may be assigned

Skills and Qualifications

• Minimum 3-5 year’s construction experience.
• High school education or higher required
• Prior work experience as a Project Coordinator in residential construction
• Excellent organizational skills with the ability to recognize and meet deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work within a collaborative team
• Ability to work independently under general guidance and direction
• Knowledge of Ontario Building Code and Health & Safety regulations
• Good knowledge of construction methodology, material and regulations.

Physical Demands

• Ability to carry drawings and diaries as required.
• Ability to use stairs, ladders and climb over rough terrain.
• Work normally requires a high level of physical effort in walking, bending, stooping and climbing.
• Primary work location is site office or project site.
• Project related travel anticipated.
• Exposure to construction work site environment in all seasons.

Job Title: Project Manager (Burnaby, BC or Langley, BC)
Job Description:
You believe in quality work. You see the big picture of a project—from start to finish. You know what is imperative and what can wait. You’re a problem solver who won’t let a project hiccup slow you down. You’re proactive, you pitch in where needed. With intuition and strategic thinking, you prioritize competing demands as you lead your team to deliver on time.

Binnie is looking for Project Managers to join our growing Development & Infrastructure Group, which provides professional services for municipal infrastructure programs, large multi-family housing projects, recreational facilities, and major commercial and industrial developments.

Projects typically include underground infrastructure renewal, drainage improvement and in-stream works, stormwater management and green infrastructure, pump stations and facilities, roadway geometrics and rehabilitation, cycling facilities and pathways, and traffic calming design.

We have full-time positions available in both our Burnaby Office, located near scenic Deer Lake, and our new Langley office, located near Highway 1 and 200th Street Interchange, and the Golden Ears Bridge and Carvolth Bus Exchange with ample parking, amenities and restaurants close by.

You will work with our experienced Senior Project Managers and our talented engineering team to ensure we meet our client needs. This is an excellent opportunity for advancement. You will utilize your excellent client networking and business development skills to secure new business opportunities while maintaining strong relationships with our existing clients.

YOUR ROLE:
Leading civil engineering design work, from the conceptual level through to detailed construction drawings
Acting as the key contact on projects working with stakeholders, consultants, contractors and support staff
Engaging in active business development
Preparing proposals and reports in coordination with our Proposal Team
Developing project schedules and coordinating resources
Monitoring budget and progress on projects
Training under the supervision of our Senior Project Managers
Undertaking quality control procedures and monitoring design standards on completed work
WHAT YOU BRING:
5 to 10 years of related experience in local land development and/or municipal engineering
Registration as a P.Eng. with EGBC, an AScT with ASTTBC, or equivalent
Valid Class 5 Driver’s License and personal vehicle
Exceptional project management, design, and time management skills
Demonstrated team management and delegation skills
Proven conflict resolution capabilities
Strong communication and time management skills and ability to work concurrently on several different projects
Excellent attention to detail to consistently produce accurate, high quality work
Confidence to perform design work with minimal supervision
ABOUT BINNIE:

We are the people behind the infrastructure you use every day. We’re small enough to know each other’s names, and big enough to be where we’re needed. As an employee-owned firm and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, we take pride in our work and are respected as one of the top engineering firms in British Columbia. We support some of the most important infrastructure in the province and beyond.

We’re looking for professionals who want to build careers and communities that last. We can’t do it without you.

THE PERKS:

People come first. We support you with the education, mentoring, and growth opportunities you need to build an interesting career. As an employee-owned firm, we create a clear internal growth path that can keep up with even the most ambitious professionals. Whether it’s soccer or coffee clubs, hockey pool, lunchtime yoga, Movember or Bowling for Big Brothers, everyone can get involved in their own way.

Interested in this job?

Let us know why you want to work at Binnie, and why you would be a fit as our next Project Manager. Submit your application at the link above.

Thank you for your interest in Binnie. We look forward to reviewing your application.

General Duties and Responsibilities
Researching clients and potential clients, procuring of major new projects, building effective relationships with general contractors, owners, developers, architects, engineers, suppliers, and manufacturers at a senior level, advising major clients about new and effective products and services, and actively seeking out new opportunities, projects and clients for Canem.
Managing projects procured in the Branch, reviewing job progress & projection reports on a monthly basis with the project managers, ensuring profitability and achievement of financial goals of large construction projects, directing the project managers for re-design and purchasing major equipment for projects.
Directing preplanning activities to ensure that preplans adhere to Canem philosophies, assign project teams, direct purchasing of materials and tools, directing quality controls on installations and design liabilities, participating in all major project pre-plan meetings and ensuring effective execution of project in accordance with the preplan and project close-out.
Working closely with branch and corporate management in setting and achieving of branch and corporate financial objectives, participating in management of branch staff and responsibilities as assigned by Branch Manager, maximizing profitability of branch and projects by ensuring cost control and effective project management as required
Managing employee relations and resolving of employee concerns and conflicts directly under supervision, providing direction in training of project managers, assistants and assist with the training of foremen, assist with the hiring of field manpower, building positive relationships with project managers, estimators, and assistants, and supervising project managers as assigned by Branch Manager.
Evaluating, and negotiating contracts for all major projects, as assigned by Branch Manager.
Assisting the Estimators in the budgeting process and in closing all major tendered project opportunities to ensure compliance with the Branch Business Plan.
Providing leadership and positive motivation for project staff and company partners by acting as a responsible and goal-oriented team player and leading by example in achieving excellence and being accountable for results and outcomes.
Position Requirements

The Construction Manager position requires a highly experienced, senior manager of commercial, communication and service electrical projects with proven success in managing project and people and achieving excellent business results. The ability to network, market and sell services is a key requirement of this position.

Preferred Qualifications
6 – 8 years experience in managing electrical construction projects
4 – 6 years experience in supervising and leading project management staff
Certification as electrician’s journeyman or relevant degree or diploma
Current knowledge of electrical, building and municipal codes and regulations
Excellent knowledge of industry products, practices and standards
Outstanding sales, marketing and networking skills
Ability to learn quickly, be flexible and adaptable
Strong organizational abilities and demonstrated attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong time management skills, specifically the ability to multi-task and prioritize
Able to work independently and in team environments
Excellent knowledge of and proficiency in required computer programs
SAP knowledge an asset
Knowledge of engineering software and engineering skills an asset
PMP certification considered an asset

Description

DEPUTY CONSTRUCTION MANAGER

REQUISITION NUMBER: TAME-CAED02289237

At Bombardier Transportation, our trains and rail solutions move millions of people safely and reliably around the world, every single day. Join us, and you’ll be part of a global team, sharing knowledge, experience and ideas across countries and cultures, and boosting our reputation as a global leader in rail technology. Your work will have a truly human impact, connecting communities, cities and businesses, and helping people to get where they need to be. It’s all about progress.

Join us as a Deputy Construction Manager and you’ll be looking at a career-defining role based in Edmonton.

As a Deputy Construction Manager, you will Assist the Construction Manager with management of all interfaces between the BT Systems Scope of Work and all the systems, structures and equipment as provided by the DBJV Civil Scope of Work to ensure successful integration.

Your responsibilities will include:
Directly manage a project team including project administrators, schedulers, administrative support personnel and project controllers to ensure the execution of the project is on time and within budget;
Monitor, recommend, and initiate when necessary, changes to or corrective actions for commercial issues, product design, manufacturing and/or services to assure compliance with contract requirements, and to maintain or improve project performance;
Establish and maintain partner interfaces to achieve the goals of the joint venture and system end user. To the fullest extent possible, anticipate and satisfy the partner and end-user needs, while operating within established policies, procedures and commercial guidelines.
Qualifications

Key requirements:
Degree in Civil or Electrical Engineering preferred;
Five (5) years of technical/engineering in a relevant position;
Knowledge of and experience with risk and opportunity assessment tools and in cost recovery management;
Experience and knowledge of Project Management skills, including processes and procedures, customer interface, schedule management, scope management, commercial management, personnel administration, and negotiation;
Experience reading and understanding construction drawings;
Good communication and interpersonal skills, ability to interface internal and external customers, including technicians, engineers and middle / senior management.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

About Bombardier Transportation
Bombardier Transportation is a global mobility solution provider leading the way with the rail industry’s broadest portfolio. It covers the full spectrum of solutions, ranging from trains to sub-systems and signalling to complete turnkey transport systems, e-mobility technology and data-driven maintenance services. Combining technology and performance with empathy, Bombardier Transportation continuously breaks new ground in sustainable mobility by providing integrated solutions that create substantial benefits for operators, passengers and the environment. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, Bombardier Transportation employs around 39,850 people and its products and services operate in over 60 countries.

Bombardier is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.

Tuesday, May 26, 2020

We are proud to be one of North America’s largest integrated master-planned community homebuilders having built over 15,000 new homes and condominiums. We are committed to building excellence and in creating communities that are well located, rich in amenities and full of life. We are proud of our history and excited about our future as we continue to realize our vision to provide families and individuals with a place they can truly call home.

Key Functions & Duties

The Senior Project Manager is responsible for all aspects of project management which includes project start up, obtaining building permits, preparing tenders, budgets, estimates and construction schedules. The position of Senior Project Manager will work with internal and external personnel to ensure project construction is executed in a timely and cost-effective manner while maintaining integrity of design.

Job Duties:
Lead all work activities on assigned high rise construction projects to ensure the design, project specifications, regulations and safety codes are met.
Plan all project timelines, milestones and deliverables. Establish and deliver mechanisms for tracking and communicating project progress.
Lead, develop and assign responsibilities to Assistant Project Managers and/or Project Coordinators to ensure performance standards are met.
Coordinates Site Superintendents and project workforce needs with the Director, Field Operations and the President, High Rise Division.
Liaise with the Site Construction Team on matters impacting the progress of the project to resolve any constructional issues in a timely manner.
Primary liaison with Site Superintendents and Sub-trades.
Work with the Site Construction Team, consultants, sub-trades and suppliers to ensure they are meeting all project contractual obligations.
Oversees and attends regular construction meetings to review schedules/activities associated with the High-Rise Construction division.
Oversee total construction effort to ensure project is constructed in accordance with design budget and schedule.
Interface regularly with Site Construction Team, client representatives, architect representatives, subcontractors, etc.
Identify and resolve conflicts with project teams and associate work; create contingency plans to mitigate risk.
Closely monitor the efforts and billing of third-party workers, such as consultants, contractors and other specialists.
Establish and deliver mechanisms for tracking project progress and reporting.
Manage completion requests and Tenant Occupancy dates and Project close out.
Oversee and ensure that safe work practices and procedures are being followed during site visits.
Oversees and attends regular construction meetings to review schedules/activities associated with the assigned High-Rise Construction projects.
Meets regularly with President, High Rise Division to report on project progress.
Steers project(s) through design, permits and construction phases to deliver on time and within budget.
Skills and Qualifications:
Minimum of Post-secondary Diploma or Degree in building technology or a construction related field.
Minimum of 10 years’ of direct work experience working in residential high rise construction of with 7 years’ of supervisory and project management experience.
Strong management, delegation, planning and leadership skills.
Thorough understanding of construction methods, scheduling and blueprint reading
Excellent communication, integration, problem-solving and interpersonal skills.
Excellent project management skills, including budgeting, scheduling and directing associates work efforts
Ability to deal effectively in demanding situations
Highly effective organizational, planning and time management skills
Results oriented with the ability to interpret and effectively manage multiple and competing priorities and time lines.
Thorough knowledge of Ontario Building Code
Microsoft Office applications, Excel, Word, Outlook Express, MS Project

Excellent time management skills and ability to manage multiple ongoing projects

Ability to consistently maintain a high degree of accuracy and quality in work
ABOUT BINNIE:

We are the people behind the infrastructure you use every day. We’re small enough to know each other’s names, and big enough to be where we’re needed. As an employee-owned firm and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, we take pride in our work and are respected as one of the top engineering firms in British Columbia. We support some of the most important infrastructure in the province and beyond.

Our Construction Managers assume full responsibility for the management of each project assigned through to completion.

What Will You Do

Working under general supervision and in conjunction with Local Team and Area Operations Management; the Construction Manager is responsible for managing a safe and clean worksite; Ensuring project timelines are met; Scope changes are quickly and properly documented; as well as Developing and maintaining Customer and Subcontractor relationships.

In the role of Construction Manager, you will be instrumental in the successful completion of assigned projects. The following metrics define this responsibility:
Projected monthly Revenue variance
Executed Gross Margin (Slippage)
Project cash flow
Timely Project completion
Customer Satisfaction level
How will you do it

Engage in the sales support activities in the early audit process to provide input on vendor/partners selection, scope enhancements, value engineering, risk assessment etc. Prepares cost estimates and project scheduled.

Drive the project scheduling and construction management of assigned projects. Ensure that assigned projects are done accurately, on-time, billed, within budget and within scope of the contract. Maintain profitability goals and positive cash flow for assigned projects.

Understand project scope and customer expectations. Utilize resource planning techniques to gain high productivity from team members.

Plan, schedule and control project activities. Broad knowledge of commercial/contractual complexity/deal structure/financial acumen/supply chain.

Participate in the Area Financial Monthly Project Backlog reviews, as needed.

Develop and adhere to a Project Execution Plan for each assigned project.

Establish customer touch points throughout the life cycle of projects to gain feedback on customer satisfaction. Establish long-term client relationships with customers. Provide leadership by demonstrating focus on exceeding customers’ expectations.

Effectively communicate the status of assigned projects to Local Team and Area Operations Manager as required and provides monthly forecasts of revenue, costs, and gross margin for project execution.

Foster and maintain good working relationships with subcontractors. Foster and maintain good working relationships with JCI internal Systems, Service and Lighting partners.

Ensure compliance with provincial and federal legal requirements.
Ensure business is conducted with the highest ethical standards.
Champion and drive the Safety Program for employees and subcontractors at all levels.

It is essential to have a presence on the construction site during the execution phase. Travel to and from project locations in Quebec is required.

5 to 10 years of experience in construction project management.

Tetra Tech is a leading provider of high-end consulting and engineering services for projects worldwide. With more than 20,000 associates working together, Tetra Tech provides clear solutions to complex problems in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development. Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in over 400 locations around the world. We offer competitive compensation and benefits and are searching for innovative people to join our teams. We are Leading with Science® to provide sustainable and resilient solutions for our clients.

Job Details:

We are currently seeking Construction Managers to join our exciting renewable energy team. The construction managers are to provide construction management leadership and expertise on wind energy construction projects, ensuring that the project meets design intent, as well as meeting schedule and cost objectives. The ideal candidate has civil, mechanical and electrical construction experience and strong skills in managing a diverse group of project participants (client, contractors, regulatory agencies, stakeholders). To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Responsibilities:

Site Coordination
Ensure contractors fully understand their contractual obligations and project requirements
Liaise with contractors to minimize contractor conflict and encourage synergy on multiple contractor work sites.
Identify slow progress, inadequate quality or performance, possible future construction problems and suggest possible solutions.
Project Schedule and Cost Control
Monitor project schedule and costs, update and report as project development proceeds. Take action, as required, to address issues in a proactive manner.
Confirm monthly contract progress payment documents, forecast and manage potential changes.
Construction Monitoring
Monitor and inspect construction to confirm quality and that the constructed works are in conformance with the design.
Review and manage technical submittals (shop drawings, RFI’s, RFC’s and work plans) to confirm conformance with design and quality of work.
Address issues that arise in a timely and cost effective manner.
Effective documentation of progress through daily and weekly reports (with detailed photos).
Equipment Procurement Completion
Monitor the receipt and inspection of major equipment/materials to ensure compliance with technical aspects and commercial terms, facilitate responsibility transfers and acceptance.
Regulatory Compliance and Liaison
Act as the Owner’s representative during construction, responsible for day to day and week to week interface with key stakeholders including regulatory agencies, government (local, municipal to federal), landowners.

Requirements:
Strong construction background, having worked on 2 or more wind projects including experience with wind turbine foundation construction and/or turbine erection/installation.
Construction experience of at least 10 years, capable of working on several major industrial projects simultaneously in a multidiscipline environment.
Prefer an Engineer or appropriately recognized technical designation.

Competitive salaries and benefits

What You’ll Do:

Reporting to Parkwood’s VP of Operations, the Construction Manager role is accountable for The Best Homeowner Experience, adhering to high standards of generally accepted building practices and people care.

· Recruits, hires, evaluates, trains, develops and retains a productive and highly engaged construction/customer service department

· Oversees recruitment, selection, training and continuous evaluation of suppliers, trade partners and design professionals to ensure achievement of quality standards, scheduling deadlines and budgets Ensures effective material usage and proper integration of new products and construction methods

· Oversees warranty department and ensures clear communication between the two departments

· Develops implements and monitors processes to meet the Company’s high standards for quality construction, customer satisfaction and achieving customer touch point objectives

· Responsible for all jobsite compliance programs including training on and implementation of scopes of work, meeting building codes, OH&S

· Oversees all procedures necessary to maintain safe worksites. Implements Safety Program, ensures compliance by all employees, vendors and others who access construction sites and directs investigations and corrective actions for safety lapses

· Implements and monitors systems to ensure that construction schedules are adhered to without compromising quality and safety

· Oversees efficient completion of all construction work ranging from off sites, to 100% completion of homes at closing, to provision of timely and effective customer service

· Makes strategic adjustments to schedules and procedures based on business needs and field conditions

· Leads construction and customer service teams to effectively coordinate with design professionals, sales and marketing, management, trades, permitting authorities and customers to produce quality homes and improvements

· Controls costs and manages quality through efficient scheduling, communication and management of all disciplines

· Designs schedules to accommodate and make necessary adjustments for timely completion of model homes and installation of homebuyer options

· Forecasts schedules and monitors expenditures, analyzes variances, and initiates corrective actions where necessary.

People Care

· Supporting the professional development and career growth of the Parkwood Construction team

· Providing oversight and coaching for the members of the Parkwood Construction team and others across the organization who fulfill construction support functions

· Working with team members to set individual objectives

· Building a cohesive and high functioning team

· Assessing team and individual performance

Who You Are
A minimum of 5 – 10 years’ relevant construction management experience, preferably in the residential construction industry.
College diploma or a combination of post-secondary education and experience
Demonstrated leadership ability
Customer serviced focused with the ability to resolve problems effectively
Ability to set priorities, meet deadlines and manage variable workloads
Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to work in a fast-paced work environment
Excellent interpersonal skills and a collaborative management style.
Self-motivated with ability to work well both in a team and independently

As a Sr. Project Manager, you will be responsible for the concurrent management of multiple major multi-million dollar projects. The Sr. Project Manager provides leadership and direction to project teams comprised of internal and external partners through all phases of projects including budgeting, planning, design, construction, occupancy and closing. The Senior Project Manager will need to maintain an extensive working knowledge of the acceptable procurement policies, procedures, industry standards, finance and administration procedures, and project delivery methodologies.

Key Responsibilities

· Lead and Coordinate the TRC 3yr Capital plan

· Assisting to prepare and oversee the capital budget, and to ensure associated project financial accountability, contract and schedule management, and quality control and assurance

· Work with process owners, senior leaders and relevant stakeholders to define, acquire and direct the necessary resources for project teams as well as project requirements and deliverables

· Liaise with 3rd party vendors/consultants to investigate alternative methods of achieving the project deliverables

· Assist the client with preparing the business case for the project

· Prepare Project Charters, User Requirements Documents, and assist process owners in completing relevant project approval documents

· Develop detailed project Schedules & identify major milestones for successful completion of the project

· Obtain budget level cost estimates for all aspects of the project and prepare the overall project budget

· Assess potential risks and propose risk mitigation strategies

· Work with client and stakeholders to ensure internal resource availability and allocation

· Resolve conflicts to deliver project objectives

· Manage changes to project scope, timing, and/or budget

· Monitor and approve all budgeted project expenditures

· Maintain comprehensive project documentation

· Chair regular meetings with stakeholders to provide status updates and manage progress

· Provide regular status updates to senior leaders

· Escalate issues as required

· Participate in establishing and documenting company wide processes for PMO

· Perform other duties and complete additional projects as assigned, commensurate with job knowledge and experience

Job Requirements

· Bachelor’s degree in science or engineering or a similar degree or related experience

· 3-5 years working experience managing large-scale construction projects, which included site preparation and facility renovations

· PMP Certification

· Advanced knowledge of building and construction, design, construction contract administration and Ontario Building Codes, including advanced understanding of industry practices, or deep expertise in a highly specialized and critical discipline

· Experience with chemical, laboratory and/or pharmaceutical manufacturing processes

· Demonstrated working knowledge of architectural, engineering, and construction practices

· Proven familiarity with design and construction contracts, contract law, public contracting code, and construction claims procedures. Ability to draft modifications to standard agreements consistent with Regental Policy and in coordination with legal counsel

· Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills, including highly effective negotiation skills and highly developed political acumen. Superior written communication skills to prepare clear, concise and professional reports and correspondence

· Strong organizational and time management skills with particular attention to detail and ability to multitask

· Experience preparing and managing budgets

· Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop and implement solutions

· Good critical thinking and analytical skills to proactively identify and resolve problems

· Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence others, foster teamwork, and create a collaborative work environment

· Typically working in an office environment but must spend time on construction sites as required

· May require working during non-standard hours depending on project plans

Working at TRC

Our employees are our best resource! TRC ensures safety always comes first. Our commitment to safety is imperative to delivering high quality products. Our employees also enjoy a group retirement plan, 100% company paid competitive medical and dental benefits, subsidized corporate gym membership with Goodlife Fitness, Monday to Friday working hours, a casual dress code, extended growth opportunities across the TRC & LGC networks and more!

YOUR DAY AS A CLIENT SERVICE MANAGER

Proactively assists Client Executive/ Client Service Manager(s) in managing a book of business by reviewing the client’s exposure and loss history and proposing appropriate coverages and/or solutions.
Assist Client Executive/ Client Service Manager(s) in developing account strategies, presentations and proposals.
Assist Client Executive/ Client Service Manager(s) in ensuring maximum retention of book by providing exceptional client service by regularly contacting existing clients to ensure quality service is being delivered and needs are met and exceeded.
Ensures all client and insurer correspondence is accurate and flows in an efficient manner.
Responds to telephone calls and written inquiries from clients and underwriters in a timely and professional manner.
Markets new business as well as renewals and endorsements in a timely and efficient manner.
Prepares underwriting submissions, client proposals, Cover Notes, Certificates of Insurance etc and maintains appropriate documentation for various accounts and/or correspondence.
Reviews policy wordings and other documentation for accuracy and completeness.
Participates in industry functions and targeted public relations activities.
Maintains extensive market relationships.
Requests and follows up with insurers for quotes, outstanding information, endorsements or policy documentation.
Ensures abeyances and follow ups for outstanding items from underwriters and clients are in place and done.
Collaborates with Client Service Assistants ensuring internal and external documents are accurate and expedited in a timely manner.
Monitors and ensures follow ups on outstanding client accounts receivables.
Works with Accounting to resolve accounting discrepancies and related issues.
Follows BFL policies and procedures, including security and quality procedures, as currently set out and as amended from time to time.
Other miscellaneous duties and special projects as required.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE

Level 2 license
At least 5 years of experience as a Client Service Manager or similar position
FCIP or CIP designation preferred
Must have strong technical knowledge
Must be completely client focused
Good knowledge of markets and their policy wordings
Good quantitative skills and personal computer literacy – strong Word and Excel
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Creative application of products, markets, and alternatives
Ability to independently carry out assignments

PERKS

You will be working in a thriving, progressive and well-established insurance brokerage company
Competitive salary, group insurance benefits, and RRSP matching plans from your first day
A culture that encourages and supports continued education

OFFICE INFORMATION

Founded in 1987 by Barry F. Lorenzetti, BFL CANADA is one of the largest employee-owned and operated Risk Management, Insurance Brokerage, and Employee Benefits consulting services firms in Canada. The firm has a team of over 700 professionals located in eighteen offices across the country. BFL CANADA is a founding Partner of Lockton Global LLP, a Partnership of independent insurance brokers who provide Risk Management, Insurance and Benefits Consulting services in over 130 countries around the world.

Here at BFL our employees have the freedom to demonstrate their own creativity, leadership and entrepreneurship because we strongly believe in them. We are a national collaborative team that thrives in a fast-paced environment.

Our Vancouver office is situated in Coal Harbour, half a block from the world renowned Seawall. Our office is easily accessible for employees by car and public transit and there are bike storage lockers in our building.

Let’s stay in touch: follow us on LinkedIn to see what we are up to and check out our other job openings.

Position Summary

The role of the Microsoft Infrastructure Project Manager is to plan, execute, and finalize projects according to strict deadlines and within budget. This includes acquiring resources and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants in order to deliver projects according to plan. The Project Manager will also define the project’s objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle.

Job Description:

Direct and manage project development from beginning to end.
Conduct project kick-off meetings with the internal team and the project stakeholders.
Effectively schedule the resources that are available for the project.
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.
Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents.
Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis.
Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals.
Draft and submit budget proposals, and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary.
Where required, negotiate with other department managers for the acquisition of required personnel from within the company.
Determine and assess need for additional staff and/or consultants and make the appropriate recruitments if necessary during project cycle.
Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and other stakeholders.
Delegate tasks and responsibilities to appropriate personnel.
Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the project team.
Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path.
Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools.
Track project milestones and deliverables.
Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations.
Determine the frequency and content of status reports from the project team, analyze results, and troubleshoot problem areas.
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans.
Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle.
Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members and contractors, and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.
Build, develop, and grow any business relationships vital to the success of the project.
Conduct project closing meetings, reports, and presentations
Develop best practices and tools for project execution and management.

Résumé de la position

Le rôle du gestionnaire de projets d'infrastructure Microsoft est de planifier, d'exécuter et de finaliser les projets selon des échéances strictes et dans les limites du budget. Cela comprend l’acquisition de ressources et la coordination des efforts des membres de l’équipe et des tiers contractants ou consultants afin de réaliser les projets conformément au plan. Le responsable du projet définira également les objectifs du projet et supervisera le contrôle de la qualité tout au long de son cycle de vie.

Description de l'emploi:

Diriger et gérer le développement du projet du début à la fin.
Organisez des réunions de lancement du projet avec l'équipe interne et les parties prenantes du projet.
Planifiez efficacement les ressources disponibles pour le projet.
Définir la portée du projet, les objectifs et les produits livrables qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'entreprise en collaboration avec la direction et les parties prenantes.
Développer des plans de projet à grande échelle et les documents de communication associés.
Communiquer efficacement les attentes du projet aux membres de l'équipe et aux parties prenantes de manière claire et en temps opportun.
Assurer une liaison permanente avec les parties prenantes du projet.
Estimer les ressources et les participants nécessaires pour atteindre les objectifs du projet.
Rédiger et soumettre des propositions de budget, et recommander des modifications budgétaires ultérieures si nécessaire.
Si nécessaire, négociez avec d'autres responsables de département pour l'acquisition du personnel requis au sein de l'entreprise.
Déterminer et évaluer les besoins en personnel et / ou en consultants supplémentaires et procéder aux recrutements appropriés si nécessaire au cours du cycle du projet.
Définir et gérer en permanence les attentes du projet avec les membres de l'équipe et les autres parties prenantes.
Déléguer des tâches et des responsabilités au personnel approprié.
Identifier et résoudre les problèmes et les conflits au sein de l'équipe de projet.
Identifier et gérer les dépendances du projet et le chemin critique.
Planifiez et programmez les échéanciers et les jalons du projet à l'aide des outils appropriés.
Suivre les jalons et les produits livrables du projet.
Élaborer et publier des rapports d'avancement, des propositions, des documents sur les exigences et des présentations.
Déterminez la fréquence et le contenu des rapports de statut de l'équipe de projet, analysez les résultats et résolvez les problèmes.
Gérer de manière proactive les changements dans la portée du projet, identifier les crises potentielles et élaborer des plans d'urgence.
Définir les critères de réussite du projet et les diffuser aux parties impliquées tout au long du cycle de vie du projet.
Encadrer, guider, motiver et superviser les membres de l'équipe de projet et les sous-traitants, et les inciter à prendre des mesures positives et à rendre compte de leur travail.
Établissez, développez et développez toutes les relations commerciales essentielles au succès du projet.
Organiser des réunions de clôture de projet, des rapports et des présentations.
Développer les meilleures pratiques et outils pour l’exécution et la gestion de projets.
Compétences:
Expérience avec la gestion de SharePoint 2013 directement dans SharePoint Online.
Plus de 5 années d'expérience SharePoint avec SharePoint 2007, 2010, 2013 et SharePoint Online.
Expérience avec SharePoint, dans la migration manuelle de contenu et de l'utilisation d'outils de migration automatique (ex: Metalogix) permettant de bien comprendre l'expérience de Remediations Direct migrant de SharePoint 2013 sur site / hébergé vers SharePoint en ligne
Expérience avec SharePoint sur infrastructure Azure & Azure et / ou expérience avec la construction de solutions SharePoint, la gestion des autorisations et l'administration.
Connaissance et expérience de la mise en œuvre de solutions d'entreprise dans SharePoint.
Vaste base de connaissances sur Office 365, SharePoint Online
Expérience avec les équipes de conception et de mise en œuvre pour Office 365 et les technologies associées, y compris, sans toutefois s'y limiter, SharePoint, Active Directory et les services ADFS (Active Directory Federation Services), la synchronisation Active Directory.
Expérience et / ou compréhension approfondie de la pile de collaboration Microsoft, notamment Office 365, Skype Entreprise et SharePoint en ligne.
Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle directe dans une capacité de gestion de projet, incluant tous les aspects du développement et de l'exécution de processus.
Bonne connaissance des logiciels de gestion de projets, tels que Microsoft Project
Compréhension compétente et compétente de la technologie Microsoft.
Expérience confirmée de la gestion du personnel.
Une expérience de travail indépendant et dans un environnement de collaboration axé sur l’équipe est essentielle.
Excellentes compétences en communication et en organisation
Excellentes compétences verbales et écrites en anglais et en français
Capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois, à sortir des sentiers battus, à penser debout et à résoudre les problèmes
Capacité à travailler avec tout type de personnes et à pouvoir visualiser un événement non seulement du début à la fin, mais également les étapes à suivre pour le réaliser.
Capacité à diriger et à travailler en équipe
Connaissances techniques notamment dans le domaine des infrastructures Microsoft
Atout:
Solide connaissance pratique des technologies d'infrastructure Microsoft actuelles, notamment Active Directory, Microsoft 365, System Center, etc
Certifications en gestion de projet telles que PMP ou Prince 2
Diplôme universitaire ou diplôme d'études collégiales dans les domaines de l'informatique, de l'ingénierie ou de la gestion de projets.

Financeit is a market leading point-of-sale payment plan provider, focused on the home improvement industry, but also with clients in the vehicle and retail industries. We specialize in payment plans, but our end-to-end suite of workflow and lead management solutions give some of North America’s largest enterprise businesses, big box retailers, OEMs, and dealer networks the technological edge they need to stay ahead of the competition.

What YOU Will Do

Sommaire du poste

Pomerleau recherche activement un adjoint
gestionnaire de contrat conception / construction pour un tout nouveau projet
majeur en infrastructure réalisé en mode alternatif (conception-construction et
partenariats public-privé (PPP)).

L’Adjoint gestionnaire de contrat conception
/ construction supportera le gestionnaire de contrat conception / construction dans
la mise en œuvre de la stratégie de gestion du contrat principal de
conception-construction afin de faire valoir nos droits auprès du client et de
s’assurer que nous respectons nos obligations. En parallèle, il participera à
la mise en place et au suivi, sur le plan administratif et légal, des contrats
de fourniture et de sous-traitance. Par son implication sur un projet majeur, l’adjoint
gestionnaire de contrat conception / construction œuvre également à bâtir et à
maintenir des relations d’affaires solides avec les différents clients et
partenaires d’affaires de l’entreprise.

Principales responsabilités :
Assurer l’administration du contrat principal et des sous-contrats;
Mettre en œuvre la stratégie de gestion du contrat de Conception construction;
Travailler en interface avec les équipes de construction pour valoriser sur le plan contractuel les évènements venant perturber l’exécution du projet;
Veiller au respect de nos droits et obligations au titre du contrat principal;
Bâtir et rédiger des dossiers permettant d’obtenir des indemnisations en termes de coûts et de délais de la part du client principal;
Faire l’analyse contractuelle et légale des offres des prestataires, sous-traitants et fournisseurs
Gérer de l’information relative aux offres complexes;
Assurer la coordination avec les différents partenaires du projet
Interagir et représenter l’entreprise (ou le consortium) auprès des partenaires, des sous-traitants et des autres parties prenantes du projets;
Identifier en continu les risques du projet, incluant la mise en œuvre des mesures de mitigation et l’analyse quantitative des risques résiduels (avec le support du spécialiste en gestion des risques);
What YOU Will Bring

· Posséder un minimum de 2 années d’expérience professionnelles en gestion
contractuelle.
· Être titulaire d’un diplôme de second cycle universitaire en gestion de
projets ou en administration des affaires ou en droit.

Atouts :

· Posséder des connaissances techniques en génie civil, en infrastructures
ou en bâtiment (conception ou construction);
· Avoir été impliqué dans un processus d’appel d’offres de propositions ou
d’octroi de contrat pour un ou plusieurs projets réalisés en mode
conception-construction ou partenariat public-privé (PPP)

As Project Manager you will be responsible for all aspects of managing an implementation of FreeBalance Government Accountability Software using solid project management principles and applying technology to government business operations. Management of a project software implementation

Use effective leadership skills to direct all phases of programs from inception through completion to include planning, evaluating whether working as a team or independently

Job Title: Heavy Civil Project Manager - Mid to Senior Level
Job Description:
Emil Anderson Construction (EAC) is an award winning integrated construction company with over 70 years experience successfully completing road and bridge building, paving and industrial projects throughout BC.

As a family-owned and people focused company we strive to train and develop the best leaders in our industry. We provide a culture of learning, open communication, professionalism, respect and accountability. We are seeking a Heavy Civil Project Manager (mid to senior level) for our civil construction division based in Kelowna, BC. This is an opportunity to influence our future and make a difference in our companys success.

Responsibilities:

· Provide positive safety and quality leadership throughout the duration of the project.

· Represent the company as the commercial point of contact for the client, acting in the companys best interest, while maintaining positive relationships with the client.

· Ensure project deliverables and plans are prepared and issued to the client in accordance with the contract requirements.

· Develop and monitor resource requirements for the project, coordinating with other personnel and operating divisions to optimize corporate resource utilization.

· Negotiate and manger major vendor contracts and subcontracts.

· Identify changes to scope of work, and manage the change process is a proactive, and collaborative manner.

· Regularly monitor and review project cost variances, providing feedback to project teams as appropriate, and reporting job performance to the Operations Manager.

· Develop, maintain, and drive the construction schedule.

· Confer with project personnel to provide technical advice and resolves problems proactively.

· Identify constructability issues in moderately complex situations and develop solutions to the construction plan and schedule where applicable.

· Evaluate workmanship and quality and abide by the company Quality Management program.

· Mentor and lead operations staff on site.

Qualifications:

· As a personal core value, have an unwavering commitment to a culture of zero incidents;

· A minimum of 5 years, preferably 10 years, of Project Management experience managing road and civil construction projects ranging in value from $2M to $50M;

· Experience managing self-perform operations in a unionized environment;

· Bachelors degree in engineering or construction management, or civil technologist diploma;

· Strong knowledge of construction disciplines, cost control, scheduling and safety regulations;

· Ability to take on unique challenges daily, with the responsibility of keeping a project on schedule and in budget;

· Demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment;

· Strong organizational skills;

· Strong written and verbal communication skills;

· Willing to travel out of town;

· Knowledge of WorkSafeBC Health & Safety legislation and regulations;

· Must possess a vaild class 5 drivers license and clean drivers abstract;

Emil Anderson Construction thanks all applicants for their interest in the position, however only those under consideration for the position will be contacted. For more information about our company and future employment opportunities please visit our website at www.eac.bc.ca.

About Behavox


We are a fast growing and pioneering people analytics company that is transforming the financial workplace. We use cutting-edge software and machine learning to generate previously unidentifiable insights into employee behavior and performance. We have been recognized by renowned companies such as Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud for our achievements in AI, big data analytics, and machine learning. We have also been included in the Forbes FinTech 50, CB Insights AI 100, and Tech Nation's prestigious Future 50 program.

Our goal is to help businesses achieve better outcomes by developing and delivering data-driven solutions for compliance, CRM, HR, and workplace productivity. We also aim to rapidly expand our worldwide customer base to include companies across all major industries.

About the role


The Project Management Team is responsible for enabling and enforcing, seamless delivery of the Behavox Platform with a high degree of efficiency and quality across our large and diverse customer base.

As a Project Manager, you will work alongside members of our revenue organization to lead the end-to-end execution of technical and business focused deliverables. You will be responsible for driving decisions to ensure the delivery team can effectively execute project plans. Your success will be measured by transparent KPIs and your ability to demonstrate the Behavox core values.

This is a unique opportunity to work with front-line experts in AI, machine learning, software engineering, and leaders in the financial industry.

Ideal candidate profile
Proven project management skills, having successfully delivered large enterprise scale projects (across multiple geographies, managing third party vendors, with 10+ team members) with an overall 3-5 years of experience.
High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing priorities and project support requests simultaneously.
Exhibit discipline necessary to achieve excellence while adhering to the boundaries of the statement of work.
Assertive and articulate communication skills.
Courage, resolve and strength of character needed to thrive in challenging situations.
What we offer
Innovative, dynamic, and collaborative team;
Competitive salary;
Annual bonus contingent on performance;
Fully covered health benefits.
Selection Process


Selected candidates will be invited for a phone interview to discuss their skills, experiences, and interests. Promising candidates will be invited to meet the Behavox team and deliver a presentation. Those who demonstrate the highest potential will be invited for a final executive-level interview.

Full-time

AbCellera is a young, energetic and rapidly growing company. We’re looking for a project manager to work with our scientists, partners and collaborators to push the frontiers of science. Our ideal candidate is someone with demonstrated experience in managing large-scale projects with cross-functional teams; who is adept at juggling multiple competing priorities; who enjoys finding creative solutions to unexpected challenges; and who takes pride in the order of a well-crafted Gantt chart. If you’re self-motivated, supremely organized, a team builder, and you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

How you might spend your days:
Managing project applications or work plan development; establishing project plans, budgets, milestones, deadlines, objectives
Coordinating the launch of new projects
Monitoring and reporting on project progress and finances
Performing risk assessments and developing mitigation strategies
Managing changes to the project within the constraints of scope, timeline and costs as required
Developing and improving project management processes and guidelines
Facilitating internal project meetings, or meetings with partners
Working with the Business Development, Finance, Operations, Legal and other teams as appropriate
Working with the Safety Officer and regulatory agencies to ensure compliance and safety
Closing out completed projects

We’d love to hear from you if:
You have a M.Sc. or PhD in a STEM-related field
You have some project management experience in the biotech industry or in an academic research environment, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
You are friendly and personable with excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
You have excellent organizational skills with impeccable attention to detail
You are adaptable and have the analytical skills to respond to rapidly changing priorities
You love to solve problems both big and small, and have a can-do attitude
You have demonstrated leadership skills

Offers & benefits:
The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefits
A minimum of 3 weeks’ vacation
A place in our beautiful office in Vancouver, BC, Canada (just off Cambie Street, with plenty of good lunch options nearby)
Opportunities for personal and professional development

About AbCellera:
At AbCellera, we find the next generation of therapeutic antibodies. To succeed, we create innovative solutions for our partners - combining custom antigen preparation and immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation - leaving no stone unturned and revolutionizing how scientists can explore natural antibody diversity and the scale at which they can do it. You’ll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.

We’re a growing company with state-of-the-art discovery tools and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn’t just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of innovators working together to solve the toughest problems. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We’re looking for someone like you to support and organize our efforts along the way.

To apply:
Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 1031 in your cover letter. We apologize in advance, but we receive a large volume of applications and are only able to contact those who are selected for an interview.

Project Details:

The Project Manager is required to manage all of the day-to-day program and technical matters that are related to initiating a program to implement Unique Identification (UID) to all serially managed materiel across the Department of National Defence to improve accountability and life cycle management of these items. This program is in support of the implementation of Automatic Identification Technology (AIT). The PM is to carry out the necessary authority to coordinate work from Contractor personnel and other resources, including sub-contractors, to carry out the Program.

Required Experience:
• Minimum 5 years experience within the last fifteen years as a Project Manager, preforming duties in relation to Data Remediation Services and Item Marking Services
• A successfully completed University degree
• A Valid Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification or equivalent
• Proven experience working on two large scale projects (minimum 6 consecutive moths on each project) Large scale is defined as a budget of $10M CDN or more.

PMP Equivalency:
Equivalent is defined as PMI Program Management Professional (PgMP), CompTIA Project+, Projects in Controlled Environments (PRINCE 2), American Academy of Project Management, Australian Institute of Project Management (AIPM), International Project Management Association (IPMA) or Masters in Project Management from a recognized university.
Preferred Experience:
• Experience managing the implementation of a STANAG 2290 or MIL-STD-130 compliant Unique Identification marking program

Type of assignment:
This is a full-time contract with the possibility of renewal or extension.
