We're building the most user-friendly and advanced devices and platform that bring peace of mind to seniors and their loved ones. At the moment, we are seeking a passionate Project Manager to extend our existing team.

The Project Manager will be an experienced leader and facilitator who is ambitious, organized, detailed oriented and enjoys developing business procedure and process to eliminate uncertainties. An excellent project manager, they will communicate seamlessly with all levels of the organization. They will be adept at simplifying actions, resolving conflicts, managing relationships and influencing others to accomplish at the highest level.

Responsibilities:

· Managing all aspect of the project and delivering the product to production; including requirements generation, hardware, firmware, software, documentation, regulatory testing.

· Constantly keeping all stakeholders informed of project status

· It is expected that projects should be managed with minimal supervision.

· Working with all internal engineering team such as hardware, firmware, software, marketing, mechanical, and sales to plan, create and execute schedules and deadlines.

· Manages and organizes all product development activities and makes all Buy, Build or Partner decisions.

· Manage all required testing of product features and performance.

· Document all aspect of project and communicate with all stakeholders

· Help the engineering team with technical documentation such as manuals, help documents, and support documents.

· Track industry technology developments, supplier roadmaps, standards bodies and make product recommendations.

· Establishes the design, technology, product development, and vendor strategy and workflow

· Manage and label product samples throughout the development process, receive and review final production samples with product team for approval.

· Schedule and manage weekly meetings with to review project status and outstanding issues.

· Maintain detailed spreadsheets with product specs, costing and timeline for all projects

· Manage product certification processes for FCC, IC, PTCRB, and more

· Manage and deploy modifications and improvements with vendors if defects are found

· Ensuring finish products are meeting the company standards, quality, product requirements and specifications

· Ensures that product labeling and packaging meeting marketing requirements

·

Requirements

· You should have a Bachelor’s Degree and Engineering background with significant hands-on experience in product development.

· 3-4 years of experience in developing consumer electronic products from concept to volume production.

· Must be self-motivated and result oriented.

· Strong background in developing products in the embedded environment.

· Have a strong knowledge of product development concepts, practices, and procedures.

· Effective organization, project management, and coordination skills.

· Proactive in taking ownership of issues and driving to resolution.

· Manage risks and prepare mitigation plans.

· Good communication skills, both written and verbal.

· Familiar with electronic components, products, and current technologies.

· Ability to read and understand technical documentation.

· Knowledgeable in working with CM, OEM, and sourcing with suppliers in Asia.

· Familiar with Quality Control procedures.

· Must be team player and able to work alone.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

SUBNET Solutions Inc. is a software solutions company headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, with offices in Edmonton, Alberta, the United States, South Africa, and Australia. We integrate cyber-security, operational technologies, and distributed system techniques together when developing solutions to these problems.

It is the essential function of the Project Manager to ensure that the cyber-security software solutions we provide are delivered on-time, on-scope, and on-budget. The Project Manager does this by coordinating all internal and external activities throughout the lifecycle of the project.

Successful Project Managers at SUBNET Solutions Inc. are organized, self-motivated, and have a passion for excellence. You will need to work well in a fast-paced environment, traverse various technologies, engineering teams, and client types.

Project Managers report to the Project Manager Team Lead.

Construction Superintendent

As Construction Superintendent, you will oversee the entire construction process on site. You are responsible for creating and monitoring project momentum, scheduling, quality control, safety, and delegating work to the project team and sub-contractors. The Construction Superintendent is an essential part of the project team and is a dynamic leader who can manage people just as effectively as construction activities. The Construction Superintendent reports directly to the General Superintendent who oversees the performance of all of our projects.

Ventana typically has 20-25 projects under construction at any given time, and we build a variety of projects including multi-family residential, commercial, industrial, institutional, civic, and green buildings – LEED® certified. Being a part of Ventana means working on a variety of interesting projects including breweries and recreation complexes, working with a supportive team, and being proud to say “we built that”.


Construction Superintendent Responsibilities:

Documentation, Reporting and Risk Management
Review documents and drawings for accuracy and constructability
Review and enforce sub-contractor contracts and identify discrepancies in scopes of work
Advise project team of potential problems, work interferences, and schedule difficulties, while assisting in resolving conflicts
Maintain solid documentation, complete daily site reports, POs, and project photos
Manage all required municipal and provincial inspections
Budget & Cost Control
Review the budget and the underlying estimate to understand the project, and plan ahead to avoid costly issues and project delays
Effectively monitor expenditures, review invoices in detail, and manage labour and material costs
Scheduling
Prepare and maintain construction schedules, and identify and solve potential scheduling problems, and advise Project Manager of any deviations or potential deviations from the overall schedule or critical path
Order materials and equipment, and request sufficient manpower throughout the project to maintain schedule and productivity
Health & Safety
Promote a safe and healthy work environment for all personnel on site, monitor safety performance, and oversee the Site HSE Coordinator
Quality
Adhere to Ventana's quality standards, monitor the performance of sub-contractors, and implement techniques to ensure quality issues are addressed proactively,
Relationships & Leadership
Supervise and develop site team members through regular feedback, training, and coaching
Lead project meetings with internal and external parties
Maintain Ventana's professional image and keep a clean and organized job site and site office

Project Superintendent Qualifications:
8+ years of construction supervision experience
Trade background with progressive experience in General Contracting
Demonstrated competence in the areas of safety, people management, project execution, cost control, quality, and administration

Competitive salary, plus potential bonus & profit sharing
Matching RRSP
Extended benefits, Employee Assistance Program, life insurance, AD&D, LTD, CI
3 weeks of paid vacation
Professional development support
Lunch provided once per month
We get together often for company-wide social events
COR certified

Nutaq is an international company that provides innovative solutions for advanced digital signal processing (“DSP”) solutions and wireless technologies, including software defined radios (“SDR”).

By joining our team, you will have the following responsibilities:

Participate to the development process of the project (proposals);
Start, follow and participate to research & development projects, from the conceptualization to the production
Manage the budgets, deadlines, risks and deliverables of the projects under your responsibility
Interact with the customers (both internal & external) about the technical aspects of the projects under your responsibility
Manage the sub-contractors implicated in the project when necessary
Ensure an efficient transfer from R&D to production and coordinate when necessary the certification (UL, CE, FCC) of the product.

To fulfill this position, we are looking for a bilingual candidate with a university degree in electrical or computer engineering, three to five years of experience in project management, ideally in a production environment or in OEM products development environment, a deep knowledge of hardware (example: FPGA, schematic, ..) and software (C, Python) build-up. The applicant must also have seven to ten years of experience in the field of electronics and high technologies.

The knowledge of the products’ development process is an important asset. A certification in management or being a member of the Quebec’s Professional Association of Project Managers is also an important asset. The ideal candidate is resourceful, shows leadership, works well in a team and has great communication skills.

This position is an excellent opportunity to join Nutaq, a dynamic organization that is growing fast.

To apply for this position, please send your résumé by email at jobs@nutaq.com with the job title as the subject.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest towards our organization. However, only suitable applicants will be contacted.

This position is offered without restrictions to women and men alike. Nutaq subscribes to equal access to employment practices.

Chargé de projets

Nutaq, entreprise internationale en haute technologie, se spécialise dans le développement et la production de solutions novatrices dans les domaines des communications sans-fils en traitement de signaux numériques. L’entreprise compte sur une clientèle impressionnante tant par sa renommée que par son potentiel d’affaires. Le volet international de l’entreprise lui permet aussi d’être à la fine pointe des besoins de ces marchés émergents.

En vous joignant à notre équipe, vous aurez notamment les responsabilités suivantes :

Participer au processus d’élaboration des projets (propositions);
Effectuer le démarrage, le suivi et l’exécution de projets de recherche et développement, de la conception à la fabrication.
Gérer les budgets, les échéanciers, les risques et les livrables des projets sous votre responsabilité.
Interagir avec les clients (internes et externes) au sujet des aspects techniques des projets sous votre responsabilité.
Gérer les sous-traitants du projet, lorsque nécessaire.
Assurer un suivi du transfert à la production efficace du produit, et coordonner lorsque nécessaire la certification (UL, CE, FCC) du produit.

Pour combler ce poste, nous recherchons une personne bilingue qui possède une formation universitaire en génie électrique ou informatique, 3 à 5 années d’expérience en gestion de projets, idéalement dans un environnement de mise en production, ou de développement de produits OEM, et une connaissance avancée de la conception matérielle (par exemple, la schématique, FPGA) et logicielle (C, Python). La personne doit également posséder une expérience pertinente de 7 à 10 ans dans le domaine de l’électronique et des hautes technologies.

La connaissance du processus de développement de produits constitue un atout certain. Une formation en gestion et/ou être membre du PMI peut également être un atout important. De plus, le candidat recherché possède un bon sens de la débrouillardise et du leadership, une grande capacité à travailler en équipe et est un bon communicateur.

Cette offre est une excellente occasion de joindre Nutaq, une organisation dynamique et en pleine croissance!

Pour soumettre votre candidature, veuillez nous envoyer votre curriculum vitae par courrier électronique à jobs@nutaq.com.

Nous aimerions remercier tous les candidats de leur intérêt pour notre organisation. Cependant, nous ne communiquerons seulement qu’avec ceux qui seront retenus.

Ce poste s’adresse aux hommes et aux femmes; le genre masculin est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et uniquement dans le but d’alléger le texte.

Company Background:

CLEARGOALS was established in 2008 and is a privately held corporation that supports both the IBM Marketing technology stack and the Adobe Marketing Cloud products. We are a unique consultancy in that we provide traditional enterprise software services (implementation, training and configuration) along with marketing agency programs and staff augmentation for marketing departments.

We work with companies to ensure that they have the best marketing processes in place using the right enterprise technology and tools. We provide best practices and the knowledge, skills, training, and discipline to their marketing teams to ensure their success. We create a marketing technology roadmap to ensure ROI.

Cleargoals official website: https://cleargoals.com/

Position Summary:

As a Project Manager (PM), you are responsible for ensuring ongoing project success for our clients in planning, managing and executing projects related to marketing technology. While working within the strategic direction set by senior management, the PM will manage client relationships and work closely with various teams of Business Solution Architects, Business Solutions Consultants and Developers to manage work streams, tasks and execution of projects to ensure deliverables and deadlines are met within project scope, timeline and budget.

Responsibilities:
Project initiation, planning; executing; monitoring; closing
Coordinate and facilitate project assessments, Statement of Work (SOW) and Kick-off meetings
Work directly with teams to: Initiate project work, manage client workflow and prioritization, attend appropriate client meetings, track project milestones and costs, provide quality assurance and quality control of projects, and complete reporting on all projects
Participate in requirement reviews, solution overviews with Business Solution Architects, and design reviews to understand campaign objectives / automation / product configuration requirements to build and implement Software products / SaaS vendors (i.e.: IBM, Adobe and Sprinklr) for Enterprise Marketing and Customer experience applications
Work closely with Principal Business Architects and Principal Consultants, gather the project specifications (functional analysis, configuration, Object Oriented analysis, UI specs, asset life cycle management), provide subsequent data mappings, modeling and conversion mapping
Work closely with Principal Architects and Principal Consultants plan and manage Quality Assurance process (test-case and scenarios, functional and application test and User Acceptance Test (UAT))
Act as a relay between the senior technical team and the clients in the overall deployment of project
Contribute to building and tracking of project financials, resource planning and risk planning to ensure project profitability is obtained
Coach and monitor utilization of PMP platforms
Act as a mentor and support to the project team in delivering high quality solutions
Solve complex problems by applying and / or adapting existing methods and procedures
Use own judgement for optimal resolution
Manage medium-size teams and monitor their work efforts
Requirements

Education & Experience
A bachelor's degree or college diploma in preferably an IT field or Engineering; or equivalent experience
2 + years of experience in IT Management, Systems Analysis and/or Business Analyst in a related field
Experience in using at least one well-defined Project Methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, PRINCE2, etc.
Functional knowledge of Software Development Process / SaaS implementations and all facets of Project management (tasks management, time management, cost management, quality management, change management, risk & issue management throughout the project lifecycle)
History of working directly with clients and building long-term relationships
Track record of successful project delivery with effective reporting and communication on project status
Strong communication skills and ability to manage / prioritize multiple software development projects as well as manage stakeholders’ (internal and external) expectations
Propose areas for improvement (BPI / BPR)
Exposure to data modeling principles and database behavior, thorough understanding of the business analysis process
Good understanding of system integration and its requirements
Knowledge of business software such as Microsoft Office Suite, google products, Mavenlink, Zendesk and Smartsheets.
PMP Certification preferred
Experience in deploying CRM preferred
A strong plus
Experience in Campaign Management, Marketing Operations and Marketing Automation
Experience in software development industry
Experience with campaign design, development of digital marketing strategies, creation, implementation, and management
Working with an email marketing platform
Skills and Abilities
Ability to multi-task and work with multiple accounts (customers) at the same time
Highly motivated with a solution-oriented attitude
Ability to manage expectations, both internally and externally
Interpersonal skills to ensure that all resources work as a team, and demonstrate a "can do" work attitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail, solid organizational and time management skills
Willingness to learn and go above and beyond
* Other duties and functions may be added as the role expands or business needs shift

The Project Manager will be versed with the development process and will be responsible for steering product development teams to deliver on project objectives. In addition, will liaise with the internal and external customers, to provide best solutions to the development and manufacturing needs of our business partners.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for promoting and maintaining safe and healthy working conditions in his / her assigned work area; instructs and enforces compliance with established safe work practices and procedures; ensures assigned trainees receive appropriate training and information necessary to conduct their activities in a safe and healthy manner.

Facilitates effective communication between the external customers and the internal technical team to ensure mutual understanding of requirements, priorities, timeliness, limitations, perspectives and positions.
Establishes project milestones, effectively manages project timelines, and ensures that the resources assigned to projects are adequate to meet project objectives.

Establish and maintain functionally integrated project schedules to enable accurate project and financial analysis and ensures inputs are provided to the management for accurate business planning processes.
Monitors project deliverables against plan and works with project teams to identify risks, contingencies and alternatives to maintain project schedule.

Identifies, recommends and implements opportunities for streamlining or other efficiency/improvements for teams and business processes.

Responsible for the efficient utilization of resources and supplies to reduce waste and achieve cost containment and Lean objectives.

Those who join Emergent BioSolutions feel a sense of ownership about their future. You will excel in an environment characterized by respect, innovation and growth opportunities. Here, you will join passionate professionals who advance their scientific, technical and professional skills to develop products designed-to protect life.

PROJECT MANAGER (PROJECT SPECIALIST)

Emergent BioSolutions is currently seeking a Project Manager (Project Specialist) in our Winnipeg office. The successful candidate will have a minimum of post-secondary education, a minimum of 2 years of Project Management experience and one to three years of relevant experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry The ideal candidate will have solid leadership and interpersonal skills combined with strong written and presentation skills and have the ability to negotiate. In addition, this individual will possess a strong work ethic and a commitment to excellence and innovation.

THE COMPANY

Emergent BioSolutions is dedicated to one simple mission—to protect and enhance life.

As a global specialty pharmaceutical company, Emergent offers specialized products to healthcare providers and governments to address medical needs and emerging health threats.

We value the diversity that each employee brings, and while we look for people who share our Core Values, we thrive on difference as well. With hundreds of talented employees working around the globe, Emergent is a growing organization with a wide variety of scientific, technical and professional career opportunities worldwide.

THE OPPORTUNITY

The Project Manager leads diverse projects involving cross-functional teams focused on the successful completion of new or existing projects. This will include development of plans, providing direction of schedules, and monitoring budgets and spending. In addition, the Project Manager will lead the project/program from initiation through completion. The Project Manager organizes interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/program on schedule and within budget constraints.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for the management of project(s):
Manages single or multiple complex projects.
Develop project plan documents including Technical Baseline, Risk Management Plan and Gantt charts to meet long-term project goals. Identify, report, and document changes to the project.
Build and lead cross-functional project teams to implement the project plan to achieve project deliverables, timelines, and budgets.
Manage the contractual, technical and financial requirements of each project with general instructions
Monitor and manage day-to-day aspects of project and scope, including regular meetings, minutes and reporting with general supervision.
Review and evaluation of deliverables prepared by the project team, lead communication and delivery to the sponsor/client and is responsible for resolving difficult problems to meet the deliverables.
Lead the cross-functional teams to identify project issues and the development of risk mitigation strategies and implementation plans; recognize problems, evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions.
Responsible for the financial aspect of the project:
Manage and monitor project budgets and/or revenues, including reforecasting.
Review the appropriate financial reports to identify and report any variances.
Monitor the scope of the projects and identify and report on potential changes that may have an impact to quality, time or cost.
Responsible for regular effective project reporting to Senior Managers and internal and external sponsors/clients:
Develop and deliver engaging, informative and well-organized presentations.
Provide regular updates and recommendations on the project status, including milestones achieved, mitigation plans for identified delays or risks, and changes in project scope and project financials.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed by those in this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties, and other duties may be assigned.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:
Qualified candidates will have a minimum of post-secondary education, preferably in Business or Science related fields.
A minimum of 2 years of Project Management experience and one to three years of relevant experience in Pharmaceuticals or Biotechnology industry is preferred.
Solid leadership and interpersonal skills, combined with strong written and presentation skills, and the ability to negotiate and positively influence peers in multiple disciplines are requirements.
Must be results oriented, flexible, demonstrate a significant level of initiative, and have the ability to comprehend detailed and complex technical, financial, and contractual issues.
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Citizenship/Permanent Resident or Valid Work Permit.
Successful Completion of a Criminal Record Check.

Job description
Murex is a recognized global leader in software development for trading, risk management and processing. Every day banks, asset managers, corporations and utilities, across the world, rely on Murex people and Murex solutions to support their capital markets activities. Our motto “pioneering again” sums it all up: since its creation, Murex has reinvented itself time and again to adapt to capital markets revolutions – each time offering innovative software solutions to the industry.

Over 2200 specialists are located across our 17 offices: Beijing, Beirut, Dubai, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Moscow, New York, Paris, Sao Paulo, Santiago, Seoul, Singapore, Sydney, Tokyo, and Toronto.

Why join us:

Murex is the right place for you if you are looking to work alongside other bright and motivated individuals in an environment where collaboration, ownership and creativity are highly valued. We believe in empowering our people to take the reins in tackling challenging opportunities with support and guidance when needed. We also believe in continuous growth of our team and encourage exploration to keep ahead of the fast-paced changes in capital markets and fintech.

Job Purpose

Manage challenging projects and ensure that customer solutions are delivered on time according to budget and the required quality standards in order to strengthen Murex reputation in implementing solutions for clients.

Your Responsibilities

•Manage and deliver projects on time, on budget, and up to Murex quality standards in order to achieve client satisfaction.

•Challenge and Enrich the available process and methodology with its own vision to ensure we deliver high added value through rigor and innovation

•Lead the service sales function to facilitate the winning of new business/projects

•Ensure the project team (project manager officer, business analyst, stream leads, team members) is fully engaged, and be proficient in managing virtual(matrix) teams to achieve the best outcome.

•Manage effectively the escalations to the appropriate level within the client’s or our organization when necessary

•Obtain the client’s acceptance of the solution upon project completion

•Is responsible to provide the project financials & reporting in assigned areas including resource costs/client invoicing

Requirements

•Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Operations Research, or Management Information Systems

•Around 10 years’ business experience of which 5+ years of project management experience in the delivery of a capital markets technology platform

•Experience in an international setting and project delivery in a vendor environment

•Prior experience as part of a management team (lead role with plan, resource and issue/change responsibilities) that successfully managed a full life cycle implementation

•Experience in supporting business development opportunities through proposal creation, review and presentation

•Customer focus

•Good communication skills, both written and verbal

•Spanish or French are a plus.

NORR is an employee-owned global architecture and engineering firm that has set the standard for inspired and timeless designs around the world. With offices in Canada, the US, UK and UAE, the firm employs more than 750 professionals in 14 diverse market sectors. Toronto is home to a multi-disciplinary office, where our integrated approach to design and studio life blend into the buzz of downtown. We’re dedicated to expanding our expertise in markets that include Commercial, Education, Government, Health Services, Hospitality, Justice, Sports & Recreation and Transportation. Our team in the Toronto office is currently seeking a Project Manager who will ensure that all contractual commitments are met within schedule and budget by planning and managing each stage of the project.

As a Project Manager you will use your interpersonal and leadership skills as well as an understanding of project financials to determine the necessary resources required for successful project execution, provide leadership for a multi-disciplined team, monitor project performance and forecast revenue.

Duties and Responsibilities
Project Management
Negotiate, develop, monitor and control the scope of deliverables, work plans, schedules and budgets for all project stages
Develop a detailed work plan for all architectural and engineering disciplines, allocate hours to the work plan and monitor project progress weekly
Lead an integrated team of architects and engineers in the quality assurance and quality control procedures for all deliverables, specifically the construction drawings and specifications
Lead and attend regular coordination meetings for all architectural and engineering disciplines in all project phases
Maintain a good understanding of the project scope and when changes to the scope occur, negotiate solutions to ensure outcomes meet client expectations and contractual obligations; prepare PCNs as required
Ensure timely communications throughout all project phases, develop and maintain meeting minutes, and follow up on all action items
Comply with the NORR Quality Management System (NORR QMS) methodology; develop, monitor and control scope, deliverables, work plan, schedules and budget for all project stages
Monitor, control and report project progress (% complete) on a monthly basis as part of the project review process
Participate in monthly project reviews to review project, budget work plan, schedule and risks
Coordinate with contractor, sub-consultants or relevant building authorities to address and document issues with constructability or owner concerns
Attend and conduct progress meetings before, during, and after the duration of the project to exchange information and resolve issues or concerns with various key stakeholders; prepare and issue meeting minutes
Ensure that all project close out documents are submitted and forwarded to appropriate parties upon completion of the project

Client Management
Act as the primary liaison with the client, contractor and project team
Ensure close client relationships are maintained through regular contact; stay informed of changing needs and direction
Participate in client planning sessions to prioritize activities and make client presentations

Business Development
Maintain and develop positive client relations to ensure business continuity and promote business growth
Leverage existing contacts to support new business opportunities
Identify potential business opportunities to maximize growth and increase market share
Participate in proposals and client presentations

Operations
Ensure project and business risks are identified and mitigated
Review and approve monthly project invoices to ensure minimizing unbilled revenue
Follow up on accounts receivables to avoid delay of payment, as needed

Teamwork
Monitor and maintain positive relationships with colleagues, consultants, and key stakeholders to ensure projects run smoothly and resolves concerns promptly and efficiently
Participate in the development of comprehensive business solutions that meet or exceed client objectives for new and existing projects

Strategic Development
Work to develop strategies for cross-selling and education clients about the firm’s areas of expertise
Provide insight on industry trends
Qualifications
Have successfully completed related post-secondary education
Is proficient in Architectural or engineering systems and design
Have experience in architectural design and presentation
Is familiar with Mechanical, Electrical and structural building systems, permit and building codes
At least 5 years of prior experience in project delivery, project management, and client management for construction project(s) valued at $1M-$10M. Renovation project work experience is required. Experience in healthcare projects is preferred.

Demonstrate an ability to coordinate with other team members and to collaborate with other professional disciplines

Novacom is a leading Construction Manager and General Contractor based in Surrey, BC and working throughout Western Canada.

We value people, relationships, innovation and culture. We believe in constantly improving ourselves to provide the best possible service to our clients. Our core business is commercial construction and renovations of financial institutions, restaurants, offices and retail spaces.

We're doing construction differently, and we're thinking outside the box about how we can improve our company and our industry. If you're looking for a company with a family dynamic where you can have opportunities to grow, be challenged and known by your co-workers, then come join us!

We are looking for experienced Project Managers to join our team, with experience on TI projects valued up to $10M, and base building projects up to $20M. This role is based at our Surrey Office.

Requirements

Personal Characteristics:
Driven - self-motivated and driven to push things forward no matter the circumstance
Energetic - engaged personality that takes on complex challenges with enthusiasm
Independent - ability to communicate effectively with team, but also act authoritatively on your own
Honest - willingness to admit when you've made a mistake and take ownership
Administrative - ability to track schedules, change orders, field reports, weekly progress reports etc.

Personable - able to build and maintain solid relationships with vendors and clients

Organizer- meticulous in site organization

Responsibilities:
Project Startup -- issuing contracts, requesting insurance and bonds, WCB notices, etc.

Site Superintendent Interface -- ability to work in partnership with Site Superintendent to deliver a high quality finished product while managing the schedule and budget

Benefits
Benefit Plan
Profit sharing / incentive
Salary commensurate with experience - typical range is $85-115K
Excellent candidates may have opportunity for growth within the company

Job Description
Job purpose

Bring your technical knowledge, skills, and personality to manage our main strategic accounts. From scope definition to on-boarding and gathering client requirements. You will evaluate the different stages of the projects and intervenes from the design stage to the final delivery. Manage and execute several projects and rigorously follow the timetable to ensure client satisfaction.

Duties and responsibilities

·Operate as the lead point of contact for all matters specific to the client once an order is placed.

·Provide guidance, support and training, professionally addressing client's needs and resolving areas of concerns

·Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions, according to client needs and objectives

·Act as a client manager for the client, by performing the following actions:

·Managing long term road map of the client's projects

·Working closely with the client (PM) through planned regular meetings to update and maintain project objectives, schedules, budgets and quality assurance processes while controlling scope, time, cost, quality and risk

·Managing, facilitating and tracking the execution of service deliverable as per the client contract while identifying risks/delays and providing solutions

·Maintaining clear records of decisions/minutes of meetings in an organized manner

·Act as a project owner for the client by performing following actions:

·Maintaining knowledge of the product through continuous training to assist with the client's questions/requests

·Leading requirements gathering efforts with client to create features/tickets.

·Lead and execute client rollouts.

·Work in partnership with engineering and production teams to identify project scope, gaps, and limitations (Manage internal relationships with other departments)

·Work with project coordinator to have all administrative work complete in order to ship , invoice and or resolve outstanding client issues

·Documenting process improvements, best practices, guidelines and new project workflows

·Manages multiple projects and ensures strict adherence to critical path

·Communicates and elevates client concerns in a timely manner to management.

·Prepares project reports for management operations meetings

·Be a catalyst for continuous service improvement both internally and with clients

·Handles ad-hoc inquiries, other client requests and special projects as assigned

Qualifications

·Experience working as a client relationship manager, as a project manager, or similar role

·Bachelor's in related field, or equivalent experience

·Knowledge of the POP/Retail/Fixture/Digital Media (Signage), an asset.

·Able to read, understand and work with basic technical information and drawings

·Experience tracking relevant KPIs (e.g. customer satisfaction)

·Organizational skills and ability to work independently

·Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skils

·Solid leadership and ability to drive initiatives cross-functionally

·Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite of tools (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)

·Fluent in English and French

**

Devoirs et responsabilités

• Agir comme point de contact principal pour toutes les questions spécifiques du client une fois la commande est passée.

• Fournir des conseils, du soutien et de la formation, répondant professionnellement aux besoins des clients en résolvant les domaines de préoccupation

• Assurer la livraison rapide et réussie de nos solutions, selon les besoins et les objectifs du client

• Agir en tant que gestionnaire client, en effectuant les actions suivantes:

• Gérer la feuille de route à long terme des projets du client

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le client (PM) à travers des réunions régulières prévues pour mettre à jour et maintenir les objectifs du projet, les calendriers, les budgets et les processus d'assurance qualité tout en contrôlant la portée, le temps, les coûts, la qualité et les risques

• Gérer, faciliter et suivre l'exécution des services livrables conformément au contrat client tout en identifiant les risques / retards et en fournissant des solutions

• Tenir des registres clairs des décisions / procès-verbaux des réunions de manière organisée

• Agir en tant que propriétaire de projet pour le client en effectuant les actions suivantes:

• Maintenir la connaissance du produit grâce à une formation continue pour répondre aux questions / demandes du client

• Diriger les exigences de collecte des efforts avec le client pour créer des fonctionnalités / tickets.

• Diriger et exécuter les déploiements clients.

• Travailler en partenariat avec les équipes d'ingénierie et de production pour identifier la portée, les lacunes et les limites du projet (Gérer les relations internes avec les autres départements)

• Travailler avec le coordonnateur de projet pour terminer tous les travaux administratifs afin d'expédier, de facturer et / ou de résoudre les problèmes clients en suspens

• Documenter les améliorations de processus, les meilleures pratiques, les directives et les nouveaux workflows de projet

• Gérer plusieurs projets et garantir le strict respect du chemin critique

• Communiquer et élever les préoccupations des clients en temps opportun à la direction.

• Préparer les rapports de projet pour les réunions des opérations de gestion

• Être un catalyseur pour l'amélioration continue des services à l'interne et avec les clients

• Gérer les demandes ponctuelles, les autres demandes des clients et les projets spéciaux assignés

Qualifications

• Expérience de travail en tant que gestionnaire de la relation client, en tant que chef de projet ou rôle similaire

• Baccalauréat dans un domaine connexe ou expérience équivalente

• Connaissance du POP / Retail / Fixture / Digital Media (Signage), un atout.

• Capable de lire, comprendre et travailler avec des informations techniques de base et des dessins techniques

• Expérience de suivi des KPI pertinents (par exemple, la satisfaction du client)

• Compétences organisationnelles et capacité à travailler de façon autonome

• Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale et compétences interpersonnelles

• Leadership solide et capacité à conduire des initiatives de manière interfonctionnelle

• Excellente maîtrise de la suite d'outils Microsoft Office (Word, Excel et PowerPoint)

• Maîtrise de l'anglais et du français
Company Description
IVC est un type différent de spécialiste de détail. Nous sommes déterminés à nous démarquer et à être la seule société de présentation de produits dérivés spécialisée dans la beauté, le luxe et la mode. Nous sommes issus d'une nouvelle génération de créatifs, qui sait rassembler différents experts des mondes de la beauté et de la technologie pour créer une stratégie de marque mondiale unique. Nous partageons une vision commune pour intégrer des technologies innovantes et définir de nouvelles tendances de vente au détail. C'est ce qui nous rend unique et ce qui fait la réussite de notre travail et de nos clients.

IVC is a different kind of retail specialist. We’re driven to stand apart and be the one merchandising display company that specializes in beauty, luxury, and fashion. We’re from a new generation of creatives, one that knows how to bring together different experts from the worlds of beauty and technology to create a single, global brand strategy. We share a common vision to integrate innovative technologies and set new retail trends. It’s what makes us unique, and what makes our work, as well as our clients, successful.

Our company is looking for a Product Manager to join our growing team as we enter a new phase of expansion. Have you taken a startup from 0 to 100 and are ready for a new and exciting challenge with a ton of upside?

REQUIREMENTS

Knowledge/Responsibilities
Knowledge of software development life cycle methodologies and techniques
Manage software development projects (define, design, develop, deploy, support)
Conducts project meetings and is responsible for project planning, tracking and analysis, and status reports
Oversees and has accountability for the successful completion of the project on time and budget
Ability to effectively and proactively communicate with internal and external project sponsors and stakeholders
Practical experience gathering, identifying and documenting software and business requirements; including reviewing and evaluating project activities progress and results to ensure timelines are met
Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile conflicts
Proven analytical skills while engaged in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Document additions/changes from original requirements and disseminate to client and work teams
Minimum Qualifications
BS/BA in Computer Science or related science/technical field
4+ years experience managing software development projects
Solid understanding of app development projects and concepts as they relate to business objectives
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Highly motivated, hands-on and results-oriented
Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines while maintaining a positive attitude
Excellent verbal and written communication and prioritization skills
The most important characteristic of a Product Manager joining our team is your attitude. We want you to join because you don't see roadblocks, you see opportunities to be at your best. You know that somehow, you and the rest of our team can figure anything out.

This attitude will make you successful in this role (note that this comes before all else):

· You get your hands dirty: You are comfortable diving into new projects and always bring your own POV. Whatever the task, you like to stretch outside your comfort zone to achieve greatness.

· You're the best listener in the room: You're never dogmatic about your views and understand how to listen to users and stakeholders.

· You get that product is a team sport: You understand how to talk to every kind of role on a product team and how to get the most out of people.

· You're mission first: You get stuff done and you don't let anything get in the way of moving our product forward.·

Bonus points:

· Experience building out products at scale

· Basic (or better) experience with modern software development frameworks (JS, Python, etc.)

BENEFITS

Our mission is big and audacious, but we're assembling a team to take the challenge head on.

As a Product Manager - you'll be joining a team that prioritizes:

· People: Our company is more than just a business. We're a band of brothers and sisters supporting each other on our mission to rebuild business banking. We're really serious about mission, fit, and the people we work with. You'll be part of a rapidly scaling team that reflects these values and keeps this place special.

· Diversity: You'll find yourself in an environment that values diversity and inclusivity. Excellence doesn't come in one flavor and neither should we.

· Leadership: You're right in the thick of it, making critical decisions that will clear our path forward.

If you recognize yourself in this job description, let's talk.

Project Manager

Apply Now

JOB SUMMARY

Facilities Decommissioning and Environmental Remediation (FD&ER) is responsible for the execution of all activities associated with the Care and Maintenance, Environmental Remediation and Decommissioning of facilities that have been transferred to FD at Chalk River Laboratories. The Project Manager, reports to the Manager, CRL Facilities Decommissioning Program Execution and has overall responsibility for managing all aspects of project execution in their portofilio (direct personnel reports, characterization, work planning, engineering, procurement, risk, schedule, stakeholder engagement, project closeout). Is accountable for the complete delivery of large-scale, high-risk, projects of critical significance, characterized as multi-year in duration and involving a significant financial commitment (typically >$15M annually).

DUTIES

The Project Manager, ensures that specific projects performed by his/her Program are planned and implemented in accordance with CNL’s policies, procedures, and project management processes to meet Customer requirements. The Project Manager specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Ensure safety is paramount in all activities.
Manages a high-risk portfolio of projects of critical significance, characterized as multi-year in duration and involving a significant financial commitment (typically >$15M annually)
Manages the collective and individual performance of a large project team, (typically more than 25 CNL staff) through the establishment of project-related performance objectives, and the provision of both formal and informal performance feedback (appraisal) mentoring and guidance to ensure project(s) success.
Defines roles and responsibilities, and manages performance, including discipline, appraisals and merit allocations. Provides constructive feedback including disciplinary action if required or the termination/re-negotiation of external contracts.
Authorizes project expenditures and procurement requisitions; e.g., purchase orders, invoices and expense claims within higher limits of authority.
Using extensive knowledge of business and management principles, manages all aspects of project planning, budgeting and resource allocation, through discussions with internal clients to define the scope of the project, deliverables and timing. Builds and sustains large project teams, and sets priorities/clarifies goals.
Serving as Responsible Manager for the projects.
Responsible for managing, coordinating, and administering the Program Execution project from the conceptual stages through planning, engineering, procurement, construction, start-up and project closeout.
Responsible for coordinating with other functional managers (Engineering, Safety & Licensing, Procurement, QA, Planning and Control, Construction/Installation) to ensure that functional resource requirements are planned in accordance with Program delivery requirements, and that Program-specific aspects of functional resources are implemented.
Ensuring proper implementation of, and monitor the performance of, the Operations Technical Safety Management Programs which include Conduct of Operations, Maintenance Program, Hoisting and Rigging Program, and Emergency Management Program.
Motivates project team staff to deliver quality results on time and on budget, and coaches/mentors others for success.
Participates in management team meetings related to project performance, priorities and staffing.
Secures external and internal resources to execute the project.
Coordinating with Senior Management and subcontractors.
Ensuring that applicable Company-wide procedures, operating instructions, and project-specific processes, procedures, and tools are applied to the planning, execution, and control of projects within the Project, and that their application is subject to periodic review for compliance and effectiveness.
Implementing the Facilities Decommissioning QA Manual within the Program, ensuring that project-specific QA Plans/Checklists are prepared, and establishing objectives for quality, continuous improvement, and customer satisfaction across the Program.
Monitoring and reporting overall progress of projects within the Program, conducting reviews to verify outputs are aligned with plans, while and ensuring that significant variances and trends are investigated.
Knowledgeable in Engineering, Safety & Licensing, Procurement, QA, Planning and Control, Construction/Installation, and applicable business systems to ensure that Program-specific aspects of functional resources are implemented.
Establishing and maintaining a strong and effective customer relationship.
Establishing a safe work environment and improve the safety culture in this organization.
Assuring all safety management programs are followed and appraise the overall nuclear safety on projects.
QUALIFICATIONS

The Project Manager, has a degree from an accredited university in a discipline relevant to project management, engineering, business or commerce and an excellent track record for leading large projects to successful conclusion.

The Project Manager has years of progressively responsible project experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience, in a senior or lead project capacity.

5-10 years of construction and/or decommissioning relevant experience or equivalent

Typically, s/he has achieved PMP or AACE certification

The Project Manager, has an established track record for project delivery and demonstrated leadership, regulatory and company requirements, Operations, Maintenance, Hoisting and Rigging, Construction Management, and Emergency Management.

Must be self-motivated and flexible relative to work assignments; possess excellent oral and written communication skills, and be able to interface with peers other company organizations and Senior Management.

S/he has extensive knowledge of processes related to strategic planning, human resources, and the management of people. S/he has strong general management skills, including planning, budgeting, resourcing, time management, negotiation skills, contract management and administration, and progress reporting for an executive audience.

Project manager must have (5) years of experience, within the past eight (8) years, as Project Manager, working on technical or IT projects.

MUST demonstrate a minimum of one (1) project, undertaken within the past five (5) years, working on a Government of Canada (GoC) IT project in a project management role.

MUST be Fluent in both English and French.

This may be demonstrated by evidence of working in projects in both languages (i.e. one project where the language of work was English and another project where the language of work was French) or through a certification of language ability.

Note: In order to demonstrate evidence of a certification, a copy must be provided.

Majority of the Work will take place at 9 Boulevard Montclair, Gatineau, Quebec. Part of the Work may be conducted with remote access.

Ottawa, ON (Required)

Project Management Professional (PMP) (Preferred)

French (Required)

GEA is one of the largest suppliers for the food and beverage processing industry and a wide range of other process industries. Approximately 18,000 employees in more than 50 countries contribute significantly to GEA’s success – come and join them! We offer interesting and challenging tasks, a positive working environment in international teams and opportunities for personal development and growth in a global company.
Your responsibilities and tasks:


The Project Manager will be responsible for projects throughout all phases of the project cycle from contract award to the handover of plant to the client. These projects may vary in complexity, time and economic size, but in any case it will be the duty of the project manager to deliver the project according to the budget, schedule, scope and specifications together with meeting customer satisfaction. As the leader of the project execution team, the project manager will require strong communication and people management skills to allow for success of the project.

Tasks:
Provide a main point of contact for the customer and potentially many stakeholders; to coordinate, review, organize and communicate with. This can include but not limited to; correspondence (written and verbal), meetings, submittals and training.
Work with GEA Product Technology Centers (PTC) and Food Application Centers (mainly in Europe) to deliver process solutions for GEA North America clients.
Coordinate and manage project support disciplines within the project life cycle (Process Engineering, Purchasing, Design, I&C, Structural, Field Install Supervision, etc.)
Coordinate the approval and submittal of project documents (P&IDs, drawings, project documentation, etc) for submittal to the customer.
Responsible for Project Controlling according to GEA guidelines with a focus on Revenue and Margin, this includes the approval of the as-sold budget, development and approval of any change orders, reporting of key figures and ensures timely invoicing and payments.
Consult with other in-house engineers, Product Technology Centers, Supply Chain, vendors, or other individuals to determine specifications, resolve issues and coordinates delivery times to coincide with the required project schedule.
Update and maintain the Project database for assigned projects including filing and updating of correspondence, technical specifications, project management documents, and drawings.
Maintain and update risk analysis on a regular basis, also keeps management informed of any major changes/updates.
Develop and leads project closeout meetings to transfer knowledge of “lessons learnt” to all members of the project management and applications sales support teams.
Review contract documents and specifications to make sure they all conform to all stakeholders understanding of scope and works to bridge any gaps.
Contribute to team effort by completing all tasks as may be assigned by the supervisor.

Your profile and qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree in Industrial, Mechanical, or Chemical Engineering with minimum three years engineering experience is required.
Ability to read and interpret technical specifications and drawings is required.
Food, Dairy, Brewery or Beverage industry Project management and/or Process engineering experience is a plus.
Must be willing and able to travel internationally including the United States of America (approximately 20 - 25 % of the time).
Understanding of process technology, preferably in hygienic food processing.
Must be detail oriented.
Must possess good English language communication, verbal and written.
Must possess good interpersonal skills and work well in a team setting as well as independently.
Must be self-motivated and able to function with minimum supervision.
Advantageous to have working knowledge of MS Office products and Lotus Notes.
*This role is eligible for the employee Referral Program as per the terms and conditions of the program.

Owned by Tokyo-based Rakuten and headquartered in Toronto, Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the most advanced global ecommerce companies, with the world’s most innovative eReading services offering more than 6 million eBooks and audiobooks to 30 million + customers in 190 countries. Position Overview:
Spire Development is an integrated development and construction company that provides a comprehensive package of real estate services from in-house marketing to design and related development services to construction. We work with the commercial, industrial, and multi-family residential sectors and pride ourselves on being a “one-stop shop” for our clients, taking care of all aspects of their projects. We are passionate about helping our clients realize their dreams and creating a lasting legacy in our community.

Our success stems from our competitive drive and a deep-seated desire to build and help our clients realize their dream. For this we maintain the highest of ethical business practices and standards and keep track of every detail.

From a top level, you will be coordinating the design and development of multiple construction projects from conception to completion. Prepare and establish project plans, manage and control implementation processes, execute change orders, prepare project documentation, and evaluate and report progress from bid to close-out for multiple commercial construction projects.

Overall Performance Goals & Expectations:
Working with the COO on upcoming projects;
Working with the Site Superintendent with the coordination and administration of the job site daily;
Works directly with project team members, suppliers and contractors to define project requirements and scopes of work, and requests for proposal and bid submittals;
Solicits, evaluates, and produces accurate quotes, bids, and tenders; concludes arrangements for goods, materials, and services;
Conducts contract reviews to ensure completeness and inclusion of required terms and conditions and necessary revisions;

To be a top candidate, you will have a combination of the following:

Education and/or Experience:
Min post-Secondary Education Technical Diploma
Working knowledge of construction drawings, documents and specifications
5+ years of Project Management either in construction, or engineering
Understand method of contract negotiation, bidding, purchasing, negotiating, contracting, cash flow, expediting, receiving and transporting
Manage the purchase of construction materials (researching, quoting, ordering, and tracking of delivery)
Strong written and spoken English

Excellent organizational skills and have the ability to time manage and meet multiple tasks within a high-pressure work environment
Self-motivated and results-driven

Must have the ability to multi-task and use sound judgment to prioritize activities

Is technologically advanced, Microsoft Office application i.e. Project, Excel, Word & Outlook

Knowledge of Spectrum and Procore software is an asset
Why Work Here?
We offer an exceptional work environment where you have great independence in your job, provided you get the job done
We are practical, down-to-earth and non-bureaucratic. If you enjoy working in a dynamic, nimble environment, where your ideas are listened to, this is the job for you

Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: Apr 8 2020

** Please note, this is a 12 month contract opportunity **

JOB PURPOSE:

GSK is looking to rapidly deliver its Consumer Healthcare (CH) innovation products in priority areas. This role will manage the roll out of innovation roll and achieve this on-time and according to the plan. GSK Consumer Health is at an exciting point in its journey and has exciting projects for 2021 and beyond which are required to meet its growth goals. Effective management and project delivery of the many elements of the CH strategy is vital to CH and thus GSKs return to shareholders.

The impact of the role is immediate in terms of ensuring effective organization, mobilization, planning and executing key projects critical to commercial success and organizational health. A top priority are the critical consumer launches for 2021 on key strategic brands which will have a significant impact on GSKs leadership share position. The scope of projects under this role spans across categories and brands, involving multiple functions, manufacturing sites and retailers.

This individual will be required to onboard to the existing projects underway, fully understand all affected brands, company processes, roles & responsibilities, and quickly develop trusting relationships. Due to a high level of change with the integration of two multinationals, the individual must also be highly adaptable to change, comfortable with ambiguity and demonstrate ability to navigate uncharted waters. The role reports into the Strategic Project Manager within the Commercial Excellence department.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead matrixed cross-functional teams and external stakeholders (e.g. Regulatory, Supply, Manufacturing, Packaging, Sales and Marketing) to launch innovation, including development of the project critical path, team meetings, issues / risks / opportunities and stakeholder management.
Manage and deliver against all project objectives as per agreed project charter (scope, time, budget, resources and quality). Ensuring project and overall business objectives remain aligned.
Holds accountability for the project planning process, to develop and implement project plans with dependencies.
Maintain project documents in line with agreed requirements including materials for reporting and governance as required. (e.g. time, KPIs, benefits, quality, lessons learnt)
Maintain and administer central project information systems (e.g. MS Server & SharePoint)
Ensure an effective communications plan is managed on an on-going basis.
Suggest creative solutions and continuous improvements to process or project challenges
Role model and coach the project team to help embed the best practice project management process and ways of working.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience demonstrating learning agility.
Minimum 3 years experience in a commercial role i.e. marketing, sales or supply chain
Project management qualification strongly preferred (e.g. PMP, Prince 2) or equivalent proven track record of delivery.
Specialization in STEM, Business, or commercial an asset.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Previous project management experience should ideally include:
Strong project management skills and aptitude coupling both hard and soft skills.
Design, planning, governance, phasing and implementation of projects.
Tools and techniques for issues and risk management, decision making and reporting.
Experienced and comfortable with engaging with senior management.
Experience managing country level implementation of global projects or local cross-functional projects, in a complex matrix.
Well-developed soft skills such as influencing, leading without authority and problem solving.
Experience using enterprise PPM systems to manage projects. (e.g. MS Project Server, Clarity).

We’re setting the baseline for awesome.

What we offer

We’re proud of the high quality solutions we deliver to our clients. More importantly, we’re proud of the people who bring them to life.

We believe in treating people well, compensating them fairly, and supporting them to live fulfilled and balanced lives. We offer great extended benefits, flexible time-off, and professional development opportunities for all staff. We want people to feel they can bring their whole selves to work and strive to offer an environment where everybody feels listened-to, welcome, and safe. How to Apply

At Ayogo, we activate, engage and empower patients faced with challenging healthcare transitions. Ayogo's highly-scalable behavioral support platform creates value for innovative life sciences companies by helping their patients successfully transition on to therapy. Our "dynamic tailoring" technology allows us to ensure the support we provide is personal, relevant, and timely, and based on each patient's unique psychosocial context. We use psychometrics, machine learning, and persuasive design to create intelligently adaptive patient success programs.

Ayogo's been named among the 100 most innovative digital health companies globally, and is broadly recognized for its progressive corporate culture. The team we've assembled is full of smart, passionate, dedicated people who love to solve real problems. We strive to live our internal motto: do our best work, save the world, laugh every day.

Qualities we value

Passion: energy and drive that keeps you moving, and inspires those around you.

Empathy: the ability to put yourself in the shoes of others; kindness; compassion.

Diligence: a strong desire for excellence; habitual professionalism.

Positivity: a solution-oriented mindset; an innate ability to raise spirits.

Talent: natural ability that blooms into mastery.

Curiosity: thirst for knowledge, and to always be advancing by asking questions.

Leadership: setting a proactive and positive example through action.

Collectivity: acting to ensure the whole is greater than the sum of the parts.

Project Management

Initiation

WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE ROLE:

Job description

United Gulf Construction Inc is seeking an organized, and reliable addition to our established Construction Team to take on the role as a Construction Project Manager for our many current & future projects.

Working as the role of a Project Manager your responsibilities would be:

· Oversee construction and compliance with plans.

· Lead project meetings with both internal and external parties

· Ensure proper permits are secured and posted. (obtain needed permits)

· Coordinating all trades from excavation to turn key (making sure they are where they should be when they should be and taking steps to notify if not)

· Ensure timely completion of all work at/below budget

· Oversee all on-site and off-site compliance plans with buildings and safety regulations.

· Determine and allocate needed resources to ensure availability throughout the project.

· Build and maintain construction schedule in conjunction with project team to meet milestones and completion dates.

· Oversee and execute quality control programs to ensure high quality standards.

Position Requirements:

· Minimum of 10 years in on-site construction management with major focus on multi-unit residential building construction.

· Excellent computer skills including MS Outlook, MS Project, MS Excel

· Familiar with design build practices and procedures

· Knowledge of contracting, construction management, design, procurement and scheduling.

· Detailed knowledge of building components, detail and design.

· Understanding of materials, take offs, and estimating

· Extensive knowledge of workplace health and safety regulations

· Capable of identifying and resolving constructability issues in moderately complex situations.

· Ability to build and maintain effective relationships and work within a team environment.

· Ability to manage and direct subcontracts and the ability to lead and evaluate trade performance.

· Above average organizational, time management, and project management skills.

· Engineering degree is not a requirement, but looked at as a major asset.

Overall responsibility of the project manager is planning, executing and finalizing projects within budget while adhering to deadlines. This includes acquiring resources and coordinating the efforts of team members and third party contractors or consultants in order to deliver projects according to plan.

Preference will be given to those who have worked in construction for a minimum of 10 years, resourceful degrees and with an aptitude for managing others.

This is a full-time, permanent position. United Gulf Construction Inc is offering competitive pay and benefits, and will be directly based on experience. Our employees are key to our success,

Diversified Drafting & Design has been established since 1998 providing computerized drafting and design services for custom residential homes and additions to owners and builders across the region. To enable the company's continued growth, we are always seeking highly motivated individuals for the position of Construction Project Manager.

Job Description

Reporting to the Owner, you will be responsible for the construction management and supervision of new custom residential homes in accordance with the Ontario Building Code and to the individual customer's requirements and satisfaction. You will be planning, organizing, directing and controlling construction projects from start to finish according to schedule, specifications and budget. You will also be dealing with customers, suppliers, sub-trades, and Building Officials.

Required Skills and Qualifications

College Diploma in an Architectural Construction Technology program or equivalent experience. Several years of experience in the construction industry, including experience as a construction supervisor or field superintendent. Extensive experience in the construction industry may substitute for post-secondary education requirements. Valid Driver's License. Candidates must possess a positive, professional attitude and appearance with a commitment to customer satisfaction. Individuals must be highly motivated with the ability to learn quickly and meet deadlines. This is a career position with a rapidly growing company with opportunity for advancement and bonuses.

Job Wages

Wages to commensurate with experience and ability. We regret that we can only respond to those candidates chosen for an interview.

Move, Build, Grow your career!

As the premier global asset management and disposition company, Ritchie Bros. helps thousands of people around the world buy and sell heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide for making buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent. If you’re an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit, we want you to join our growing team – employed in a wide variety of positions from sales to operations to corporate functions – as we transform the global used equipment market.

At Ritchie Bros., Territory Sales Managers support a large and diverse customer base. Our goal is to be the trusted advisor to our customers and offer end-to-end solutions for buying and selling used equipment, trucks and other assets to help them achieve their goals.

#LI-Sales

Join a growing global company that offers endless career and learning opportunities with a work culture like no other and move forward with us, build your success, and grow your career. #LI-Sales

We’re looking for a Trainee Territory Sales Manager based in Regina, Saskatchewan.

The Opportunity:

In this position, as a Trainee Territory Sales Manager, you’ll be placed into an intensive 6-month hands-on training program where you will work with and learn from one of our sales teams. This program is designed to educate you on our business, our customers and the skills and processes required to become a successful Territory Sales Manager. Upon completion of your training, you will then enter a Sales Practicum period of 1 to 3 months. Here you will be given the opportunity to put your training to practice while still supported by your sales coach and team. Upon completion of this structured training program you will then be qualified to be a Territory Sales Manager and have the opportunity to manage a multi-million-dollar territory.
As a result of this Trainee program you will become competent in the following:
Territory Management: Prospecting & Developing Business, Planning & Pipeline Management.
Selling Skills: Call Preparation, Relationship Building, Building Rapport, Identifying Needs, Delivering Value & Gaining Commitment
Procedures & Processes: Deal Management Auction Operations & Customer Service
Equipment & Sector Knowledge: Heavy Equipment Knowledge, Maximizing Equipment Values, Market Knowledge
Here’s what you bring:
1 to 5 years in a structured sales role, and a consistent track-record of meeting & exceeding quotas.
You have a strong learning ability, coupled with a desire to learn more about everything around you.
A strong work ethic without sacrificing your sense of humor or ability to have fun on the job.
The ability to travel 1 to 2 days per week to cover the territory, as well as up to a week a few times per year to attend auctions and training.
You will have to maintain a valid, clean driver’s license.
It helps if you have experience around heavy equipment.
Strong communication skills, especially when it comes to listening.
A head for numbers, and the ability to make sound decisions quickly in a fast-paced setting.
You’re competitive, but you never sacrifice integrity to win business.
A natural ability at building authentic customer relationships.
It’s important to note that:
You will be required to work outside for extended periods in all types of weather.
You will be required to climb on top of and under large construction equipment.
You will most likely be required to relocate. A requirement of the program is to relocate if a territory in the region in which you are trained is not available therefore being mobile is essential.
What We Offer:

Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the world, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 55 years in business. And, we’ll make sure we help you achieve your own goals along the way. We offer our Trainee Territory Sales Managers a competitive compensation package that includes:
Competitive salary throughout training
Comprehensive medical & dental benefits.
RRSP & employee share purchase plan, both with company matching.
Ongoing sales training and professional development.
A tuition reimbursement program.
Unlimited potential and growth with a Global company
To get an idea of what our auctions are like, you can check out some auction videos on YouTube right here: http://bit.ly/KKL9Fz

Want to learn more about the company? Visit our Career site, LinkedIn or connect with us today through Facebook or Twitter.

Established in 1958, Ritchie Bros. (NYSE and TSX: RBA) is a global asset management and disposition company, offering customers end-to-end solutions for buying and selling used heavy equipment, trucks and other assets. Operating in a multitude of sectors, including construction, transportation, agriculture, energy, oil and gas, mining, and forestry, the company’s selling channels include: Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers,, the world’s largest industrial auctioneer offers live auction events with online bidding;IronPlanet, an online marketplace with featured weekly auctions and providing its exclusive IronClad Assurance® equipment condition certification;MarketPlacee, an online marketplace offering multiple price and timing options;Mascus,a leading European online equipment listing service; and Ritchie Bros. Private Treaty, offering privately negotiated sales. The company also offers sector-specific solutions including GovPlanet, TruckPlanet, Kruse Energy Auctioneers and Cat® auctions, plus equipment financing and leasing through Ritchie Bros. Financial Services.For more information about the unprecedented choice provided by Ritchie Bros., visit RitchieBros.com.

Job Description

Timeless Medical Systems® is looking for energetic and well-rounded Project Managers who will excel at implementing our medical applications for the healthcare market. As a Project Manager (PMP), you will develop and manage a plan to implement Timeless Medical System's applications in healthcare facilities throughout North America. You will manage multiple implementation plans simultaneously through a 90-day cycle, engaging the customer at all levels (CIO, Physicians, Clinical Managers, Nurses, IT, Training, and end users). This position interacts with customers virtually and/or on-site.

Responsibilities
Lead Timeless implementation projects, serving as the primary customer contact
Develop and manage project plan, utilizing Microsoft Project software
Manage implementation issues, escalating when appropriate
Identify resource needs and develop a plan to utilize resources to meet project scope
Maintain complete understanding of contract deliverables and manage project scope to ensure project is delivered on time and within budget
Support sales team during contract negotiations
Collaborate with Timeless teams, including Support, Account Management, Product Management and Sales, to address customer issues
Maintain understanding of how the application is used and configured, including the ability to provide an application overview
Work with clinical leads to identify work flows, and plans to address change in their healthcare organization
Communicate effectively at all levels
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required
PMP certification preferred
3 years minimum experience implementing or managing healthcare software
Ability to work with customers to understand their needs and develop custom solutions
Application and industry knowledge
Superior leadership, influence, communication, interpersonal, and technical skills
Ability to prioritize multiple demands in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Skilled at anticipating and solving problems
Travel requirements - 50%
About Timeless Medical Systems®

Timeless Medical Systems® is part of the Timeless Group of Companies, which is a highly specialized software development company based in Charlottetown, PEI. Timeless Medical Systems'® main goal is to create truly groundbreaking products that have a major impact on the lives of healthcare and medical professionals. We specialize in mobile, point of care clinical applications which are on the cutting edge of medical technologies, covering multiple areas of the hospital. We look and act a lot like a start-up company but we have the luxury of working within a successful and established leading technology company with some incredible investment and support. We offer an environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented. Come join us at our HQ in Charlottetown, PEI!

Why work at Timeless Medical Systems
Competitive salary, commensurate on your experience
Health care coverage
Professional Development/Continued Education
Flexible work schedule
Ability to work remotely
Individual Development Plan (IDP) - you plan out goals for each year that will increase your knowledge and skillset, and use company time to work towards completing your IDP
