About the role:

Are you interested in a an opportunity where you can manage projects involving implementing capital equipment procurement of communications equipment for the federal government?

Do you enjoy Managing Projects? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We currently have an opportunity for a Project Manager to join our team in support of our contract with our federal government client.

The Project Manager is responsible for implementing capital investment and procurement of communications equipment.

Other responsibilities include (but not limited to):
• providing analysis and recommendations to Senior Management regarding Statement of Operational Capability Deficiency (SOCD), Information Exchange Requirement (IER), Minor Requirement (MR) and Small Capital Projects (SCP.)
• preparing and coordinating, with supporting organizations, documentation required to support projects through submissions as assigned.
• creating, developing, and documenting a suite of project planning documents to guide the team through delivering project activities, in collaboration with Senior Management, the Project Authority, and relevant stakeholders.

The qualifications:
• 10 years’ experience in Project Management and implementation of capital equipment projects including experience in successfully applying Government of Canada project documents, processes and procedures
• 3 years’ experience years with Command, Control, Communication, Computer, Surveillance Reconnaissance (C4ISR) systems including Classified C4ISR systems; including Over the Air Rekeying (OTAR) of Type 1 radios, and HAVE QUICK II frequency hopping technology.
• 5 years’ experience providing engineering, support, planning or the life cycle management for Type 1 Cryptographic Devices for the Government of Canada.
• 3 years’ experience providing support for, or working with, Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA) radios.
• The ability to obtain a Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret level

In accordance with the Vision, Purpose, and Values, and strategic direction of the Vancouver Island Health Authority (Island Health) patient and staff safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone; as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.

The Island Health Project Manager, Capital Projects is responsible for overseeing and supporting the planning, design and/or implementation of assigned mid-range facilities projects of moderate scope and complexity across Island Health, including project planning, project management, communications, and contract management. Oversees assigned staff and provides leadership by directing work teams, contractors and consultants as needed on a project- by-project basis.

Education, Training And Experience

Bachelor degree in Architecture, Interior Design, Engineering, Red Seal Trade certification, PMP, or a related field together with five (5) to seven (7) years' recent related experience managing, leading and directing facilities projects in a complex healthcare environment, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Valid driver's licence.

Skills And Abilities
Knowledge of capital project planning and implementation processes including design, construction and procurement within current standards, codes, bylaws and regulations.
Comprehensive knowledge of project management principles and methodologies Ability to interpret construction drawings and construction specifications
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage planning, design and construction projects simultaneously.
Ability to supervise and provide direction to team members.
Demonstrated ability to identify, plan, organize, prioritize and implement projects in a timely manner,
Demonstrated ability to work within a dynamic project environment with changing priorities
Demonstrated attention to detail.
Ability to operate related equipment including related software applications.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders including a wide range of people.

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.

Bell Business Markets is Canada's leading provider of information and communications technology (ICT) solutions. Our Business team serves 96 of the Top 100 businesses in Canada and 3 out of every 4 small and medium businesses. Bell provides end-to-end solutions including Internet, Private Network and Broadcast services, Voice and Unified Communications, Data Centres, Customer Contact, Security, Mobile and Small Business Solutions.

Key responsibilities:

During your orientation, you will be exposed to all aspects of project delivery that will prepare you for your role as project manager. You will learn the details surrounding the management of key operational processes including the compiling, analyzing, preparing and distributing of data and operational reports that assist our leaders in management of the department, resource planning and project status performance. You will also be exposed to our project and program methodology and the foundations of program and account management.

What’s in it for you?
Ownership of work and projects to help drive company success
An assigned mentor from the Bell senior leadership team
Networking events to foster professional relationships
Critical Competencies:

A Bachelors degree in an area such as Business Technology Management, IT, Engineering (Systems, Communications, Computer, Networking, IT Security), completed by the position start date.

To be successful in this role, you must:
Have excellent written and oral communications skills, being able to provide clear, complete, and concise verbal instructions and written documentation.
Have the ability to deal courteously and effectively with people, to meet deadlines, to analyze and solve problems, as well as to interact and communicate effectively with a wider variety of levels of employees and external customers.
Be organized and highly effective at problem solving.
Have outstanding influencing and negotiation skills
Work independently but understand the need to work collaboratively within a team environment.
Demonstrate the ability to be proficient in project management processes and tools including Microsoft Project, database, and presentation software.
Have the ability to translate and communicate complex customer issues and their resolution to senior management client teams and be seen as a thought leader.
Perform comprehensive reviews of performance results.
Build weekly and monthly scorecards and dashboards for various business leaders.
Investigate, analyse and understand results and identify and prioritize improvement opportunities.
Build insightful executive presentations to share findings and influence stakeholders on next steps.
Enhance current reporting by creating templates and processes to measure key indicators.
Work with various teams including Finance, Product / Marketing, Delivery and Serve to understand and explain monthly, quarterly, and annual Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Assist in the development of yearly operations targets by translating corporate initiatives into objectives.
Work with the technical teams to outline internal project reporting requirements, and assure reporting initiatives are completed accurately on time and within budget
Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information:

Position Type: Management
Job Status: Grad Hire
Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Ottawa
Application Deadline: 05/28/2020

Description

SigmaPoint Technologies Inc. is an Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) partner focused on delivering complete end-to-end manufacturing solutions to technology companies. Our service offerings include innovative product design and engineering, test solutions, manufacturing, logistics and post-manufacturing repair/warranty services. With an impressive customer base and world-class lean manufacturing services, SigmaPoint continues to grow as leader in the EMS industry and as such, are actively looking to for a Project Manager.

Reporting to the Manager of Customer Experience, the successful candidate will use project methodologies and best practices in a matrix environment to provide tactical support and act as the primary interface between the customer and the various SigmaPoint (SP) functional areas necessary to manage the day-to-day customer relationship. The Project Manager will be the “Voice of SigmaPoint” to the customer and the “voice of the customer” to SigmaPoint.

Main Responsibilities:
Identify and manage stakeholders, collect requirements and define scope.
Plan risk management, identify and conduct analysis, implement and monitor risk responses.
Lead Customer Focus Team (CFT) to deliver appropriate levels of customer service and satisfaction such that members are engaged, responsible and productive to satisfy internal & external metrics.
Define, sequence and estimate activity durations, and develop Gantt charts for New Product Introductions.
Support the CFT in lessons learned, continuous improvement / lean activities and programs.
Champion issues management, lead team members to resolve issues and present potential solutions to the customer.
Resolve alignment issues between Purchase Orders, Quotes, Contracts and Technical Data Packages Revision Control.
Ensure the CFT is properly interpreting and executing contractual requirements.
Maintain Customer Resource Management (CRM) database.
Work with CFT to provide acceptable commitments based upon customer demand and SPs capabilities.
Champion resolution of Customer specific On-Time Delivery (OTD) and quality issues.
Ensure customer specific Purchase Price Variances are addressed to prevent manufacture delays.
Manage stakeholder expectations, coordinate, negotiate and communicate commitment dates on customer orders.
Participate in kick-off meetings to ensure successful handover from Business Development as it relates to the New Customer Introduction Process, successful integration of new customers and manufacturing readiness.
Provide progress updates, revenue reports and support Quarterly Business Reviews.
Ensure Engineering Change Orders (ECO’s) are priced appropriately and implemented effectively.
Escalate issues as appropriate through internal site management and corporate resources.
Maintain an awareness of the customer’s product life-cycle plans.

Requirements:
A Project Management Professional (PMP) with 3 to 5 years of experience in the electronics field.
The ability to learn the operating facets of the Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) industry.
Must be able to problem solve, prioritize and support continuous improvement.
Exceptional computer skills, experience with Excel, Microsoft Office, Power Point, MS Project.
Attention to detail, highly organized, flexible, efficient and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
A demonstrated high level of initiative and the ability to work independently as well as excellent oral and written communication with team building & leadership skills.

Job Description
Project Manager - Downtown Vancouver (BC)

Vancouver, BC | Full Time | Tech Team

Join our 25+ person team for an opportunity to tackle fun new challenges while making a big impact in a collaborative and culture driven environment. Our Vancouver Team is passionate about building tools that advance the music industry to modernize the way artists create, distribute, and get paid.

WHO WE ARE

We are Create Music Group, one of the fastest growing music technology companies in the entertainment industry. We monetize over 8 billion monthly music streams and are currently one of the largest music rights holders in the world. We operate a number of different services out of our 22,000 sq ft HQ in the heart of Hollywood, Los Angeles (US) including: music distribution, music publishing, YouTube monetization, artist development, brand development, and production. Check us out at createmusicgroup.com.

We collaborate with some of the most influential personalities and musicians including Future, Migos; Marshmello, Porter Robinson, Dillon Francis, Don Diablo; Young Thug, Trippie Redd, Soulja Boy; Jacob Sartorius, and others. We are at the forefront of the entertainment industry and looking for someone to join us and to become a part of the Create family. Our Content Claiming Specialist leads our efforts to generate revenue for our clients.

WHO YOU ARE
Passionate about digital media and driven towards a career in the music industry
A self-starter with a high-autonomy attitude
Detail-oriented with a knack to get lots of information and planning organized
Tech savvy and well-versed in a variety of project management processes and tools
A multi-tasker with great communication skills to drive our development projects to production
REQUIRED SKILLS
Assisting in defining project scope as well as specifications
Manage scope creep
Experience with Atlassian (Jira, Confluence) or other ticketing systems
Plan, manage and deliver technology projects with agreed upon scope, timeline and budget
Determine resource needs, assign individual tasks/responsibilities to project team and develop schedules to ensure timely completion of projects
Experience in managing long-term and short-term development projects (1 month to 2 years)
Experience in managing multiple dev projects congruently
Experience with Agile and Waterfall development strategies and its best practices, as well as critical path
Experience managing timelines and Gantt charts
Assemble resources and key decision makers from across the organization to deliver defined scope of work and support through go-live
Stay up-to-date with product knowledge, business flow, sales process and market dynamic
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
PMP Certification
Any coding experience
Experience with a variety of tech stacks
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
You’ll be responsible for driving our development teams over the finish line on a variety of different projects
You’ll be communicating with the development team in Vancouver and relaying objectives achieved to leadership
You’ll be communicating daily with the management team in Los Angeles
You’ll be holding teams accountable based upon timelines and functionality requirements
You’ll help develop spec documents to make requirements explicitly clear to the development team
You’ll be responsible for developing release schedules and aligning different team members to supply different content that you require
You’ll get to travel to Los Angeles a few times a year
COMPENSATION
Salary: $100,000 to $140,000 CAD
Potential for Company Stock Options
15 Days Paid Vacation
5 Days Paid Sick Leave
Comprehensive Health and Dental Insurance
PERKS
Fun office in downtown Vancouver, featuring open-plan work environments
Communal snacks and all the coffee or tea you could ever want
Weekly catered lunches at the office
Potential travel to our LA Headquarters to meet the rest of our team
Awesome social events and activities every month
Super dog-friendly office!
MORE ABOUT US

Our team in Vancouver is the heart of Create Music Group’s technology! We commit to building a community where our employees are valued for their contributions and perspectives. You will be working with a team where the impact of what you do really matters. While we are extremely hardworking and focused, Create Music Group also believes in a healthy work/life balance. You can find us hanging out in our common areas where we play video games, challenge each other to a game of pong, or lounging with our friendly office dogs! Our high-energy culture is a great place for personal growth and career success. If you are motivated, have a positive attitude, enjoy challenges and want to be part of a growing team - then we want to hear from you!

TO APPLY

Send us your resume and cover letter. Your cover letter should tell us who you are and why you would be the perfect fit for this position - and for our team! Link us anything else you want - your portfolio, website, socials, etc.

*** Only applications with a cover letter + resume will be accepted

Pretio is seeking a dynamic Project Manager for our Internal Products Team. This can be a remote position so candidates across Western Canada are encouraged to apply.

Pretio is an adtech leader that connects millions of people with some of the world’s greatest brands every day.

Our mission is to make the right connection 99% of the time. We know that the digital marketing space is a crowded one, but our amazing people are what makes us stand apart from the noise. Our team is made up of out-of-the-box thinkers who think critically and challenge standard practices, all in the name of making the right connection and serving our clients in the best way possible.

The PM helps to manage the creation and development of our live-owned products and will occasionally assist with third party agency clients. The PM understands user behaviours and motivations through qualitative and quantitative methods like user interviews, usability testing, A/B testing and experimental design

Proven ability to develop an idea from concept to prototype including the ability to document functional requirements

Able to communicate effectively with engineering, management, customers and business personnel
Able to prioritize and handle multiple projects simultaneously
Strong writing, presentation, and analytical skills with attention to detail

CANARIE strengthens Canadian leadership in science and technology by delivering digital infrastructure to support world-class research that directly benefits all Canadians.

CANARIE and its twelve provincial and territorial partners form Canada’s National Research and Education Network. This ultra-high-speed network connects Canada’s researchers, educators and innovators to each other and to global data, technology, and colleagues.

Beyond the network, CANARIE funds and promotes reusable research software tools and national research data management initiatives to accelerate discovery, provides identity management services to the academic community, and offers advanced networking and cloud resources to boost commercialization in Canada’s technology sector.

Established in 1993, CANARIE is a non-profit corporation, with the majority of its funding provided by the Government of Canada.

Who We Are

We’re a small team of dedicated thinkers, innovators, and problem-solvers. Our team is positive, passionate, and collaborative.

We work with Canada’s higher-ed community, private sector, and government partners to ensure that Canada’s bright researchers and entrepreneurs benefit from the technologies and tools that are critical to their success. Together with our partners across the country, we work to ensure that Canada leads in research and innovation.

The Position: Project Manager

The Project Manager is accountable for developing, implementing and administering CANARIE’s project management processes including reporting on these activities.

This is a full-time, permanent position that reports to CANARIE’s Chief Financial Officer.

Key Responsibilities

Standardizing project management workflows by:
Evolving, implementing and administering CANARIE’s project management processes, templates and reporting standards

Corporate project management as follows:
Partnering with CANARIE’s Program Managers and the internal support team to develop, implement and track project management plans for externally facing projects for CANARIE’s programs
Partnering with department managers and the internal support team to develop, implement and track project management plans for complex internal projects

Managing the prioritization of corporate initiatives by:
Managing a centralized calendar
Coordinating staff allocation to projects
Reporting on the status of corporate projects
Developing, analyzing and reporting on project execution metrics
Domestic and international travel may occasionally be required
Related duties and responsibilities, as required
The Ideal Candidate

To excel at CANARIE, you have a demonstrated capacity to work collaboratively on teams, and are also an energetic self-starter with the self-motivation to work independently. You have excellent oral and written communication skills, and can count time management, problem solving, and managing multiple priorities as your strengths. You also share a dedication to CANARIE’s core values: service, teamwork, innovation, quality, and integrity.

Relevant experience in publicly funded not-for-profit organizations is desirable. Bilingualism is preferred.

What You Bring

Education and Experience

College diploma or university degree in Business Administration or a related field or a suitable combination of education, experience, or other relevant training
Minimum of 8 years of relevant progressive experience

Skills

Experience managing information technology projects
Project management and project administration experience

Technical Proficiencies

Strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite
Other proficiencies related to the job
Come Work with Us

If this seems to be the right fit for you, please send us a note and your resume to careers@canarie.ca, and include the position title in your subject. We thank all applicants, however only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Our Company

We are a young energetic company and we are looking to grow our core team!

We Operate a large Custom Homebuilding business in Muskoka and we are expanding. This is your chance to get in on the ground floor!

Demonstrate excellent project management skills; while managing multiple projects.

Coordinate with contractors, the client, and their representatives including site staff on scheduling, coordination and other critical items to ensure the project is completed on time and on budget.

The ideal candidate will have 3 to 5 years of experience in residential construction

A detail-oriented person with exceptional organizational skills.
Ability to communicate effectively with fellow team members executive team, clients and trades

Welcome to Brand Society. We are an agency changing the game -redefining the way that brands engage consumers by creating compelling stories and experiences that attract and resonate across an ever-evolving landscape. A modern design studio that specializes in delivering sophisticated, intuitive design solutions. Our clients’ businesses range from automotive, retail, technology to various government agencies.

Brand Society develops interactive web-based media solutions and POS. The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for the successful development of these solutions, working with cross-functional, multi-project team resources to ensure solutions are delivered on-time and on budget according to defined scope, timeline and cost parameters. The Project Manager plans, schedules and controls all project activities toward these objectives, applying technical, theoretical and managerial skills to satisfy project requirements, while building positive professional relationships with clients and associates.

Manage client, third-party vendor and internal team performance and dynamics as appropriate
Plan and manage internal and external project communications, ensuring effective exchange of project information and deliverables
Identify, analyze, prioritize, mitigate and communicate project risks

Post-secondary education in business or technical field
Minimum 2 years of experience as a Project Manager managing print and interactive web projects
Experience planning and managing Print Campaigns
Project Management Certification desired but not required

Demonstrated experience managing multiple third-party vendors
Demonstrated experience managing external and internal clients

Ability to handle multiple planned and unplanned projects, roles and responsibilities

Bird Construction is a leading general contractor in Canada with a long history of service that has offices from
coast to coast. Bird’s clients include leading firms in the commercial, institutional, retail, multi-tenant residential,
industrial, mining, water and wastewater, energy and civil sectors. Today, Bird is a publicly traded corporation
with employees forming a significant shareholder group. This enhances the degree to which employees at all
levels commit to their clients. A hands-on approach to the business has given Bird an edge in being able to
make decisions quickly and to adapt to the requirements of their clients.

The Project Manager leads, directs and coordinates the daily management of the assigned project(s). This leadership position is accountable for the overall performance of the project including costs, schedule, quality, project status, and adherence to company policies and procedures. More importantly, the Project Manager will manage a successful team and help develop future construction professionals.

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Provide safety leadership through implementation of Bird Safety Program and monitoring of safety performance of project team and subcontractors.
Planning, scheduling, setting objectives and controlling activities during the construction phase of a project(s) in conjunction with the Project Superintendent and Project Team.
Supervision and development of project team members through regular feedback, training and coaching; timely completion of performance evaluations.
Administration and management of prime contract and subcontracts; includes negotiation and awarding of subcontracts for scopes of work as well as review and evaluation of subcontractor performance.
Manage project budget and billings and work with accounting to ensure timely payment of A/R and A/P.
Review and analysis of costs and identify revenue opportunities.
Monthly and quarterly reporting on financial and overall performance of project to Senior Management.
Foster and maintain positive relations and communication with clients, consultants, architects and subcontractors.

Qualifications:
Institutional and commercial construction background.
Completed education in a construction-related discipline as well as demonstrated, progressive experience in General Contracting; direct project management of large institutional or commercial projects.
Your demonstrated leadership, project management and problem-solving skills support your collaborative approach to delivering results and developing team members.
Service and results-oriented, you are able to build and steward trust with a broad network of professional colleagues, subcontractors and team members to effect competitive excellence, pride in teamwork and outstanding project delivery.
You have demonstrated competence in the areas of safety, workforce management, project execution, cost control, quality and administration.
Ability to read, understand and interpret contract documents, drawings, specifications, scopes of work and project schedule.
Excellent computer skills and proficiency with MS Office including MS Project; experience with Viewpoint Project Management system will be considered an asset.

The Hakai Institute conducts leading-edge, long-term scientific research on the coastal margin of British Columbia. Our set of interlocking programs blend technology and science to better understand the coastal margin of BC and beyond. We eschew artificial scientific, geographic and organizational boundaries, as our interdisciplinary teams work from ice fields to watersheds to the nearshore and coastal oceans. We link regional, national and global networks, bringing together academic, government and other partners to tackle complex scientific challenges.

Ensure that effective project mandates, requirements, and milestones are in place and that progress is effectively managed and communicated
Help manage collaborative development activities with regional and national partners, government agencies, universities and international research organizations

Overview


Do you want to watch clinical development change, or do you want to be the one to shape it?

Because we’re hoping you’re here for the latter.

Who are we?

We Are PRA Health Sciences. We provide innovative drug development solutions across all phases and therapeutic areas. But innovation just for the sake of innovation isn’t why we do it. Side by side with our clients, we strive to move drug discovery forward, to help them develop life-saving and life-improving drugs. We help change people’s lives for the better every day. It’s who we are. Innovating to help people is at the heart of our process, but it’s even more than that. It’s our privilege.

We are 17,000+ employees strong, operating in more than 90 countries. We are committed to saving lives, and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do.

Responsibilities


What will you be doing?

Long story short, you oversee the whole project or a portfolio of projects. As a Project Manager, you will be the primary liaison to your clients, ensuring questions are answered and issues are resolved. You work together with other project leaders and vendors to keep your projects running at optimal quality - on time and on budget - managing all project deliverables, with financial acumen and a risk mitigation mindset. As a project leader, you provide feedback to your team to help improve overall performance.

Job Responsibilities:
Act as primary liaison with clients.
Lead and direct cross-functional team leaders and third parties/vendors with some supervision and support.
Manage project contractual deliverables, including progress via metrics and adherence to contractual agreement time, quality/scope, and cost deliverables).
Participation and attendance in bid defense process.
Provide feedback on project team members’ performance to respective line-managers.
Maintain detailed understanding of each functional service area and lead multifaceted functional teams effectively with little supervision or support.
Develop in depth analysis and projections of project timelines and financials for senior and customer management with little to no supervision.
Qualifications


What do you need to have?

Level 1:
Minimum 3 years of experience in clinical research, including in a management role as a team lead or project manager, required
Undergraduate degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key responsibilities of this job, required
Undergraduate degree with 5 years of experience in clinical research with at least 2 years as a full-service project manager, preferred, OR
Graduate degree with 3 years of experience in clinical research and at least 1 year as a functional team lead role or single service project management, preferred
English fluency (ability to read, write, speak)
Travel of up to 25% is required for this position. Exact amounts of travel will vary, pending client needs.
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.


Level 2:
Minimum 5 years of experience in clinical research, including a minimum 2 years of full-service project management experience
Undergraduate or graduate degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key responsibilities of this job, required
Undergraduate degree with 7 years of experience in clinical research with at least 3 years as a full-service project manager, preferred, OR
Graduate degree with 5 years of experience in clinical research and at least 2 years as a functional team lead role or single service project management, preferred
English fluency (ability to read, write, speak)
Travel of up to 25% is required for this position. Exact amounts of travel will vary, pending client needs.
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

costs and schedule.

during the integrated team reviews;

This opportunity offers challenging work, intriguing projects, and a long- term professional career with a leading company in the industry! Please apply today!

We are an inclusive employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants needs throughout the recruitment process. Who We Are

Ocado is a UK based company admitted to trading on the London Stock Exchange (Ticker OCDO). It comprises one of the world's largest dedicated online grocery retailers, operating its own grocery and general merchandise retail businesses under Ocado.com and other specialist shop banners, together with its Ocado Solutions division.

The Ocado Solutions division is responsible for providing Ocado's innovative advanced robotics technology, known as the Ocado Smart Platform ("OSP"), to our major retailer clients around the world. OSP comprises access to Ocado's physical infrastructure solutions, running highly efficient warehouse operations for the single pick of products, together with the entire end-to-end proprietary software applications and advanced robotics required to operate a world-class online grocery business.

Our unique, proprietary and industry-leading technology is set to transform the shopping experience of consumers around the world. We have partnered with Sobeys in Canada to help redefine the grocery customer experience through the adoption of the centralized, automated model of online retailing provided by the Ocado Smart Platform.

Come join us as we build our Candian team, bringing world-class innovation and technologies to one of the most exciting global markets for e-commerce.

What You Will Do

The Ocado New Customer Fulfillment Center Implementation Team leads the end to end delivery of our industry-leading customer fulfilment centers (CFCs) around the world. Our Implementation Project Managers play a crucial role within the team for delivering individual CFCs on time, to specification and budget.

The role involves working as part of a dynamic internal team, and side by side with our partner businesses across the globe to ensure that CFCs are delivered to plan. This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced, driven individual with comprehensive project management skills and a natural ability to steer, influence, communicate across different levels and negotiate critical project issues. The budgets, scale, and scope of the projects are significant, but the degree of ownership, responsibility, and chance to develop make this position a career-defining role for the right candidate.

Day-to-day responsibilities could include:
Accountability for successfully delivering an Ocado/Sobeys CFC
Manage a circa $100m project to ensure the CFC is delivered on time, to specification and on budget
Manage client relationships with key client stakeholders
Lead and collaborate with internal and external stakeholder teams throughout the construction
Form fantastic working relationships and build strong on-going partnerships with key teams to ensure alignment across the project and to ensure that deadlines are met
Collaborate side by side with Implementation Manager counterparts in the UK to ensure wider program alignment, project continuity and delivery synergies
Drive the project by responding proactively to breaking issues, non-conformances, competing priorities and key dependencies to ensure that the right decisions are taken swiftly
Inspire confidence across the CFC project with timely and professional communications to all levels of the business
Coordination of risks and issues within the project with regular reporting and escalation to senior management when required
Deliver status reporting, change management and associated "best in class" project management documentation and administration
Maintain and monitor progress of the project against Ocados standard project methodology and proactively contribute to the development of best practice
Who You Are

To qualify for this position, you should meet the following requirements:
A minimum of 5 years' relevant experience.
BS/BA degree in a related discipline or advanced degree is preferred.
Extensive experience in managing complex projects or organizational change programs; ideally this would be in the engineering, construction, logistics or e-commerce sectors
A highly analytical and logical approach to work, with an ability to plan and prioritise workload to ensure all given deadlines are met
Ability to understand and challenge expert opinions and show initiative and innovation
World-class collaborator with experience working across complex organizations, with an ability to project a professional enthusiastic image at all times; providing leadership and motivation to the team (incl. stakeholders and suppliers); setting out clear goals parameters
Must possess strong people skills, with the ability and experience to motivate and influence teams and deliver through others
Strong skills as a nurturer of energetic and winning cultures within projects
Must be a driven, self-motivated individual, able to be resilient, adaptable to quickly changing priorities and deliver under pressure
Must have seasoned experience working with project and program leaders
Experience managing significant ($10m+) budgets
Fluency in French is not mandatory but is highly desirable
Must be able to travel, although the role will be predominantly based at the CFC, with a proven ability to manage projects across multiple time zones and flexibility to work remotely and with teams in other time zones.
Location:

· Train and provide guidance on Health and Safety policies and procedures.

· Be present on building sites to assess ongoing work conditions and ensure compliance.

· Coordinate with Site Managers and workers to develop and implement solutions to safety related concerns.

· Hold workers, including subcontractors accountable for failure to follow safe work procedures and Health and Safety policy.

· Facilitate and participate in incident/accident investigations and risk assessments. Develop corrective actions and follow up on actions to ensure compliance.

· Conduct regular site safety audits. Complete action plans to address any concerns.

· Responsible for all Site safety communication including, daily safety talks and JHSC meetings.

· Coordinate employee training; ensure all training is up to date and compliant, conduct new hire safety training and book training as required.

· Address worker or workplace concerns including; work refusal, conflict resolution, any health and safety related concern.

· Responsible for all emergency response procedures including; evacuation plans, fire drills, first aid.

· Oversee return to work process, WSIB claims management and modified work program.

· Manage site and project safety resources and equipment.

Qualifications

· Post-secondary certificate, diploma or degree in Occupational Health and Safety preferred.

· 5+ years' experience of practical Health and Safety Experience.

· Construction experience.

· Knowledgeable in Occupational Health and Safety legislation.

· Proven Leadership skills with the ability to influence others to follow safety practices, procedures, and regulations.

· Proven ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills.

· Regular travel will be required.

Benefits:
Extended health care
Life insurance
Casual dress
Vacation & paid time off
Company pension

Surespan is a Canada-wide general contractor working on heavy civil construction projects with a focus on bridge construction and remote access. Focussing on ingenuity and value-engineering, Surespan highly prizes each individual's contribution to making Surespan a best-in-class employer and industry service provider.

Review Glassdoor: https://goo.gl/djGUzi

Review LinkedIn: https://goo.gl/smoa76

Reporting to the Vice-President Construction, the successful candidate will take responsibility for all aspects of project planning, execution, monitoring and control as well as closing. The Project Manager represents the interests of Surespan Construction Ltd. in interactions with the customer, crews, subcontractors and suppliers, and the general public.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

Particular tasks and responsibilities include:
Read and thoroughly understand the contract.
Provides overall administrative and technical direction for the project.
Maintains safety standards in all aspects of the project.
Contributes as appropriate to the pre-award process of determining project scope, planning and estimating.
Participates in the development of the project budget and schedule and develops the project execution plan, after being awarded the project.
Implements procurement policies for subcontracted work and materials/equipment supply, and ensures compliance with agreements entered into. Evaluates all bids and quotations and selects subcontractors and suppliers.
Ensures that the project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule. Monitors and controls progress, costs and budgets throughout the project, and complies with all project reporting procedures. Monitor and regularly report variances in accordance with project controls procedures.
Implements change management procedures, ensuring clear and concise documentation for any and all changes to scope and delays that impact the work, including but not limited to weather, site access, component delivery, etc.
Responsible for planning, scheduling and estimating any potential scope changes. Identifies required and optional changes in project scope; negotiates change orders with the customer.
Responsible for the review and obtaining any interpretation of the project specifications and scope, and developing work plans to execute specifications for all disciplines.
Selects key personnel for the projects in conjunction with the Superintendent and Operations Coordinator.
Selects subcontractors for the project, in conjunction with the Superintendent
Advises the Vice President, Operations on project status and results in a timely fashion.
Reviews project’s progress with the project staff as the project proceeds.
Acts to resolve disputes between the company and customer, or company and subcontractors when possible prior to VP Operations involvement.
Ensures that the project staff understands the company’s operating policies and practices, and applies these appropriately.
Contributes to the overall positive team culture of the organization.
Effectively contributes to a strong team environment through assisting teammates in accomplishing mutual goals, supporting and promoting team spirit and cooperation.
Proactively looks for improvement opportunities to job related processes and procedures and communicates through appropriate channels.
This role will require travel, working extended hours, including a flexible and variable work schedule as needed to meet business objectives.
Education and Experience Required:

The Project Manager shall possess the following minimum education and work experience:
Experience in contract interpretation.
University or technical school graduate in engineering or construction management and eligible for or have attained P. Eng. or CET designations. Candidate will have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in the capacity of Project Manager supplemented by other aspects of construction management including cost estimating.
In lieu of post-secondary education, highly experienced individuals will be considered.
Comfort with a corporate structure and the associated administrative and reporting requirements.
Demonstrates strong customer focus at all times.
Demonstrates integrity, strong initiative, work ethic, as well as a focus on safety and quality of work on a continuous basis.
Skills Required:

The Project Manager shall possess the following skills:
Ability to understand legal and technical aspects of the contract.
Organizational skills and time management, project management.
Effective communication skills both written and verbal for interface with Clients and coworkers.
Able to work in a team environment (Engineering, Purchasing, Estimating, Construction, etc.), motivate compliance with processes and timelines.
Customer-focused in defining quality and establishing priorities.
Have an excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to perform comfortably in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented work environment and successfully execute many tasks simultaneously, with the ability to work extra hours if needed to meet deadlines.
Ability to manage time and deal with multiple issues, including shifting priorities and schedules.
Effective computer skills: Microsoft Office Software and other Company and discipline specific software skills. Microsoft Projects, presentation skills, meeting management.
Location of Employment:

The Project Manager will be based out of the Surespan Group Head Office in North Vancouver, British Columbia and work with each Business Unit across Canada. It should be expected that some travel may be required. Applicants must hold a valid passport and be legally permitted to work in Canada.

Surespan offers a competitive salary package commensurate with experience along with an excellent benefits package.

ClearBlue Technologies Group

Job Brief:

We are currently seeking Construction Project Manager to join our Team. If you match the description below, we want to meet you!

What Success Looks Like in This Role

The Construction Project Manager is the ultimate authority on the development and completion of all construction projects. Leading all functions of construction project management including planning, designing, processing, specs-approvals, managing staff, supervising sub-contractors, budgeting, scheduling, progress reporting and timely completion of projects.

Perks

RRSP Contribution Match: RRSP is a personal savings plan that lets you save for your retirement on a tax-sheltered basis. Includes employer match of up to 3%.

Healthy upside: Quarterly bonuses based on targets achieved.

Paid Training: We also provide the appropriate level of job training for the position and are here to help you and see you succeed!

Responsibilities:
Direct and oversee construction projects from conception to completion while monitoring compliance with health and safety regulations.
Coordinate subcontractors and the construction team to meet contractual conditions of performance.
Prepare external and internal reports relating to job status, daily progress, estimates, and deliverables.
Negotiate agreement terms, manage construction contract drafts, bid on projects, and obtain permits to analyze and mitigate risks.
Communicate with the responsible parties to ensure quality construction exceeds company standards and proper industry techniques and processes are utilized, while ensuring the client’s needs and wants are efficiently met.
Review projects on a daily basis to ensure quality construction standards exist and estimates remain within budget.
Supervise construction projects to ensure they are completed on time and exceed the customer’s requirements.
Work under deadlines in a fast-paced environment to plan and coordinate all aspects of the construction process from hiring contractors to working with engineers, architects, and vendors.
Compile and plan budget, cost estimates, and other financial estimates
Determine needed resources (manpower, equipment and materials) from start to finish with attention to budgetary limitations
Plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deadlines will be met
Ensure that all deficiencies are dealt with
Review the project at completion with the foreman and superintendent to discuss successes and challenges
Complete the required paperwork to ensure that the job is billed out
Manage project financial performance
Estimate project costs, and submit tenders
Manage the project and be present on project sites on a regular basis
Requirements:
Procore Experience
Understanding of all facets of the construction process
Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
Able to manage team of employees and multiple projects
Experienced at compiling and following strict budgets
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Accurate and precise attention to detail
Goal-oriented and organized leadership
Able to analyze problems for better solutions
In-depth understanding of the construction industry
Self-motivated and self-directed
Computer Skills: Proficient with Microsoft Office; Microsoft Project and experience with Project Management software preferred
Organized and able to create multiple timelines, budgets, and schedules
Advanced knowledge of construction management processes, means and methods
Ability to plan and see the “big picture”
Excellent time and project management skills
Able to Read and interrupt Construction Drawings
To apply, please send your application, with your name and resume.

To learn more about our company visit us here: www.clearbluetechgroup.com

Assignment Description

Millennium is looking for a Project Manager to manage multiple projects that support initiatives by expanding access to technology. The projects are usually conducted in a hybrid methodology between waterfall and agile working in a matrix environment. Some examples of the current projects are the implementation of an enterprise wide CRM system with a cloud-based integrated solution, a revitalized website, the implementation of Self Service Payment equipment and functionality, Self Checkouts and Point of Sales units and staff workspace reconfiguration.

The position includes the facilitation of collective decision-making, goal setting and conflict resolution; ensuring high quality processes and standards are in place to improve business processes and systems performance while preserving current technologies and environments stability.

Qualifications
University degree in engineering, business or equivalent discipline
Project management certification
Minimum of ten (10) years of enterprise experience leading enterprise projects with technology and facilities focus (i.e. Software as a Service (SaaS), application development focus, facilities renovations, etc.)
Experience performing business analysis. Hands-on experience in leading and building business process mapping and design
Experience leading stakeholders in visioning exercises
Minimum of five (5) years of experience leading agile teams in the Scrum master role and conducting daily standups, product grooming sessions, retrospectives, etc.
Demonstrated expertise in communications, stakeholders’ management and change management
Demonstrated ability to provide leadership, show initiative and self-direction, maintain currency of knowledge, and identify and solve problems that require investigation and creativity, under sustained pressure in a results-oriented team environment
Demonstrated ability to respond flexibly and productively to multiple and changing priorities in a variety of work environments, including joint project teams, work with consultants, and on individual assignments
Superior teamwork, interpersonal, organizational and facilitation skills
Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with clients, vendors, and team members: strong customer service orientation
Demonstrated ability to be an effective when dealing with people from outside the organization
Ability to build trust, communicate status and set a course for success with senior executives and inspire collaborations and team spirit for all project team’s members while working in a matrix environment
Strong financial expertise to manage programs and projects budgets with focus to minimize variances to actuals with timely and accurate reporting
Technical Capabilities
Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with corporate clients, vendors, and team members: strong customer service orientation
Demonstrated superior problem solving skills
Very strong oral and written communication skills
Extended experience with project management tools
Very strong competency with MS Office Suite (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Visio and other relevant technical tools
Proven experience facilitating and managing agile ceremonies required to successfully deliver technical solutions (stand up meetings, retrospectives, product grooming sessions, etc.)
Program Management and Scrum Master/Agile Practitioner certifications an asset

Project artifacts such as business case, project charter, projects roles and responsibilities, project scope, business requirements, project schedule, and project management plan
Programs and projects dashboards to provide high level view of initiative status and key metrics
RFx and any other deliverables required by Purchasing during the procurement process

YOUR DAY AS A CLIENT SERVICE MANAGER

Proactively assists Client Executive/ Client Service Manager(s) in managing a book of business by reviewing the client’s exposure and loss history and proposing appropriate coverages and/or solutions.
Assist Client Executive/ Client Service Manager(s) in developing account strategies, presentations and proposals.
Assist Client Executive/ Client Service Manager(s) in ensuring maximum retention of book by providing exceptional client service by regularly contacting existing clients to ensure quality service is being delivered and needs are met and exceeded.
Ensures all client and insurer correspondence is accurate and flows in an efficient manner.
Responds to telephone calls and written inquiries from clients and underwriters in a timely and professional manner.
Markets new business as well as renewals and endorsements in a timely and efficient manner.
Prepares underwriting submissions, client proposals, Cover Notes, Certificates of Insurance etc and maintains appropriate documentation for various accounts and/or correspondence.
Reviews policy wordings and other documentation for accuracy and completeness.
Participates in industry functions and targeted public relations activities.
Maintains extensive market relationships.
Requests and follows up with insurers for quotes, outstanding information, endorsements or policy documentation.
Ensures abeyances and follow ups for outstanding items from underwriters and clients are in place and done.
Collaborates with Client Service Assistants ensuring internal and external documents are accurate and expedited in a timely manner.
Monitors and ensures follow ups on outstanding client accounts receivables.
Works with Accounting to resolve accounting discrepancies and related issues.
Follows BFL policies and procedures, including security and quality procedures, as currently set out and as amended from time to time.
Other miscellaneous duties and special projects as required.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE

Level 2 license
At least 5 years of experience as a Client Service Manager or similar position
FCIP or CIP designation preferred
Must have strong technical knowledge
Must be completely client focused
Good knowledge of markets and their policy wordings
Good quantitative skills and personal computer literacy – strong Word and Excel
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Creative application of products, markets, and alternatives
Ability to independently carry out assignments

PERKS

You will be working in a thriving, progressive and well-established insurance brokerage company
Competitive salary, group insurance benefits, and RRSP matching plans from your first day
A culture that encourages and supports continued education

OFFICE INFORMATION

Founded in 1987 by Barry F. Lorenzetti, BFL CANADA is one of the largest employee-owned and operated Risk Management, Insurance Brokerage, and Employee Benefits consulting services firms in Canada. The firm has a team of over 700 professionals located in eighteen offices across the country. BFL CANADA is a founding Partner of Lockton Global LLP, a Partnership of independent insurance brokers who provide Risk Management, Insurance and Benefits Consulting services in over 130 countries around the world.

Here at BFL our employees have the freedom to demonstrate their own creativity, leadership and entrepreneurship because we strongly believe in them. We are a national collaborative team that thrives in a fast-paced environment.

Our Vancouver office is situated in Coal Harbour, half a block from the world renowned Seawall. Our office is easily accessible for employees by car and public transit and there are bike storage lockers in our building.

Let’s stay in touch: follow us on LinkedIn to see what we are up to and check out our other job openings.

Learn more about us on our website: http://www.bflcanada.ca/

Who Are We?

At National Credit Recovery Inc., our primary purpose is to serve Clients and their customers related to debt collection, debt purchasing, business process outsourcing (BPO) and litigation solutions. Our Agents are central to ensuring we are able to collect on outstanding debts effectively. They also provide the best customer service, loyalty, litigation and retention solutions possible too.

We are a global organization with multiple locations in Canada and abroad. It is important to have a Project Manager who is able to set a long-term vision and strategy for our companys products and clients. We are excited to provide internal and external growth opportunities as we continue to expand. National Credit Recovery Inc., is proud to offer initial paid training, monthly coaching, performance management support and ongoing learning and development opportunities. We value providing numerous employee engagement and philanthropic initiatives throughout the year also.

Who You Are:

NCRis ideal Project Manager is someone who has the ability to communicate effectively and delegate duties to appropriate participants and stakeholders. Strong Project Managers thrive at planning activities by establishing project plans, specifying goals, strategy, scheduling, and identification of risks, contingency plans, and allocation of available resources. The ideal candidate enjoys the full project lifecycle and making a vision come to reality! The ideal candidate for this role will have a significant influence on the future growth of NCRi across the organization. It is a necessity for our ideal candidate to have a strong background in software development too. If this sounds like you, please apply now!

What Youll Be Doing:
Manage from concept to design sample production, testing, forecasting, cost analysis, mass production, promotion, support, and finally product end of life
Effectively engage, lead and influence cross functional teams to deliver highest level of quality on all projects within committed timeline and scope, and meet all project deliverables
Communicate with project team in planning, scheduling, and coordinating production projects
Track project activities such as milestones, deliverables, budgets, and expenses
Manage and implement marketing activities through research, strategic planning and implementation
Maintain an accurate record of all historical quotations, invoices, detailed drawings, and final renderings for all projects
Conduct project reviews and communicating updates with production team
Attend and facilitate meetings as required
Other duties as assigned
What You Bring:
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience as a Project Manager in a BPO environment
PMI/PMP certification is considered a definite asset
Formal project management training is desirable
Strong knowledge of project management methodology and best practices (e.g. PMI)
Strong proficiency using Project Management Tools including MS Office Suite, MS Project, Teamwork, etc.
Must be self-motivated, a self-starter and able to work with a team
Solid time management skills, the ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to organize, prioritize and adapt to change

As a management consulting firm, Advanis’ expertise and innovations have a profound impact on business. Our

research helps clients design successful new products efficiently; set the right prices; test entirely new product or
service ideas; increase their customers’ satisfaction; target their most lucrative customers; and much more. We
consult to some of the biggest and best corporations in the world. Our work helps clients stay competitive in
today’s rapidly evolving markets.

Do you have experience managing teams, making impactful decisions, and are well organized, detail oriented,
and pro-active? Consider a career move to Advanis as a Project Manager. We are seeking candidates with a

University degree and a minimum of two years marketing or marketing research project management
experience. Prior experience with—and a strong interest in—data collection management and market research is
a must.

Candidates who have studied market research, operations management, management science, project
management, marketing, and management information systems focus have been successful at Advanis, but
other degree programs have also yielded strong team members.

On client-sponsored projects, Project Managers work closely with other project team members and will have

day-to-day activities that involve:
 Establishment of project timeline, and management of timeline and budget;
 Primary client contact on all data-driven projects, and during the data collection stage of all other

projects;
 Responsibility for overall success of data-driven projects, including project set-up, survey design, and

reporting (primarily online);
 Responsibility for successful data collection on all projects;
 Management of all tasks of the project including survey design, field administration, sample list

identification, data cleaning, analysis, and reporting, through:
o Day-to-day contact with project team members to ensure that tasks are being completed

appropriately and timely; and
o Interface with Computer Sciences team up to project data collection launch.

Delbridge Solutions is growing.

Delbridge Solutions is one of North Americas fastest growing technology companies. With offices in Toronto, USA, and Europe, we provide world-class software solutions for Budgeting, Forecasting, Reporting, Business Intelligence, and Sales Performance Management. Majority of our clients are Fortune 1000 companies and trust Delbridge Solutions as a partner to support their business processes.

We are looking for creative, entrepreneurial, and ambitious individuals who share our passion for growth!

Who you are:

You are an experienced Project Manager who wants to lead multiple client projects across different industries. You want to work with clients to maximize their investment in their solution while building long-standing relationships with your clients. As a client-facing, technologically-astute problem solver, you are ready to join a rapidly scaling mid-sized company that is effectively carving out their share of the market. You are ambitious and you want to join a company that is ready to invest in you the way you invest in them

You want to:

Be recognized. You want to move up the ranks quickly. You want your achievements to be applauded and appreciated.

Be an innovator. You want to bring your ideas to the table and see them implemented.

Be a leader. You want to customize smart solutions and work in partnership with our clients. You want to mentor junior team members.

What you will be doing as Project Manager:
Communicate. You will manage project timelines, budget and provide regular status updates to the client. You will create documentation and lead project meetings.
Drive implementation. You will provide leadership through the full lifecycle of the solution. You will:
Gather client business requirements in partnership with the consultants and help document them in a requirements document
Create and manage project plans
Chair status meetings and also create status reports
Manage project tasks between consultants and manage project timeline/scope/budget
Communicate project risks and create mitigation strategies
Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a tailored solution meeting clients specification.
Mentor. You will support and mentor the junior team members.
Nurture. You will manage and foster strong client relationships, providing support to project kickoffs and ongoing implementations.
Travel. You will reinforce our belief in face-to-face relationship building, traveling up to 5 days a month to client sites across North America.
What you will bring to the team and Delbridge Solutions:
Project Management experience. You have 2+ years in managing delivery of enterprise application solutions, ideally in a client-facing consulting role at a software/SaaS product company
Tools. You are an expert in using Project Management software such as MS Project, Smartsheets, etc.

Job Title: FSP - Clinical Research Manager - Oncology ( Project Manager - Office Based
Job Description:
Job Overview:


Clinical Research Manager

Oncology Experience Required

Office Based in Montreal/Quebec

Why settle for one thing when you can have everything?

Covance gives you the best two-for-one opportunity for career growth. Who doesnt want twice the perks? Working at Covanceone of the largest FSP CROsand partnering with one sponsor with a dedicated therapeutic focus. You can have it all!

As a Covance employee dedicated to an FSP project, you will bring your specialized discipline to a core team working directly with one sponsor. Whether your specialization is in clinical monitoring, clinical project management, data management, biometrics or pharmacovigilance, Covance has an FSP opportunity to match your area of expertise.

You will enjoy the best of both worldsall the benefits that come along with Covances Energizing Purpose, Exceptional People and Extraordinary Potential combined with working exclusively with one sponsor and this also comes with the benefit of bringing your strong therapeutic experience to allow your expertise to shine through.

Covances FSP model is flexible and scalable. Our teams are collaborative and proactive a great place for you to continue honing your therapeutic skills and growing and excelling in new and exciting research.

Covances reach is global extending to 60+ countries making us one of the largest FSP CROs. No matter where you are located on the globe, we have an FSP opportunity for you.

The Clinical Research Manager is accountable for execution and oversight of local operational clinical trial activities and has ownership, oversight, and impact on local regulatory and financial compliance, at a country operations level in compliance with ICH GCP and country regulations.

The position has a significant impact on how a country can deliver country-specific trial commitments and objectives especially during the study.
Significant impact on the ability to effectively conduct clinical studies and develop the pipeline, while maintaining local regulatory and compliance requirements in countries. The position has a significant impact on how a country can deliver country-specific trial commitments and objectives. As a customer-facing role, this position will build business relationships and represent Client with investigators, functional outsourcing partners and other external partners and therefore have a significant impact on country-level customer relationships.
Requires ability to make decisions independently and oversee important activities relevant to clinical research activities in the country according to predetermined global policies and commitments with the support, oversight and supervision of the Country Research Director or Therapeutic Director. Requires strong understanding of local regulatory environment, country regulations, client policies and procedures, quality standards.
Strong scientific and clinical research knowledge is required for this position. A strong understanding of clinical trial planning, management and metrics is essential as well as the ability to focus on multiple deliverables and protocols simultaneously. Requires skills to effectively build and maintain professional relationships with investigators and other external stakeholders, requiring strong communication, educational/pedagogic, diplomatic and empathic skills. The role will require proven ability to collaborate and lead high performing cross-functional teams also in a virtual environment.
The position requires strong leadership skills (scientific and business) and ability to coordinate and lead local teams to high performance. Oversee country commitments, compliance and training needs. Additionally, business leadership and alignment with corporate requires that individual has ability to lead across several dimensions simultaneously.
Works collaboratively with Country and Regional Operations; Pharmacovigilance, Regulatory, Global Medical Affairs and Global Human Health internally; and with external functional outsourcing vendors. Requires coordination and alignment with the regional and broader organization. Additionally, will work to build and maintain relationships with investigators and other external partners and promote Clients reputation. In collaboration with CRD, represents Client in Pharma industry issues and in seeking influence in external R&D environment.
Education/Qualifications:

University/college degree (life science preferred), or certification in a related allied health profession from an appropriately accredited institution, nursing certification, medical or laboratory technology
A combination of education, training, and experience will be considered in place of a college degree

Experience:
1-2 years of Clinical Research Project Management or Clinical Lead experience
At least 1 year of field monitoring experience
1+ years of experience working in Oncology as PM or lead
A total of at least 5 years experience working in clinical research

The Hakai Institute conducts leading-edge, long-term scientific research on the coastal margin of British Columbia. Our set of interlocking programs blend technology and science to better understand the coastal margin of BC and beyond. We eschew artificial scientific, geographic and organizational boundaries, as our interdisciplinary teams work from ice fields to watersheds to the nearshore and coastal oceans. We link regional, national and global networks, bringing together academic, government and other partners to tackle complex scientific challenges.

The Hakai Institute - part of the British-Columbia-based Tula Foundation is currently looking for a talented project manager to join our team. The successful candidate will be part of an outstanding distributed organization. You will work on a variety of interesting and challenging projects. You will collaborate with local, regional, national and global experts. Specific roles and responsibilities may include:
Work closely with our Research and Finance teams to manage the creation and submission of project proposals
Manage project implementation, helping to define, redefine and communicate project milestones and status throughout the project
Manage all formal project reporting submissions
Organize, plan and execute project meetings, including project status updates, with clearly articulated recommendations and requests for feedback
Ensure that effective project mandates, requirements, and milestones are in place and that progress is effectively managed and communicated
Help manage collaborative development activities with regional and national partners, government agencies, universities and international research organizations

5+ years’ progressive experience in a similar role
Post-secondary education (BA, BSc, BBA) or equivalent
Ability to meet deadlines while working in a distributed and collaborative team environment
Strong leadership and organizational skills with the ability to build and maintain strong working relationships
Ability to prioritize workloads and delegate responsibilities effectively
Excellent technical, interpersonal and teamwork skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Previous experience in a senior leadership role would be an asset

We are an engaged, energetic, creative, collaborative team

Competitive salary and extended medical benefits
Commitment to excellence at all levels

Overview


Do you want to watch clinical development change, or do you want to be the one to shape it?

Because we’re hoping you’re here for the latter.

Who are we?

We Are PRA Health Sciences. We provide innovative drug development solutions across all phases and therapeutic areas. But innovation just for the sake of innovation isn’t why we do it. Side by side with our clients, we strive to move drug discovery forward, to help them develop life-saving and life-improving drugs. We help change people’s lives for the better every day. It’s who we are. Innovating to help people is at the heart of our process, but it’s even more than that. It’s our privilege.

We are 17,000+ employees strong, operating in more than 90 countries. We are committed to saving lives, and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do.

Responsibilities


What will you be doing?

Long story short, you oversee the whole project or a portfolio of projects. As a Project Manager, you will be the primary liaison to your clients, ensuring questions are answered and issues are resolved. You work together with other project leaders and vendors to keep your projects running at optimal quality - on time and on budget - managing all project deliverables, with financial acumen and a risk mitigation mindset. As a project leader, you provide feedback to your team to help improve overall performance.

Job Responsibilities:
Act as primary liaison with clients.
Lead and direct cross-functional team leaders and third parties/vendors with some supervision and support.
Manage project contractual deliverables, including progress via metrics and adherence to contractual agreement time, quality/scope, and cost deliverables).
Participation and attendance in bid defense process.
Provide feedback on project team members’ performance to respective line-managers.
Maintain detailed understanding of each functional service area and lead multifaceted functional teams effectively with little supervision or support.
Develop in depth analysis and projections of project timelines and financials for senior and customer management with little to no supervision.
Qualifications


What do you need to have?

Level 1:
Minimum 3 years of experience in clinical research, including in a management role as a team lead or project manager, required
Undergraduate degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key responsibilities of this job, required
Undergraduate degree with 5 years of experience in clinical research with at least 2 years as a full-service project manager, preferred, OR
Graduate degree with 3 years of experience in clinical research and at least 1 year as a functional team lead role or single service project management, preferred
English fluency (ability to read, write, speak)
Travel of up to 25% is required for this position. Exact amounts of travel will vary, pending client needs.
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.


Level 2:
Minimum 5 years of experience in clinical research, including a minimum 2 years of full-service project management experience
Undergraduate or graduate degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key responsibilities of this job, required
Undergraduate degree with 7 years of experience in clinical research with at least 3 years as a full-service project manager, preferred, OR
Graduate degree with 5 years of experience in clinical research and at least 2 years as a functional team lead role or single service project management, preferred
English fluency (ability to read, write, speak)
Travel of up to 25% is required for this position. Exact amounts of travel will vary, pending client needs.
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.
LOCATION: This position may be home-based or office-based, depending on location.

PRA is an EEO/AA employer and is committed to providing opportunities to minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities.
