Position Overview: *
We are looking for a Project Manager to be located in either our Brandon or Winnipeg, MB location. This position is responsible for planning and preparing construction schedules and reporting on milestones. Other responsibilities will include but are not limited to: management of cross functional team activities to ensure that the build team objectives are met, selecting subcontractors and coordinating their activities, management of the build and associated budget, ensure in stock equipment levels are adequate to meet build program demands.

Key responsibilities include:
Schedule and direct site construction activities in logical steps, budget proper time and resources required to meet deadlines defined in the build schedule.
Working with the Program Manager to prepare and submit budget estimates.
In consultation with Construction Managers - determine project labor requirements
Responsible for creating and updating in SAP – Vendor Data, IO’s and PO’s for each build related project. Goods Receipt on PO’s will be updated as work is completed
Regularly meet with the construction team, build coordinators and site configuration team to ensure schedules are aligned.
Review inventory levels to ensure equipment required for the build program is available
Update the database to track program changes and progress on a daily basis
Bi-weekly meeting with the Real Estate team or contractors to track site acquisition progress and to determine workload priorities.
Generate weekly progress reports for Sales / Marketing and XCI management team
Compile reports on construction related spend for monthly budget reviews
Ensure the most cost-effective plan and schedule is implemented without compromising safety or build quality
Ensure all change orders / requests between team members and contractor representatives are properly documented (i.e. verbal agreement followed up with a PO immediately)
The ideal candidate will possess:
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in the project management or build-out of wireless network infrastructure.
Completion of related Engineering post-secondary diploma/degree or equivalent through a combination of education and/or experience.

Overview

An exceptional opportunity currently exists to join one of North America’s leading management training and productivity improvement consulting firms with a solid reputation for delivering quantifiable and sustainable operational and financial results to our diverse Client base.

Parisella, Vincelli Associates Consulting Group (PVA) is made up of a dedicated and passionate group of professionals from a variety of professional disciplines. Our mandate is to improve our Client’s operational and financial performance through a wide variety of techniques including: on-the-floor one-on-one coaching, development and installation of Management Operating Systems, enhanced work methods, streamlined business processes, etc. Our business mantra is three-fold: Targeted Performance; Measurable Results; and Sustainable Change.

We are currently looking for a Project Manager to join our growing team of experienced and dedicated professionals. We are looking for someone with proven experience managing project teams within the following disciplines: change management, productivity management, process improvement, process re-engineering, cycle-time enhancements, organizational redesign, and supply chain management.

As a Project Manager, you are looking for a team environment which is fast paced, challenging, and motivating, while providing you with a career path where you will be assigned to our Clients’ sites located across North America, and to improve their business processes through PVA’s proven approach and methodology.

Required Qualifications
Minimum 5-7 years of experience in related consulting industries, with a proven track record supported by a minimum 3-5 years of experience as a Project Manager
Direct involvement in implementing organizational and performance based change initiatives, and successfully working with various improvement methodologies and their application in the Client’s work environment through multidisciplinary project teams
Bachelor’s Degree such as a BA, BSc, BComm, or BBA (MBA or Master’s is an asset) with a focus on operations management, organizational development, business management, performance enhancement, etc.
Diversified business background and acumen, supported by strong analytical and mathematical proficiencies
Strong training and one-on-one coaching skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills (both oral and written)
Proficient with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, Power Point, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to lead, manage and motivate project teams to succeed in a dynamic, fast paced, and results oriented environment
Demonstrated ability to adapt quickly in a constantly changing project environment
Organized, disciplined, and motivated to succeed
Preferred Qualifications
Excellent understanding, knowledge, and / or expertise in business sectors such as: Automotive, Consumer Goods & Services, Energy & Resources, Forest Products, Health Care, Manufacturing, Mining & Metals, Telecommunications, and Transportation & Logistics
Demonstrated knowledge / understanding of concepts such as Lean, Six Sigma, TQM, JIT, MRP, ERP, procurement, etc
Fluency in a second language (French)
Proficiency with project management and application software
Must Have the Following Requirements
Ability to travel 100% of the week (from Sunday night to Friday)
Have a valid Driver’s licence
Valid passport (American or Canadian)
Why join PVA?
Dynamic, challenging and results oriented team environment supported by a passionate group of professionals
Growth potential and continuous learning opportunities
Competitive salary and benefits package
Permanent, full-time position (not contract work)
Retirement program participation (RRSP in Canada / 401K in the USA)
Annual vacation & sick day allotments and an exclusive Travel Day Program
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Description:
At Williams Engineering Canada, we brighten the lives of people in our community.

We believe in the value of shared knowledge to better consult, create, and encourage diverse perspectives, to provide innovative solutions across the busiest cities and the most remote regions of Western and Northern Canada. We recognize that our people do much more than engineer solutions and solve our clients’ greatest challenges; they have the opportunity to impact the communities in which they live, work, and build relationships in. In order to make a positive impact on our communities, we must start by positively impacting our own people. To us, this means providing fair compensation, training, advancement opportunities, and an open-door team environment. This also means maintaining a healthy work-life balance, which is why we offer a flexible work environment to support the unique and busy lives that our people lead.

Position Purpose: Responsible for the management and delivery of projects, understanding client’s requirements, delivering projects within these requirements, and within the set schedule and budget. Additionally, the project manager assists with business development and the generation of revenue while striving for client satisfaction while maintaining project profitability.

Gross Project Fee Revenue Target: $2M+ per annum

Specific Responsibilities Include:
Service Line Accountabilities –Project Quality and Profitability

Regional Accountabilities - Client Relationships and Operational Management

Work with RBDMs on acquiring new business and keeping RBDM informed of project progression.

Assist regional revenue target in pursuing proposal work with RLT.

Coordinate with Team Leads/Engineering Managers to identify resources needed and assign individual responsibilities.

Create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.

Manage day-to-day operational aspects of projects and scope.

Effectively apply our methodology and enforce project standards.

Review deliverables prepared by team before passing to client for quality assurance.

Minimize our exposure and risk on projects.

Review team hours and expenses on a regular basis.

Ensure project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately.

Follow up with clients, when necessary, regarding unpaid invoices.

Manage project budget.

Motivate team to work together in the most efficient manner.

Determine appropriate revenue recognition, ensure timely and accurate invoicing, and monitor receivables for project.

Hold regular status meetings with project team.

Analyze project profitability, revenue, billing rates and utilization.

Manage day-to-day client interactions, while managing client expectations.

Review project contracts to ensure scope and risk is considered and covered in relation to delivery of project.

Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.

Assist proposal teams to ensure accurate and professional presentation.

Lead the preparation of proposals for projects.

Champion project management processes and technology.

Employees are required to adhere to the company and client safety policies and practices in effect at any given time.

Education:
PMP certification, P.Eng., or C.E.T. designation.
10+ years’ experience in Consulting Engineering or related field.
Experience in engineering project delivery.

Qualifications:
Advanced understanding of revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections and makes decisions accordingly.
Understands various pricing models and billing procedures.
Ability to facilitate complex teams and client meetings effectively.
Possesses strong understanding in the area for engineering for multiple disciplines.
Excellent interpersonal skills; a person who listens well, respects diversity of opinions and has an open, clear and succinct communication style.
Superior presentation and project management skills.
The ability to recognize and accurately define problems and solutions by collecting data and establishing facts to draw valid conclusions.
A results oriented and decisive individual with the ability to delegate effectively.
A leader in organizational and time management skills in handling multiple priorities, performing a variety of tasks, and meeting required deadlines.
Experienced and excellent judgement to plan and accomplish ambitious but achievable goals for various members of teams to deliver projects.
Act as a leader in representing the company to the staff, clients and community, ensuring best image is presented.
Strong understanding of contractual negotiations and associated risks with opportunities.
A mentor to newer project managers.
Lead by example in providing project audits to ensure correct process for other project managers.
Provide experienced leadership in a business environment.
Application knowledge of WEC systems and programs (including Gnosis, Vision, Career Path, MS Office, Planifi, MS Dynamics, discipline specific drafting/design software, etc.)

We're looking for a Project Manager to report to one of our Program Managers. You’ll be responsible for projects each with budgets less than $1 million and ensuring that the team delivering that work has everything they need.

As a Project Manager, you’ll be ensuring that projects happen flawlessly, on time and on budget. You’ll have multiple projects on the go at any given time, so you should be able to handle competing priorities. You should be a master crafts-person, with an understanding of all of the Project Management fundamentals and good business sense. Relationships will be key, as things move quickly at Klick, and you’ll need to build mutual trust to be run successful projects.
Your primary responsibilities on your projects will be:
Scope, risk, schedule, budget, quality, and communication
Updating project documentation: WBS, Gantt Charts, specifications, status reports, change requests, etc.
Manage relationships with third party stakeholders if the project requires

At Klick, we hire senior, but that doesn’t mean you won’t have room to grow. With 30-50% growth year over year, it will be integral that you not only know your craft, but that you prepare yourself to take on bigger and more complex projects.
To succeed at Klick, you’ll need to love a fast pace, believe that big things are possible and know that you’re only as good as your team. Specifically, we’re looking for:
3-5 years of project management experience
Experience in digital, CRM, software development, digital/interactive and/or new media projects
Agency experience and pharma experience are major bonus points
Certifications considered but not mandatory
Klick is growing fast. Since inception in 1997, we’ve averaged 30% growth every year, and this year’s crazy audacious target is 50%, and it looks like we’re going to meet it. All of that insane growth means a ton of opportunity, both for your career and for us to build an amazing workplace where you can do your best work. We’re one of Canada’s top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Managed, Best Employers and fastest growing. We’ve been able to keep our culture and our company strong by exacting hiring standards, so it’s hard to get a job here, but it’s totally worth it (if
you ask us).

Thanks and we look forward to hearing from you!

Klick embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We're committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. AdvanTecs Industrial Division, Advanced Flow Systems, is seeking a collaborative and innovative Project Manager to join our team in Maple Ridge, BC. As a Project Manager with Advanced Flow Systems, you will be responsible for providing full-cycle project management, ensuring projects stay within scope and budget and are delivered on time to the customer. We are looking for someone that is not afraid to hold others accountable and will ensure that projects hit their committed dates.

Essential Functions for this role are:

Client Project Management

· Manages customer relationships, together with Sales, and drive projects through to completion with the goal of ensuring customer satisfaction and retention while maintaining project budget

· Develops and controls project schedule and deliverables through project planning, execution and communication

· Ensures scope of work is well defined and understood by both internal and external stakeholders

· Manages risks and their impact and creates awareness of risks with internal and external stakeholders

· Manages the project to defined plan, ensuring sign offs and customer approvals as needed and detailed documentation of all agreements, disagreements, changes and issues

· Reviews and organizes project documentation and coordinates with Quality Assurance and Document Control to meet ISO Standards and customer requirements

· Tracks project milestones, progress payments and costs and reports them against budget

· Assists inter-disciplinary team members in the scheduling of project tasks and finds appropriate resolutions to identified issues

· Schedules meetings, documents and distributes meeting minutes to the team and to customers

· Manages subcontractors and vendors, and monitors their scope and schedule

· Manages Change Orders and Engineering Change notices with customer and internal stakeholders such as Estimating, Scheduling, Production, and Quality Assurance) including clear scope and follow-through to execution and billing

· Investigates budget overruns and shortfalls, summarizes and presents findings to internal stakeholders and Management

· Responsible for providing project status and progress updates including details on issues and their resolution to management

· Develops comprehensive project completion reports (lessons learned) to avoid errors, inefficiencies and other issues in future projects

Internal Project Management

· Assists in the delivery of other internal activities such as new system implementation and process and/or customer audit

· Leads and/or participates in process improvement and other internal projects

Estimating

· Developing various types of estimates for project work from conceptual proposals and budgetary quotes, to detailed estimates for ongoing projects utilizing estimating tools including rate sheets, databases and spreadsheets

· Responsible certain aspects of the estimate on case by case basis. Responsibilities may include:

o Establishing the estimating scope of work;

o Preparing the estimate methodology and basis of estimate;

o Producing the overall estimate schedule; and

o Identifying all deliverables and interfaces with other disciplines

· Coordinating and monitoring input from Engineering, Procurement, Contracts, Quality and operations to ensure a timely completion

· Establishing the key parameters associated with the overall quality and accuracy of the estimate such as: equipment and material pricing, material take-off, BOM and other, and labour productivity

· Assembling final estimate packages (once trained)

· Conducting detailed analysis of completed estimates including bench-marking against similar completed projects and reconciliation of completed estimate to prior estimates

· Producing comprehensive estimate review packages for company and client review including all cost inputs, markups and margins, discounts and assumptions

· Drafting customer proposals

· Conducting pre-proposal review meetings for projects quoted

· Maintaining appropriate backup and history of quote assumptions, exceptions, codes and calculations

· Participating in estimate vs. actual results review after projects are completed

· Offer suggestions for improvement and participate in team activities

If you have the following skills, then we want to hear from you!

· 5 or more years experience as a Project Manager within the heavy industry, construction, or manufacturing environment

· Business or Technical Degree is an asset

· Experience in the pipe welding industry is an asset

· Currently pursuing or willing to pursue PMP Certification is an asset

· Advanced proficiency in MS Project, Word and Excel

· Strong understanding of business, data, process, cultures, and people

· Ability to hold other departments accountable to their commitments and deadlines by being firm yet professional

· Superior documentation skills including creating detailed records and history of events with proof (i.e. pictures, emails, receipts of delivery etc.)

· Exceptional written and verbal communication skills abilities, with the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization

· Strong work ethic, positive energy and a take-charge attitude while remaining humble and cooperative

· Superior time-management and organizational abilities, with a strong ability to set and follow priorities

· Strong sense of ownership and urgency with an ability to understand the importance of others requirements

· High ability to work independently, with an awareness of when to escalate a decision and ask for help

· Appreciation of feedback and constructive comments based in a desire to improve and impress the customer

· Ability to take ownership of your projects

· Ability to innovative solutions to drive project schedules and increase margins

· Proven ability to maintain composure under pressure and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

Working Conditions

· This position works out of an office environment most of the time and will be required to enter a well-ventilated manufacturing facility as needed and be exposed to noise and welding environment.

· This role may be required to visit client sites that are outdoors and be exposed to the elements.

The Project Manager, under the direction of the President, Production, will primarily be responsible to coordinate and assist site superintendents with general project management. This position will assist to remove any/all road project blocks. This role will also manage and create project documents, schedules, and budgets. The Project Manager must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and position-relevant bonding and certifications.

Responsibilities:
Coordinate and assist site superintendents with general project management.
Assist to remove any/all road project blocks.
Manage and create project documents, schedules, and budgets.
Create and supply health and safety documents to site superintendent and/or foremen in addition to creating and issuing startup notices.
Work with purchasing to issue subcontractor and supplier purchase orders.
Review and source possible cost savings.
Obtain product and material related documentation for consultant or customer.
Monitor project schedules and budgets.
Attend weekly/biweekly project meetings with the client and the engineer. Manage all action items that arise in these meetings.
Create a bi-weekly action item report outlining areas of the project that are behind schedule and create an action plan to help the team gets the project back on schedule or ahead of schedule.
Monitor project quality, Issue start-up notices and assist site superintendent with project start-up.

Objectifs du poste

L’équipe système OPC est responsable de la coordination de la construction, de la surveillance des travaux (Sous-systèmes d’Alstom et le autres travaux Civil/Archi/EM), ainsi que la mise en place d'un suivi de l'état d'avancement de tous les éléments concernant les activités de construction/Installation et les contrôler en vue des durées et productivités planifiées.

Responsabilités

Au sein de l’équipe OPC, le Coordonnateur Construction suit de près toutes les activités des Sous-systèmes sur la zone assignée et se rapporte au Responsable de construction de la zone.

Le Coordonnateur Construction organise les ateliers de coordination et effectue des visites régulières de chantier pour :

Surveiller, acter et reporter les activités des sous-systèmes et/ou celles des autres entités de construction (Civils, etc.)
Vérifier, suivre et reporter les conflits et les problèmes de coordination signalés par les sous-systèmes et/ou celles des autres entités de construction (Civils, EM, etc.).
Coordonner le processus de mise à disposition des zones de travaux entre les différentes entités de construction ; documenter et suivre la liste des réserves jusqu’à l’achèvement des travaux.
Évaluer l'avancement des travaux par rapport au programme de construction convenu.
S'assurer que les permis nécessaires pour les activités de construction sont disponibles avant le début des travaux d’installation.
S'assurer que chacun des Sous-systèmes dispose du matériel, moyens et outils nécessaires pour l’exécution des travaux conformément au programme de construction convenu.
Acter les déviations des travaux chantier soulevées par les Sous-systèmes et suivre avec les personnes en charge jusqu’à la résolution.
En coordination avec l'équipe SSE, identifier et reporter les dangers et risques liés aux travaux de chantier.
Évaluer la possibilité des travaux en parallèle entre les différentes entités pour optimiser le calendrier de construction, puis coordonner et planifiez ces activités en conséquence.
Suivre les rapports quotidiens des travaux d’installation produits par les Sous-systèmes.
Coordonner avec l'équipe du matériel roulant les mouvements et les livraisons des trains.

D’autre part, le coordonnateur doit assister, si besoin, le Responsable de Construction de la Zone dans la consolidation/préparation des documents liés à la gestion de la construction.

Profil recherché:
Formation Ingénieur + expérience minimum 5 ans dans le domaine de la construction
Excellentes compétences en Reporting/Coordination.
Très bonne maitrise de l'Anglais/Français.
Utilisation courante des outils Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint et Outlook).
Vous êtes reconnus pour votre capacité de travailler sous pression, d’opérer dans un environnement multitâche et votre engagement.
Bonnes compétences en communication indispensables

Construction coordinator

Purpose of the job

System OPC Construction Site Coordination Team is responsible to ensure the coordination

(between Alstom’ sub-systems and the Civil/Archi/MEP Works) and the surveillance of the works as well as the implementation of progress monitoring of all items concerning the construction / installation activities and compare to planned durations and productivities.

Responsibilities

Within the Construction Site Coordination Team, Construction coordinator follows closely all subsystems works in the assigned area and reports to the Area Construction Manager.

The Construction coordinator conducts site visits and organizes necessary workshops to:

Monitor, record and report Construction activities of Subsystems or/and other construction entities (Civil, MEP, etc.).
Identify, verify and follows-up reported clashes between subsystems and other construction entities (Civil, MEP, etc.).
Lead the process of handover/handback related to specific work areas; log and follow-up the snags until completion of works.
Assess and report the progress of works against the agreed construction schedule.
Ensure that the necessary permits are available before the start of the Installation works.
Ensure that each subsystem mobilizes its teams and have all the required material, plants and tools for installation works as per agreed construction schedule.
Log the deviations of site works raised by Subsystems and follow-up with persons in charges until rectification.
Coordinate with EHS team identifying and reporting EHS hazards.
Optimize the construction schedule by assessing and coordinating concurrent activities between different entities (Subsystems and Civil/MEP Engineer).
Follow the Subsystems daily reports.
Coordinate with the Rolling Stock team the movements/delivery of trains.

Otherwise, the Construction Coordinator should assist, when needed, the Area Construction Manager during the preparation/consolidation of construction management documents.

Profile:
Engineering Degree + Minimum 5 years of experience in the construction field
Excellent Reporting/Coordination skills
Fluency in English and French is essential
Fluency in the use of Microsoft office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).
Behavioral Skills / Competencies: Demonstrated ability to deliver under pressure
Excellent level of multitasking, Committed and dedicated to deliver and Good communication skills.

CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGER NEEDED IMMEDIATELY!!

INTRODUCTION

Located in the Greater Toronto Area, we are a team of highly qualified professionals with over 17 years of experience as General Contractors. We provide the highest quality preventative maintenance solutions for all common areas of multi-unit residential buildings. We offer scheduled maintenance, as it may be needed from time to time, and onsite inspections. We also specialize in custom indoor and outdoor renovation services.

OUR VISION

Our vision is to deliver top-quality work that consistently meets standards of professionalism, reliability, and integrity. We strive to build trusting relationships with our clients based on ethics, honesty, and respect.

OUR MISSION

By implementing best practices in project management and general contracting, we promise a worry-free turnkey service. In all of our projects, we use the best material and tools and strive to meet and exceed the expectations of our clients. We understand that building maintenance and repair can have an impact on our clients, their families, neighbors and pets. In agreement with our clients, we aim to contain noise level and working hours while maintaining a safe environment and providing the highest standards of quality. We are 100% committed to all projects and guarantee open communication and involvement at all times.

OUR SERVICES

As a leader in the field, we offer the convenience of using one company to handle all building maintenance and property refurbishment saving our clients time, effort, and expense. Our complete building solutions include scheduled maintenance and regular onsite inspections, as well as custom indoor and outdoor renovation services.

Career Opportunity
Role Title
Project Manager
Purpose of role
The Project Manager will provide and apply high quality project management methodologies and techniques to manage a wide range of projects. Using high-level understanding of business and IT processes and strategy, the Project Manager will be involved in projects to enhance current operations and/or to develop new business solutions deploying technology within Foresters Financial or with 3rd party vendors/partners
Job Description


Responsibilities:
Plan, manage and successfully oversee the implementation of large, highly visible projects
Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion is on time, on budget and within scope. This includes the development and management of detailed project charters, plans, work breakdown structures and time budgets
Conduct post-project reviews to certify project success criteria have been met
Identify and assess risks, severity and impacts. Determine and implement risk strategies and communicate risks to client and stakeholders as appropriate
Closely monitor project financials, follow-up on issues and provide regular status updates to management and stakeholders
Monitor implementation efforts and transition issues to ensure that business risks are identified and solutions are recommended
Lead and manage project teams to effectively utilize strengths of team members
Manage stakeholder expectations, including understanding their points of views and needs while keeping Foresters Financial strategic goals in mind and fostering a win/win relationship
Leverage knowledge of business through understanding, and applying rapidly changing technology and business process delivery trends
Apply influence and negotiation to gain support and achieve consensus
Qualifications:
Minimum 5 years of experience in a Project Management role managing a variety of business and IT project sizes and types
University degree; an MBA would be an asset
Strong IT Infrastructure and or Application Development project experience
PMP or formal project management education is an asset
Experience implementing Life Insurance projects, products and IT systems and awareness of Life Insurance industry knowledge and systems features including New Business and In-Force administration
Experience with both Waterfall and Agile development methodologies
Must be well versed in project management methodology and have proven ability to lead projects to appropriately guide project requirements, identify technology issues and risks and direct investigation and analysis of technical alternatives
Ability to assess priority and severity of issues by understanding business objectives, technical costs and user needs as well as being able to weigh alternatives for resolution
Understand and manage to the critical path of the project
Proven track record of successfully delivering significant business projects
Understanding of finance issues, budgeting and cost-benefit analysis
Excellent planning and organization skills
Ability to provide solutions while managing tight deadlines and motivating in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a keen attention to detail
Excellent ability to multitask, to respond to constantly changing needs and schedules and to organize and prioritize workload
Strong interpersonal skills to interact with all levels of staff from CEO, SVP’s and VP’s to managers and other staff
Sound judgment and decision-making skills to act effectively in resolving issues as they arise.
Demonstrated oral and written communication skills and ability to negotiate
General knowledge/understanding of business processes and strategy
Strong technical and analytical skills
Risk and Control assessment skills
Proven ability to influence, lead and obtain agreement from cross-functional team
Only those candidates who will be selected for further consideration will be contacted by our Talent Acquisition Team. Foresters Financial is committed to supporting diversity and accessibility. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Company Logo:
Overview:
Cyntech Services, a Keller Company, has built a solid reputation throughout Canada as an industry leader in providing innovative, comprehensive, and reliable storage tank upgrading and construction services. Our unique pneumatic lifting technology allows our skilled engineers and technicians to safely and efficiently lift and service large diameter storage tanks for the energy and petro-chemical industry.

We take pride in providing the highest possible level of service to our clients. By fostering a healthy and safe work environment, Cyntech is able to attract some of the best individuals in the industry. Our experienced team of professionals are able to tackle any job while adhering to the highest standards of safety and quality. Cyntech has a proven quality assurance program that has been developed for both broad and specific scopes of work.

We are seeking a results-driven Project Manager to join our Bonnyville, AB area office. The ideal candidate will have the desire to work in a quality company with superior products and a reputation for excellence.

Responsibilities:
In this position, you will be responsible for day to day management of projects, estimating and proposal preparation, business development, contract negotiations, managing change orders and claims, monitoring and managing project schedule, cost control and QA/QC requirements, project invoicing and securing payment.

Qualifications:
Qualified candidates should have 5 - 10 years Civil Construction or Structural Construction experience with a BS or MS degree in Civil Engineering or Construction Management. Other requirements include: strong project management experience in general construction, solid familiarity with all project contractual requirements and proven experience working effectively as a liaison with Engineers, General Contractors, and Owners. Experience within project development/marketing and experience with Aboveground Storage Tank/API preferred. Excellent computer skills and written & verbal communication skills necessary. Travel required.

Who We Are

Ocado is a UK based company admitted to trading on the London Stock Exchange (Ticker OCDO). It comprises one of the world's largest dedicated online grocery retailers, operating its own grocery and general merchandise retail businesses under Ocado.com and other specialist shop banners, together with its Ocado Solutions division.

The Ocado Solutions division is responsible for providing Ocado's innovative advanced robotics technology, known as the Ocado Smart Platform ("OSP"), to our major retailer clients around the world. OSP comprises access to Ocado's physical infrastructure solutions, running highly efficient warehouse operations for the single pick of products, together with the entire end-to-end proprietary software applications and advanced robotics required to operate a world-class online grocery business.

Our unique, proprietary and industry-leading technology is set to transform the shopping experience of consumers around the world. We have partnered with Sobeys in Canada to help redefine the grocery customer experience through the adoption of the centralized, automated model of online retailing provided by the Ocado Smart Platform.

Come join us as we build our Candian team, bringing world-class innovation and technologies to one of the most exciting global markets for e-commerce.

What You Will Do

The Ocado New Customer Fulfillment Center Implementation Team leads the end to end delivery of our industry-leading customer fulfilment centers (CFCs) around the world. Our Implementation Project Managers play a crucial role within the team for delivering individual CFCs on time, to specification and budget.

The role involves working as part of a dynamic internal team, and side by side with our partner businesses across the globe to ensure that CFCs are delivered to plan. This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced, driven individual with comprehensive project management skills and a natural ability to steer, influence, communicate across different levels and negotiate critical project issues. The budgets, scale, and scope of the projects are significant, but the degree of ownership, responsibility, and chance to develop make this position a career-defining role for the right candidate.

Day-to-day responsibilities could include:
Accountability for successfully delivering an Ocado/Sobeys CFC
Manage a circa $100m project to ensure the CFC is delivered on time, to specification and on budget
Manage client relationships with key client stakeholders
Lead and collaborate with internal and external stakeholder teams throughout the construction
Form fantastic working relationships and build strong on-going partnerships with key teams to ensure alignment across the project and to ensure that deadlines are met
Collaborate side by side with Implementation Manager counterparts in the UK to ensure wider program alignment, project continuity and delivery synergies
Drive the project by responding proactively to breaking issues, non-conformances, competing priorities and key dependencies to ensure that the right decisions are taken swiftly
Inspire confidence across the CFC project with timely and professional communications to all levels of the business
Coordination of risks and issues within the project with regular reporting and escalation to senior management when required
Deliver status reporting, change management and associated "best in class" project management documentation and administration
Maintain and monitor progress of the project against Ocados standard project methodology and proactively contribute to the development of best practice
Who You Are

To qualify for this position, you should meet the following requirements:
A minimum of 5 years' relevant experience.
BS/BA degree in a related discipline or advanced degree is preferred.
Extensive experience in managing complex projects or organizational change programs; ideally this would be in the engineering, construction, logistics or e-commerce sectors
A highly analytical and logical approach to work, with an ability to plan and prioritise workload to ensure all given deadlines are met
Ability to understand and challenge expert opinions and show initiative and innovation
World-class collaborator with experience working across complex organizations, with an ability to project a professional enthusiastic image at all times; providing leadership and motivation to the team (incl. stakeholders and suppliers); setting out clear goals parameters
Must possess strong people skills, with the ability and experience to motivate and influence teams and deliver through others
Strong skills as a nurturer of energetic and winning cultures within projects
Must be a driven, self-motivated individual, able to be resilient, adaptable to quickly changing priorities and deliver under pressure
Must have seasoned experience working with project and program leaders
Experience managing significant ($10m+) budgets
Fluency in French is not mandatory but is highly desirable
Must be able to travel, although the role will be predominantly based at the CFC, with a proven ability to manage projects across multiple time zones and flexibility to work remotely and with teams in other time zones.
Location:

The role will be based in Pointe-Claire, QC, with a level of travel required to visit other sites and offices internationally particularly within the onboarding phase, for an initial prolonged period.

For a sense of who we are and what we deliver we invite you to explore online to learn more about Ocado Technology and Ocado Engineering, which directly support the Ocado Solutions division, and take the next step in what will be an amazing career with us.

Learn about our partnership with Sobeys:
Ocado seals new international tie-up with Sobeys in Canada
A sneak peek at the future of grocery automation in Canada
Check out this video about our advanced robotics technology

What Success Looks Like in This Role

The Construction Project Manager is the ultimate authority on the development and completion of all construction projects. Leading all functions of construction project management including planning, designing, processing, specs-approvals, managing staff, supervising sub-contractors, budgeting, scheduling, progress reporting and timely completion of projects.

Estimate project costs, and submit tenders
Manage the project and be present on project sites on a regular basis

Understanding of all facets of the construction process

Experienced at compiling and following strict budgets
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Excellent time and project management skills

and pro-active? Consider a career move to Advanis as a Project Manager. We are seeking candidates with a

Who Are We?

At National Credit Recovery Inc., our primary purpose is to serve Clients and their customers related to debt collection, debt purchasing, business process outsourcing (BPO) and litigation solutions. Our Agents are central to ensuring we are able to collect on outstanding debts effectively. They also provide the best customer service, loyalty, litigation and retention solutions possible too.

We are a global organization with multiple locations in Canada and abroad. It is important to have a Project Manager who is able to set a long-term vision and strategy for our companys products and clients. We are excited to provide internal and external growth opportunities as we continue to expand. National Credit Recovery Inc., is proud to offer initial paid training, monthly coaching, performance management support and ongoing learning and development opportunities. We value providing numerous employee engagement and philanthropic initiatives throughout the year also.

Sr. Project Manager:
CLIENT is undertaking several projects to define Business Intelligence & Analytics (BIA) planning roadmaps aligned to CLIENTs lines of business. The BIA team requires a Sr. Project Manager resource to project manage the completion of these BIA projects. As well, the successful PM resource will be expected to lead the coordination of BIA resources and issues with the ADMS Upgrade project, which is managed externally to BIA.

The time allocation for the successful candidate will be split across three areas of focus, which includes;
• Customer Experience BIA Roadmap development project,
• Transmission & Distribution BIA Roadmap development, and
• Coordination of schedule, tasks, resources & issues with the ADMS Upgrade project.

Its expected that this resource allocation will be on a full-time basis based on 7.5hrs per day with time to be allocated within the projects as needed.
Please note, the Project Managers are required to be on-site for the duration of the projects.

As a result, CLIENT is looking to secure the services of one (1) Senior Project Manager, with demonstrated experience delivering opportunity assessments, roadmap planning, or similar delivery planning artifacts, with specific experience with BIA initiatives. The Project Manager must have experience managing projects which included a large operational reporting deliverable.
The Senior Project Manager will work under the direction of the Senior Manager, BI and Analytics, with guidance from the BIA Portfolio Manager, with support from BIA team members and with other CLIENT IT resources as required.

The Senior Project Manager is responsible for all aspects of project management to completion assigned projects while following the CLIENTI Portfolio and Project Management (PPM) framework under the guidance of the IT PMO and the BIA Portfolio Manager.

The Senior Project Manager will have responsibility for deliverables, including (but not limited to):
• Development and management of Project Management controls including Project Charter, Project Management Plan, RACI, etc.
• Delivery of an Opportunity Assessment, Total Cost of Ownership, Requirements, Capital Work Order, and supporting documents.
• Develop and manage overall planning, budgeting, scope management, scheduling, resourcing, risks & issues (through Microsoft Project Online).
• Provide project leadership throughout all project phases.
• Monitor and control key indicators and milestones throughout the delivery of the project.
• Manage project communications and business expectations.
• Make recommendations and take corrective action to manage issues and risks throughout the project.
• Prepare status reports for project stakeholders.
• Ensure all relevant commercial requirements are met including legal and procurement within scope of a project.

Qualifications

The successful Senior Project Manager will have the demonstrated capabilities identified below, as well as demonstrated prior experience delivering or working on Business Intelligence, specifically reporting, projects.
The successful candidate will have a positive attitude, high personal standards and be a good communicator. In addition, they should be at home in a technical environment where success is based on establishing face-to-face working relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts.
The critical skills for this role include:
• Experience managing data projects which can including Business Intelligence dashboard development, data integration, data lake development, moving data to cloud for analytics, BI platform development and/or report conversion from one BI platform to another. There must be a solid understanding of big data and reporting.
• Demonstrated Senior Project Management capabilities (leadership, influence, delegation, organization, facilitation, project planning & control).
• Experience managing both the business, financial and the technical aspects of a project.
• Experience using MS Project 2016 (in a MS Project Server Online environment) to manage tasks, schedule and resources
• PMP certification.
• Working knowledge of organizational change management practices (e.g. Prosci) would be considered an asset.
• Working knowledge of ITIL would be considered an asset.

Areas of focus for this role include:
• Coordination with stakeholders from multiple business units with sometimes conflicting requirements and/or priorities.
• Management of a project team with diverse resources from multiple teams with the IT Division.

About Us

Backed by a 50-year legacy of engineering excellence, reliability and industry-leading customer service, Telesat has grown to be one of the largest and most successful global satellite operators.

Telesat works collaboratively with its customers to deliver critical connectivity solutions that tackle the world’s most complex communications challenges, providing powerful advantages that improve their operations and drive growth.

In addition to our state-of-the-art global, geostationary satellite fleet, Telesat LEO, our Low Earth Orbit network scheduled to begin service in 2022, will revolutionize global broadband connectivity by delivering a combination of high capacity, security, resiliency and affordability with ultra-low latency and fiber-like speeds.

Telesat also provides industry-leading technical consultation and support services to satellite operators, insurers and other industry stakeholders around the globe.

Privately held and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, with offices and facilities around the world, Telesat’s principal shareholders are Canada’s Public Sector Pension Investment Board and Loral Space & Communications Inc. (NASDAQ: LORL). For more information, visit www.telesat.com.

We're here to make a huge impact, and we wake up with this mindset every day.

Overview

The Project Manager provides project support to the MSA Executive, Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association. The Project Manager supports the management of engagement activities, budgeting, proposal preparation, and accountability reports to stakeholders. This is done with a focus on improving collaboration and quality improvement with Health Authorities, consistent with the goals of the Facility Engagement Initiative. More information on the Facility Engagement Initiative, the Memorandum of Understanding: Regional and Local Engagement can be found here.

Key Responsibilities and Duties

At the direction of the MSA Executives, the Project Manager:

· Supports the development and implementation of structures, processes and programs that support the Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association to prepare to meet their funding criteria as per the Memorandum of Understanding: Regional and Local Engagement.

· Assists with the preparation and implementation of governance, operational structures and processes in alignment with the provincial Facility Engagement Initiative, as appropriate.

· Provides direct support to the Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association in developing effective engagement processes and lines of communication among the medical staff of Dawson Creek District Hospital.

· Coordinates and schedules meetings of the Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association, and meetings between the Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association (or its representatives) and the Health Authority.

· Provides administrative and corporate governance support for meetings of the Association and meetings of directors, including preparation of meeting packages, agendas, briefing and discussion documents, minute-taking for meetings, and arrangements for meeting logistics (food order/room bookings).

· Coordinates submitted projects/initiatives; analyzes data; researches and advises on complex issues.

· Tracks and prepares reports on the major areas of activity and project progress relating to physician engagement.

· Maintains of records for financial reporting analysis, as required.

· Facilitates the administration of contracts and agreements with local structures and other resources as required.

· Attends Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association meetings, meetings with Health Authority Representatives, and Dawson Creek District Hospital Medical Staff events.

· Communications with and among the members, directors and others, as required to follow up on action items and develop strategies to address issues;

· Liaises with the Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association Facility Engagement Lead on matters related to the operations, projects and programs of the Dawson Creek Medical Staff Association, as appropriate.

Skills & Qualifications

· A Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in disciplines such as health administration, health policy, and/or community development.

· At least 5 to 10 years’ experience or an equivalent combination of relevant education and experience.

· Strong knowledge of health regions and acute-based health care services. Experience working with physicians and health authorities preferred.

· Demonstrated leadership skills with experience in leading complex change.

· A solid track record in stakeholder engagement and experience working with multiple stakeholders and groups.

· Experience with quality improvement and evaluation.

· Diplomatic problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills.

· Exceptional organizational, delegation, presentation, communication, facilitation, and relationship-building skills.

· Project and budget management experience.

· Ability to handle multiple projects, meet tight deadlines and work independently, as well as in a team environment.

· Excellent computer skills (i.e. Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint).

· Must be willing and able to travel: valid driver’s license required and access to a car preferred. Evening meetings and/or overnight stays will likely be required.

Competencies

· Project Management

o Sound analytical, problem solving, and project coordination skills.

· Collaborative Leadership

o Promotes and generates cooperation to achieve a collective outcome; fosters the development of a common vision and fully participates in creating a unified leadership team that gets results.

· Conflict Management

o Brings substantial conflicts and disagreements into the open and attempts to manage them collaboratively to build consensus.

· Team Leadership

o Willingly cooperates and works collaboratively toward solutions that generally benefit all involved parties; works cooperatively with others to accomplish organizational objectives.

· Drive for Results

o Demonstrates concern for achieving or surpassing results against an internal or external standard of excellence. Shows a passion for improving the delivery of services with a commitment to continuous improvement.

· Strategic Perspective

o Develops and communicates a compelling and credible vision of the future for members of the medical staff. Focuses on the long term success of the organization as a community. Shares the vision, values and organization plan with all stakeholders; and integrates and represents fairly the needs and desires of all stakeholders.

· Building Strategic Alliances

o Has knowledge and skills to engage internal and external stakeholder analysis and to negotiate agreements and alliances based on full understanding of politics.

Work from home opportunities
Flexible working hours

LNS Services is looking for a new team member to fill the position of Project Manager. In this position you will be responsible for all aspects of successful execution of a project. Provides overall leadership and control of the project, typically involving scope definition, scheduling, mobilization, engineering, design, procurement, subcontracts, construction, commissioning and closeout. Project usually includes heavy industrial installation of bulk materials handling equipment and structures, although it may include commercial, infrastructure or institutional facilities.

Education:
Post-secondary degree in engineering, construction or project management, or a technical school diploma and extensive practical PM experience on applicable project work.

Experience:
Eight (8) years of work experience in engineering, construction or other related technical field with increasing levels of responsibility and development, or fifteen (15) years of similar experience (without an appropriate post-secondary degree).

Responsibilities:
Participate in proposal development (scope, schedule, cost, team, execution plan)
Work with the project stakeholders to develop the project charter, which outlines the scope, goals, deliverables, required resources, budget and timing
Complete the activities required in the project mobilization checklist
Manage your external customer and communicate regularly with them
Customize a project management and execution plan to provide direction to the team
Develop the work breakdown structure and estimate the effort required for each task
Create the cost control budget from the as-sold proposal cost estimate
Provide a construction-driven, resource-loaded project schedule to identify when each task will be performed
Develop a procurement and contracting plan and associated schedules
Determine what external consultants or subcontractors will be required to complete the work identified in the project plan
When required, work with HR and group leads to recruit appropriate staffing resources
Clearly communicate expectations to team members and stakeholders
Proactively lead, coach and motivate project team members
Be accountable for project team performance and results
Act as a mediator between stakeholders and project team members
Work with the project team to resolve issues and solve problems
Effectively manage project scope by ensuring that any changes to scope are documented and approved using a change order process
Ensure that project quality and safety targets are set and achieved
Track and report regularly on project milestone progress using approved reporting template
Provide internal project financial reports to senior business manager
Determine project close-out and archiving requirements and complete a post-project evaluation of performance
Ensure all project documents are safely archived before demobilizing project team

Skills:
Effective team management and ability to hold members responsible for their performance
Excellent communication skills – Both verbal and written
Attention to detail but ability to focus on the big picture
Proficient in project management tools including MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
Outstanding time management, prioritization, multitasking, and organizational skills

We are a growing tunneling contractor based in Calgary, AB that offers its employees exciting opportunities for career growth, a great working environment, and competitive compensation. Innovative Pipeline Crossings Inc. (IPC) specializes in trenchless tunneling technologies, balancing cost-effective drilling solutions with environmental protection.

IPC is respected in the trenchless contracting industry by clients and employees alike, for our integrity, commitment to excellence, and customer orientated service.

Our great team of staff are the best in their field. They are committed to collaboration, quality, and safety. We invest in our people, and they deliver excellence!
We believe in leading through innovation and providing superior value and service to our clients and partners by with safe, high quality, and environmentally conscious trenchless solutions.

The Position: As we are expanding our field of operations, we are in need of more specialized and experienced people to join our team. We’re looking for someone motivated to join IPC in the position of Project Manager. The Project Manager is responsible for the safe, technical and economical execution of the company’s project in the field. Together with the Project Director and the Construction Manager, he will be part of the Site Management. This position will develop and provide technical, project management and cost-control support on an operational level.

Compensation includes:
Equitable pay based on experience
Health spending account and extended benefits

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Ensure the Project Execution Plan, Inspection Test Plans, will be followed and executed accordingly
Maintain customer relations during the project duration to client’s counterpart, providing reporting and status updates as required
Participate in pre-planning meetings with the client, sub-contractors and internally
Regularly review budget, costing, and controls to ensure execution of the project within the budget, and communicate budget status to VP Operations
Ensure schedule stays current, updating as required, and maintaining the execution of the project within the final and approved schedule
Assist with site logistics, including crew travel schedules, trucking deliveries
Procurement and coordination of sub-contractors and their crews and ensure their reporting and work
Participate in daily site meetings, and reporting
Approve field tickets and invoices, timecards, POs
Monitor job progress, and provide daily status reporting to clients and senior management
Ensure quality control measures are met on site and appropriate documentation is made
Assess possible risks for projects, and create a management plan for mitigating risks, in collaboration with the Proposal Manager, HSE Manager, and VP Operations
Ensure the HSE standards by the client and the company will be followed and executed by all team members

Management Responsibilities

This position will involve managing and supervising overall site crew as well subcontractors

Key Technical Skills and Knowledge

Theoretical and practical project management knowledge and experience
Knowledge of various techniques and tools required, such as budgeting, costing, scheduling, etc.
Ability to create project execution plans, using bid documents and other resources
Knowledge and experience in strategic planning, risk management, and / or change management
Excellent time management and organizational skills, with strong attention to detail and the ability to multitask and handle competing priorities
Budget management skills, including knowledge of cost allocation and forecasting
Proficiency in project management software tools, and Microsoft Office suite
Proven leadership, conflict resolution, communication, and analytical skills

Qualifications

Education – An education in the tunneling or oil field industry, such as Driller, Heavy Duty Machinery operator or another related field experience are required
Education – A bachelor’s degree (4 year) or higher in Engineering, OR related technical field experience. Minimum 2 years of specialized experience in the field, as well at least 2 year’s experience in a leadership or supervisory positions.
Relevant work experience – knowledge and experience with Microtunneling Machines and/or Direct Pipe technology are preferred

Key Competencies

Adaptabilty: Adapts well to changes in assignments and priorities; adapts behavior or work methods in response to new information, changing conditions, or unexpected obstacles; approaches change positively and adjusts behaviors accordingly.
Collaboration: Builds constructive working relationships with clients/customers, other work units, community organizations and others to meet mutual goals and objectives. Behaves professionally and supportively when working with individuals from a variety of ethnic, social and educational backgrounds.
Client Focus: Makes customers/clients and their needs a primary focus of one’s actions; shows interest in and understanding of the needs and expectations of internal and external customers (including direct reports); gains customer trust and respect; meets or exceeds customer expectations
Decision Making / Solution Driven: Breaks down problems into components and recognizes interrelationships; makes sound, well-informed, and objective decisions. Compares data, information, and input from a variety of sources to draw conclusions; takes action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and probable consequences.
Team Leadership: Communicates a vision and inspires motivation; engages with others (direct-reports and peers) in team process to solve problems; works to find a win/win resolution of differences; is aware of how management style impacts staff productivity and development; modifies leadership style to meet situational requirements; helps team stay focused on major goals while managing within a context of multiple directives.
Work Standards: Sets high standards and well-defined, realistic goals for one’s self; displays a high level of effort and commitment towards completing assignments in a timely manner; works with minimal supervisor; is motivated to achieve.
Communication Skills: Must have very good written and oral communications. Required to speak effectively before groups of clients, subcontractors, and/or employees of the organization. Educated in Intercultural Management to be able to manage the international teams working for the company
Stress Tolerance: Maintains effective performance under pressure; handling stress in a manner that is acceptable to others and to the organization.

Physical Demand

Office – While performing the duties of this job, requirements may include prolonged standing, walking and/or sitting. Computer work is also required which will involve visual focus on screens and documents.
Field – While performing the duties of this job, requirements may include use of hands to handle/feel objects, tools, or controls. Occasionally requirement to climb stairs and/or ladders, balance, stoop or kneel and/or walk on uneven ground. You may occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Ability to hear equipment alarms, voices, radio transmissions, and other noises consistent with construction sites. Ability to work in all weather conditions, inside and outside.

Other Relevant Information

This position is assigned to the Corporate Office and to field locations during operations.
Travel is required in this position.

Job Title: FSP - Clinical Research Manager - Oncology ( Project Manager - Office Based
Job Description:
Job Overview:


Clinical Research Manager

Oncology Experience Required

Office Based in Montreal/Quebec

Why settle for one thing when you can have everything?

Covance gives you the best two-for-one opportunity for career growth. Who doesnt want twice the perks? Working at Covanceone of the largest FSP CROsand partnering with one sponsor with a dedicated therapeutic focus. You can have it all!

As a Covance employee dedicated to an FSP project, you will bring your specialized discipline to a core team working directly with one sponsor. Whether your specialization is in clinical monitoring, clinical project management, data management, biometrics or pharmacovigilance, Covance has an FSP opportunity to match your area of expertise.

You will enjoy the best of both worldsall the benefits that come along with Covances Energizing Purpose, Exceptional People and Extraordinary Potential combined with working exclusively with one sponsor and this also comes with the benefit of bringing your strong therapeutic experience to allow your expertise to shine through.

Covances FSP model is flexible and scalable. Our teams are collaborative and proactive a great place for you to continue honing your therapeutic skills and growing and excelling in new and exciting research.

Covances reach is global extending to 60+ countries making us one of the largest FSP CROs. No matter where you are located on the globe, we have an FSP opportunity for you.

The Clinical Research Manager is accountable for execution and oversight of local operational clinical trial activities and has ownership, oversight, and impact on local regulatory and financial compliance, at a country operations level in compliance with ICH GCP and country regulations.

The position has a significant impact on how a country can deliver country-specific trial commitments and objectives especially during the study.
Significant impact on the ability to effectively conduct clinical studies and develop the pipeline, while maintaining local regulatory and compliance requirements in countries. The position has a significant impact on how a country can deliver country-specific trial commitments and objectives. As a customer-facing role, this position will build business relationships and represent Client with investigators, functional outsourcing partners and other external partners and therefore have a significant impact on country-level customer relationships.
Requires ability to make decisions independently and oversee important activities relevant to clinical research activities in the country according to predetermined global policies and commitments with the support, oversight and supervision of the Country Research Director or Therapeutic Director. Requires strong understanding of local regulatory environment, country regulations, client policies and procedures, quality standards.
Strong scientific and clinical research knowledge is required for this position. A strong understanding of clinical trial planning, management and metrics is essential as well as the ability to focus on multiple deliverables and protocols simultaneously. Requires skills to effectively build and maintain professional relationships with investigators and other external stakeholders, requiring strong communication, educational/pedagogic, diplomatic and empathic skills. The role will require proven ability to collaborate and lead high performing cross-functional teams also in a virtual environment.
The position requires strong leadership skills (scientific and business) and ability to coordinate and lead local teams to high performance. Oversee country commitments, compliance and training needs. Additionally, business leadership and alignment with corporate requires that individual has ability to lead across several dimensions simultaneously.
Works collaboratively with Country and Regional Operations; Pharmacovigilance, Regulatory, Global Medical Affairs and Global Human Health internally; and with external functional outsourcing vendors. Requires coordination and alignment with the regional and broader organization. Additionally, will work to build and maintain relationships with investigators and other external partners and promote Clients reputation. In collaboration with CRD, represents Client in Pharma industry issues and in seeking influence in external R&D environment.
Education/Qualifications:

University/college degree (life science preferred), or certification in a related allied health profession from an appropriately accredited institution, nursing certification, medical or laboratory technology
A combination of education, training, and experience will be considered in place of a college degree

Experience:
1-2 years of Clinical Research Project Management or Clinical Lead experience
At least 1 year of field monitoring experience
1+ years of experience working in Oncology as PM or lead
A total of at least 5 years experience working in clinical research

Job Description:
Job Title: Senior Project Manager
Work Site: Facility Functional Planning - Vancouver General Hospital

Status:
Start Date:
Hours:
Regular Full Time

As soon as possible

0800-1600, with Saturday, Sunday, and statutory holidays off

Reference#: 121705-mhs

WHO WE ARE:
As one of British Columbia's six regional health authorities, we, Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) are a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents living in Vancouver, Vancouver's North Shore, Richmond, the Sea-to-Sky Highway, Sunshine Coast, Bella Bella, Bella Coola, and the Central Coast. VCH is made up of 13 hospitals, a number of community health centres, 2,500 physicians, more than 13,500 full time staff, and over $3 billion in funding.

But that's only part of the story. VCH is about something bigger; this is a place where we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. At our core, we are a people-focused organization where entrepreneurial spirit runs deep, and opportunity exists for all those who see themselves in the transformation of health care as we know it.

JOB SUMMARY:
Reporting to the Manager, Planning and Projects or designate, the Senior Project Manager is responsible for overseeing and supporting the planning, design and/or implementation of assigned large facilities projects with a high degree of complexity across and Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) including project planning, project management, communications, and contract management. Supervises designated staff and provides leadership by directing work teams, contractors and consultants to ensure accountability and performance.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education & Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture, Interior Design, Engineering or related field.
Professional designation plus seven (7) to ten (10) years’ recent, related, progressive experience in all phases of project planning/design/construction management for a large complex multi-site organization, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Knowledge & Abilities

Knowledge of capital project planning and implementation processes including design, construction and procurement within current standards, codes, bylaws and regulations.
Comprehensive knowledge of project management principles and methodologies and ability to coach team members on these skills.
Ability to interpret construction drawings and construction specifications.
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage planning, design and construction projects simultaneously.
Broad knowledge of patient care delivery systems in primary, acute and community settings.
Understanding of available resources for projects and applicable stakeholder groups including feedback and detailed analysis on project processes.
Ability to supervise and provide direction to team members.
Demonstrated ability to identify, plan, organize, prioritize and implement projects in a timely manner.
Demonstrated ability to work within a dynamic project environment with changing priorities.
Demonstrated attention to detail.
Ability to operate related equipment including related software applications.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.
**Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***
Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Job Description
Summary

TCET is looking for a Project Manager for the National LINC Online Curriculum and Online PBLA Project. The Project Manager will be responsible for planning, execution and closing; ensuring that the needs and goals of the project are met and the commitments on cost, quality, schedule, scope and time are achieved. The Project Manager will enable collaboration across a geographically dispersed team, monitor project health and provide regular project updates to stakeholders and project team members.

Over a five-year period, this project will develop Language Instruction for Newcomers to Canada (LINC) online curriculum for Canadian Language Benchmark (CLB) levels 3 to 5 across all skill areas (L/S/R/W). The project will contribute to building the infrastructure to support LINC service providers across Canada in the delivery of efficient and effective online language training. The project aims to optimize use of public funds, enable LINC instructors across Canada to use a PBLA supported, ready-made solution for their online or blended training programs, facilitate use of avenue.ca for distance language education and ultimately provide newcomers with the official language skills needed to achieve their integration goals.

Duties & Responsibilities
Project Managing instructional design, development, implementation of courseware, Learning Manage System (LMS) integration, and supporting end-user communication and training.
Team recruitment, team building, team motivation, and direction.
Complete staff supervisory duties in accordance with company policy.
Manage project budget, review and approve expenses, monitor cash flow, forecast costs and review financial claims.
Project Plan creation, including a Charter, a Schedule and all necessary Management Plans (Risk, Communication, Schedule, Budget/Cost, Procurement, Change, Quality, and Resource).
Manage project schedules, track and communicate project status, issues, risks, and decisions to stakeholders.
Manage subcontracting agreements and stakeholder relationships.
Lead preparation and delivery of project related reports and presentations to stakeholders.
Be accountable for on-time delivery of deliverables.
Record project data for future estimating and continuous improvement processes.
Assist with testing, quality assurance, writing communication copy, and other duties as needed.
Collaborate with management and operational staff on facilities and operational issues as needed.
Qualifications
Post Secondary Degree in relevant area
PMP certification or sufficient work experience applying PMP guidelines.
5+ years direct project management experience leading training, software or technology projects.
2+ years experience managing large-scale, custom, multi-year eLearning or technology projects.
Able to provide leadership and direction in a virtual team environment.
Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
Able to communicate professionally and facilitate meetings with varied stakeholders including funders, advisory committee members, vendors, and staff.
Strong budgeting and scheduling skills.
Proficient in MS Office (MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, Outlook) and cloud based applications to support virtual teams.
Aptitude and willingness to learn new technologies.
Flexibility to occasionally work evenings and travel within Canada.
Knowledge of instructional design principles preferred.
Moodle and/or general LMS experience an asset.
Not-for-profit or settlement sector experience an asset.
