Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!
Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Plans, manages, executes and controls one or multiple assigned infrastructure and engineering projects involving larger scope, risk, impact and sensitivity. Ensures the successful delivery according to enterprise engineering project management standards, governance and procedures.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Plans, manages, executes, and controls all aspects of assigned capital projects involving larger scope, risk, impact and sensitivity, in alignment with the divisional strategy and departmental objectives.
Leads the strategic planning of the assigned capital projects, including defining the scope of the project in collaboration with senior management; creating business cases/justifications and work plans, determining the objectives and measurements, determining the budget, resources, and stakeholders; setting up the project schedule and review plan.
Manages and monitors the assigned projects throughout the implementation stage, including executing the project according to project plan; creating project management records and documentations; monitoring the project progress and financial status of project. Anticipates and proactively manages change throughout the project life cycle.
Prepares contracts, Requests for Proposals (RFP) and Tender documents for projects, including terms and conditions, scope of work definition, technical requirements and specifications, project specific requirements and project schedule constraints.
Presents and reports the project progress, risks, expectations, timelines, milestones and key project metrics to senior leadership teams. Provides suggestions and recommendations to the senior leadership teams on risk management and project delivery.
Manages cross functional project teams and stakeholders across the enterprise. Develops and maintains a respectful and productive relationship with all stakeholders. Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of the project.
Provides expert advice and recommendations on engineering project management standards, governance and procedures to continuously improve the enterprise project management practices.
Provides technical and project management guidance to Project Managers and Project Coordinators at lower levels.
Qualifications

Education and Experience:

The competencies for this position would typically be acquired through completion of University degree in Engineering and/or Business and a PMP certification is required. Requires seven 7 years of previous experience in engineering project management.

Other Requirements:
Advanced knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of project management.
Advanced interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships with multiple internal and external stakeholders.
Advanced analytical thinking and problem solving skills, to resolve critical and high impact issues.
Advanced time management and organization skills to balance and coordinate effort across multiple, concurrent activities.
Advanced verbal and written communication skills.
Solid technical skills in business and project management computer applications and databases.
Other Information

University degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering is preferred.

Experience in the following systems will be an asset:

• Automatic Train Control (ATC)
• Data network and Telecommunications
• SCADA System
• AC and DC Power and Distribution Systems
• Operational Safety Systems
• Testing and Commissioning (T&C) Activities

The successful candidate should be:
• Focused on positive customer interactions and project outcomes
• Familiar with managing the full Systems Engineering project cycle

Experienced in:
• Soliciting expectations and requirements from both technical and non-technical parties
• Translating expectations, needs and wants into design/build work packages
• Managing design/build contracts
• Interpreting and resolving trade-off decisions
• Verifying solutions and validating outcomes
• Managing and building consensus amongst executive-level stakeholders

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.
Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.
Rate of Pay

Salary starting at $101,116 per annum.
How to Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner
of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

Closing Date: Open until filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Job Description:

Description
~ Français à suivre ~

PTW is seeking an experienced Project Manager with a solid track record of managing the creation, management and delivery of quality products from start to finish. This role works directly with our clients and internal team to ensure deliverables fall within applicable scopes and budgets. Ideal candidate would be passionate about games, have a strong quality mindset from a consumer perspective and is a collaborative leader. Is this you?

**During the Current Covid-19 global pandemic, this role will be a Work From Home position**

What you’ll be doing
Deliver projects successfully within budget, timeframe and quality scopes as per clients’ expectations
Collaborate with clients to establish schedules, define budget and ensure creation of test coverage and project metrics
Produce and present reports to stakeholders utilizing data that represent product quality KPI
Quality and project management through test scope/scheduling, evaluating ROI and cost vs benefit analysis
Manage, lead, motivate, coach and train Functional Game QA Leads
Plan, apply and adapt project test strategies with the support of Team Leads
Coordinate with other internal departments to ensure all aspects of each project are compatible and resources are adequate to fulfil clients’ needs
Define and implement critical knowledge transfer and overall communication process with internal and external teams
Act as the primary point of contact for internal inquiries from Leads and resolve conflicts/issues in collaboration with HR as they arise
Collaborate with internal and external partners and stakeholders across a range of technology disciplines and geographic locations
Process and workflow management, identifying, innovating and improving processes to maintain high quality standards
Requirements
What we’re looking for
2+ years relevant experience in a Project Management or similar role in the Video Games or related industry. Experience in outsource environment a plus
Experienced with financial management, budget tracking, QA cost estimates and constraints
Strong understanding of analytics and KPIs as a way of tracking product quality
Tech savvy with strong proficiency using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Jira
Solution driven, problem-solver with demonstrated critical thinking capabilities to understand, define, propose and implement tangible solutions
Exceptional interpersonal skills and strong verbal and written communication in the English language
Ability to communicate across technical and non-technical disciplines as well as all levels of management
Proven expertise in conflict resolution and ability to provide constructive and positive feedback
Take charge, motivated self-starter, and autonomous leader with excellent time management and organizational skills
Strong team motivator with the ability to lead others, develops talent, mentors and cultivates members to keep a high standard of accuracy and lead by example
Excel working in a fast-pace, high pressure environment with capabilities to adapt quickly to changing demands
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus
Functional verbal French
Benefits
What we offer
Competitive pay
Comprehensive group insurance coverage
Paid accrued vacation and paid sick days
Diverse and collaborative environment with growth opportunities
Unlimited coffee with office location near metro in the heart of the Mile End gaming hub
Fun, dynamic and collaborative environment
Who we are

PTW is a leading global provider of customer experience, quality assurance, localization, engineering and audio production services, to key software and technology-focused markets including games, interactive entertainment media, education, e-commerce and internet of things.

For over 20 years, we’ve delivered great results for our clients. Our main aim is to advance their businesses and enhance their customer’s’ satisfaction. We’re dedicated to helping every client develop the best products and consumer experiences possible. And because we believe in partnerships and collaboration, the journey is shared, and the successes are too.

http://www.ptw.com

GESTIONNAIRE DE PROJET

PTW est à la recherche d'un gestionnaire de projet expérimenté doté d'une solide expérience en matière de gestion de la création, de la gestion et de la livraison de produits de qualité, du début à la fin. Ce rôle travaille directement avec nos clients et notre équipe interne pour veiller à ce que les produits livrables respectent les portées et les budgets applicables. Le candidat idéal serait passionné par les jeux, aurait une mentalité de qualité forte du point de vue du consommateur et serait un leader collaboratif. Est-ce vous?

**Pendant la pandémie mondiale actuelle de Covid-19, ce rôle sera un poste de travail à domicile**

Ce que vous ferez
Réussir les projets dans les limites du budget, des délais et de la qualité, conformément aux attentes des clients
Collaborer avec les clients pour établir des calendriers, définir un budget et assurer la création d'une couverture de test et de métriques de projet
Produire et présenter des rapports aux parties prenantes en utilisant des données représentant les indicateurs de performance clés de la qualité des produits
Gestion de la qualité et des projets via la portée / la planification des tests, évaluation du retour sur investissement et analyse coûts / avantages
Gérer, diriger, motiver, encadrer et former les responsables de l’AQ du jeu fonctionnel
Planifier, appliquer et adapter les stratégies de test du projet avec l’aide des chefs d’équipe
Assurer la coordination avec les autres services internes pour s’assurer que tous les aspects de chaque projet sont compatibles et que les ressources sont suffisantes pour répondre aux besoins des clients
Définir et mettre en œuvre le transfert des connaissances critiques et le processus de communication global avec les équipes internes et externes
Agir en tant que point principal de contact pour les demandes internes des responsables et résoudre les conflits / problèmes en collaboration avec les ressources humaines à mesure qu'ils surviennent
Collaborer avec des partenaires et des intervenants internes et externes dans plusieurs disciplines technologiques et lieux géographiques.
Gestion des processus et des flux de travail, identification, innovation et amélioration des processus pour maintenir des normes de qualité élevées
Ce que nous recherchons
2+ ans d’expérience pertinente dans la gestion de projets ou un rôle similaire dans les jeux vidéo ou dans un secteur apparenté. Expérience dans un environnement externalisé un atout
Expérience de la gestion financière, du suivi budgétaire, des estimations de coûts d’AQ et des contraintes
Excellente compréhension de l’analyse et des indicateurs clé de performance comme moyen pour suivre la qualité des produits
Connaissances techniques avec une grande maîtrise de MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Jira
Axés sur les solutions, résolveur de problèmes avec capacités de pensée critique démontrées pour comprendre, définir, proposer et mettre en œuvre des solutions concrètes
Compétences interpersonnelles exceptionnelles et forte communication verbale et écrite en anglais
Aptitude à communiquer entre disciplines techniques et non techniques ainsi que tous les niveaux de gestion
Expertise avérée dans la résolution de conflits et capacité à fournir des commentaires constructifs et positifs
Leader motivé et autonome, doté d'excellentes compétences en matière de gestion du temps et d'organisation
Solide chef d’équipe, capable de diriger les autres, de développer les talents, de conseiller et de former les membres pour garder un niveau élevé de précision et de montrer l’exemple
Excel travaillant dans un environnement rapide et soumis à de fortes pressions, doté de fonctionnalités permettant de s'adapter rapidement à l'évolution de la demande
L’attestation Project Management Professional (PMP) est un atout
Bilingue - compétences de communication écrite et verbale en anglais et en français
Ce que nous offrons
Poste à temps plein et permanent offrant des possibilités de croissance
Salaire compétitif avec couverture d'assurance groupe complète
Vacances accumulées payées avec congés de maladie payés
Café à volonté avec emplacement de bureau près du métro au cœur du centre de jeux vidéo du Mile End
Environnement amusant, dynamique et collaboratif
Qui nous sommes

PTW est l'un des principaux fournisseurs mondiaux d'expérience client, d'assurance qualité, de localisation, d'ingénierie et de production audio, sur les principaux marchés axés sur les logiciels et la technologie, notamment les jeux, les médias de divertissement interactifs, l'éducation, le commerce électronique et l'Internet des objets.

Depuis plus de 20 ans, nous livrons d'excellents résultats à nos clients. Notre objectif principal est de faire progresser leur entreprise et d'améliorer la satisfaction de leurs clients. Nous nous engageons à aider chaque client à développer les meilleurs produits et expériences de consommation possibles. Et parce que nous croyons aux partenariats et à la collaboration, le voyage est partagé et les succès aussi.

http://www.ptw.com

Job Title: Construction Superintendent
Reports to: Director of Operations and Project Manager
Company: Doran Contractors Limited
Location: Various project sites, Ottawa, Ontario
Date Prepared: January 14, 2020

About Doran Contractors

Founded over 100 years ago, Doran is an industrial, commercial and institutional construction general contractor that can tackle any job from multi-tenant condominiums, senior’s residences, retail plazas, transit stations and tunnels, office buildings, bridges and pump stations. From tender closing to substantial completion, Doran takes pride in staying on time and budget, with aspirations of exceeding the owner’s expectations at every opportunity. A proud part of the Taggart Group of Companies, we value integrity, quality and community.

We are now inviting experienced Construction Superintendents to apply to join our team!

Work Description

The Construction Superintendent is responsible for the overall supervision of construction projects, crews and sub-contractors. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality approach to all employees, customers, subcontractor, general contractors, tenants, managers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Doran Contractors vision, mission, and must comply with all company policies and procedures. The Superintendent in coordination with the Director of Operations and the Project Manager is responsible for identifying issues, designing and carrying out policies and procedures that support the projects and initiatives of the company.

Major Responsibilities:
Construction Superintendent
Oversee and manage the construction site from the set-up phase, including setting up structures and processes for the site office, access, site fencing., through to hand-over at the completion of the project.
Assist the Project Manager in developing and maintaining construction production schedule and site management plan.
Review and understand project drawings and specifications, and address any discrepancies by reporting them to the Project Manager.
Provide schedule updates to the Project Manager on a regular basis;
Schedule meetings with and manage subcontractors.
Establish and maintain quality control measures on site.
Participate in setting up the site safety plan with the Corporate Safety officer (CSO);
Provide guidance to employees and contractors on how to work in a more safe and efficient manner.
Participate in all Safety reporting functions. Ensure the timely delivery of safety reports to Corporate Safety Officer in order to maintain all legislative requirements.
Plan and prepare three-week construction schedule look a heads, including milestones, and monitor progress against established schedules.
Ensure accurate and timely project close date; adjust working schedules to ensure deadlines are met.
Identify and resolve conflicts within project teams and associated work; create contingency plans to mitigate risk.
Ensure inspections are completed periodically throughout the construction phases to ensure buildings meet specifications of clients.
Coordinates all activity between trades and suppliers.
Verify all onsite safety training for all new hires, including employees, trades and contractors. Ensuring all documentation is prepared and submitted as required in conjunction with Project Coordinators and CSO.
Conduct daily toolbox talks and ensure all sub-contracts submit daily hazard assessments.
Oversee performance of all trade contractors to ensure architectural and engineering drawings are being delivered with accuracy and to regulatory standards.
Recommending employee actions such as hiring, training, promotions, disciplinary and corrective measures to the Director of Operations and/or Project Manager.
Enforce all Doran Contractor policies and procedures.
All other duties as required.
Statement of Qualifications:
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Post-secondary Certificate in Civil Engineering Technologist, Engineering Degree or other formal Technical training that is relevant to the field.
A minimum of five years of work experience as a Construction Superintendent in the ICI sector, with demonstrated increased responsibility/supervisory work.
Prior experience with construction projects in ICI, such as condominiums, multi-story retirement homes, multi-unit apartment buildings, retail developments, large commercial turn-key buildings, commercial fit-ups or other similar projects is required.
Ability to professionally interact with design professionals, consultants and clients throughout the project.
Ability to read blueprints, schematics, field drawings and plans.
Strong communication, integration, problem-solving and interpersonal skills.
Ability to cope with high intensity and stressful environments.
Strong attention to detail.
Demonstrated success in project delivery and execution of project management methods.
Understanding fundamentals of contracts and experience in managing contractors under the terms of a contract.
A valid driver’s license is required as this requires travel to and from sites to the office.
Physical/Sensory Effort/ Work Environment
Loud and busy work environment
Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines
Standing and/or sitting for long periods of time.
Difficult weather conditions, working outdoors and on site.
Overtime as required.
Application

All candidates are asked to submit a resume and project list via the following link: taggartgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs. Any questions regarding the position can be directed to careers@taggart.ca.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

This position is also referred to as: site superintendent, site supervisor, site manager.

Accommodation/AODA:

The Taggart Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, physical or mental handicap, or financial ability.

In accordance with the Accessibility of Ontarian's with a Disabilities Act, we're committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation or special assistance, please sen an email to hr@taggart.ca with your request. Your information will be treated as confidential.

Construction Superintendent

Apply Now

INTRO

Projects is responsible for the delivery of IR&P/PNL capital, operating, decommissioning, and commercial projects. These projects address site infrastructure (Landlord), licensed nuclear facilities, and environmental remediation activities – as well as products and services for CNL customers. The project scopes entail new‑build construction, upgrades, fabrications, demolitions, and system improvements.

Construction Superintendents are accountable for construction and installation activities on all IR&P/PNL led projects, as well as various Site & Nuclear Operations (Landlord) initiatives. The CNL Construction Superintendent conducts oversight on vendors and CNL staff, who perform construction or other fieldwork activities, to ensure safety and contractual requirements are met.

DUTIES
Overseeing Construction projects, providing project oversight to the Site Superintendent or General Contractor, who supervises the trades directly.
Ensuring that permits are available and in order for the trades, contractors or CNL staff to complete their work. For delivering and/or ensuring that pre-job briefings are conducted with the work crew with respect to safety compliance and that all historical documentation is appropriate and available, and that hazard assessments, are completed. The position ensures that all necessary documentation, has been obtained for each project.
Liaising with the CNL Client on project status and for addressing any changes requested by clients that may impact the work plan and the anticipated delivery of the project.
Operated as the CRL Sponsor for vendors performing construction activities on the CRL site and satellite locations and facilities.
Oversees construction activities in accordance with the Management Control Procedure, 900-505240-MCP-001, and its lower-tiered documents.
Ensures that construction activities are completed according to approved and validated design output documents and supplier’s shop drawings, and that these activities are carried out to meet all applicable technical, regulatory, and code requirements, as specified.
Provide constructive input in the development and delivery of the project and throughout the stages of initiation, planning, execution, control and closeout.
Ensure that the CNL standards for material selections, operating and maintenance functions are followed.
Enforce workplace safety at all times. Use event-free tools.
Ensure environmental aspects are considered on job sites.
Act as contractor Sponsor on behalf of client (see 900-510400-STD-005).
Assist in preparation of contract documents and contractor selection. Ensure that all data pertaining to hazard issues such as asbestos and the rules on hiring contractors to perform such work at CNL is included.
Assist the construction team in the development of work plans instructing internal resource support assigned to the contract (temporary services, connections, inspections).
Arrange for contractor employees to attend CNL Construction Safety Orientation training courses, and obtain all security clearances.
Verify Contractor qualifications.
Verify Equipment certifications.
Maintain a daily job history log throughout the project, as required.
Prepare or obtain general work permits, IH (Industrial Health) permits, fire safety clearances, DDCC (Digging, Drilling, and Coring Clearance) clearances, material and equipment passes and all other permits required to execute the project.
Ensure construction boundaries are controlled.
Anticipate demand for internal trade resources (e.g., service connections) and work with appropriate Planner for resource allocation.
Coordinate/Supervise work to be done by internal resources and/or arrange for procurement of required materials.
Monitor work progress and report to Project Management team as required.
Assess work scope completion upon receipt of contractor invoices and accept invoice as CNL Superintendent.
Manage/monitor changes or modifications to the work scope using the RFI process.
Initiate and control changes or modification the work scope using the ECC/ FCN process.
Ensure relevant regulatory authorities and other agencies requirements are met (CNSC, TSSA, ESA, Canadian Welding Bureau, etc).
Prepare ImpAct submissions, and participate in event investigations or root cause determinations, as required.
Ensure all equipment being removed is controlled as per the relevant procedures.
Inspect workmanship to ensure contractual or project requirements are met.
Identify the resources required to mitigate hazards and coordinate these resources.
Coordinate all issues pertaining to the disposal of wastes generated by the project.
Organize and conduct construction meetings along with minutes, as required.
Ensure all required inspections have been performed and recorded and copies submitted to the project team.
Maintain a flexible work schedule that may include work outside of normal hours.
Must exercise Due Diligence from a legal aspect.
Promote safety and good housekeeping practices and instruct employees in same.
Provide advice and mentoring to peers and other staff.
QUALIFICATIONS
Graduate from an Institute of Technology with a minimum of six years’ experience in the field of construction, including five years as a supervisor. OR Successful completion of a recognized apprenticeship in one or more relevant industrial trades and a minimum of ten years pertinent experience as a journeyman plus five years’ experience as a supervisor.
Have the ability to read and understand specifications and drawings and interpret complex construction drawings.
Have demonstrated supervisory and interpersonal skills and be able to work effectively with others.
Have the ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Have a working knowledge of all current applicable company regulations, safety regulations procedures and collective agreements.
Have a willingness to undergo additional training appropriate to the position, (e.g.) computers, quality assurance, and applicable codes, supervisory and team building skills.

Seaforth Building Group is currently seeking a Construction Project Manager to run construction projects throughout the GTA and surrounding area.

Your new role:

The job of the Construction Project Manager is to manage and monitor the full cycle of construction to make sure that all targets of the project are met. You must prepare and manage the construction project plan, budget and schedule. You will supervise sub-contractors on site and ensure they properly fulfill their responsibilities. You will be establishing strong relationships with clients, consultants, contractors and various partners in order to maximize efficiency. Your job will also entail conducting site meetings and controlling labour, material and equipment expenses.

As a Construction Project Manger you will:
Maintain contract with more complex subcontracted scopes and subcontract administration, including defining work scope, answering inquires and monitoring progress.
Review and understand broader contract obligations. (CCDCs, Drawings & Spec Books)
Manage change order process, including pricing, negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impact.
Develops and monitors overall project schedule.
Create and issue tender packages and contracts and monitor their progress.
Maintains, performs and/or supervises project document control and procedures.
Perform multiple site visits to supervise construction, coordination/planning and project completion.
Identifies and assists in resolving complex field technical issues.
Involved in and assists with overall project closeout, including document archival, maintenance and warranty manuals, deficiencies and warranty work.
Some after hours work may be required.
Other duties as required.
Is this the right role for you?

To qualify for the Construction Project Manager job, you must possess a minimum 3 years' experience as a Construction Manager or Project Manager having successfully managed projects from start to finish. You must possess a post-secondary education in construction management, engineering or related discipline. The successful candidate will have knowledge of construction costs and budgets, have the ability to anticipate stakeholder needs, investigate the underlying causes and identify short and long term solutions. You will have experience planning and managing a project schedule, and maintaining effective relationship with clients, owners and consultants. The successful candidate will also posses a G-License, clean driving record and a reliable vehicle.

If this is an opportunity you are interested in and your background matches the experience required, please send your resume in confidence and we will be pleased to receive it for review.

About Cognition+ Inc.:

Cognition+ Inc. is the leading provider of software solutions in the mutual insurance industry in Canada. Founded in 1993 by a group of mutual insurers, Cognition+ Inc. provides powerful, easy to use, and affordable software that ensures insurance companies of all sizes can compete in the insurance marketplace. Cognition+ Inc. offers solutions for policy, claims, accounting, financial reporting, and investment and includes integrations with third party trading partners including brokers, financial institutions and service providers. Leveraging an internal rating and underwriting rules engine along with significant application programming interface development provides extensive flexibility, extendibility and scalability. Using industry best practices for privacy, security and roles based authorization and access, Cognition+ Inc. offers onsite and cloud based solutions to 32 insurance companies in Canada. Located in London, Ontario, Cognition+ Inc. has strong longstanding relationships with insurance and technology partners in North America.

Everyone at Cognition+ Inc. has ideas and experience that we believe contribute to our success. In addition to a great work environment and great location (with free indoor parking), we offer flexible work hours, a work from home policy, catered information sessions, potluck lunches and more!

You will have direct experience working with clients, developing relationships of trust, and managing precise communications. Your specific authority levels will vary by project, and you will be working collaboratively with functional groups in a matrix environment. You will be responsible for the Release Management life cycle inclusive of product/program initiatives, software updates and bug fixes. You will provide best practices, processes and release governance to help business teams test and manage releases in all environments using Agile methodology.

As the Project Manager, you are accountable for the successful delivery of projects involving the construction and renovation of large ($50 million or more) Healthcare facilities. You are a critical resource, ensuring the complex projects you manage adhere to required scope, quality, schedule, and budget.

The expertise you provide begins early in the design and tendering stages, requires rigorous attention throughout the construction phase, and continues right through to the end of the warranty phase. You will be responsible for:

-managing contracts within NS Healthcare Infrastructure Projects Division with contractors and consultants on these projects;

-leading your project team of professional designers, builders, inspectors, and other key project members, in resolving issues and removing roadblocks;

-identifying, analyzing and mitigating project risks;

-ensuring safety is of top priority and work is carried out in accordance with the OHS Act and Regulations, as well as NS Government standards and polices;

-providing a smooth transition to end users by ensuring the building is ready for occupancy, with no outstanding deficiencies.

You are the key point of contact who keeps Senior and Financial Managers and the stakeholder departments advised of the status of the projects.

As a key member of Healthcare NS Infrastructure Projects Divison you provide strong leadership qualities as you motivate your building construction team to meet all challenges that arise throughout the life of the project.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering from an accredited engineering institution with a minimum of six (6) years' experience managing the construction of large complex buildings, preferably in the field of Heathcare. You must also be (or meet the requirements to be) actively registered as a Full Member (P.Eng) with Engineers Nova Scotia (ENS).

Or, an Architecture degree from an accredited architecture institution with a minimum of eight (8) years' experience managing the construction of large complex buildings, preferably, in the field of Heathcare. You must also be (or meet the requirements to be) actively registered as a Full Member (Architect) with Nova Scotia Association of Architects (NSAA) or acceptable equivalent and relevant experience deemed suitable by the employer[.

A strong technical background and a firm understanding of the building construction industry and engineering principles; experience in managing quality, finances and schedules of projects, and effective skills in risk management are required.

Extensive experience in planning and managing various phases of Real Property healthcare projects with challenging degrees of complexity and magnitude, including buildings, and/or fit-up of construction projects with a value in excess of $100 Million would be considered an asset.

Travel within the province is a component of this position. As such, you must have a valid driver's license and the ability to travel.

About Nova Scotia Healthcare Infrastructure Projects

Health care needs are evolving and redevelopment projects in Nova Scotias two largest centres present a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to rethink and rebuild the way we deliver health care. The plans are focused on making our health care system stronger to ensure the needs of Nova Scotians remain at the heart of everything we do. Together, these projects will help support the health care of all Nova Scotians today, and for future generations. The intent is to provide a long-term road map for development to provide Connected Care for Nova Scotians for the next 50 years, ensuring that the appropriate programs and services are provided in the right locations to achieve excellence in health, learning and research. A key driver for this project is to upgrade the facilities to meet the desired healthcare standard, which the current aging infrastructure become increasingly unable to accommodate.

Are you interested?

Working together to provide the best health care for Cape Breton. It's time for a revitalized health system in Cape Breton. There is an opportunity to provide quality services in our communities and facilities today, and for future generations.

This transformation means we'll be better able to meet the needs of patients, families, and communities.

For further information: https://healthredevelopment.novascotia.ca/cbrmhealth

Lawson is a leading consulting and surveying company. We go into remote locations, working accurately and efficiently while maintaining a high level of safety. Throughout our history, we have successfully gathered the data needed and provided the information and guidance required by our clients, no matter the location or level of difficulty presented in each project.

Our Opportunity

As we continue to grow, our company is accepting applications for a Project Manager position. This position will be located out of Winnipeg, Manitoba and will be responsible for overseeing projects across Eastern Saskatchewan, Manitoba and Ontario. The successful individual will work on upcoming projects in various industry sectors, such as Pipeline, Municipal, Civil, Heavy Industrial and Power Distribution. The Project Manager will be responsible for the success of the projects, through effective planning and management of schedules, staff, and resources, relationship building with clients and successful leadership of their team.

Responsibilities

Reporting directly to the Eastern Regional Manager, the Project Manager will be responsible to:
Plan and manage the entire lifecycle of a project, including the allocation of resources, scheduling, documentation, budget and other factors necessary for project success.
Build strong relationships with current and potential clients based on trust and value to secure future work.
Provide guidance, support and training to direct reports, monitor their performance on an on-going basis, conduct performance reviews, discipline as required and resolve team conflicts.
Plan project timelines and workflow and oversee the day-to-day activities of direct reports to ensure project deliverables are conducted accurately, on time and to the required quality assurance standards.
Implement and train direct reports on new initiatives to improve the safety of the work site and the efficiency, accuracy and quality of the work produced.
Facilitate on-the-job training to continuously develop direct reports and ensure they stay up to date on current technologies and survey methodologies.
Establish and utilize mechanisms for tracking and reporting project progress, contract deliverables, and various other metrics for Lawson management, clients and other stakeholders.
Communicate regularly and work with clients across a variety of industries to effectively overcome issues and ensure client satisfaction.
When required, conduct a broad range of field surveys including, but not limited to pipeline, topographic, volumetric, preliminary planning, design, control and quality assurance.
Qualifications
Post-secondary education in Surveying, Geomatics, Leadership or Project Management (an equivalent combination of training and experience may be considered on an individual basis).
A minimum of seven (7) years of surveying experience of which at least four (4) years must be in a supervisory role for a survey field crew is required. Exposure to drafting and drafting standards is also required.
2+ years of project management experience is required.
Demonstrated successful people leadership ability.
Proven ability to communicate effectively (both verbal and written) and build relationships with co-workers, clients and other contractors.
Must be a self-starter who takes initiative and is proactive with upcoming work.
Proven ability to organize and prioritize workflow.
Comprehensive understanding of theory, limitations and use of robotic total stations, electronic field books, precision verticality and leveling instruments, RTK/GPS systems, laser alignment equipment and other surveying equipment.
Advanced knowledge of engineering drawings, specifications, standards and construction methods.
Understanding of drafting principles and engineering standards.
Advanced knowledge of survey control networks, monuments, survey computations including transformations and high-level geomatics.
Advanced knowledge of Trimble software, AutoCAD Civil 3D and Microsoft Office (including Outlook, Excel and Word) is required. Knowledge of project management software is an asset.
Strong work ethic with ability to multitask in a fast pace environment and effectively prioritize workload.
Valid driver’s license

You won’t get lost in the numbers here, but rather enjoy positive guidance as you learn, grow and create an impact. Lawson is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

We have an immediate opening for a Senior Project Lead in the Bombardier Aviation Experimental (BAEX) engineering organization.

The Experimental Engineering department (BAEX), located in Ville Saint-Laurent, is responsible to plan, design, build and validate systems and infrastructure required to support both ground and flight testing in order to provide quality test results for all new and In-Service Aircraft Programs.

In your role, you will:
Establish aggressive short, medium and long term Engineering objectives and timelines for a high complexity integrated system test rig, in collaboration with the section chief
Coordinate rig upgrade, electrical and mechanical design objectives, as well as fabrication activities, with all stakeholders, both internal and external to BAEX, follow-up and engage them in achieving results
Define and plan simulation models rig upgrade to follow configuration requirements and its evolution
Understand simulation models upgrade complexity to be able to determine any technical and/or schedule risks and the required level of verification and validation required before deployment
Demonstrate initiative and judgment in order to resolve issues related to reaching objectives
Plan and prepare implementation schedules, identify milestones, and track progress
Perform risk analyses, throughout the project, to identify and implement mitigation plans
Be accountable for meeting objectives, performance goals and project deadlines
Track, document and update the budget as well as manage changes or out-of scope items
Prepare weekly and monthly reports as well as post-mortem reviews (if needed)
Establish and maintain relationships with customers and suppliers
Required skills (advanced)
Have experience in leading and driving engineering and fabrication activities for internal resources as well as third party Engineering service suppliers
Leadership, ability to have a strategic perspective with a global vision
Strong organizational, interpersonal, time management and communication skills
Be autonomous and a critical thinker in order to take the right decisions
Be confident and have experience in multidisciplinary team coordination
Ability to assign tasks effectively and then follow up with thoroughness and rigor
Be a team motivator, collaborator and promote the valorization and respect of others
Have resilience, openness to change and manage stress positively
Have good cost and contract management skills
Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
You have good experience and knowledge of Aircraft system such as FBW, Avionics, hydraulics and electrical
You have knowledge of simulation models rig architecture to be able to interface with simulation suppliers
You have minimum of 10 years’ experience in project management in the aerospace, transportation or other field where you have taken on increasing level of responsibilities and demonstrate the ability to handle more complex projects
Training or Bachelor's degree in Project Management, Engineering, or relevant experience in the aeronautical
You have management and supervisory experience that will differentiate you from other candidates and make you a prime candidate for this position
You have Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification from the Project Management Institute (PMI)
You have exceptional relational and editorial skills in English and French
You are familiar with Microsoft Office software such as PowerPoint, Excel and MS Project
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

The Project Manager is the lead manager on saturated ash or gypsum Pond or Dry CCR Landfill Construction, Operation, Maintenance, and Closure projects and is generally assigned to a single project. This position requires travel, generally limited to within the Tennessee Valley area, but may extend to nationwide. The Project Manager is the primary interface between the corporate support groups and the project management team. The Project Manager is responsible for the total execution of projects, which includes the following: safety leadership, profit and loss, regulatory compliance, efficient utilization of resources, contract administration, cost administration, building the project per plans and specifications, schedule adherence, and meeting production/profitability goals. Project Managers are responsible for all client interaction on projects. Assigned projects are generally from $500,000 to $25,000,000. Project Managers are expected to support business development efforts with existing clients by identifying and communicating information regarding client organizations and future opportunities. When not assigned to projects, Project Managers are expected to support broader sales, proposal and estimating activities. The Project Manager is expected to use their experience and judgment to make decisions within their limits of authority.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Committed to and responsible for Envirocon’s Safety Culture & actively involved in project Health and Safety, including;
Embraces and enforces the site and corporate Health and Safety Plans
Works with the site Health and Safety representative and Site Safety Steward
Ability to review project hazards and participate in Job Hazard Analysis
Perform pre-task planning
Brief craft before assigning new task
Participate in incident investigation and reporting
Manage and direct project teams by providing clear communication, coordination and follow up to meet project goals and objectives; ensure project scope or work, schedule and budget are clearly defined and understood.
Establish project procedures and execution of project activities consistent with contractual documents and quality plans.
Serve as project representative with client, contractors, subcontractors, and vendors at kick off meetings, job walks, project review, and other meetings and correspondence.
Responsible for the successful execution of assigned projects and is the primary interface between the corporate support groups and project management team.
Responsible for the overall profit and loss for assigned projects.
Responsible for generating basic project schedules, and the ability to read and understand more complex critical path logic schedules generated by others.
Responsible for determining and resourcing the necessary equipment for effective execution of projects.
Responsible for coordinating with the Operations Director and Human Resources for the reassignment, hiring, and training of all project personnel including project craft and salaried staff. Responsible for Personnel Performance Management from beginning to end of project for all direct report personnel.
Responsible for scheduling resources on an overall project basis.
Coordinate training and compliance measures to ensure project procedures are followed.
Identify and secure necessary approvals for all changes in project scope, budget and/or schedule.
Responsible for having a fluent understanding of Envirocon cost administration process including completing or reviewing weekly receiving reports, completing monthly final forecast cost and revenue forecasts (FFC/FFRs) reading and understanding weekly/monthly unit cost reports, and determining weekly and monthly production quantities. Work in conjunction with assigned Project Accountant (PA) and Project Controls Specialist (PCS).
Responsible for having an understanding of general contract administration and a complete understanding of assigned project contract requirements including the tracking of pay quantities, recognizing a change in scope or conditions, development of claims and responsible for leading claim and change negotiations. Work in conjunction with assigned Contracts Manager.
Responsible for the management of subcontractors and working with Subcontract Administrators (SA).
Responsible to follow the company’s policies in the procurement of materials, vendors, and subcontractors for assigned projects.
Responsible to keep accurate project documentation.
Takes part in the estimating and proposal process to include attending job walks, read and understand project plans and specifications, equipment selection, subcontractor selection, establishing production rates, and developing overall approaches to work scopes.
Provide business development support and assist with client interaction. Build and maintain awareness of client organization structures, decision-makers, etc. as well as understanding of future projects/opportunities for Envirocon. Share client knowledge with supervisor(s) and support business development activities, as requested.
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Implement, maintain and document in Halogen all ASMART goals, personnel development and mentoring of direct reports assigned to each project.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ability to deal effectively and tactfully with a wide variety of individuals in person, via telephone and in writing. Excellent customer relations skills.
Ability to work independently and resolve practical problems, keeping all appropriate parties aware of issues or risks. Have a strong work ethic.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to include efficient technical writing skills as well as client presentations.
Must have proficient computer skills including the use of the Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Project Scheduling software including Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project.
Fluent contract and cost administration skills.
This is a project-based position and requires extensive travel. Relocation is not required.
Understands equipment selection and utilization.
Ability to read and understand project plans and specifications.
Understand basic behavior based safety programs and enforce company’s safety policies.
Current 40 hour OSHA HAZWOPER certificate or 8 hour refresher certificate or the ability to obtain if needed.
Education and Experience
Baccalaureate Degree in Construction Management, Heavy Civil, Engineering, Geology or related discipline preferred.
Must have five (5) years of progressive Project Management experience on saturated ash or gypsum Ponds or dry CCR Landfill Construction, Operation, Maintenance, and Closure
An equivalent combination of education and field experience plus 3 years of experience with project management responsibilities may be considered.

Canem is celebrating almost 60 years of being at the cutting edge of prefabrication and project management. With locations in Victoria, Nanaimo, Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Red Deer, Lethbridge, Saskatoon, Winnipeg and Cambridge, we are looking to continue to grow our team. See how you can begin your career with us!

We are Contractors that Care and are looking for dynamic, innovative and enthusiastic individuals to join the Canem team. There are available opportunities for those looking to join Canem in both in the field or one of our 10 branch offices. Please visit our website for more information.

Canem is currently seeking a Construction Manager to join our team in Richmond, BC.

Summary

We are looking for a Construction Manager who will be responsible for managing construction projects in the branch and supervising the successful progress and achievement of financial and non-financial objectives of projects. The Construction Manager participates in providing leadership for the branch and is a key contributor to marketing and selling of Canem services and products at a senior industry level. The Construction Manager reports directly to the Branch Manager.

General Duties and Responsibilities

The Construction Manager is responsible for duties assigned by the supervisor, including but not limited to:
Researching clients and potential clients, procuring of major new projects, building effective relationships with general contractors, owners, developers, architects, engineers, suppliers, and manufacturers at a senior level, advising major clients about new and effective products and services, and actively seeking out new opportunities, projects and clients for Canem.
Managing projects procured in the Branch, reviewing job progress & projection reports on a monthly basis with the project managers, ensuring profitability and achievement of financial goals of large construction projects, directing the project managers for re-design and purchasing major equipment for projects.
Directing preplanning activities to ensure that preplans adhere to Canem philosophies, assign project teams, direct purchasing of materials and tools, directing quality controls on installations and design liabilities, participating in all major project pre-plan meetings and ensuring effective execution of project in accordance with the preplan and project close-out.
Working closely with branch and corporate management in setting and achieving of branch and corporate financial objectives, participating in management of branch staff and responsibilities as assigned by Branch Manager, maximizing profitability of branch and projects by ensuring cost control and effective project management as required
Managing employee relations and resolving of employee concerns and conflicts directly under supervision, providing direction in training of project managers, assistants and assist with the training of foremen, assist with the hiring of field manpower, building positive relationships with project managers, estimators, and assistants, and supervising project managers as assigned by Branch Manager.
Evaluating, and negotiating contracts for all major projects, as assigned by Branch Manager.
Assisting the Chief Estimator in the budgeting process and in closing all major tendered project opportunities to ensure compliance with the Branch Business Plan.
Providing leadership and positive motivation for project staff and company partners by acting as a responsible and goal-oriented team player and leading by example in achieving excellence and being accountable for results and outcomes.
This job description provides a general guideline for areas of responsibility. Additional detailed job responsibilities and individual goals are set for the employee with their supervisor.

Position Requirements:

The Construction Manager position requires a highly experienced, senior manager of commercial, communication and service electrical projects with proven success in managing project and people and achieving excellent business results. The ability to network, market and sell services is a key attribute of this position. Proficiency in related computer programs is a requirement.

Preferred Qualifications:
6 – 8 years experience in managing electrical construction projects
4 – 6 years experience in supervising and leading project management staff
Certification as electrician’s journeyman or relevant degree or diploma
Current knowledge of electrical, building and municipal codes and regulations
Excellent knowledge of industry products, practices and standards
Outstanding sales, marketing and networking skills
Ability to learn quickly, be flexible and adaptable
Strong organizational abilities and demonstrated attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong time management skills, specifically the ability to multi-task and prioritize
Able to work independently and in team environments
Excellent knowledge of and proficiency in required computer programs
SAP knowledge an asset
Knowledge of engineering software and engineering skills an asset
PMP certification considered an asset

Location: Ottawa, ON
Pomerleau’s story is, first and foremost, one of strong family values and solid work ethic, infused with entrepreneurial spirit and leadership. It is a story of growth and evolution, expansion that saw this small-scale company from the Beauce region near Quebec City, grow to become the coast-to-coast business it is today. For 50 years, and with over two thousand projects under its belt, the family business has stayed true to the values of the company founder, Hervé Pomerleau: respect, rigor, relationships, solutions and innovation. Pomerleau’s goal for the years to come is to further strengthen its position as a major player in the Canadian construction industry, equally focused on buildings and civil work. “With more than half a century of experience and thousands of innovative achievements from project to project, Pomerleau builds places to live, play or work.” With extensive expertise, knowledge and integrity, Pomerleau is ready to face any upcoming industry challenges. Pomerleau has been recognized as a Canadian Best Managed Company and one of the top 10 contractors in the country. With operations expanding nationally across three core divisions, Pomerleau is managing more than 125 construction sites simultaneously while upholding its solid reputation as a reliable and safety-driven company.

Experience with Projects >$20M Proven track record in project management with projects in excess of $20M.
Extensive Design Build Knowledge Demonstrated commitment to first class trade relationships and client service.

A True Leader & Mentor Your teams show progression and engagement under your guidance.

Balance You value a job done well and done right, while balancing fiscal performance and quality if work.
Summary of Role

You will be expected to lead a portfolio of projects within the Canadian Building Operations Division (CBO) and ensure overall business performance alongside streamlined project execution.

Working for the Canadian Building Operations Division (CBO), headquartered in Ottawa, you will be part of the senior project leadership team. This team has successfully delivered on several marque projects that you are likely familiar with – Landsdowne Park, the Museum of Science and Technology, the Prime Minister’s cottage and West Block on Parliament Hill. Ninety percent of the work for the CBO group is construction management (CM) and while they expect an increase in lump sum work in the coming years, CM remains the core competency and preference of the organization.

This is a business-focused role and allows you to step beyond pure project management and take pride in the ownership of your portfolio, inclusive of the project teams within it. This will allow you to create a vision for your group and lead a team toward significant goals where their development and career progression is as important as the client experience. Your stakeholders will include leadership, clients, trade partners, your team and peer group. This is a true leadership role, affording you the opportunity to transition from project management to business leadership..

Conducting detailed document review

Construction Superintendent

The Construction Superintendent is responsible for the overall supervision of construction projects, crews and sub-contractors. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality approach to all employees, customers, subcontractor, general contractors, tenants, managers and suppliers.

Responsibilities
Oversee and manage the construction site from the set-up phase, including setting up structures and processes for the site office, access, through to hand-over at the completion of the project.
Assist in developing and maintaining construction production schedule and site management plan.
Review and understand project drawings and specifications, and address any discrepancies by reporting them to the Construction Manager.
Provide schedule updates to the Construction Manager on a regular basis.
Schedule meetings with and manage subcontractors.
Establish and maintain quality control measures on site.
Identify and resolve conflicts within project teams and associated work; create contingency plans to mitigate risk.
Ensure inspections are completed periodically throughout the construction phases to ensure buildings meet specifications of clients.
Oversee performance of all trade contractors to ensure architectural and engineering drawings are being delivered with accuracy and to regulatory standards.
Provide guidance to employees and contractors on how to work in a more safe and efficient manner.
Participate in all Safety reporting functions. Ensure the timely delivery of safety reports to Safety Officer in order to maintain all legislative requirements.
Ensure accurate and timely project close date; adjust working schedules to ensure deadlines are met.
Verify all onsite safety training for all new hires, including employees, trades and contractors.
Enforce all Richcraft policies and procedures.
All other duties as required.
Required Education, Skills and Qualifications
Post-secondary Certificate in Civil Engineering Technologist, Engineering Degree or other formal Technical training that is relevant to the field.
A minimum of 5 – 8 years of work experience in residential construction with demonstrated increased responsibility/supervisory work.
Ability to read blueprints, schematics, field drawings and plans.
Strong communication, integration, problem-solving and interpersonal skills.
Ability to cope with high intensity and stressful environments.
Strong attention to detail.
Demonstrated success in project delivery and execution of project management methods.
Understanding fundamentals of contracts and experience in managing contractors under the terms of a contract.
Updated safety certificates are required
A valid driver’s license is required as this requires travel to and from sites to the office.

Who we are?

Tri City Canada Inc. is a General Contractor that specializes in “Project Management”. Our home base is in Kamloops British Columbia however have jobs scattered all over British Columbia, and in the past have had jobs in other provinces and places. Our specialties include but are not limited to land development, land use redevelopment, construction management and green building.

As each new challenge and project presents itself, a unique team of professionals is assembled. We believe that construction is a team effort involving ownership, the design team, and construction team with an experienced and qualified project manager. At Tri City we understand that good communication, administrative excellence, good follow up, and hard work makes the difference between an average build and a great build.

Our Superintendents are the face and front-line representation of Tri City Canada Inc. on our jobsites. They work with the Project Manager, HSE/HR Manager, employees, sub-trades, and all parties involved in the project to complete designated projects to plans, specifications and acceptable quality standards within the restraints of the budget and schedule. This leadership position is responsible for the day to day management of the construction site and executing field operations safely, adhering to company policies and procedures. We are currently seeking a project Superintendent for our “Hamlets at Duncan” project on Vancouver Island in Duncan BC. (ASAP)

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Assist key personnel in determining manpower needs based on the project needs and requirements.
Confirm construction schedule and ascertain strategy to complete project in designated time.
Review plans, specs, and sub-trade contracts, and become familiar with overall project, systems & details.
Work with the Project Manager to confirm budgets that will be under superintendent's control, such as rentals, building materials, temp labor if needed throughout, & temporary facilities.
Source and identify for the Project Manager local suppliers and sub-trades that can be used for the project.
Co-ordinate delivery of materials, scheduling of sub-trades and our own forces to meet the pre-arranged schedule.
Maintain a system for Quality Control to ensure quality of workmanship.
Be prepared to answer questions about project specifics at project meetings, etc.
Provide leadership and set the ultimate example for all personnel on the site.
Supervision and development of site team members through regular feedback, training, and coaching; timely completion of performance evaluations.
Develop, maintain, and revise if needed a schedule throughout the project for completion of tasks and organization of sub-trades that can be monitored throughout. This includes looking ahead to consider unforeseen factors.
Identify and advise of design deficiencies.
Maintain daily paperwork and forward necessary documentation and or information to all necessary parties.
Create a system to manage the daily reporting and paperwork involved in the project that can be tracked throughout.
Work with and adhere to the Tri City Canada Inc. health and safety program with the help of the HSE Manager, to ensure that safety standards are met and exceeded on the project.
Physical Requirements:

Ability to perform in all weather conditions is required. Worker may be standing or walking for long periods of time. Periods of high physical exertion may come into play if there is a requirement to fill in on the tools. This may include but is not limited to bending, twisting, heavy lifting (up to 50lbs), repetitive motion, and climbing ladders. With the administrative portion of this job, there may be some periods of sitting and typing/and or writing.

Qualifications:
Demonstrated, progressive experience in General Contracting as a Superintendent. Will consider experience as an Assistant Superintendent and or other leadership roles.
5 years of progressive experience in the industry preferred.
Trade background in carpentry preferred. (Red Seal Certification considered an asset).
Effective supervision, coordination, and scheduling of construction activities to ensure consistent completion of projects on-time, on budget and to the clients’ satisfaction.
Demonstrated leadership, field management and problem-solving skills to support your collaborative approach to delivering results and developing team members.
Service and results-oriented, you are able to build and steward trust with a broad network of professional colleagues, subcontractors, and team members to promote competitive excellence, pride in teamwork and outstanding project delivery.
You have demonstrated competence in the areas of safety, workforce management, project execution, cost control, quality, and administration.
Proactive problem-solver that can manage difficult situations with positive results.
Sound knowledge of construction, building techniques, and ability to read and interpret contract drawings and specifications.
Good computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office. Experience with construction related software and platforms considered an asset.
The suitable candidate will be okay with the possibility of travel depending on project location. Compensation and living arrangements will be worked out with the Project Manager.
Must maintain a valid class 5 driver’s license.
Compensation and Career Development:

Tri City Canada Inc. is proud to provide this career opportunity within a progressive environment with continuous learning and opportunity for growth, as well as a competitive compensation package. Compensation will be based on education and experience or a combination of both. At Tri City Canada Inc. we value ongoing education and training.

Overall accountability for on-time, on budget successful delivery of projects, within a change management framework.

Intimately understand the key details of the project to help ensure the team is highly engaged and dedicated to its success.

Create standards and processes for project management and coach and mentor team members in their adoption.
Identify and recommend continuous improvement opportunities across the organisation.

7+ Years of proactive, assertive, confident Project Management experience, with a high level of trust among all project stakeholders.

University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
Ability to demonstrate extensive project experience championing technical, strategic and organisational transformation initiatives, with an understanding of the product lifecycle.

Experience with multiple types of projects, including, but not limited to, SDLC ( Waterfall, Agile, Hybrid ), Third Party Implementations, Infrastructure, Product Launches, Organisational Transformations.
Proven ability to quickly and confidently earn the trust of sponsors and key stakeholders; mobilise and motivate teams; set direction and approach; resolve conﬂict; deliver difficult messages with grace; execute with limited information and ambiguity.
Solid influencing skills with sound business and technical acumen; possess general understanding for application programming, database and system design.
Ability to navigate a highly matrixed organisation; focused and versatile team player that is comfortable under pressure and working with a high level of ambiguity, with a strong drive for results.
Exceptional analytical & problem-solving skills; with the ability to manage time well, prioritise, multitask, and troubleshoot.

Job Description

Manage all aspects of Construction Management and General Contracting for commercial interiors and new custom home construction projects
Collaborate with subtrades, clients, architects and other members of a project team
Development of client proposals and project cost estimates
Prepare and manage bid documents and contract administration
Procurement and schedule management
Negotiation, costing, budget management, risk management and quality control
Implementation of B&V Health and Safety Policies
Continually foresee potential issues or conflicts and propose solutions for evasive actions
Figure out details and best construction methods to achieve the designer’s goals
Track project budgets, documents and progress in Viewpoint Construction Management Software
Review of shop drawings and submittals

Expectations and Experience

Architectural background an asset
Minimum of 10 years of local construction management experience
Knowledge of local codes and subtrades
Knowledge of LEED® would be an asset
Exceptional communication and organizational skills
Superior customer service
Energetic, positive and can-do attitude required
Computer proficiency (MS Office, MS Project)
Valid driver’s license and vehicle required

Boszko & Verity Inc. is a construction company that values good design. We are proactive managers and problem solvers who ensure that the client’s goals and the designer’s creative vision are realized with ease and efficiency. Our reputation is built on solid construction management skills, design expertise and most importantly good customer service.

No phone calls please or agencies. We thank all who apply, however, only those short listed will be contacted for an interview.
