Overview

The Project Manager will be responsible for managing the repositioning, redevelopment and conversion of a multi-residential Retirement property in Windsor, Ontario including suite renovations, common area upgrades and resident relocations. The project manager will ensure projects are completed within a specific timeframe and on budget, through proper planning and implementation.

Duties and Responsibilities

Planning:
With direction from the Operations group, define the scope of work to be accomplished in order to reposition the property (identify priorities, time limitations, budget & quality)
Responsible for sourcing, negotiating and awarding all contractors
Ensure engineering and design resources are available and capable of meeting objectives
Review engineering and design specifications produced by engineers prior to distribution to contractors or city officials
Prepare recommendations for Management approval based on established scopes
Creates accurate in-house designs and specifications for projects prior to tendering
Performs tendering process and tender analysis professionally and accurately
Complete pre-construction walk-throughs with contractors

Implementation:
Oversee all assigned projects and ensure they are completed on time and within budget
Establish and coordinate documented project/work schedules
Provide regular status reports of project milestones and make adjustments to schedules as needed
Ensure the cost effective management of all processes related to the projects including controlled access sites and on-floor raw material, work in process, and finished components
Manage internal and external resources to achieve project objectives
Maintain compliance of departmental operating procedures

Project Administration:
Collect, maintain and update all project related documents and provide direction/guidance to on-site management if needed.
Update project status, provide progress photos and create reports on a weekly and monthly basis to the Senior Operations team
Review and approve invoices

Monitoring/Closing:
Perform regular documented reviews, maintain weekly progress reports and issue updates to affected parties
Continuously improve cost reduction initiatives
Report to senior management, the status of the project development and engineering issues for resolution
Conducts deficiency/sign-off meetings and creates a detailed deficiency report for the contractor to resolve

Requirements

University, Engineering degree and/or PMP designation would be an asset. Minimum College education required
Solid understanding and experience in EPCM project style and implementation
5 years experience in managing Multi-Residential Property Management projects.
5 years experience in Project Management or Construction Management.
Experience in space conversion projects.
Knowledge of building systems.
Computer skills (Excel, Word, PCC)
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Strategic thinking and decision-making skills
Driven and self-motivated individual
Works well in a team oriented environment
Ability to work independently
Excellent communication (both written and verbal)
Emotional Intelligence
Experience working with Seniors an asset
Superior organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills

WESCO is known for the best service and the best people, always going above and beyond to provide top-notch service to our customers. As a leading global provider of supply chain solutions, WESCO’s goal is to ensure that our customers have the products they need, when and where they need them — whether that is on a construction site or in a manufacturing plant. We back up those products with proven expert services that help companies increase efficiency and productivity, reduce costs, create safer workplaces, and achieve sustainability goals. If this is a culture you want to be a part of, we invite you to join WESCO, a place where inclusion and diversity is valued and continuous improvement is a way of life.
Brief Description
Responsible for managing branch functions to provide acceptable return on controllable assets while improving market share.
Detailed Description
• Plans, develops, and implements specific actions and programs in accordance with management operations plan.

• Identifies market potential by industry and update annually.

• Develops, implements, and adjusts branch sales plan designed to increase market penetration.

• Hires, deploys, and manages outside salespersons to provide coverage of total branch geographic market segments while ensuring adequate potential for individual territory development.

• Develops outside salespersons by providing sales technique and product training through personal example, coaching, and formal and informal training sessions.

• Calls on customers, managers, and principals of key accounts to foster growth and ensure adequate coverage, penetration and customer service.

• Conducts quarterly reviews with outside salespersons to focus on performance against objectives by account and product code, and provides counseling, help, and motivation to achieve objectives.

• Develops team working relationship between all employees clearly defining each member's primary and secondary responsibilities and how each relates to others within branch.

• Ensures adequate delegation of authority to branch operations manager and branch subordinates to carry out responsibilities and tasks.

• Establishes and controls pricing levels while implementing policies and programs to improve margins.

• Develops and maintains cooperative relationships consistent with good commercial policies with regard to selected suppliers.

• Assists financial services with exercising policies pertaining to extension of credit, collection of accounts receivable, attainment of acceptable days outstanding, and minimization of potential losses.

• Oversees inventory administration by branch operations manager to ensure adequate stock and provide excellent customer service while maintaining an acceptable month’s supply.

• Ensures branch is taking an active role in negotiating lower costs and extended payment terms from our key suppliers.

• Manages annual employee reviews based on performance against measurable objectives.

• Assists branch operations manager in selection, hiring, development, promotion, demotion and dismissal of employees.

• Develops and implements plans to provide premium customer service and review performance against objectives regularly.
Job Requirements
EXPERIENCE:

Successful selling in electrical distribution industry – 5 years required; 10 years preferred.

Demonstrated teamwork, leadership and flexibility.

EDUCATION:

High School Degree or equivalent required; Bachelors’ Degree preferred.

SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS:

Business and management principles, including strategic planning, resource allocation, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.

Principles and processes for providing customer and personal services, including customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluating customer satisfaction.

Strong verbal, written, analytical, persuasion, and interpersonal skills.

Time management.

Excellent computer skills.

Sales ability, financial aptitude, strong leadership and people skills.

Working Environment:

· General Office – Work is generally performed within an office environment, with standard office equipment. Lighting and temperature are adequate and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc.

physical requirements:

· Work is generally sedentary in nature, but may require standing and walking for up to 10% of the time.

mental requirements:

· Employee required to organize and coordinate schedules.

· Employee required to analyze and interpret complex data.

· Employee required to problem-solve.

· Employee required to communicate with the public.

· Employee required to manage other employees.
Additional Details

WESCO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

Introduction:
Pivotree architects, builds, hosts and manages a wide range of commerce experiences for well-known domestic and global brands. Customers turn to Pivotree as their trusted partner when they want to grow revenue, increase online and in-store traffic, improve customer experience, grow a loyal customer base, achieve operational efficiencies, and higher profits.

Pivotree is a privately-held and venture backed company with an aggressive growth objective including strategic acquisitions. 2018 was a transformational year for Pivotree with the combination of three existing businesses in this sector: Tenzing, ThinkWrap and Spark:Red. Our combined team is made up of a diverse blend of engineers, solution architects, programmers, UI developers, project managers and analysts who work together to create and manage next-generation commerce excellence. We hold ourselves to the very highest standards and our employees take great pride in our accomplishments.

Position Summary:
We’re on the hunt for an experienced Senior Project Manager. In this role you’ll be responsible for planning, directing and coordinating with our clients and our internal teams to ensure project goals and objectives are accomplished within approved timelines, scope and budgets.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Able to lead cross-functional, multi-site project teams composed of employees, contractors and external vendors in support of several concurrent projects and initiatives
Has a high attention to detail and commitment to quality
Creates and promotes a positive work environment where people are on-side, feel a collective sense of accountability, and are recognized for success
The source for information on the scope of work/deliverables for assigned projects, for the timeframe for delivery, and for the team’s work
Committed to ensuring a high level of stakeholder satisfaction through prompt and efficient communication and proactive support
Decisive and able to adapt to change and competing demands
Self-motivated and ready to roll up their sleeves and get into it!

Key Skills & Competencies:
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
8+ years of experience in a Software Project Management role
Proven experience leading medium to large application development or systems integration projects ($1-3M budgets)
Experience leading and managing projects with multi-site, cross-functional resources
Ability to manage and forecast project budgets, to report on project financials, and to ensure timely and accurate invoicing
A deep understanding of project management methodologies (SDLC/waterfall, Agile)
Demonstrated high level of communication, both written and verbal
Ability to meet scope, quality, budget & schedule commitments that deliver customer value
Ability to manage change and work well under pressure

Experience with eCommerce
SAP/Oracle or large ERP experience an asset
Working knowledge of Jira/Confluence, Kanban, Sprint Planning

Does this sound like you? Please send us your resume and include any additional links you think might be relevant (LinkedIn, published work, social, etc.).

Responsibilities:
Chairs HSE meetings and manages team safety inspections to ensure that policies, procedures, and standards are followed.

Develops and implements quality management plan and Quality Control (QC).
Ensures the project is constructed as per design, budget, quality, and schedule.
Participates in the review of design documentation and seek resolution from the design team with respect to compliance, scope creep, cost optimization, code requirements, procurement, safety in design, construction sequencing, and constructability.
Understands client drivers and offers value engineering proposals for functionality, cost, and/or schedule benefit while maintaining value added outcomes as part of our solution provider service where warranted.
Develops the Project Execution Plan (PEP) with the superintendent.

Ability to identify and solicit internal or external support to solve construction challenges.

Knowledge of construction law and building codes.

The Municipal Group of Companies is comprised of numerous complementary business units within the heavy civil construction and mining industries. Complementing our work in these industries, the Municipal Group provides extensive waste management and environmental services across Nova Scotia and New Brunswick. Close to a dozen integrated companies have enable us to serve virtually the entire region in this capacity. We are currently seeking a Heavy Civil Construction Project Manager to join our expanding team based out of our main office in Bedford, Nova Scotia.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
Attends and participates in Job Handover Meeting, including Critical Path scheduling, Document organization and control, equipment and manpower requirements, and review of the estimate for completeness of take-off, scope and pricing.
Oversee Control of Project cost by development of project budget with the estimator
Attend all job progress meetings
Develop, maintain and regularly review up-to-date project progress information, including Critical Path scheduling, Work in Progress Reports, and analysis of all job costs
Work with the General Superintendent and on-site superintendent to coordinate the activities of the Foremen and subcontractor work crews as required
Provides necessary documents to field superintendents, foremen and Project Coordinators in a timely manner and follow up on all open action items.

Visit project sites daily for troubleshooting and for the purposes of ensuring project quality.
Initiate and review regular project billings
Is responsible for the overall safety of all manpower working on the contract, proactively supports the corporate safety program and sets a positive example
Develops, chairs and initiate all job closeout activities, including preparation of as-built drawings, retaining release from subcontractors, ensuring warranty information provided to owner, final payment quantities and payment and recovery of holdback

5-10 years’ experience managing construction projects. Civil Construction experience is a must
High attention to detail
Utilizes strong organizational and planning skills;
Strong computer skills with knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Power Point,Outlook)

Tactful and mature demeanour with well developed interpersonal skills including the ability to work well with diverse personalities;

Are you looking to Catapult your career? Do you want to be involved in the deepest dig ever done in Langley? Does working on three different build forms on one project interest you? Caliber Projects is looking for a Project Manager for our condo and office tower project in Langley. The project is located at 200 and 84th street in Langley and is part of the largest master plan community every developed in Langley.

Project Development

Complete a detailed review of all construction drawings to ensure drawings are correct and consistent. Use Caliber’s drawing review SOP and checklist to complete the review

Communicate with design team to ensure that IFC dwgs are complete and correct.

Design, development, and completion of working documents

Review scopes of work for each contract and update based on the project

Coordinate specific project requirements with all parties to ensure all requirements are met

Project Tender and Budget

Tender all scopes of work, negotiate contracts and award trade and supplier contracts on for assigned site.

Enforce Contract objectives as per Scopes of Work (LOI Appendix A)

Create initial project costing and budget at design development and Building permit stage

Create and maintain Anchor Budget for the project

Any variance to Anchor Budget to be reported immediately to the Senior Project Manager.

Actual Budget to be reviewed against the Anchor Budget on a weekly/monthly basis and results communicated to the Senior Project Manager

Ensure that the project is delivered in accordance with Caliber’s Performance Standards, Appendix ‘A’ scopes of work, all Municipal & Code Standards, all Safety Standards, Work Safe BC and Caliber’s Health & Safety program.

Project Schedule

Establish Baseline Schedule and mutually approved between Senior Project Manager & Superintendent, Superintendent is responsible for delivery of project on or ahead of schedule.

Review the Actual Performance schedule on a weekly basis and at regularly scheduled trades meetings. Project 6-week look ahead schedule to be updated for bi-weekly meetings with trades on site.

Communicate any changes to Baseline schedule to the Senior Project Manager and address at Consultants meetings as schedule updates – quarterly.

Project Permits

Arrange required permits from Municipalities

Receive all Municipal finals in order to achieve provisional/final Occupancy

Cost Control

Collaborate with Senior Project Manager regarding any cost variance affecting the Anchor Budget in a timely manner.

Review actual costs vs budgeted with Site superintendent on a monthly basis.

Manage all changes to scope of work including RFI, SI, CD and CO’s

Monitor project to ensure use of labour and required material controls. (Productive labour force, Lumber Orders, Concrete Orders, etc.)

Complete all progress draws based on construction progress and invoicing.

Create change orders for changes to subcontract scopes of work.

Document sub-trade back charges and inform trades of issues in a timely manner.

Review with Site Superintendent whether to rent or purchase tools/equipment based on duration of use, wear and tear, future repairs, etc.

Regularly review invoices and approve per invoice processing SOP.

Apply for substantial performance and holdback release

Safety

Understand and ensure adherence to all required safety policies as directed by Caliber’s Health & Safety Manual and Work Safe BC Health & Safety Regulations.

Review daily site audits provided by the CSO to ensure worker safety compliance on site.

Review daily safety inspection reports, trade toolbox meeting minutes, trade JHA’s and provide comments/feedback/follow-up as required. Follow up with trades who are not up to date with their paperwork.

Personnel Management

Supervise the personnel necessary for the effective execution of assigned project, throughout all stages.

Maintain a good working relationship with all sub trades and employees by personally demonstrating Integrity, Honesty, Hard work, Respect, Passion, innovation

Coordinate consultants, trade contractors and site staff in resolving issues

Resolve all major trade contractor disputes

Assist the Site superintendent overseeing and monitoring of all trades and construction operations for the assigned project.

Coordinate all trades to ensure they carry out all their duties as prescribed in their scopes of work.

Be familiar with trade’s Scopes of Work, to ensure we are not self-performing something already covered contractually.

Create and administer all Trades/Suppliers list for said project.

Coach and Connect with Caliber employees to help train them in their role. Report any concerns with Caliber employee performance to the Senior Project Manager.

Ensure all site staff are aware of and adhere to all Corporate Performance, Employment Standards and Company Policies.

Review timecards for Caliber Employees and temporary labour

Quality Control/Reports/Logs

Ensure project is completed with Caliber performance standards and project specific ‘Scope’s of Work’.

Monitor project to ensure conformity with all milestones, building code requirements, applicable specifications and drawings.

Adhere to any Caliber construction protocols as developed over time.

Perform audits of trade layout on a regular basis – if it appears to be wrong it probably is.

Review and sign off on daily superintendent reports on a weekly basis.

Ensure up to date knowledge of ALL RFI’s, SI’s, Shop Drawings, etc. and make sure trades are following the required changes on site.

Personal Development

Maintain awareness of general market conditions as it pertains to personnel, suppliers and trade availability.

Maintain a thorough understanding of the issues facing the construction industry.

Maintain a network of: Sub-trades, Suppliers, Industry Peers.

Stay abreast of technical advancements in the construction industry.

Partake in continuing education to constantly grow ability and knowledge of construction practices and procedures.

Continue to hone verbal and written communication skills.

Interactions

Report to Senior Project Manager as called upon.

Key internal interactions: Construction Department and Accounting Department, as necessary.

Key External interactions: Sub-trade/Supplier Team, Municipality/Consultants/ General Public

Maintain an effective level of communication with the client

Chair all consultant and owner meetings on site

Proven effective communication skills (Verbal, written and e-mail) able to communicate with a variety of people and groups.

DuraSystems (www.durasystems.com) is a North American-based manufacturer specializing in supplying fire-rated systems and assemblies to the industrial, commercial and institutional market sectors.

DuraSystems has 30 years of experience providing passive fire protection solutions to a wide range of sectors including telecommunication, electrical power utilities, petrochemical, mining and resource industries, transportation and oil and gas platforms.

THE PROJECT MANAGER OVERVIEW:

The Project Manager will partner with sales, estimating, operations and logistics to develop a project plan while focused on managing every detail in sheet metal and fire barrier systems that will be used in the manufacturing of HVAC units.

KEY FOCUS:

* Demonstrate a strong technical/mechanical aptitude in developing project plans that include transformer barriers, ducts, plenums, wall and ceilings for fire protection in buildings and infrastructure.

* Coordinate and manage all phases of the project from award through delivery – ensuring thorough communication internally and externally.

* Understand, translate and update all technical details including drawings ensuring conformance with UL/ULC standards.

* Proactively manage and ensure all systems and data or updated regulary for projects – ensuring data integrity.

* Understand and prepare a full project plan. Plan and track deliverables and costs to ensure on time and on budget performance.

* Coordinate with clients on requirements, issues and schedule updates in a timely manner.

* Produce fabrication details for manufacture and quality, based on drawings approved by client

* Track the progress and quality of work being performed by operations

* Research and review suppliers and procure required materials

* Estimate and list up materials required for construction specification.

* Produce and edit installation manuals for clients.

* Other tasks include: issuing purchase orders, setting up new vendors and archiving documents for electronic records.

QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLSET:

* A minimum of 5-7 years of project management experience

* Project Management or Engineering Technologist Diploma or equivalent.

* Strong knowledge of AutoCAD (2D and 3D).

* Ability to effectively use MS Office suite.

* Highly organized with great communication and presentation skills.

* Strong time management and multitasking ability.

* Excellent oral and written English communication skills.

* Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team and interact with staff at

various levels of the organization.

* General knowledge of HVAC.

Job Description
Job Title:
Practice Leader - Construction Project Manager


Designation:
• P.Eng or CET

Education:
• Technical diploma or degree in a related field

Job Summary:
Our client, in Mississauga, Ontario, or Vancouver, British Columbia, is seeking a Practice Leader to strengthen capabilities in Construction Management, Project Management and Construction Administration across multiple disciplines.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with planning, directing and coordinating activity on construction sites, preparing budgets, developing contract documents, choosing contractors, negotiating contract terms and managing contracts. The successful candidate will join a team of Practice Leaders from other service lines to collaborate and strategize with.

The Construction & Project Management Practice Leader is responsible for the continuous improvement and maintenance of quality of Construction & Project Management services as well as for supporting regional market needs and initiatives. They will lead responses to changes in the industry, emerging issues, and client expectations, and help operations in all disciplines that offer construction services to remain current and competitive.

Job Duties:
• Responsible for overall Service Delivery and Quality of Work related to Construction & Project Management in all disciplines.
• Represent the company’s practice area expertise in developing new business and services.
• Technical training and mentoring across all practices regarding Construction & Project Management.
• Develop and maintain templates, contracts, tendering methodology, SOPs and other Practice resources.
• Work closely with other Practice representatives.
• Catalogue knowledge and technical documents.
• Perform regular visits to operating groups in all offices offering Construction & Project Management services.
• Audit completed projects.
• Contribute to the development of new business materials and presentations related to the Practice.
• Attend relevant conferences, network with industry leaders, and seek appropriate speaking opportunities.
• Develop ways for the company to share its knowledge with current and prospective clients, such as company-sponsored seminars, white papers, blogs, etc.
• Identify opportunities to publicize the company’s Practice area expertise.
• Additional duties as assigned by the Director of Practice Leadership, CTO or CEO.

Qualifications:
• Technical diploma or degree in a related field
• P.Eng license (A CET or other credentials may also be acceptable depending on experience.)
• 15+ years of experience in Construction & Project Management
• Specific training on contract administration and specification development. A CET or other credentials may also be acceptable depending on experience.
• Experience managing large-scale, multi-step projects.
• Technical understanding of construction including construction law, construction methodology, drawings and specifications.
• Strength in leadership, communication, negotiation, time management, and decision making.

1675

Lori Morris Concierge - Toronto, ON

The Project Manager is responsible for managing a list of multiple projects with regard to timing, budget and client satisfaction. The effective and efficient delivery of this role ensures client expectations are met and exceeded.

The Project Manager reports to the Director of Project Management. The Project Manager has three key roles with regards to the management of a project; (1) Making sure that the client and Lori Morris’s requirements are met and/or exceeded, (2) To ensure the project, within it’s set scope of work is completed on time and (3) That the project, within its scope of work is completed on budget.

In order to achieve these roles a Project Manager must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills. These skills will be applied when working with contractors, trades and suppliers as well as when working with LMD’s internal departments. A Project Manager must be able to multi task effectively. This multitasking not only applies to juggling their role as being an employee of LMD and also representing the best interests of the client but more importantly applies to constantly walking the delicate line between managing effectively and micro managing.

A Project Managers tool kit consists of Open Issues lists, Tasks lists, SORs and Project Timelines. These documents are expected to be kept up to date and communicated to all applicable parties.

As with all LMD employees, the Project Manager is expected to follow LMD’s Policies, Procedures and General Information.

REQUIREMENTS
Knowledge of the interior design industry
Knowledge of plumbing, appliance, lighting installation requirements
Knowledge of millwork design, fabrication and installation
Knowledge of tile, slab, floor, trim and plaster installation
Knowledge of electrical requirements and restrictions
Ability to read and interpret the following; floor plans, RCPs, electrical drawings, perspectives, millwork drawings, millwork shop drawings, detail drawings and tile layouts
Excellent interpersonal skills
Effective verbal and listening communications skills
Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
Exceptional organizational skills
Effective written communication skills
Excellent computer skills
Fluent knowledge of MS Windows, MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point)
Understanding of AutoCAD
Stress management skills
Time management skills
Be honest and trustworthy
Be respectful
Moral integrity
High sense of team work
Possess cultural awareness and sensitivity
Be flexible
Demonstrate sound work ethics
RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide the Project Coordinator and all Schedule Administrators the entire scope of work of a project (SOR, timing, special requirements and budget) with regards to correctly filling in all LMD schedules
Represent clients’ interests and concerns
Manage and update project information including SOR, Open Issues, Task Lists and Time Lines
Receiving all items delivered on-site
Obtain required client buyoffs and approvals
Provide all financial documents to the client
Ensure project is completed on time and on budget
Liaise with finance department to ensure that invoices are prepared and presented to the client for payment on a timely basis in keeping with LMD terms and conditions.
Follow up with client during the project regarding outstanding deposits and invoice payment
Work with all parties to trouble shoot and problem solve issues that jeopardize timing and/or budget
Interface with the client regarding any and all matters relating to LMD
Ensuring drawings are approved as required
Provide drawing release timing
Ensuring billable time meets budget requirements
Distribute drawings to all interested parties
Track and ensure all interested parties have the correct drawing and schedule revisions
Coordinate and facilitate site access for the following LMD related design and decoration measurements
LMD On-sight Measures, Wallpaper Installation, Drapery Hardware and Drapery Installation
Review all construction progress on a regular basis to ensure that construction is following latest released prints
Coordinate and facilitate site measurements and/or installation for the following LMD related installations;
Wallpaper, Installed lighting, Plumbing, Millwork hardware, Interior doors, Appliances, Tiles and Flooring, Broadloom, Bathroom Accessories, Wall Panels and Bench Panels, Existing Mattress Dimensions (± 1”), Cushion Templates
Work with the Senior Design Coordinator to ensure Install site readiness
Perform “Final Install” walk through of assigned projects with the Senior Design Coordinator and ensure that the “Installed Items List” is filled in correctly and accurately.
Ensure that all returns have been picked up and accounted for.
Endeavour to collect all outstanding amounts for invoices including the final invoice.
Collections will be taken over by the finance department one month from the date of the final invoice.
Must possess a current/valid driver’s licence and must be legally able to drive
Must possess a reliable vehicle for daily transit
The PM will spend a significant amount of time driving between project sites and visiting clients and sight locations
The incumbent will be required to travel to assigned project construction sites on a regular basis
EXPERIENCE
5 years’ experience as a Project Manager (preferred)
Please reply with a cover letter and resume.

Hazelwood Construction Services, Inc., a division of The Hazelwood Group, is seeking a Construction Safety Officers for an upcoming project near Lilooet, BC, from June to December, 2020. The work schedule will be two weeks on, one week off, and will require both day and night shift work. The work to be done includes re-coating the interior of a 3m diameter, 1.4km long steel penstock and two turbine scroll cases at BC Hydros Bridge River 2 Hydroelectric facility in Shalalth, BC.

Reporting to the Safety Manager in Nanaimo, the Construction Safety Officers ensures that all workers on site are following established policies and safety regulations. The main responsibilities of this role involve performing safety inspections, conducting job hazard analyses, ensuring proper safety communication with crew and subcontractors, along with record keeping and administration. The CSO may take on additional roles and responsibilities, but their primary job is helping to create a safe work site. Successful candidates will be required to pass a drug pre-screening test and will be required to complete BC Hydro WPP Training.

Job Duties
Responsible for ensuring OHS program and site specific safety management plan is followed.
Preparation of all JHAs, Safe Work Procedures, risk assessments, and other site specific safety documents.
Conducts onsite safety orientations for workers and visitors.
Inspecting site conditions to determine if hazards are present and to establish procedures and policies to overcome those hazardous situations on a daily, weekly, and informal basis.
Looks for broken equipment, defective tools, and other potential hazards, focusing on worker safety.
Determines what type of personal protective equipment (PPE) is needed and understands the Confined Space & Fall Protection document, and makes sure that workers know how to operate and use tools and equipment.
Diminish or eliminate work-related accidents.
If an accident occurs, the CSO will conduct a safety investigation to determine root causes, what procedures may have gone wrong, and will gather the evidence necessary to identify the cause of the accident.
Based on investigation results, the CSO will document findings and make recommendations that should be followed to prevent the accident from happening again.
Reviewing and meeting all Provincial safety standard requirements for record-keeping and documentation.
Participates in and facilitates Safety meetings on a daily and weekly basis.
Trains and carries out drills and exercises on how to manage emergency situations.
Responds to employees safety concerns.
Arranges for WCB mandated testing and/or evaluations of the workplace by external agencies/consultants.
Office administration, including entering of project records (timecards and daily progress) into Heavy Job software.
Requirements
Completion of Construction Safety Officer Certificate.
Have a minimum of 5 years experience with equivalent projects of a similar scale and or complexity and must be familiar with all applicable regulations.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Thorough understanding of current WorksafeBC Regulations.
Understanding of current WorksafeBC Regulations, Codes of Practice, Bulletins and other safe work practice requirements and recommendations.
Confidence, with the proven ability to build credibility and strong partnerships at all levels.
Very strong sense of urgency with proven record of following through to meet deadlines and commitments.
Energetic, self-motivated, creative and especially positive outlook.
Meticulous document control.
Proven ability to maintain confidences and ensure confidentiality of information and records.
Complete proficiency with MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint and other common applications.
Physically fit
Passing mandatory drug pre-screening.
Completion of BC Hydro WPP Training.

It is a great time to join the CRH Canada team! CRH Canada is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.

We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!

You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Under the long established and respected name of Dufferin Construction, CRH Canada operates a multi-million construction business which provides construction services throughout Southern Ontario and on key projects across Canada. Founded in 1912, Dufferin Construction has built a solid reputation for market excellence, drawing on a rich history and a strong heritage of quality, stability and innovative leadership in the marketplace. Dufferin Construction is one of the largest heavy civil engineering contractors in the industry, employing over 1000 people.

Position Responsibilities:
Assist the Project Superintendent in planning, coordinating and supervising construction activities including crew and equipment
Ensure compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act and Regulations for construction projects by implementing the Company’s OH&S management system
Maintain and manage plans, specifications, cost, and material estimates, subcontract and related reports
Establish, monitor and initiate updates to, construction work schedules
Maintain accurate cost control plans by entering daily units of completion and processing time cards and material packing slips for payment and cost control updates
Coordinate proper procurement of construction materials ensuring timely delivery and accuracy of purchase orders
Expedite progress payment certificates, final payment certificates and all extra work orders as per contract
Calculate all productivity and material yields
Arrange and conduct construction field services as required
Maintain diary for each project on a daily basis
Employees may also be assigned other work as required
Educational Criteria:
Civil Engineering Degree or Civil Engineering Technologist or Technician Diploma and related experience
Working Conditions:
Standard 50 hours per week, will be required to work overtime and night shifts based on operational requirements
Working on a job site, from a construction site trailer
Travel to/from/within jobsite(s)
Daily exposure to construction environment i.e. heavy equipment, oncoming traffic, inclement weather (heat, cold, rain etc.)
Position Dimensions:
Valid full class G drivers license
Relocation would be the responsibility of the applicant
Demonstrates a sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals and objective
Focused on details, highly organized and works effectively with shifting priorities and rapid change
Effectively examines events, issues and problems to generate optimal solutions in a timely manner
Communicates with impact and creates an environment in which people communicate openly and honestly
Fosters teamwork and cooperation with a strong ability to work with a highly functional team of experts
Strong computer skills (Microsoft Office)
Dufferin Construction builds careers. Our door is always open to hire highly skilled and motivated individuals who want to develop to their full potential while playing a key role in our future plans. Solid growth opportunities are available that provide progression from entry level to senior management positions. Our growth and development strategy involves defined practical experience in project management, augmented with annual training programs to accelerate career progression.

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

Job Title: Project Manager - Real World Solutions/Late Phase Services (Home-Based Canada or US)*)
Job Description:
Overview


Project Manager – Real World Solutions

The Project Manager/ Senior Project Manager (PM) in Real World Solutions, is responsible for owning and achieving interim and final contractual deliverables for assigned projects/programs, according to time, quality/scope and cost constraints. The PM must have a detailed understanding of all functional service areas and be able to autonomously lead multifaceted functional teams effectively. The candidate is expected to bring to the position a strong understanding for planning and conducting real world research under GEP/GPP and GCP guidelines.

Responsibilities


Understands and manages client expectations to achieve study aims while building and maintaining strong client relationships.Proactively identifies, mitigates and manages risks and/or issues.Manages project resources and utilization.Contributes to development, maintenance and approval of operational study plans. Guides and supports team leads in prioritizing, problem-solving and contingency planning.Owns projections of units/hours (revenue and resources), actual units/hours efficiency analysis.Identifies out of scope activities/requests and ensures these are approved upfront via contract modification.Ensures control of financial risk to PRA.Leads presentations of financial reviews and is accountable for action item follow up.Ensures adherence to company SOP, policies and guidelines at the project level.Assumes a leadership role to ensure project team compliance with PRA processes and systems including escalation to relevant functional and operational management.Mentors other members of the project management team or functional leads, as required.Attends and presents at client meetings, including bid defense meetings.May act as a lead project manager on international projects.

Qualifications
An undergraduate degree (graduate degree preferred).
A minimum of 5 years of experience in clinical research, including real-world project management research experience.
Reads, writes and speaks fluent English; fluent in language of host country.
** Must have experience Demonstrating and Understanding/Conducting Real World Solutions Project Management**
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status
Location: Consideration will be given to candidates located in US or Canada

PRA is an EEO/AA employer and is committed to providing opportunities to minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities.

BE Totally Engaged. BE Business Savvy. BE the Right Partner Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as a Program Manager- Water and Wastewater
In this role, you’ll join a team of building and infrastructure experts. Through our Get it Right Solution™, you’ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success.
At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.
With over 650 employees and 27+ office locations throughout Canada and the Middle East, Colliers Project Leaders offers a multi-cultural, multi-generational work environment where we cultivate excellence, develop leaders and deliver on our clients’ vision. Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ: CIGI; TSX: CIGI), an industry leading global real estate with more than 16,000 skilled professionals operating in 66 countries.
We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team
Who you are
As a successful Program Manager you will bring a wealth of experience leading programs of projects and be able to demonstrate a portfolio varying in scope and complexity with depth in municipal infrastructure projects, specializing in water and wastewater.

What success looks like
Provide project leadership and design review expertise to the client's projects, representing their best interests and achieving their strategic end goals.
You will be a trusted advisor to the client, applying your deep understanding of design, construction and operation of water and wastewater facilities and associated infrastructure assets.
Ability to Lead clients through the set-up, initiation, execution, monitoring and reporting of their projects.
Provide leadership to a highly skilled project team, guiding them towards common goals and establish levels of authority and lines of communication.
Act as the key interface between Colliers Project Leaders and the Client.
Chair project and site meetings, identify and resolve project issues and coordinate multiple stakeholders.
Serve as the relationship manager role for select clients with the goal to nurture trusted relationships.
Contribute to the strategic growth of the infrastructure services business unit.
Apply your leadership and communication skills to bring together stakeholders and project teams.
Peer review the work of, mentor and develop project managers and engineering support staff.

What you bring:
Minimum 15 years’ experience leading large, complex programs of projects in the municipal water and wastewater industry valued at >$100M
A degree or diploma in civil engineering or a related engineering discipline.
P.Eng. and/or PMP designations are required.
Extensive client facing experience in the delivery of related projects.
Led and/or significantly contributed to the preparation of RFP/Q’s, tenders and tender awards.
Strong working knowledge of a variety of design and construction delivery models.
The leadership skills needed to influence decisions and resolve client and project issues.
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.

Why Join the Tiree Team?

As a leader in the project management industry, we deliver complex and cutting-edge real property projects across Canada and abroad.

Your Challenge:

As a senior project manager you will be responsible for the planning and delivery of complex projects. Given the size and scope of the projects you will have a background successfully delivering similar-sized initiatives in the past.

Your Day to Day:
Lead facilitation meetings to elicit client project requirements
Develop project scope, requirement documents, statement of work, participating in client discussions, analysis of functional and operational requirements of the client
Produce key project management deliverables: project management plans, risk management plans, change management procedures etc
Manage engineering and associated specialist teams, reviewing project costs and resolving variances with predetermined budgets by recommending action and resolving conflicts
Maintain the change management process that records changes to the scope of work
Monitor the design, implementation and operations of the project against established goals
Identify and resolve strategic risk issues with clients
Requirements

The Experience You Bring:

Degree or diploma in engineering, architecture, design or a relevant field
Experience working on large scale projects
10 years+ experience as a project manager supporting construction or engineering projects of high-complexity and value
Strong knowledge of project management best practices and a track record of successful deliver
Effective leadership and organizational skills with the ability to effectively influence others and successfully resolve a variety of client, project and technical issues
Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications
PMP designation or Prince 2 is an asset
Eligibility to obtain secret security clearance. Asset: existing secret security clearance
Benefits

Our People – work with industry leaders and best-in-class project teams

Our Projects – work on the most iconic and exciting real property projects

Our Culture – work within a vibrant corporate culture, with a full schedule of social events and a comprehensive health and wellness program

Our Compensation – work for an employer that offers competitive pay, RRSP matching, health benefits, and paid professional development

Tiree is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes employment equity. Tiree is committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted regarding an opportunity with us, please advise our recruitment team of accommodation measures you may require.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in Tiree but wish to note that only qualified candidates will be asked to attend an interview.

The Development and Inspections Division of the City of Winnipeg provides an array of services to help residents and businesses manage their development and building needs from permits to property standards. As Winnipeg moves towards its 25 development plan (OurWinnipeg) the Manager, Development and Inspections will have an opportunity to play a key role in facilitating Winnipeg’s economic development.

Reporting to the Director of Planning, Property and Development, the Manager of Development and Inspections is responsible for the overall leadership, planning, implementation, evaluation and management of Development and Inspection Division programs and activities.

This is an excellent opportunity for a service oriented leader who excels at bringing vision to execution while empowering and collaborating with their team.

As the Manager, Development and Inspections you will:
Lead a division overseeing zoning and permits, building inspections and property standards.
Provide direction, leadership, expertise and guidance to Development and Inspections Division staff.
Identify improvements, and implement new processes and systems for measuring productivity, efficiencies, and bringing in overall improvements for the Division.
Develop, communicate with and maintain strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders such as staff, department leadership, council and businesses and organizations throughout Winnipeg.
As a member of the management team, participate in the strategic and operational planning and delivery of the Planning, Property and Development services department.
Ensure that the City is adequately protected, both legally and financially, in its dealings with development and construction.

Your education and qualifications include:
You have a degree in engineering (ideally coupled with an MBA).
You have 8-10 years of progressive experience in the construction and/or land development industry or related field and ideally have a background in both the public and private sector.
You are a proactive leader who has lead through complex change and who champions accountability, teamwork and service.
You possess strong business acumen and have significant experience in engaging and collaborating with multiple levels of internal and external stakeholders.
You have a track record of providing solid strategic advice to senior leaders on complex topics and sensitive issues.
You have been responsible for financial management, budgeting, operations and strategic planning.
You are a strong and clear communicator and are well equipped to manage sensitive issues and concerns.
You’re experienced in developing and implementing policies, programs and procedures.
You are a strong leader possessing the ability to distill, communicate and apply complex technical and building code requirements into construction plans and built form.

Conditions of employment:
Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
A Police Information Check satisfactory to the employer will be required from the successful candidate, at their expense. To obtain a Police Information Check, please visit www.winnipeg.ca/police.
Must possess and maintain a valid Class 5 Manitoba Driver’s License. The successful applicant is required to provide a vehicle for transportation while on City business, subject to the terms and conditions of the City Transportation Policy.

CORE COMPETENCIES for ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE CITY OF WINNIPEG:
Citizen & Customer Focus
Respecting Diversity
Ethics and Values
Integrity and Trust
Results Oriented

budgeting

Excel

The Project Manager is accountable for safety, schedule, cost, quality and general overall project performance, and is responsible for promoting close and harmonious relations with the client and consultants. The Project Manager provides leadership regarding project matters and strategy. The Project Manager is accountable to and draws authority from the Construction Manager and the President, regarding issues such as safety, quality, progress, cost, schedule and any other project matters.

The Project Manager is accountable and responsible to provide proactive leadership in:

Safety & Environment
Assisting the Superintendent in establishing the Project Specific Safety and Environment Plan and ensuring it is understood and adhered to as further defined in the Project Site Specific HSE Manual.
Risk, Opportunity & Obligation
Knowing the project and contract requirements and ensuring that these are communicated and understood.
Enforcing contractual responsibilities and resolving disputes.
Identifying, tracking and mitigating risks throughout the project life cycle.
Ensuring scope is covered and risks are allocated to the appropriate parties
Identifying, tracking, and ensuring opportunities are maximized and realized
Providing feedback to the project team regarding expectations
Project Planning & Execution
Putting the Project Execution Plan in place (including project procedures) and ensuring it is communicated and understood
Project organization and staffing.
Assisting the superintendent in establishing the major construction work plans and engineering methods
Evaluating and approving construction methods.
Performing detailed cost review of equipment to be used.
Chairing project startup meetings.
Delegating work and scopes
Ensuring that the project team is efficient and tasks are completed timely
Making sure the team is “Doing what we are saying we will do”
Scheduling
Scheduling, task definition and breakdown oversight.
Regular schedule progress reporting and updates oversight
Review of logic with the Superintendent
Ensuring compliance by all parties with the schedule
Quality
Overseeing development and ensuring compliance with a Project Quality Plan
Ensuring the project is completed in compliance with the contract requirements.
Planning for contract close out, including occupancy, commissioning, and maintenance and warranty manuals.
Prompt attention to deficiency and warranty work
Ensuring the project is practicing CCM’s Value Management Policy.
Compliance with the Corporate Quality Management requirements
Mentoring staff on quality expectations and potential deficiencies
Project Cost Controls
Ensuring project profitability
Budget/cost control system preparation, maintenance and forecasting.
Working closely with accounting and payroll.
Defining procedures and authorizing material procurement.
Handling all change orders, including negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impact
Verifying timecards are coded correctly.
Communicating cost risks and opportunities to the staff
Providing expectations for the staff in regard to being efficient and maximizing profit
Project Document Controls & Procedures
Ensuring project correspondence and records (paper and electronic) are properly managed and maintained.
Contract document, Request for Information, Site Instruction, and Submittal controls and distribution procedures
Subcontract Management
Negotiating and issuing subcontracts and monitoring their progress, schedule, and risk of default
Issuing subcontract revisions timely
Tracking of costs with subcontractors to ensure that the budgets are being maintained.
Maintaining up-to-date lists of subcontracts and subcontract revisions.
Project Administration
Securing and maintaining all necessary insurance, bonds and permits.
Preparing /verifying of progress payments with owner and subcontractors
Preparing the monthly billing
Overseeing the accountant in their duties regarding waivers, and other items tracked related to payment
Ensuring subcontractors are not overpaid
Soliciting feedback from staff on subcontractor and supplier payments
Approving invoices from subcontractors and suppliers
Communications
Maintaining excellent relationships with owner, designer consultants, subcontractors and public
Labor relations
Liaising with building authorities and regulatory agencies as required beyond that performed by engineers
Preparing the Monthly Status Report for client communications.
Preparing the Project Risk Report for internal review.
Meeting manager; acting as chair on project meetings.
Management of internal project close-out including archiving of documents and producing the final project report.
Primary point of contact for challenges and opportunities with subcontractor’s upper management.
Primary point of contact for challenges and opportunities with Design team upper management
Primary point of contact for challenges and opportunities with Owners and the Owner’s Representative
Professional Development
Supervising, mentoring, coaching and training project personnel
Ensuring project staff is performing their roles well and learning roles of their supervisors
Promoting a team atmosphere to give the most opportunity for the staff to learn from each other.
Please contact us for more information at careers@clarkcm.ca

Job Description:
At Aecon, we’re building the future and our people are at the heart of everything we do. We're always looking for exceptional talent to work on our exciting and ever-expanding project portfolios. We are focused on being the #1 Canadian Infrastructure Company and the first choice employer in our industry.

Position Overview

Reporting to the Vice President, Estimating and PMO, the Contracts Manager will support our Estimating and Project Management teams, and will be responsible for ensuring that key legal documents supporting construction activities are compliant and consistent with Aecon’s commercial Risk Management Policies, and are optimal and practical to each project opportunity.

Key Responsibilities

Formalize, document, and maintain Departmental / Divisional best practices and processes.
Incorporate / comply with Aecon’s risk management policies and procedures.
Provide comprehensive review of key legal documents during the bid stage.
Compile logs of all key commercial risk items and any variances to Aecon’s risk and financial policies and preferences.
Propose alternate contract language where required.
Collaborate with Estimating, PMO, Operations, Finance, Legal, Treasury, Taxation, Senior Management as appropriate.
Generate associated qualifiers and exceptions to support the tender period RFI process and bid submissions.
Assist in the coordination of post submission RFI’s related to commercial risk items.
Coordinate the execution of key legal documents.
Coordinate internal and external distribution as applicable.
Maintain all key document control and electronic filing.
Facilitate the development of internal and external Joint-venture agreements as required.
Facilitate the review, approval and execution of Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDA’s), Memorandums of Understanding (MOU’s) and Letters of Intent (LOI’s).
Liaise with Estimating Coordination re: key Subcontractor Agreements as required.
Participate in Project Handover and Project Kick-off meetings as appropriate.
Perform all duties in compliance with Aecon’s current and applicable processes, templates, checklists and tools.
Support the development of project Contract Management Plans as appropriate.
Support the administration of Contract Amendments affecting relevant Terms and Conditions.
Provide input into project Risk Register development as applicable.
Keeping appropriately current with applicable construction law.
Ensure adherence to appropriate Limits of Authority protocol.
Mentor and coach Estimating, PMO and Operational staff as may be required

Required Knowledge and Experience

Minimum of 7 years experience in Contract Administration
Engineering or Business Degree (or equivalent combinations of training)
Professional Engineer designation (P.Eng.) an asset
Strong construction knowledge
Strong business acumen
Skills allow for working independently with little supervision
Prior Operational experience an asset.
Thorough knowledge of contract language / Terms and Conditions / Bonding etc.
Self motivated with excellent organizational skills.
Strong computer skills (MS Word including “blackline” functionality, MS Excel)
Strong communication skills – oral and written are essential.
Ability to work accurately, effectively under pressure.
Adaptable to flexible work schedule when required to meet deadlines.
Ability to work with others as a team

As energy availability becomes increasingly critical, there’s no end to the scope and significance of your work — and to where it can take you at Stantec. Every day, we’re problem-solving and collaborating on projects that are as challenging as they are impactful. Whether designing a transformational cross-country pipeline, optimizing facilities, verifying the safety and reliability of an asset, or in the field overseeing construction projects, you’ll be joining a team of recognized industry experts on work that’s critical to our clients and our communities. The Oil & Gas industry is changing — and we’re helping clients stay ahead of the change. Join a team that’s working together with industry to deliver innovation for the long term on some of the most important and interesting projects around the world.

Your Opportunity

The PCM is responsible to ensure the work is completed on time, on budget, and in accordance with safety, environmental, quality, and regulatory compliance requirements. Monitoring the day-to-day construction activities while supporting the Contractors management team, the PCM supports project execution objectives. Acting as the primary liaison between the Contractor and the project management team for construction, cost, and schedule issues, the PCM will support the Contractor to ensure that the technical requirements of the project are understood and achieved.

We are looking to fill this position for opportunities in Alberta, Saskatchewan, British Columbia, and Ontario.

Your Key Responsibilities

Developing and promoting a site culture of safety, environmental, quality and regulatory compliance.
Supporting product realization and productivity by establishing a collective and inclusive client and Contractor dynamic.
Lead and/or facilitate meetings including, construction kick off, progress, environmental, safety, quality, socioeconomic, and other meetings with contractors and internal stakeholders ensuring proper documented exchange of information.
Interact with Contractor construction management team on a daily basis to proactively address issues and overcome challenges.
Identify, communicate, and document project risks in the risk register.
Work with the project costing group to ensure project controls are in place for cost and schedule.
Monitor Contractor and inspection team performance and identify opportunities for improvement.
Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly Construction progress reports as required.
Participate in schedule and milestone development and tracking.
Participate in the review of contractor schedules (this includes “look ahead scheduling” with the contractor to ensure overall project schedules are met).
Ensure the Contractor and inspection team are supporting the overall project objectives.
Identify and communicate social risks to the site security lead.
Ensure construction deficiency lists and/or punchlists are generated and plans prepared to address deficiencies.
Support commissioning and turnover to operations.
Support project close out including claims resolution and lessons learned.

Your Capabilities and Credentials

Mainline Pipeline experience – Large bore pipeline experience is preferred
API 1169 Pipeline Construction Inspector Certification required for most pipeline projects
Excellent organizational, strategic, planning and implementing skills.
Strong presentation, written, and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly convey information to a variety of audiences.
Ability to solve complex problems using sound professional judgment, creativity and innovation.
Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
Advanced skills in use of Microsoft (MS) Office Suite.

Education and Experience

Post-secondary and/or 15-20 years industry experience equivalent. Minimum of 10 years of industry experience on Major Project in a leadership role. High school & post-secondary education (preferred).

Position will work in office and field setting. Visits construction sites and works in outside weather conditions.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Job Description:
Goodfood (TSX: FOOD) est un service d'épicerie en ligne de premier plan au Canada, offrant des solutions de repas frais qui permettent aux membres, d'un océan à l'autre, de savourer chaque semaine de délicieux repas à la maison. La mission de Goodfood est de faire de l’impossible une réalité, de la ferme à la cuisine, en permettant aux membres de planifier leurs repas hebdomadaires et de faire leur épicerie en quelques minutes. Les membres de Goodfood ont accès à une sélection unique de produits en ligne ainsi qu’à des prix exclusifs rendus possibles grâce à son écosystème de classe mondiale de traitement des commandes qui sont livrées directement au consommateur. Goodfood compte actuellement plus de 200 000 membres actifs et plus de 2 000 employés dévoués et passionnés à travers le Canada.

Relevant du VP Chef National des Opérations Épicerie, le Gestionnaire de Projet Systèmes Opérationnels sera responsable de la planification, de la conception, du développement et de la mise en œuvre de systèmes qui révolutionneront l'industrie de l'épicerie en ligne au Canada.

Solides compétences de communication et de synthèse
Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais
Confortable à travailler de façon autonome dans un environnement en évolution rapide

About On Side Restoration

On Side Restoration is one of Canada’s leading, privately-owned restoration companies with branches coast to coast from Victoria, BC to St. John’s, Newfoundland. Proprietary internal systems include eClaim, a transparent web-based file management software program, and On Side LiVE, their 24 hour customizable emergency call centre. Experienced and certified crew operate On Side’s extensive fleet of emergency response vehicles and leverage their 10,000+ pieces of specialty equipment. Who We Are

Though your interests may lie in marketing, architecture, accounting, interior design, construction or sales, your enthusiasm for being the best at what you do is what counts the most. Our colleagues are also motivated by doing work to be proud of, ensuring Mosaic is a great place to work, and at all times, doing the right thing. These are important values that unite our team. Sound like you? If yes, you’re likely a great fit here.

The Opportunity

Delivering on the highest levels of quality in the industry, you are driven to make a positive impact on people and communities through your work. As a member of our growing team, you will juggle a portfolio of unique multifamily wood-frame residential projects, delivering them in a safe, timely and profitable manner.

You like to build things. You take pride when you walk past a project and say to yourself, “I had a hand in making that possible”. You’re seasoned. You’ve learned the hard lessons, while holding yourself and your team to a high standard of work. You are passionate about multifamily construction and always have been. You are on top of the latest trends and always chasing excellence with the end user in mind.

Southwestern Integrated Fibre Technology (SWIFT) is hiring a full-time Project Manager.

Are you a motivated self-starter who is tired of the commute, comfortable working at a home office and has a passion for technology, excellent organizational skills and experience in the telecommunications industry? SWIFT is looking for you!

Who we are?

Southwestern Integrated Fibre Technology (SWIFT) is a non-profit regional broadband project initiated by the Western Ontario Wardens’ Caucus to subsidize the construction of high-speed broadband networks across Southwestern Ontario.

The project’s approach strives towards the overarching goals of narrowing the digital divide and making small-town Ontario more competitive in the information economy.

As a member of our SWIFT team, you will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment and will be overall responsibility of managing the project schedules, documents, and reporting aspects of the various broadband network expansion projects.

Summary
The Project Manager has the overall responsibility of managing the project schedules, documents, and reporting aspects of the various broadband network expansion projects. The Project Manager will be responsible for managing the deliverables of Internet Service Providers as per their contracts with SWIFT, as well as internal contract execution processes.

Responsibilities and Deliverables:
Maintaining Project Plans, Project Schedules, Project Risk Registers and Project Action Registers for all infrastructure projects funded by SWIFT.
Responsible for ensuring Internet Service Providers are fulfilling contractual requirements across multiple projects.
Responsible for managing SWIFT staff deliverables when finalizing multiple project agreements with different Internet Service Providers.
Developing, updating and executing Master Program Plan. The Plan will define the high-level tasks, milestones, resources, dependencies, and timing components of the entire SWIFT program.
Providing timely and accurate reporting for all infrastructure projects.
Ongoing communications with ISP’s for project updates, reports, notifications of deadlines, answering questions, etc. Timely escalation of deviations in schedule, scope and budget.
Development of acceptance documentation.
Development of project outcome reports and presentation materials.
Providing input to Contribution Agreements with provincial and federal governments.
Maintaining knowledge and skill with training and development through courses, workshops and selected reading.
Responsible for maintaining internal document control and file organization.
Other duties as assigned.
What skills and qualifications are we looking for?
Demonstrated project management experience in the telecommunications industry.
Demonstrated contract management experience.
Ability to handle change and adapt to new situations.
Experience with developing/finalizing detailed project processes and procedures.
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, coordination skills, and the ability to work calmly under the stress of conflicting deadlines and assignments.
Comfortable/confident to independently facilitate meetings and identify when collaboration with team members is required.
Must have a passion for technology and providing effective solutions for customers, willingness to challenge the status quo.
Excellent written and oral skills.
Must be a team player and able to work independently.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft products (Teams, Planner, Visio, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint).
Valid Driver’s license.

Job Title: Senior Project Manager - Construction and buildings
Job Description:
Senior Project Manager - Construction and buildings

Mission

Our Project Management team is currently hiring seasoned project managers to efficiently manage a diversified project portfolio, leveraging their command of project management tools and dedication to delivering high-quality work. We primarily serve clients in the institutional and public sectors, whom we frequently support in the management of building construction or renovation projects. We are involved in projects of various scope, and offer services customized to each client’s needs.

Responsibilities
Coordinate the work of professionals assigned to the projects;
Provide guidance for stakeholders in seeking solutions for ensuring the proper management and successful execution of projects based on the delivery method established in the contract;
Liaise with those in charge in connection with specific issues that may affect profitability, scheduling, on-time delivery, suppliers, etc.
Prepare for, set up and host coordination meetings with the client and the various partners as required for the harmonious execution of projects;
Take part in and draft the minutes for coordination meetings;
Play an active role in all operational and strategic project management activities.
Profile
Bachelor’s degree in Architecture or Engineering;
Minimum 10 years of experience in a similar role;
Knowledge of construction and project management;
Membership in a professional order;
Bilingualism (French and English), oral and written;
Ability to travel by car;
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a team.
CIMA+ offers you

Benefits
Flexible schedules
Salary increase based on performance
Sick leave and personal leave
Comprehensive benefit plan upon hiring
Matched pension plan upon hiring
Possibility of investing in a company profit-sharing plan


For your career
Continuous training and development program
Reimbursement of professional association membership cotisation
Recognition programs
Advanced technology tools


For you and your loved ones
Wellness program
Corporate discounts: such as mobile services, fitness center, home and auto insurance, software


And much more!

Why join CIMA+?

The key to our delivery of quality services is being able to attract and maintain satisfied and engaged people. At CIMA+, employees are given the flexibility required to ensure a balanced life and fulfilling work experience in a motivating work environment. Our staff enjoy the diversity of projects and the extensive autonomy given to interact directly with clients. Such proximity is possible because of our flat corporate structure, and it translates into relationships of trust, and effective communications between team members and clients.

At CIMA+ we are committed to creating opportunities for all our employees so that they may develop, progress, and contribute to the business regardless of differences. We fully respect the principles of employment equity and encourage women, visible minorities, indigenous people, and persons with disabilities to apply. Alternative options are available upon request to facilitate participation in the recruitment process.

About Us

At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Watch our 'About Us' video

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.

Primary Responsibilities
As a Senior Project Manager in our Municipal Transportation Design Group, we'll count on you to:

• Support and help lead the growth of our highway and road design group

• Lead, plan, direct and monitor all aspects of large multidiscipline projects with high degree of technical complexity, typically in excess of $5 million and involving a large project staff

• Produce and coordinate several projects concurrently

• Establish client relations and support marketing efforts, including leading pursuits

Why HDR

At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.

OPEN CALL FOR RESUMES – CONSTRUCTION DIVISION

Mission Group, the Okanagan’s leading real estate development and building company, is collecting resumes for building projects that will start in the next 12 months.

More than just a job:

Your next job should be about more than just matching your skills with a job description. It should be about finding a company that values you as a person and what you bring to the job - your workstyle, goals and personal interests. That’s why Mission Group has created a collaborative work environment and exceptional culture that supports, incentivizes and rewards its employees. Besides competitive pay and benefits, Mission Groupers enjoy paid training and development, open vacation, a company-paid cell phone, teambuilding trips, employee discounts, etc. They can also support the charity of their choice by volunteering on company time.
