In addition to your knowledge and experience, you’re a team player who gets along well with others. You work hard and always bring your A-game and a positive outlook. For you, no task is worth doing unless it’s done well. You enjoy going to work. You treat others with respect and you’re always willing to lend a hand. You want more than just a job. You want a long-term future, a great team environment and opportunities to grow with the company.

The Company

Mission Group is a leader in the development and construction of award-winning, multi-family homes and commercial properties in Kelowna. Through land acquisition, development, design, construction and after-sales customer care, they build more than just homes – they build planned communities where every detail is carefully considered with the customer and the community in mind.

HDR is an architectural, engineering and consulting firm that excels at complex projects and solving challenges for clients.

More than 10,000 professionals, including architects, engineers, consultants, scientists, planners and construction managers, in over 200 locations worldwide, pool their solutions beyond the scope of traditional A/E/C firms.

HDR is the technical advisor for the Ontario Line, one of the largest subway projects in North America. This new 16-kilometer, fully automated driverless line serving 15 underground, surface and elevated stations in Toronto will accommodate nearly 400,000 daily boardings. It introduces a modern new transportation option to neighborhoods that historically have not had access to a major transit line. HDR is proud to lead a strong team of world-class transit and infrastructure practitioners to sculpt this legacy project that will serve the people of Toronto for decades to come. We are currently seeking team-oriented professionals in the transit and infrastructure arenas to contribute to the success of this iconic project.

The primary duties of the Senior Project Manager include planning, directing and monitoring all aspects of delivering large rail/transit multi-discipline programs, projects with high degree of technical complexity, typically in excess of $20 million fee and leading a large team of program/project staff. The leader will be involved with the production and coordination of several programs/projects concurrently, establish client relations and lead contractual, design and production meetings. There will be alternative delivery opportunities directing and coordinating with multiple consultants, contractors and agencies and the Sr PM will help establish sequencing of projects from proposal to completion stages. Schematic, design development and contract document work sessions on project sites in conjunction with project staff, appropriate technical professionals and other disciplines will be necessary.

This position is responsible for staffing coordination, workload of delivery of the program/ project, supervising large program/project staff and serve as a mentor for less experienced project managers and technical staff. The leader will works with clients and may likely to be co-located with program/project teams. Additional responsibilities include internal management for project reviews, implementing QA/QC procedures, execution of training for personnel as established by company-wide strategic plans. Typically, maintains professional engineering registration.

Keyword(s): Senior Transportation Program; Project; Design Build Manager, Design Build, Engineering, Transit Program Manager; Alternative Delivery, Senior Project Manager; #156650; Principal Project Manager.

#LI-MP2

BS in a related engineering discipline.

Must have previous experience in Design/Build projects, preferably in the Design Manager role, or Mega Project Program Management experience as the Lead on the Program.
Must have specific experience with Rail/Transit.

Extensive knowledge and practice of project and program management procedures is a must. Candidate should have excellent marketing and business development skills in addition to contacts/relationships in the Transportation Engineering marketplace. The successful candidate needs to be willing and able to relocate to execute significant projects across the country.

Demonstrated business development and strategic planning skills preferred. Good communication, leadership, planning and mentoring skills. An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must.

Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!
Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Plans, manages, executes and controls one or multiple assigned infrastructure and engineering projects involving larger scope, risk, impact and sensitivity. Ensures the successful delivery according to enterprise engineering project management standards, governance and procedures.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Plans, manages, executes, and controls all aspects of assigned capital projects involving larger scope, risk, impact and sensitivity, in alignment with the divisional strategy and departmental objectives.
Leads the strategic planning of the assigned capital projects, including defining the scope of the project in collaboration with senior management; creating business cases/justifications and work plans, determining the objectives and measurements, determining the budget, resources, and stakeholders; setting up the project schedule and review plan.
Manages and monitors the assigned projects throughout the implementation stage, including executing the project according to project plan; creating project management records and documentations; monitoring the project progress and financial status of project. Anticipates and proactively manages change throughout the project life cycle.
Prepares contracts, Requests for Proposals (RFP) and Tender documents for projects, including terms and conditions, scope of work definition, technical requirements and specifications, project specific requirements and project schedule constraints.
Presents and reports the project progress, risks, expectations, timelines, milestones and key project metrics to senior leadership teams. Provides suggestions and recommendations to the senior leadership teams on risk management and project delivery.
Manages cross functional project teams and stakeholders across the enterprise. Develops and maintains a respectful and productive relationship with all stakeholders. Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of the project.
Provides expert advice and recommendations on engineering project management standards, governance and procedures to continuously improve the enterprise project management practices.
Provides technical and project management guidance to Project Managers and Project Coordinators at lower levels.
Qualifications

Education and Experience:

The competencies for this position would typically be acquired through completion of University degree in Engineering and/or Business and a PMP certification is required. Requires seven 7 years of previous experience in engineering project management.

Other Requirements:
Advanced knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of project management.
Advanced interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships with multiple internal and external stakeholders.
Advanced analytical thinking and problem solving skills, to resolve critical and high impact issues.
Advanced time management and organization skills to balance and coordinate effort across multiple, concurrent activities.
Advanced verbal and written communication skills.
Solid technical skills in business and project management computer applications and databases.
Other Information

University degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering is preferred.

Experience in the following systems will be an asset:

• Automatic Train Control (ATC)
• Data network and Telecommunications
• SCADA System
• AC and DC Power and Distribution Systems
• Operational Safety Systems
• Testing and Commissioning (T&C) Activities

The successful candidate should be:
• Focused on positive customer interactions and project outcomes
• Familiar with managing the full Systems Engineering project cycle

Experienced in:
• Soliciting expectations and requirements from both technical and non-technical parties
• Translating expectations, needs and wants into design/build work packages
• Managing design/build contracts
• Interpreting and resolving trade-off decisions
• Verifying solutions and validating outcomes
• Managing and building consensus amongst executive-level stakeholders

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.
Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.
Rate of Pay

Salary starting at $101,116 per annum.

Tetra Tech is a leading provider of consulting, engineering, and technical services worldwide. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—20,000 people working together across disciplines and time zones to provide smart, sustainable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development. Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in 400 locations around the world. We offer competitive compensation and benefits and are searching for innovative people to join our teams. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Job Details:
We are currently seeking Construction Managers with experience in wind power construction to join our exciting renewable energy team, currently for wind projects in Alberta, Canada and New Mexico. The construction managers are to provide construction management leadership and expertise on renewable energy construction projects, ensuring that the projects meets design intent, as well as meeting schedule and cost objectives. The ideal candidate has civil, electrical and/or turbine/mechanical wind construction experience and strong skills in managing a diverse group of project participants (client, contractors, regulatory agencies, stakeholders). To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Responsibilities:
Site Coordination
Ensure contractors fully understand their contractual obligations and project requirements
Liaise with contractors to minimize contractor conflict and encourage synergy on multiple contractor work sites.
Identify slow progress, inadequate quality or performance, possible future construction problems and suggest possible solutions.
Project Schedule and Cost Control
Monitor project schedule and costs, update and report as project development proceeds. Take action, as required, to address issues in a proactive manner.
Confirm monthly contract progress payment documents, forecast and manage potential changes.
Construction Monitoring
Monitor and inspect construction to confirm quality and that the constructed works are in conformance with the design.
Review and manage technical submittals (shop drawings, RFI’s, RFC’s and work plans) to confirm conformance with design and quality of work.
Address issues that arise in a timely and cost effective manner.
Effective documentation of progress through daily and weekly reports (with detailed photos).
Equipment Procurement Completion
Monitor the receipt and inspection of major equipment/materials to ensure compliance with technical requirements and commercial terms, facilitate responsibility transfers and acceptance.
Regulatory Compliance and Liaison
Act as the Owner’s representative during construction, responsible for daily/weekly interface with key stakeholders including regulatory agencies, government (local, municipal to federal), and landowners.
Requirements:
Strong construction background, having worked on 2 or more wind projects including direct experience with wind turbine foundation construction and/or turbine erection/installation.
Construction experience of at least 8 years, capable of working on several major industrial projects simultaneously in a multidiscipline environment.
Prefer Civil, Electrical or Mechanical Engineers or appropriately recognized technical designations.

About TORCON

TORCON builds and constructs unique environments in collaboration with diverse and high profile designers and architects. With our in-house team of subject matter experts and dedicated professionals, our mission is to provide an unsurpassed level of service and innovative solutions to ensure optimal client satisfaction, allowing for existing relationships to thrive and new relationships to emerge.

Our portfolio consists of small to large-scale construction, repair and renovation projects entailing all contract types recognized by the Canadian Construction Association. All work executed by TORCON is conducted in accordance with all health and safety requirements, applicable legislation and best industry practice as showcased by our Certificate of Recognition (COR™) endorsed by the Canadian Federation of Construction Safety Associations.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the President, Project Manager’s major responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

Ensure all projects meet anticipated schedules, stay within budget, meets client expectations and are executed at highest level of quality
Prepare contracts and negotiate revisions, changes and additions to contractual agreements
Prepare and manage project budget/itemized costs, construction schedules and milestones, and monitor project progress
Prepare various documents such as meeting minutes, project progress status and change order summaries
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with Client, Consultants, Architects, Designers, Provincial/Municipal Inspectors, Site Superintendents and Sub-Trades
Ensure Site Superintendents are up to date in regards to Site Instructions (SI), Request for Information (RFI), Addendums, etc.
Tender, review, approve and award all sub-trades in conjunction with Estimator. Coordinate sub-trades work activities. Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate daily operations with Site Superintendents, ensuring quality control.
Direct the purchase of building materials and equipment
Meet with the Site Superintendents during the initial project set-up to review all aspects of the project scope, budget, schedule, list of sub-trades awarded contracts and safety principles
Monitor site safety and ensure compliance to OH&S Act and COR standards
Visit the project site on regular basis to conduct site inspection for quality control and ensure project deliverables are on schedule
Manage timely payment collection
Manage and execute the Contemplated Change Order (CCO), Change Order (CO) and Change Directive (CD) are processed in a timely manner, responding to the timeframes requested by the Client and contract specifications. In all cases, follow-up until an approved CO is received within the timelines of contract specifications
Prepare monthly report for Management review, updating project status, in addition to the Site Superintendents report, to be issued within five (5) business days after the commencement of the new month

Requirements

Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Construction, Engineering, Business or related field. Candidates with equivalent experience and certification may be considered.
PMP certification preferred
Minimum 5+ years of progressive construction project management experience (i.e., commercial, industrial, residential, new construction projects, tenant improvements, interior-fit up, renovation, additions). Canadian/Ontario experience preferred.
Construction project management experience in high security environment is an asset.
Understanding of construction industry standards, operations (i.e., construction specifications, building materials, methods and procedures) and Federal, Provincial and Municipal construction bylaws
Read and interpret blueprints
Financial analysis and mathematical skills
Project forecasting and analysis
Budget management
Internal/external stakeholder relationship management
Strong client orientation
Strong business acumen
Attention to detail, tact, diplomacy, sound judgment
Manage and lead teams
Problem solving/conflict resolution and decision making skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including interpersonal skills
Going above and beyond attitude to meet clients expectations
Time management and organizational skills
Manage multiple projects consecutively and manage competing business priorities in a fast paced environment
Experience with Adobe Acrobat Pro, AutoCAD Viewer, Project Management/Scheduling software, and Microsoft Office (i.e., Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Project, Visio, Outlook, etc.).
Valid Driver’s Licence
Health & Safety related training is an asset (i.e., WHMIS 2015, Working at Heights/Fall Prevention, Basics of Supervising, First Aid & CPR, Lockout & Tag, Confined Space, Aerial/Elevating Work Platforms, Asbestos Work in Construction Hazard Awareness, etc.).

Description
~ Français à suivre ~

PTW is seeking an experienced Project Manager with a solid track record of managing the creation, management and delivery of quality products from start to finish. This role works directly with our clients and internal team to ensure deliverables fall within applicable scopes and budgets. Ideal candidate would be passionate about games, have a strong quality mindset from a consumer perspective and is a collaborative leader. Is this you?

**During the Current Covid-19 global pandemic, this role will be a Work From Home position**

What you’ll be doing
Deliver projects successfully within budget, timeframe and quality scopes as per clients’ expectations
Collaborate with clients to establish schedules, define budget and ensure creation of test coverage and project metrics
Produce and present reports to stakeholders utilizing data that represent product quality KPI
Quality and project management through test scope/scheduling, evaluating ROI and cost vs benefit analysis
Manage, lead, motivate, coach and train Functional Game QA Leads
Plan, apply and adapt project test strategies with the support of Team Leads
Coordinate with other internal departments to ensure all aspects of each project are compatible and resources are adequate to fulfil clients’ needs
Define and implement critical knowledge transfer and overall communication process with internal and external teams
Act as the primary point of contact for internal inquiries from Leads and resolve conflicts/issues in collaboration with HR as they arise
Collaborate with internal and external partners and stakeholders across a range of technology disciplines and geographic locations
Process and workflow management, identifying, innovating and improving processes to maintain high quality standards
Requirements
What we’re looking for
2+ years relevant experience in a Project Management or similar role in the Video Games or related industry. Experience in outsource environment a plus
Experienced with financial management, budget tracking, QA cost estimates and constraints
Strong understanding of analytics and KPIs as a way of tracking product quality
Tech savvy with strong proficiency using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Jira
Solution driven, problem-solver with demonstrated critical thinking capabilities to understand, define, propose and implement tangible solutions
Exceptional interpersonal skills and strong verbal and written communication in the English language
Ability to communicate across technical and non-technical disciplines as well as all levels of management
Proven expertise in conflict resolution and ability to provide constructive and positive feedback
Take charge, motivated self-starter, and autonomous leader with excellent time management and organizational skills
Strong team motivator with the ability to lead others, develops talent, mentors and cultivates members to keep a high standard of accuracy and lead by example
Excel working in a fast-pace, high pressure environment with capabilities to adapt quickly to changing demands
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus
Functional verbal French
Benefits
What we offer
Competitive pay
Comprehensive group insurance coverage
Paid accrued vacation and paid sick days
Diverse and collaborative environment with growth opportunities
Unlimited coffee with office location near metro in the heart of the Mile End gaming hub
Fun, dynamic and collaborative environment
Who we are

PTW is a leading global provider of customer experience, quality assurance, localization, engineering and audio production services, to key software and technology-focused markets including games, interactive entertainment media, education, e-commerce and internet of things.

For over 20 years, we’ve delivered great results for our clients. Our main aim is to advance their businesses and enhance their customer’s’ satisfaction. We’re dedicated to helping every client develop the best products and consumer experiences possible. And because we believe in partnerships and collaboration, the journey is shared, and the successes are too.

http://www.ptw.com

GESTIONNAIRE DE PROJET

PTW est à la recherche d'un gestionnaire de projet expérimenté doté d'une solide expérience en matière de gestion de la création, de la gestion et de la livraison de produits de qualité, du début à la fin. Ce rôle travaille directement avec nos clients et notre équipe interne pour veiller à ce que les produits livrables respectent les portées et les budgets applicables. Le candidat idéal serait passionné par les jeux, aurait une mentalité de qualité forte du point de vue du consommateur et serait un leader collaboratif. Est-ce vous?

**Pendant la pandémie mondiale actuelle de Covid-19, ce rôle sera un poste de travail à domicile**

Ce que vous ferez
Réussir les projets dans les limites du budget, des délais et de la qualité, conformément aux attentes des clients
Collaborer avec les clients pour établir des calendriers, définir un budget et assurer la création d'une couverture de test et de métriques de projet
Produire et présenter des rapports aux parties prenantes en utilisant des données représentant les indicateurs de performance clés de la qualité des produits
Gestion de la qualité et des projets via la portée / la planification des tests, évaluation du retour sur investissement et analyse coûts / avantages
Gérer, diriger, motiver, encadrer et former les responsables de l’AQ du jeu fonctionnel
Planifier, appliquer et adapter les stratégies de test du projet avec l’aide des chefs d’équipe
Assurer la coordination avec les autres services internes pour s’assurer que tous les aspects de chaque projet sont compatibles et que les ressources sont suffisantes pour répondre aux besoins des clients
Définir et mettre en œuvre le transfert des connaissances critiques et le processus de communication global avec les équipes internes et externes
Agir en tant que point principal de contact pour les demandes internes des responsables et résoudre les conflits / problèmes en collaboration avec les ressources humaines à mesure qu'ils surviennent
Collaborer avec des partenaires et des intervenants internes et externes dans plusieurs disciplines technologiques et lieux géographiques.
Gestion des processus et des flux de travail, identification, innovation et amélioration des processus pour maintenir des normes de qualité élevées
Ce que nous recherchons
2+ ans d’expérience pertinente dans la gestion de projets ou un rôle similaire dans les jeux vidéo ou dans un secteur apparenté. Expérience dans un environnement externalisé un atout
Expérience de la gestion financière, du suivi budgétaire, des estimations de coûts d’AQ et des contraintes
Excellente compréhension de l’analyse et des indicateurs clé de performance comme moyen pour suivre la qualité des produits
Connaissances techniques avec une grande maîtrise de MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Jira
Axés sur les solutions, résolveur de problèmes avec capacités de pensée critique démontrées pour comprendre, définir, proposer et mettre en œuvre des solutions concrètes
Compétences interpersonnelles exceptionnelles et forte communication verbale et écrite en anglais
Aptitude à communiquer entre disciplines techniques et non techniques ainsi que tous les niveaux de gestion
Expertise avérée dans la résolution de conflits et capacité à fournir des commentaires constructifs et positifs
Leader motivé et autonome, doté d'excellentes compétences en matière de gestion du temps et d'organisation
Solide chef d’équipe, capable de diriger les autres, de développer les talents, de conseiller et de former les membres pour garder un niveau élevé de précision et de montrer l’exemple
Excel travaillant dans un environnement rapide et soumis à de fortes pressions, doté de fonctionnalités permettant de s'adapter rapidement à l'évolution de la demande
L’attestation Project Management Professional (PMP) est un atout
Bilingue - compétences de communication écrite et verbale en anglais et en français
Ce que nous offrons
Poste à temps plein et permanent offrant des possibilités de croissance
Salaire compétitif avec couverture d'assurance groupe complète
Vacances accumulées payées avec congés de maladie payés
Café à volonté avec emplacement de bureau près du métro au cœur du centre de jeux vidéo du Mile End
Environnement amusant, dynamique et collaboratif
Qui nous sommes

PTW est l'un des principaux fournisseurs mondiaux d'expérience client, d'assurance qualité, de localisation, d'ingénierie et de production audio, sur les principaux marchés axés sur les logiciels et la technologie, notamment les jeux, les médias de divertissement interactifs, l'éducation, le commerce électronique et l'Internet des objets.

Depuis plus de 20 ans, nous livrons d'excellents résultats à nos clients. Notre objectif principal est de faire progresser leur entreprise et d'améliorer la satisfaction de leurs clients. Nous nous engageons à aider chaque client à développer les meilleurs produits et expériences de consommation possibles. Et parce que nous croyons aux partenariats et à la collaboration, le voyage est partagé et les succès aussi.

http://www.ptw.com

At Stantec, we approach every water and natural resource project we undertakewhether at the local, regional, or watershed level thoughtfully, and execute it with excellence across all project phases. We partner with our clients to design fit-for-purpose solutions that address their communities unique needs throughout the water infrastructure lifecycle. Our experts lead their fields and guide our work with scientific rigor, an innovative spirit, and a vision for growth. Were a place where you can apply your passion and collaborate with top talent on work thats critical to our clients, our communities, and the industry at large.

Your Opportunity

The successful candidate will work on challenging and diverse tasks in a consulting and construction management role that will require application of technical skills, project delivery, and leadership for construction projects. These projects consist of water pipelines, sitework for municipal water and sewer facilities, sewer lines, infrastructure systems including treatment plants, pump stations, and related infrastructure.

Your Key Responsibilities
Responsible for a specific client or account and staff reporting to them.
May be responsible for leading the team in monitoring the progress of the projects construction activities ensuring cost, schedule and quality standards are met.
Works closely with Architects and Engineers in coordinating the planning and implementation of the project and obtaining necessary permits and licenses for timely opening of site.
Inspects and reviews projects during construction to monitor conformance with plans, specifications, and other codes and regulations.
Communicates with and makes recommendations to Project Manager, design professionals, client, owner, developer, or contractor, but does not direct the means or methods of construction.
Provides the Project Manager with updates on project progress or delays to client, design professionals, and/or contractor.
Reviews and evaluates plans and specifications to ensure designs are practical for construction.
Reviews change orders and field orders for reasonableness of pricing and constructability.
Reviews requests for information, submittals, construction schedules, shop drawings and pay applications (QA/QC).
Manages deadlines, prioritizes assignments, and prepares final documentation for closeout process.
Prepares documents and maintains file management of project-related information including, but not limited to, correspondence, reports, and pictures.
Trains and/or mentors less experienced staff in company procedures, standards and software.
Performs other duties of a similar nature and level as assigned.
Your Capabilities and Credentials
Technical expert in all relevant areas of construction, and understanding of various design and construction methods.
Requires advanced knowledge of local, state and federal building codes, construction principles, techniques and procedures, occupational hazards and safety precautions.
Ability to effectively discuss project issues with contractor, project team and clients, including ability to resolve conflict situations.
Excellent organizational skills and understanding of task assignment and schedule.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced knowledge of critical path method scheduling.
Education and Experience

Technical degree/diploma/certificate or equivalent in related field; or equivalent combination of education and construction experience. Minimum of 8-10 years of experience.

Position will work in both a field and office setting. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather. Must be available to travel for out of town projects when needed.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each others talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Job Title: Manager of Engineering Design and Construction
Job Description:
Reporting to the Director of Engineering, the Manager of Design and Construction is accountable for the management of the Design and Construction Section and has a broad mandate for the provision of engineering services to other departments of the Engineering Services Division and to other Divisions within the City. The Manager is charged with the responsibility of providing all the functions necessary to meet this mandate including in-house surveying and drafting as required, development of design criteria and construction standards, selection of consultants, project management from design through construction, and management of environmental services and the regulatory approvals.

The Design and Construction Section has a staff function rather than a line function. May be responsible for initiating capital programs while providing technical and environmental advice and engineering services to the other department managers at their request. In the course of providing the most efficient and effective service possible the Manager will make use of dedicated staff, consultants, contracts or other municipal departments as necessary without diminished responsibility for achievement of the Departmental mandate.
Education & Experience
A recognized post secondary degree in Civil Engineering or Transportation Engineering or equivalent. A minimum of 10 years experience in Municipal or Transportation Engineering with progressively more responsible project management and supervisory duties and at least 5 years work experience in the Municipal sector including supervisory experience. Registered Professional Engineer in the Province of British Columbia.Valid B.C. Drivers License.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Manages the Design and Construction Section with responsibility for the recruitment, selection, motivation, training, performance and discipline of staff and the maintenance of safe working practices.
Manages personnel requirements so as to balance the work load as much as possible.
Directs the provision of engineering and project management for the Engineering Services Division.
Develops and submits annual capital budgets for the Design and Construction Section and administers approved budgets to ensure cost control and effective utilization of resources.
Reviews drafting, survey, engineering, project management, and environmental services work programs for the best method of service delivery. Where appropriate, arranges for alternative methods of service delivery.
Monitors alternative providers and ensures that the service is effective and meets municipal standards.
Where service is to be provided by municipal staff, plans, organizes, directs and controls to ensure that the work is performed in a timely, efficient and cost effective manner.
As part of a management team reporting to the Director of Engineering, assists in the establishment of objectives, priorities, policies and procedures for the Engineering Division.
Develops and administers priorities, policies and procedures for the Design and Construction Section and ensures that the Section meets goals and objectives established by the Director of Engineering.
Establishes and maintains effective communication and coordination with other organizational units in the municipality and with outside agencies and the public where appropriate.
Promotes a service ethic within the Section and ensures that the Section’s response to public service requests is friendly, timely and effective.

Licences, Certificates & Registrations
Registered Professional Engineer in the Province of British Columbia.
Valid B.C. Drivers License.

Job Description:
Mission

Do you have a reputation for excellence and consistency on supporting large scale infrastructure programs in the P3 sector? Do you have outstanding interpersonal and communication skills? Do you believe that you have the ability to take responsibility for projects of a diverse nature and provide guidance for clients in the execution of their most ambitious undertakings? We would like to meet you!

**Please note that this job posting aims to constitute a candidate bank for our client's future needs.**

CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for a Senior Project Manager for an upcoming program in Windsor, Ontario.

As a Senior Project Manager, you will be called to provide expert level project and program management for a multi-billon dollar critical infrastructure program. The role will include providing senior project leadership under a Director of Project Management in an EPMO and construction team responsible for owner-side oversight.

Please note that the purpose of this job posting is to constitute an application bank for possible needs of our client.

Responsibilities
Initiate, plan, and execute the Project Agreement.
Review, Update, execute and maintain the PMP/PEP.
Prepare quarterly key milestones for the EPMO team to provide clarity and to monitor progress.
Develop a WBS, budgets (costs, forecasts, trends, etc), schedule (level I-V on MS Project and/or P6), month end reports;
Review, analyze, implement and maintain project controls in line with BNA and maintain an audit plan with content in KPIs.
Manage an effective change management processes within the project management governance framework.
Provide guidance to stakeholders in seeking solutions to for ensure the proper management and successful execution of projects based on the delivery method established in the contract;
Follow-up and control of project activities (forecasting dates, updating hours on tasks, earned value, percentage complete, resource management/over allocation);
Act as the single point of contact on projects and coordinate the work of professionals assigned to the projects.
Review and analyze and provide content for the Executive Management Reports.
Review, analyze, implement and maintain cost/schedule/risk integration monthly management system with BNA. Track activities of the Project, analyze and prepare reporting for the Senior Leadership Team.
Attend meetings, prepare correspondence, reports, presentations and such other contract documents as may be required.
There is a potential requirement for consultation with the client and its Owner’s Engineer, and the various Stakeholders on the project. The Sr. PM will support this interaction and facilitate discussion as needed.
Take part in and draft the minutes of meetings;
Other project management services as may be identified over time.
Profile
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent.
Minimum of 15 years of experience in a project management leadership position with extensive demonstrated success of delivering large-scale infrastructure projects.
Excellent organizational, analytical and problem-solving abilities, with exceptional initiative and attention to detail.
Sound professional judgement, initiative and ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple priorities to meet deadlines in a fast passed, deadline oriented and dynamic environment.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
Solid, proven organizational, project management and leadership skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to successfully and collaborative work within a team environment and across disciplines as well as work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills that support building internal/external relationships including communication and interfacing with VP and C-suite.
CIMA+ offers you

Salary increase based on performance

Possibility of investing in a company profit-sharing plan

Continuous training and development program
Reimbursement of professional association membership cotisation
Recognition programs

Why join CIMA+?

The key to our delivery of quality services is being able to attract and maintain satisfied and engaged people. At CIMA+, employees are given the flexibility required to ensure a balanced life and fulfilling work experience in a motivating work environment. Our staff enjoy the diversity of projects and the extensive autonomy given to interact directly with clients. Such proximity is possible because of our flat corporate structure, and it translates into relationships of trust, and effective communications between team members and clients.

At CIMA+ we are committed to creating opportunities for all our employees so that they may develop, progress, and contribute to the business regardless of differences. We fully respect the principles of employment equity and encourage women, visible minorities, indigenous people, and persons with disabilities to apply. Alternative options are available upon request to facilitate participation in the recruitment process.

Job Title: Construction Superintendent
Reports to: Director of Operations and Project Manager
Company: Doran Contractors Limited
Location: Various project sites, Ottawa, Ontario
Date Prepared: January 14, 2020

About Doran Contractors

Founded over 100 years ago, Doran is an industrial, commercial and institutional construction general contractor that can tackle any job from multi-tenant condominiums, senior’s residences, retail plazas, transit stations and tunnels, office buildings, bridges and pump stations. From tender closing to substantial completion, Doran takes pride in staying on time and budget, with aspirations of exceeding the owner’s expectations at every opportunity. A proud part of the Taggart Group of Companies, we value integrity, quality and community.

We are now inviting experienced Construction Superintendents to apply to join our team!

Work Description

The Construction Superintendent is responsible for the overall supervision of construction projects, crews and sub-contractors. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality approach to all employees, customers, subcontractor, general contractors, tenants, managers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Doran Contractors vision, mission, and must comply with all company policies and procedures. The Superintendent in coordination with the Director of Operations and the Project Manager is responsible for identifying issues, designing and carrying out policies and procedures that support the projects and initiatives of the company.

Major Responsibilities:
Construction Superintendent
Oversee and manage the construction site from the set-up phase, including setting up structures and processes for the site office, access, site fencing., through to hand-over at the completion of the project.
Assist the Project Manager in developing and maintaining construction production schedule and site management plan.
Review and understand project drawings and specifications, and address any discrepancies by reporting them to the Project Manager.
Provide schedule updates to the Project Manager on a regular basis;
Schedule meetings with and manage subcontractors.
Establish and maintain quality control measures on site.
Participate in setting up the site safety plan with the Corporate Safety officer (CSO);
Provide guidance to employees and contractors on how to work in a more safe and efficient manner.
Participate in all Safety reporting functions. Ensure the timely delivery of safety reports to Corporate Safety Officer in order to maintain all legislative requirements.
Plan and prepare three-week construction schedule look a heads, including milestones, and monitor progress against established schedules.
Ensure accurate and timely project close date; adjust working schedules to ensure deadlines are met.
Identify and resolve conflicts within project teams and associated work; create contingency plans to mitigate risk.
Ensure inspections are completed periodically throughout the construction phases to ensure buildings meet specifications of clients.
Coordinates all activity between trades and suppliers.
Verify all onsite safety training for all new hires, including employees, trades and contractors. Ensuring all documentation is prepared and submitted as required in conjunction with Project Coordinators and CSO.
Conduct daily toolbox talks and ensure all sub-contracts submit daily hazard assessments.
Oversee performance of all trade contractors to ensure architectural and engineering drawings are being delivered with accuracy and to regulatory standards.
Recommending employee actions such as hiring, training, promotions, disciplinary and corrective measures to the Director of Operations and/or Project Manager.
Enforce all Doran Contractor policies and procedures.
All other duties as required.
Statement of Qualifications:
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Post-secondary Certificate in Civil Engineering Technologist, Engineering Degree or other formal Technical training that is relevant to the field.
A minimum of five years of work experience as a Construction Superintendent in the ICI sector, with demonstrated increased responsibility/supervisory work.
Prior experience with construction projects in ICI, such as condominiums, multi-story retirement homes, multi-unit apartment buildings, retail developments, large commercial turn-key buildings, commercial fit-ups or other similar projects is required.
Ability to professionally interact with design professionals, consultants and clients throughout the project.
Ability to read blueprints, schematics, field drawings and plans.
Strong communication, integration, problem-solving and interpersonal skills.
Ability to cope with high intensity and stressful environments.
Strong attention to detail.
Demonstrated success in project delivery and execution of project management methods.
Understanding fundamentals of contracts and experience in managing contractors under the terms of a contract.
A valid driver’s license is required as this requires travel to and from sites to the office.
Physical/Sensory Effort/ Work Environment
Loud and busy work environment

Company

The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Main Purpose & Function

The award-winning False Creek Neighbourhood Energy Utility (“NEU”) has a vacancy for a Project Engineer to assist with the expansion and operation of the City’s low carbon district energy system.

The NEU is an innovative low-carbon district heating system that provides space heat and domestic hot water to buildings in the False Creek neighbourhood. This system, which is owned and operated by the City of Vancouver, sources most of its energy from waste heat recovered from untreated sewage. It is the first of its kind in North America and has been the recipient of a number of awards. The NEU currently serves 5.7 million square feet of customer building floor area, and is forecast to grow to 22 million square feet by 2035. This system growth will require the addition of new sewage heat recovery capacity, boilers, hot water distribution pipes and energy transfer stations.

In addition, the NEU is working to transition to 100% renewable energy by 2030. This goal forms part of “Big Move 4” in the City’s Climate Emergency Response.

Reporting to a Senior Engineer, the Project Engineer provides the following key functions:
New Neighbourhood Energy Infrastructure Development:perform energy demand analysis, conceptual design, cost estimating, site services, design reviews, development and construction coordination, project management, and other related activities.
Neighbourhood Energy Operations: analyze system performance to improve efficiency and reliability, respond to customer issues, and other issues.
Specific Duties & Responsibilities

New Neighbourhood Energy Infrastructure Development
Supports the neighbourhood energy expansion planning including developing energy demand analysis, GHG forecasting, evaluating options for increasing low carbon energy generation capacity, performing extension tests and conceptual design of new systems, and updating and running scenarios in the NEU financial rate model.
Provides project management function with respect to capital expansions, including expansions of the energy generation capacity, pipe network and service connections.
Assists in the oversight of contractors and consultants and the management of contracts.
Reviews designs developed by consultants to ensure conformity to City standards and specifications; during construction, ensures new infrastructure conforms to designs/specifications and recommends design changes required to respond to field conditions.
Reviews building mechanical design by developer to ensure conformance to neighbourhood energy connection standards.
Estimates costs and schedule requirements of planned infrastructure, and analyzes costs of newly built infrastructure.
Analyzes energy demand and GHG emissions data from existing customers to inform infrastructure and business planning.
Coordinates infrastructure development with other Engineering Services infrastructure branches.
Neighbourhood Energy Operations
Collects system data and analyzes system performance, with a focus on improving efficiency and reliability.
Responds to technical issues that arise in day to day operations
Researches and suggests changes to equipment, control systems, operating protocols to ensure reliable, safe and efficient services.
Responds to customer/stakeholder inquiries regarding the system.
Engages in customer outreach to stratas, businesses, property managers, etc. to keep them informed regarding NEU services and value.
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned
Qualifications

Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, preferably with a focus on Mechanical, Civil, Environmental, Chemical or Process Engineering
Master’s degree in clean energy or sustainable energy considered an asset.
Registration or eligibility for registration as a P.Eng. or as an EIT with EGBC required
A minimum of 4 years of recent related experience
Experience in designing energy systems required; experience in hydronic heating/cooling systems and in green buildings would be an asset
Experience in utilization of SCADA systems and other analytical tools to evaluate and optimize system performance and efficiency
Experience in developing and managing budgets for infrastructure capital works.
Experience in procuring and managing technical consultants to deliver projects and studies
Experience in project and construction management; accredited project management training (e.g. PMP certification, tertiary qualification) would be an asset
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Engineering knowledge related to industry best practices for energy systems
Practical knowledge of infrastructure planning and asset management principles
Knowledge of standard office software applications
Strong analytical skills and a demonstrated ability to anticipate and manage multiple interacting and technically complex issues
Strong organizational and time management skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment with little supervision
Ability to build and maintain excellent working relationships with the public, outside agencies and other employees
Proactive/professional in addressing questions and concerns from stakeholders in a timely and effective manner
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a variety of interested parties
Business Unit/Department: Engineering Services (1300)

About QuadReal

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company. QuadReal: Excellence lives here.

www.quadreal.com

We focus on supporting and growing our relationships while being respectful, open, and transparent. We value key stakeholders (community, city staff, political, consultants/contractors/service providers) as our trusted partners.

Role Description

Based in Toronto, ON, the Manager, Development Construction will report to the Vice President, Development and will work extensively with all members of QuadReals eastern Canadian development team, with projects in Ontario and Quebec. Duties for this role include: supporting for the overall development project management and assistance with project conception to execution and closeout, coordinate with the necessary permitting authorities for the receipt of regulatory permits for these projects, preparing presentation materials (written and graphic) to support senior management, and coordinating with various third-party consultants. QuadReals projects encompass all asset types including multi-family residential (rental and condominium), industrial, retail, mixed-use, and office.

More specific duties will include:
Support the construction engineering, planning, and design for new or expansion projects;
Prepare reports, review specifications, conduct technical analysis to fully define the design requirements, equipment and services required on new, expansion and remodeling projects;
Responsible for soliciting the services of architects, engineers, and consultants, and then for developing, executing and managing those contracts;
Negotiate contracts with General Contractors and trade contractors and present formal documentation for approval when required;
Ensure that contracts are fit for purpose, cost effective and incorporate appropriate Service Level Agreements;
Have a thorough understanding of, overall site management, coordination, planning, specification of business proposals and coordination of subcontractors; for large scale construction projects.
Coordinate directly with Asset Management to conceive and execute the development strategies for our properties;
Work with construction and accounting to prepare and track budgets and schedules for each project and will manage each project within the approved project budget and schedule;
Complete ongoing analysis on key components of the development, including sensitivity analyses, and identifying key issues impacting profitability;
Track comparable and competing development activity across property types;
Coordination with project consultants including planning, architectural, legal, etc.; and,
Prepare regular progress reports on existing development projects.
Experience
A minimum of 5 years' experience within development and construction
Understanding and experience with permitting process in Toronto and the surrounding areas
Experience completing high end commercial and residential construction projects.
A bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering or Construction Management.
Demonstrable experience with essential development contracts such as contracts for architectural services, engineering services, and general contracting services.
Demonstrable experience with permitting agencies, either as an architect or owners' project manager.
Fluent reading architectural and engineering plans for residential real estate
Computer Skills Highly functional capabilities in utilizing Excel, Argus Enterprise, PowerPoint, and Word.
Communication and Collaboration Skills Superior English writing and oral communication skills; ability to develop and sustain collaborative and effective working relationships with all personalities; ability to exercise discretion and strict confidentiality.
Organizational Skills and Work Habits Ability to take initiative and own your responsibilities to produce high quality work product with minimal supervision; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fluid and dynamic work environment dedicated to excellence; ability to prioritize multiple demands, allocate time effectively, work under pressure, and meet tight deadlines; flexible and adaptive to new ideas and constant changes; ability to focus on the detail to produce accurate and reliable work product while also grasping the bigger picture; possess intellectual curiosity and a strong desire to learn and develop.
Embrace and pro-actively support QuadReals company values and culture of environmental sustainability, and corporate and social responsibility.

INTRO

Projects is responsible for the delivery of IR&P/PNL capital, operating, decommissioning, and commercial projects. These projects address site infrastructure (Landlord), licensed nuclear facilities, and environmental remediation activities – as well as products and services for CNL customers. The project scopes entail new‑build construction, upgrades, fabrications, demolitions, and system improvements.

Construction Superintendents are accountable for construction and installation activities on all IR&P/PNL led projects, as well as various Site & Nuclear Operations (Landlord) initiatives. The CNL Construction Superintendent conducts oversight on vendors and CNL staff, who perform construction or other fieldwork activities, to ensure safety and contractual requirements are met.

DUTIES
Overseeing Construction projects, providing project oversight to the Site Superintendent or General Contractor, who supervises the trades directly.
Ensuring that permits are available and in order for the trades, contractors or CNL staff to complete their work. For delivering and/or ensuring that pre-job briefings are conducted with the work crew with respect to safety compliance and that all historical documentation is appropriate and available, and that hazard assessments, are completed. The position ensures that all necessary documentation, has been obtained for each project.
Liaising with the CNL Client on project status and for addressing any changes requested by clients that may impact the work plan and the anticipated delivery of the project.
Operated as the CRL Sponsor for vendors performing construction activities on the CRL site and satellite locations and facilities.
Oversees construction activities in accordance with the Management Control Procedure, 900-505240-MCP-001, and its lower-tiered documents.
Ensures that construction activities are completed according to approved and validated design output documents and supplier’s shop drawings, and that these activities are carried out to meet all applicable technical, regulatory, and code requirements, as specified.
Provide constructive input in the development and delivery of the project and throughout the stages of initiation, planning, execution, control and closeout.
Ensure that the CNL standards for material selections, operating and maintenance functions are followed.
Enforce workplace safety at all times. Use event-free tools.
Ensure environmental aspects are considered on job sites.
Act as contractor Sponsor on behalf of client (see 900-510400-STD-005).
Assist in preparation of contract documents and contractor selection. Ensure that all data pertaining to hazard issues such as asbestos and the rules on hiring contractors to perform such work at CNL is included.
Assist the construction team in the development of work plans instructing internal resource support assigned to the contract (temporary services, connections, inspections).
Arrange for contractor employees to attend CNL Construction Safety Orientation training courses, and obtain all security clearances.
Verify Contractor qualifications.
Verify Equipment certifications.
Maintain a daily job history log throughout the project, as required.
Prepare or obtain general work permits, IH (Industrial Health) permits, fire safety clearances, DDCC (Digging, Drilling, and Coring Clearance) clearances, material and equipment passes and all other permits required to execute the project.
Ensure construction boundaries are controlled.
Anticipate demand for internal trade resources (e.g., service connections) and work with appropriate Planner for resource allocation.
Coordinate/Supervise work to be done by internal resources and/or arrange for procurement of required materials.
Monitor work progress and report to Project Management team as required.
Assess work scope completion upon receipt of contractor invoices and accept invoice as CNL Superintendent.
Manage/monitor changes or modifications to the work scope using the RFI process.
Initiate and control changes or modification the work scope using the ECC/ FCN process.
Ensure relevant regulatory authorities and other agencies requirements are met (CNSC, TSSA, ESA, Canadian Welding Bureau, etc).
Prepare ImpAct submissions, and participate in event investigations or root cause determinations, as required.
Ensure all equipment being removed is controlled as per the relevant procedures.
Inspect workmanship to ensure contractual or project requirements are met.
Identify the resources required to mitigate hazards and coordinate these resources.
Coordinate all issues pertaining to the disposal of wastes generated by the project.
Organize and conduct construction meetings along with minutes, as required.
Ensure all required inspections have been performed and recorded and copies submitted to the project team.
Maintain a flexible work schedule that may include work outside of normal hours.
Must exercise Due Diligence from a legal aspect.
Promote safety and good housekeeping practices and instruct employees in same.
Provide advice and mentoring to peers and other staff.
QUALIFICATIONS
Graduate from an Institute of Technology with a minimum of six years’ experience in the field of construction, including five years as a supervisor. OR Successful completion of a recognized apprenticeship in one or more relevant industrial trades and a minimum of ten years pertinent experience as a journeyman plus five years’ experience as a supervisor.
Have the ability to read and understand specifications and drawings and interpret complex construction drawings.
Have demonstrated supervisory and interpersonal skills and be able to work effectively with others.
Have the ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Have a working knowledge of all current applicable company regulations, safety regulations procedures and collective agreements.
Have a willingness to undergo additional training appropriate to the position, (e.g.) computers, quality assurance, and applicable codes, supervisory and team building skills.
Have a good base knowledge of the National Building Code, Canada Labour Code, Canadian Electrical Code, and Ontario OH&S Act & Regulations for Construction Projects, and other codes pertaining to life safety such as Ontario Regulations dealing with hazardous products such as asbestos containing materials.
Be able to demonstrate the ability to read and interpret construction documents, technical specifications, contract condition documents and working drawings.
Have a good knowledge of construction management software systems such as MS Project, or other applicable programs.
Have experience in the building, mechanical or electrical trades.

Job Title: Field Operations Manager (General Superintendent) - Civil (Water, Wastewater Construction)
Job Description:
Job Description:
Field Operations Manager (General Superintendent) - Civil Division

As part of Field Operations, the Field Operations Manager oversees the Site Supervisory staff, Field Engineering and Field teams on all Civil / Environmental projects.

Work closely with project teams on multiple project sites to allow the successful and safe completion of projects in the most economical and expedient manner. This position will focus on project planning, scheduling, risk management, quality and cost control.

In this role, the Field Operations Manager will coach, mentor, train, and develop team members in this field. The individual will also communicate effectively with clients, subcontractors, architects and engineers to ensure timely and cost-effective completion of projects.

At Maple Reinders, we look for leaders, planners and employees who can:

Oversee complete field operations, current site conditions, and implementing change as required
Identify current and future resources, and participate in the recruitment process of acquiring new talent
Assist in the pre-planning and development of the Project Work plan of all projects and ensure all other project requirements i.e. Construction Execution plan, Quality plan, Environmental plan and Safety are developed
Assist estimating department in relation to other potential projects
Implement a document control system for Field Documentation
Provide senior level presence in the field, coach field staff on issue resolution, review site labour requirements, mentor field staff and perform succession planning

Our Field Operations Manager (General Superintendent) will oversee multiple projects that vary in size and scope and the successful candidate should have previous experience in leading a team of construction Superintendents, trades and hourly employees. We are also focused on candidates who currently have:

Minimum 15 years of construction experience – Civil and/or Building ICI projects
University Degree in Engineering, or Engineering Technology Diploma, Trade License or a combination of education and construction experience
Proficiency with MS Office and Windows based computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook and Project)
Valid driver's license
Travel throughout Ontario is required

The Field Operations Manager (General Superintendent) is a key member of Maple Reinders’ project team and is critical to the success of each project under their direction. Overview


Who are we?

We Are PRA Health Sciences. We provide innovative drug development solutions across all phases and therapeutic areas. But innovation just for the sake of innovation isn’t why we do it. Side by side with our clients, we strive to move drug discovery forward, to help them develop life-saving and life-improving drugs. We help change people’s lives for the better every day. It’s who we are. Innovating to help people is at the heart of our process, but it’s even more than that. It’s our privilege.

We are 16,000+ employees strong, operating in more than 80 countries. We are committed to saving lives, and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do.

Responsibilities


What will you be doing?

In Pharmacovigilance & Patient Safety, the Safety Project Manager (SPM) is responsible for owning and achieving successful interim and final contractual deliverables on assigned global, PVS Stand Alone projects/programs, according to the time, quality, scope and cost constraints. The SPM leads and directs cross-functional teams, understands and manages client expectations/needs to achieve client satisfaction. The SPM proactively identifies, escalates, resolves/mitigates, risks and/or issues. The SPM adheres to PRA standard procedures and processes. The SPM serves as a PVS representative during the business development process.

Acts as primary liaison with client:

Contributes to development, maintenance and approval of project plans. Guides and supports team leads in prioritizing, trouble-shooting and contingency planning.
Delegates whilst retaining ownership.
Communicates project specific priorities.

Manages project contractual deliverables:
Supervises progress via metrics.
Monitors and ensures adherence to the contractual agreement (time, quality/scope, and cost deliverables).
Leads presentation of internal project status reviews and is accountable for action item follow up.
Proactively identifies, resolves/mitigates and escalates risks and/or issues.

Manages project costs:
Owns projections of units/hours (revenue and resources), actual units/hours efficiency analysis.
Proactively and timely identifies, for assigned projects, ensuring out of scope activities are approved upfront via a contract modification.
Identifies potential or actual unrecoverable hours and provides analysis and mitigation/resolution plan for senior management’s approval.
Ensures control of financial risk to PRA.
In cooperation with the project analyst, applies efficient management of project pass-through costs and investigators payments to ensure all such costs are recovered in a timely manner, and in advance where ever possible.
Leads presentation of financial reviews and is accountable for action item follow up.
Ensures adherence to company SOP, policies and guidelines at the project level.
Assumes project leadership role in compliance at project level to PRA processes and systems including escalation to relevant functional and operational management.
Participation and attendance in bid defense process.
Provides feedback on project team member’s performance to respective line-managers.

Who We Are

Trans Mountain Corporation operates Canada’s only pipeline system transporting crude oil and refined products to the West Coast. We deliver nearly 300,000 barrels of crude oil and refined products each day through 1,274 kilometers of pipeline in Alberta, British Columbia and Washington State.

The Trans Mountain Expansion Project will provide increased capacity to support Canadian crude oil production growth and ensure access to global energy markets. The largest project in our history, it involves the installation of approximately 980 km of new pipeline, new and modified facilities including pump stations and terminals, and a new dock complex at the Westridge Marine Terminal in British Columbia.

As a federal Crown corporation, the newly formed Trans Mountain Corporation will continue to build upon our 65 years of experience delivering operational and safety excellence through our crude oil pipeline system.

We are accountable to Parliament through the Canada Development Investment Corporation (CDEV). As a wholly owned subsidiary of CDEV, we are governed by an independent Board of Directors.

Quick Facts about Trans Mountain Corporation

We operate Canada’s only pipeline system transporting crude oil and refined products to the West Coast
We have delivered safe and reliable energy transportation for 65 years
We deliver 300,000 barrels of crude oil and refined products every day on our pipeline system
Our Trans Mountain Expansion Project will provide western Canadian crude oil producers with an additional 590,000 bpd of crude oil transportation capacity and tidewater access
Our corporate headquarters is in Calgary, Alberta with regional offices along the pipeline system in Alberta and British Columbia

Reporting to the TMEP Project Manager, the Field Construction Manager, will be responsible for the day to day oversight and management of the TMEP field support resources throughout the construction execution. The Field Construction Manager ensures the successful execution, quality control, regulatory compliance, landowner relationships and closure of the construction scopes in accordance with the Project Charter and Project Execution Plan. The Field Construction Manager interfaces with the General Construction Contractor (GCC) on a day to day basis to ensure Inspection, Safety and Environmental resources align with the daily planned field activities of the GCC. The Field Construction Manager is responsible for Daily and Weekly reporting of construction progress to the Project Manager and for assisting the Project Manager in maintaining schedule and cost objectives through interfacing with the GCC regularly.

The role includes management of Consultants and direct hire Contractor resources in support of pipeline construction including, logistical planning for camps, pipe yards, and construction lay downs, right-of-way access roads, and traffic management.

The Field Construction Manager shall support all of the Owners objectives inclusive of Safety, Environmental compliance, and Regulatory compliance through proactive planning and maintaining positive relationships with all internal and external stakeholders.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Review all drawings and technical specifications for scope compliance and construct ability.
Coordinate and liaison through the Regulatory/Lands Manager, to ensure that copies of all governmental, regulatory and/or permits required are in place with compliance of contractors on site.
Is responsible for providing construction input into cost estimates.
Is responsible, through the Engineering and Project Manager, for assuring that the construction work complies with governing codes, technical specifications, and design drawings.
Respond to technical questions relating to the drawings and specifications when and if they arise, obtaining assistance from the Engineering Consultants as required.
Communicate and approve, through the Engineering and Project Manager, any design changes and/or contract extra scope.
Co-ordination of field resources based on contractor schedules and work sequence to ensure compliance with the project schedule objectives and start-up plans.
Strategic and tactical direction for pipeline construction execution.
Management of Consultant and field resources in support of construction work planning, organization and site issues including survey, access plan, traffic management.
Strong communication and ability to work collaboratively with others.
Ability to analyze and troubleshoot complex technical problems and make sound technical decisions.

Position Requirements:
A minimum of 20 years of experience in planning and execution of complex large bore pipeline construction projects, a P. Eng or other Professional designation would be an asset.
Extensive knowledge of pipeline construction from a Municipal standpoint (i.e. narrow streets, residential crossings).
Experience successfully planning and executing major projects.
Understanding of semi-automatic welding procedures and machines.
Experience leading a multi-disciplinary team of construction professionals.
Experience leading interaction with regulatory agencies (CER/NEB).
Experience creating and managing budgets including justification, prioritization and rationing, forecasting, and reporting.
Ground disturbance level 2 and a good understand of Damage Prevention rules and guidelines.
Understanding and knowledge of HDD, Direct pipe and auger bore crossings for rivers, creeks, streets environmentally sensitive areas.
Have a good understanding of environmental concerns for a project that is under scrutiny from protests.
Working knowledge of CSA 662 last edition.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner.

Location/Working Conditions

Based in Burnaby, BC
Primarily a Field Based Position
10% - 20 % Head Office

Job Title: Site Superintendent
Reports to: Construction Manager
Company: Tamarack Homes
Location: Ottawa, Ontario
Date Prepared: February 2020

Tamarack Developments

Tamarack Developments has been building new homes in Eastern Ontario since 1948. Tamarack offers a full range of housing, from custom-built luxury homes and adult lifestyle communities to high rise condominium developments in Ottawa and Kingston. A proud part of the Taggart Group of Companies, we value integrity, quality and community.

Work Description

The Site Superintendent manages and oversees all aspects of their assigned residential construction projects. This includes but is not limited to overseeing field operations, site safety, assigning tasks to the carpentry and labouring team, monitoring productivity, scheduling of trades and ensuring the quality of the workmanship with regards to servicing the new homes. The Site Superintendent provides technical support to the construction team and trades on site and ensures that we are able to deliver a quality home in a timely manner to the Tamarack clients.

Major Responsibilities:
Site Superintendent
Direct, manage and oversee all services required for the construction of a new home, from excavation to completion.
Direct the day-to-day on-site activities, such as staffing requirements, trades services, material deliveries, homeowner visits and coordination that is required with the service team for PDI’s and pre-move inspections.
Manage and direct team ranging from 6 to 20 employees on one site.
Develop and maintain construction and site management plan. Organize and lead site meetings when needed.
Ensure that the major project milestones are met. If delays are anticipated, communicate and coordinate with the key stakeholders to avoid down time as much as possible.
Manage on-time delivery for each individual home that is being constructed in the sub-division.
Ensuring that the construction is completed in accordance with Tamarack specifications and quality standards.
Coordinate all activities between site, trades, and suppliers. Troubleshoot issues that may arise during construction of the new homes. Escalate issues to the Construction Manager when delivery of the home will be delayed, or when the quality of the home will be compromised. Resolve field construction issues.
Support the Customer Service team as needed. Respond to inquiries from the Service Manager, the inspectors or any of the service team to ensure the timely response back to the homeowner.
Ensure site safety compliance by conducting daily safety checks and by providing training to the construction team or any new trade visiting site.
Manage relationships with the municipality, coordinate with inspectors to finalize grading for each individual unit.
Schedule city inspections and obtain occupancy permits when construction of home is complete.
Maintain quality control program and standards of quality that in accordance with the Tamarack Guarantees.
Ensure installation accuracy for all unit finishes and upgrades, coordinate with construction team to repair any finishes that do not meet the specifications.
Manage accuracy of trade progress and completion claims. Certify work has been complete for all invoices received.
Monitor and maintain clean construction sites, regardless of which stage of construction that a home is in.
Maintain daily logs, keeping a record of all activities and progress made for the entire construction site
Complete other related tasks to ensure that the homeowner is satisfied with the construction of their new home.
All other duties as required.
Statement of Qualifications:
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
A high school diploma is required, college diploma would be considered an asset (Construction Engineering Technology, Architectural Studies, etc.).
Minimum of 10 years in residential construction site experience is required for this role.
Experience working onsite in a leadership/supervisory capacity for a minimum of 5 years is required.
Solid understanding of residential construction methods and blueprint reading are necessary, including knowledge of the Ontario Building Code.
Sound knowledge of construction execution and best practices.
Ability to handle difficult situations with tact and professionalism.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, and ability to maintain interpersonal relationships at all levels.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Ability to use various technology tools such as Microsoft Office, specifically Outlook.
Valid driver’s license.
Bilingualism (French/English) is considered an asset.
Physical/Sensory Effort/Work Environment
Residential construction site.
Must be of good physical condition to perform various duties on site.
Ability to work outdoors in all seasons in all weather conditions.
Overtime as required.
