Position: Formwork Construction Manager

Company Name: Glenform Building Limited (“Glenform”)

Address: 200-375 Water Street, Vancouver BC V6B 0M9

Work Locations / Travel: Various (Construction Sites) Locations Across the Greater Vancouver Area

Annual Salary: CAD $85,000.00

Bonus: Discretionary bonus based on performance

Overtime: None

Hours Per Week: Forty

Benefits: Standard Benefits Package

Vacation: Twenty-four (24) days paid vacation and 10 company holidays per year

Vacancies: Three (3) Vacancies

About Glenform

Glenform is a leading specialist in the provision of reinforced concrete form solutions. Its client portfolio includes all business sectors; spanning both the public and private sector, with projects all around the world, including Canada. Glenform provides its own specialized formwork equipment and has a highly skilled team that carries out in-house design for all client projects. Through the use of the company’s proprietary bespoke formwork equipment, the company provides an integrated formwork solution to include the engineering and project management of formwork placing, steel fixing/rebar, concrete finishing, concrete reinforcing, power floating and waterproofing.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Formwork Construction Manager is responsible for overseeing the company’s bespoke system of Form Work. The prime responsibility is to use his/her knowledge of Glenform’s formwork system to ensure that workers are carrying on work as per the designs issued by head office.

The Form Work Manager’s duties and responsibilities on a daily basis involve:
Planning, organizing, directing controlling and evaluating construction projects from start to finish, according to schedule, specifications and budget – and participating in conversations and decisions involving company policies and programs.
Collaborate within the construction team, client representatives, subcontractors, consultants, architects and suppliers.
Manage the cost, scheduling, technical issues and overall productivity of the formwork construction team - ensuring the project completion is on time and within affordability and profitability parameters.
Responsible for allocating duties to the form-workers according to their capabilities. * Motivate the workers to do the work with higher efficiency and ensuring that the work is completed on time.
Develop and implement quality control programs, and coordinate the work of form-workers construction workers and subcontractors.
Ensure that safety precautions are being taken by all subordinate staff at all times. * Represent Glenform on contracts negotiation.
Participate in the purchase of building materials.
Requirements
Three years of experience in:
Formwork construction management. * Extensive experience / Demonstrated abilities in:
Formwork Construction.
Collaborating with other formwork and construction industry professionals to complete projects.
Managing costs, schedules, form-workers and budgets.
Motivating form-workers and allocating resources.
Following, implementing and managing safety and quality control measures.
Participating in contracts negotiation and the purchase of building materials.
Ability to lead.
Ability to solve problems and make incremental improvements.
Ability to meet and deal, at a senior level with customers and owners to promote Glenform’s multiple products, abilities and image.
Willingness to travel to different construction sites in the Greater Vancouver Area.
Contact Information

For more information on this position, please feel free to contact James Bradley directly via mobile at 587-777-1308 or Therese @ Glenform.com

You can also mail resumes to Therese at the following address: 200-375 Water Street, Vancouver BC V6B 0M9.

Salary: $85,000.00 /year

Experience:
Construction Project Management: 1 year (Preferred)
Construction: 1 year (Preferred)
Construction Management: 3 years (Required)

Led by a group of agency and industry professionals, Stagwell Marketing Group was born and bred in a digital first era. Stagwell today is the largest independent data driven digital marketing services firm in the U.S., serving global brands across the continuum of marketing services. We are not weighed down by legacy assets and are united in their desire to innovate, evolve, grow and deliver superior results for their clients.
Stagwell Tech is searching for an experienced and enthusiastic General Manager to lead the teams across North America. As General Manager, you will work closely with the Chief Operating Officer to support the business in achieving commercial and customer targets in order to continue the growth of this fast paced, dynamic technology Group.
We need an experienced, passionate and enthusiastic General Manager with a strong technical background. You will be comfortable with frequent travel throughout North America, in addition to travels in Europe. You will be innovative and challenge the status quo, thinking without borders and embedding this culture within your team. As General Manager for North America, you will be a brand ambassador, confident in influencing strategic and technical direction whilst delivering significant growth and profitability.
The General Manager will bring with them:
A proven track record in financial controls and management, customer experience design and execution
Strong abilities in team construction and leadership development
Will be equipped with exceptional partnership, communication and presentation skills
Able, and enjoy, operating at strategic, tactical and operational levels
Very well rounded senior leadership with experience in customer operations, Information Technologies (enterprise wide workforce management, ordering and billing system introductions among others)
Technical Project Management and/or Sr. Technologist experience highly preferred
Cross enterprise business process engineering
Compelling abilities at customer onboarding in smooth and cost effective manners
Responsibilities:
Calculate, negotiate and manage specific departmental budgets in conjunction with the finance team
Grow external engagement to increase the awareness of the brand and generate best practice initiatives which will support growth and retention
Review and influence the business learning and development strategy ensuring staff are continually developed and quality standards are delivered
Track, report and manage commissions and incentive schemes in line with budget
Conduct operational due diligence on acquisitions/mergers
Ensure an effective 24/7 operational model is in place with appropriate escalation
Identify and implement initiatives to increase gross margin, reduce operational cost and contribute towards net margin
Own and manage new client and supplier implementation programs, liaising with key stakeholders
Managing an operations team at a senior and strategic level
Client and stakeholder management at a senior level
Requirements:
7-10 years in general management or equivalent position
2-3 years IT delivery (project manager/senior technologist)
Excellent client management/negotiation skills an absolute must
Strong attention to detail
1-2 years experience working with/managing a P&L
Revenue forecasting, managing budgets and delivering into operational costs
Implementing of large and complex clients and driving efficiencies to deliver profit margins
Performance Management
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience of a fast paced, environment, working to tight deadlines
Industry specific experience, ideally in delivering interpreting services to a wide range of public and private sector clients

Manage projects during the execution of the work.
Establish and follow construction schedules.
Site visits.

Coordinate the purchase of materials with the buyer.
Establish the work schedule and respect deadlines.

Supervise the progression and quality of the work on site.

Inspiring your team, daily, with your obsession for brand and the experience of our customer in their journey through brand, you embody AllSaints
By leading and guiding our Stylist teams and calling on your own skills in building client relationships, you are at the forefront of our in-store brand experience
Curating our collections, supporting the development of the brand experience by dressing our floors, owning the instore visual merchandising experience are all crucial aspects of your role.
Your development is important to us and the development of your team is important to you. By seeking and sharing knowledge you will be the first step in your team's development
Taking your prior experiences, developing successful leaders, and challenging those around you, you’ll know how to get the best from people.
Sharing and receiving knowledge from every corner of the global business via the cloud - you will truly be a Global Leader developing a team of Global Leaders
Your skills will be called on in every aspect of running the store. Visual merchandising, back of house, front of house, this is the first step in becoming a multi-faceted leader
By using the best reporting technologies in the industry you will challenge yourself and your team to drive your business forward

Brand experience - Client first, product knowledge (yours and the team’s), digital thinking, CRM and embodying the status "Brand Ambassador".
Relationship management - customer, team, brand, community and host
Training - Weekly sessions, team development plans, store succession plans and the onboarding of new colleagues
People and Culture - Recruitment, development, performance management and succession planning
Visual merchandising - Planning and executing floor moves (potentially overnight), maintaining and developing floor sets

Business ownership - KPI review, (Conversion, ATV, UPT), market specific analysis and action

THE ALLSAINTS STORY
Founded in 1994, AllSaints has built an international team that includes some of the best global creative talent, imbued with a winning combination of business and design thinking.
The brand’s constant obsession is to deliver an immersive experience to our international customer base in a way that embraces each unique culture. AllSaints is proud of the fact that every aspect of the brand is curated in-house, from store design and construction to the coding team, making AllSaints a truly agile business working with pace and integrity.
ALLSAINTS PEOPLE
We recruit the best digital creative innovators and design thinkers across the globe to spread the AllSaints message of integrity and sophistication. Our People are the ambassadors for our brand.
We look for individuality, confidence and brand passion when we recruit. We seek talent with creative mindsets who are collaborative in their approach. Our brand ambassadors act with humility and treat those around them with respect. Obsessed with brand experience, we constantly strive to develop the brand and customer journey. By 2020, our aim is to lead the industry with best in class talent.
EXPERIENCE
We are looking for talent with experience in a customer facing role. A background of operating with pace will set you up for success with us.
BENEFITS OF JOINING THE TEAM
Career development. Your career matters to us and we will do what it takes to help you on your journey in life. You’ll have to challenge yourself and your leadership. The opportunities will be there. You will need to know what to do to take them.
In addition to this we offer competitive pay and benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we very much look forward to hearing from you.

Company Overview

PCM Canada (formerly Acrodex), is a full spectrum, enterprise-wide technology solutions provider that has been in the IT business since 1984. Our mission is to deliver enterprise IT solutions that enable customers to achieve their business outcomes. Translating our technical strength into business value for our clients requires more than just expertise and strategic alliances; it requires a team that thrives on understanding and solving problems. With office locations across Canada, we provide our clients with flexible IT solutions that drive results.

PTW is seeking an experienced Project Manager with a solid track record of managing the creation, management and delivery of quality products from start to finish. This role works directly with our clients and internal team to ensure deliverables fall within applicable scopes and budgets. Ideal candidate would be passionate about games, have a strong quality mindset from a consumer perspective and is a collaborative leader. Is this you?

**During the Current Covid-19 global pandemic, this role will be a Work From Home position**

What you’ll be doing
Deliver projects successfully within budget, timeframe and quality scopes as per clients’ expectations
Collaborate with clients to establish schedules, define budget and ensure creation of test coverage and project metrics
Produce and present reports to stakeholders utilizing data that represent product quality KPI
Quality and project management through test scope/scheduling, evaluating ROI and cost vs benefit analysis
Manage, lead, motivate, coach and train Functional Game QA Leads
Plan, apply and adapt project test strategies with the support of Team Leads
Coordinate with other internal departments to ensure all aspects of each project are compatible and resources are adequate to fulfil clients’ needs
Define and implement critical knowledge transfer and overall communication process with internal and external teams
Act as the primary point of contact for internal inquiries from Leads and resolve conflicts/issues in collaboration with HR as they arise
Collaborate with internal and external partners and stakeholders across a range of technology disciplines and geographic locations
Process and workflow management, identifying, innovating and improving processes to maintain high quality standards
Requirements
What we’re looking for
2+ years relevant experience in a Project Management or similar role in the Video Games or related industry. Experience in outsource environment a plus
Experienced with financial management, budget tracking, QA cost estimates and constraints
Strong understanding of analytics and KPIs as a way of tracking product quality
Tech savvy with strong proficiency using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Jira
Solution driven, problem-solver with demonstrated critical thinking capabilities to understand, define, propose and implement tangible solutions
Exceptional interpersonal skills and strong verbal and written communication in the English language
Ability to communicate across technical and non-technical disciplines as well as all levels of management
Proven expertise in conflict resolution and ability to provide constructive and positive feedback
Take charge, motivated self-starter, and autonomous leader with excellent time management and organizational skills
Strong team motivator with the ability to lead others, develops talent, mentors and cultivates members to keep a high standard of accuracy and lead by example
Excel working in a fast-pace, high pressure environment with capabilities to adapt quickly to changing demands
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus
Functional verbal French
Benefits
What we offer
Competitive pay
Comprehensive group insurance coverage
Paid accrued vacation and paid sick days
Diverse and collaborative environment with growth opportunities
Unlimited coffee with office location near metro in the heart of the Mile End gaming hub
Fun, dynamic and collaborative environment
Who we are

PTW is a leading global provider of customer experience, quality assurance, localization, engineering and audio production services, to key software and technology-focused markets including games, interactive entertainment media, education, e-commerce and internet of things.

For over 20 years, we’ve delivered great results for our clients. Our main aim is to advance their businesses and enhance their customer’s’ satisfaction. We’re dedicated to helping every client develop the best products and consumer experiences possible. And because we believe in partnerships and collaboration, the journey is shared, and the successes are too.

http://www.ptw.com

GESTIONNAIRE DE PROJET

PTW est à la recherche d'un gestionnaire de projet expérimenté doté d'une solide expérience en matière de gestion de la création, de la gestion et de la livraison de produits de qualité, du début à la fin. Ce rôle travaille directement avec nos clients et notre équipe interne pour veiller à ce que les produits livrables respectent les portées et les budgets applicables. Le candidat idéal serait passionné par les jeux, aurait une mentalité de qualité forte du point de vue du consommateur et serait un leader collaboratif. Est-ce vous?

**Pendant la pandémie mondiale actuelle de Covid-19, ce rôle sera un poste de travail à domicile**

Ce que vous ferez
Réussir les projets dans les limites du budget, des délais et de la qualité, conformément aux attentes des clients
Collaborer avec les clients pour établir des calendriers, définir un budget et assurer la création d'une couverture de test et de métriques de projet
Produire et présenter des rapports aux parties prenantes en utilisant des données représentant les indicateurs de performance clés de la qualité des produits
Gestion de la qualité et des projets via la portée / la planification des tests, évaluation du retour sur investissement et analyse coûts / avantages
Gérer, diriger, motiver, encadrer et former les responsables de l’AQ du jeu fonctionnel
Planifier, appliquer et adapter les stratégies de test du projet avec l’aide des chefs d’équipe
Assurer la coordination avec les autres services internes pour s’assurer que tous les aspects de chaque projet sont compatibles et que les ressources sont suffisantes pour répondre aux besoins des clients
Définir et mettre en œuvre le transfert des connaissances critiques et le processus de communication global avec les équipes internes et externes
Agir en tant que point principal de contact pour les demandes internes des responsables et résoudre les conflits / problèmes en collaboration avec les ressources humaines à mesure qu'ils surviennent
Collaborer avec des partenaires et des intervenants internes et externes dans plusieurs disciplines technologiques et lieux géographiques.
Gestion des processus et des flux de travail, identification, innovation et amélioration des processus pour maintenir des normes de qualité élevées
Ce que nous recherchons
2+ ans d’expérience pertinente dans la gestion de projets ou un rôle similaire dans les jeux vidéo ou dans un secteur apparenté. Expérience dans un environnement externalisé un atout
Expérience de la gestion financière, du suivi budgétaire, des estimations de coûts d’AQ et des contraintes
Excellente compréhension de l’analyse et des indicateurs clé de performance comme moyen pour suivre la qualité des produits
Connaissances techniques avec une grande maîtrise de MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Jira
Axés sur les solutions, résolveur de problèmes avec capacités de pensée critique démontrées pour comprendre, définir, proposer et mettre en œuvre des solutions concrètes
Compétences interpersonnelles exceptionnelles et forte communication verbale et écrite en anglais
Aptitude à communiquer entre disciplines techniques et non techniques ainsi que tous les niveaux de gestion
Expertise avérée dans la résolution de conflits et capacité à fournir des commentaires constructifs et positifs
Leader motivé et autonome, doté d'excellentes compétences en matière de gestion du temps et d'organisation
Solide chef d’équipe, capable de diriger les autres, de développer les talents, de conseiller et de former les membres pour garder un niveau élevé de précision et de montrer l’exemple
Excel travaillant dans un environnement rapide et soumis à de fortes pressions, doté de fonctionnalités permettant de s'adapter rapidement à l'évolution de la demande
L’attestation Project Management Professional (PMP) est un atout
Bilingue - compétences de communication écrite et verbale en anglais et en français
Ce que nous offrons
Poste à temps plein et permanent offrant des possibilités de croissance
Salaire compétitif avec couverture d'assurance groupe complète
Vacances accumulées payées avec congés de maladie payés
Café à volonté avec emplacement de bureau près du métro au cœur du centre de jeux vidéo du Mile End
Environnement amusant, dynamique et collaboratif
Qui nous sommes

PTW est l'un des principaux fournisseurs mondiaux d'expérience client, d'assurance qualité, de localisation, d'ingénierie et de production audio, sur les principaux marchés axés sur les logiciels et la technologie, notamment les jeux, les médias de divertissement interactifs, l'éducation, le commerce électronique et l'Internet des objets.

Depuis plus de 20 ans, nous livrons d'excellents résultats à nos clients. Notre objectif principal est de faire progresser leur entreprise et d'améliorer la satisfaction de leurs clients. Nous nous engageons à aider chaque client à développer les meilleurs produits et expériences de consommation possibles. Et parce que nous croyons aux partenariats et à la collaboration, le voyage est partagé et les succès aussi.

http://www.ptw.com

At Stantec, we approach every water and natural resource project we undertakewhether at the local, regional, or watershed level thoughtfully, and execute it with excellence across all project phases. We partner with our clients to design fit-for-purpose solutions that address their communities unique needs throughout the water infrastructure lifecycle. Our experts lead their fields and guide our work with scientific rigor, an innovative spirit, and a vision for growth. Were a place where you can apply your passion and collaborate with top talent on work thats critical to our clients, our communities, and the industry at large.

Your Opportunity

The successful candidate will work on challenging and diverse tasks in a consulting and construction management role that will require application of technical skills, project delivery, and leadership for construction projects. These projects consist of water pipelines, sitework for municipal water and sewer facilities, sewer lines, infrastructure systems including treatment plants, pump stations, and related infrastructure.

Your Key Responsibilities
Responsible for a specific client or account and staff reporting to them.
May be responsible for leading the team in monitoring the progress of the projects construction activities ensuring cost, schedule and quality standards are met.
Works closely with Architects and Engineers in coordinating the planning and implementation of the project and obtaining necessary permits and licenses for timely opening of site.
Inspects and reviews projects during construction to monitor conformance with plans, specifications, and other codes and regulations.
Communicates with and makes recommendations to Project Manager, design professionals, client, owner, developer, or contractor, but does not direct the means or methods of construction.
Provides the Project Manager with updates on project progress or delays to client, design professionals, and/or contractor.
Reviews and evaluates plans and specifications to ensure designs are practical for construction.
Reviews change orders and field orders for reasonableness of pricing and constructability.
Reviews requests for information, submittals, construction schedules, shop drawings and pay applications (QA/QC).
Manages deadlines, prioritizes assignments, and prepares final documentation for closeout process.
Prepares documents and maintains file management of project-related information including, but not limited to, correspondence, reports, and pictures.
Trains and/or mentors less experienced staff in company procedures, standards and software.
Performs other duties of a similar nature and level as assigned.
Your Capabilities and Credentials
Technical expert in all relevant areas of construction, and understanding of various design and construction methods.
Requires advanced knowledge of local, state and federal building codes, construction principles, techniques and procedures, occupational hazards and safety precautions.
Ability to effectively discuss project issues with contractor, project team and clients, including ability to resolve conflict situations.
Excellent organizational skills and understanding of task assignment and schedule.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced knowledge of critical path method scheduling.
Education and Experience

Technical degree/diploma/certificate or equivalent in related field; or equivalent combination of education and construction experience. Minimum of 8-10 years of experience.

Position will work in both a field and office setting. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather. Must be available to travel for out of town projects when needed.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Job Title: Manager of Engineering Design and Construction
Job Description:
Reporting to the Director of Engineering, the Manager of Design and Construction is accountable for the management of the Design and Construction Section and has a broad mandate for the provision of engineering services to other departments of the Engineering Services Division and to other Divisions within the City. The Manager is charged with the responsibility of providing all the functions necessary to meet this mandate including in-house surveying and drafting as required, development of design criteria and construction standards, selection of consultants, project management from design through construction, and management of environmental services and the regulatory approvals.

The Design and Construction Section has a staff function rather than a line function. May be responsible for initiating capital programs while providing technical and environmental advice and engineering services to the other department managers at their request. In the course of providing the most efficient and effective service possible the Manager will make use of dedicated staff, consultants, contracts or other municipal departments as necessary without diminished responsibility for achievement of the Departmental mandate.
Education & Experience
A recognized post secondary degree in Civil Engineering or Transportation Engineering or equivalent. A minimum of 10 years experience in Municipal or Transportation Engineering with progressively more responsible project management and supervisory duties and at least 5 years work experience in the Municipal sector including supervisory experience. Registered Professional Engineer in the Province of British Columbia.Valid B.C. Drivers License.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Manages the Design and Construction Section with responsibility for the recruitment, selection, motivation, training, performance and discipline of staff and the maintenance of safe working practices.
Manages personnel requirements so as to balance the work load as much as possible.
Directs the provision of engineering and project management for the Engineering Services Division.
Develops and submits annual capital budgets for the Design and Construction Section and administers approved budgets to ensure cost control and effective utilization of resources.
Reviews drafting, survey, engineering, project management, and environmental services work programs for the best method of service delivery. Where appropriate, arranges for alternative methods of service delivery.
Monitors alternative providers and ensures that the service is effective and meets municipal standards.
Where service is to be provided by municipal staff, plans, organizes, directs and controls to ensure that the work is performed in a timely, efficient and cost effective manner.
As part of a management team reporting to the Director of Engineering, assists in the establishment of objectives, priorities, policies and procedures for the Engineering Division.
Develops and administers priorities, policies and procedures for the Design and Construction Section and ensures that the Section meets goals and objectives established by the Director of Engineering.
Establishes and maintains effective communication and coordination with other organizational units in the municipality and with outside agencies and the public where appropriate.
Promotes a service ethic within the Section and ensures that the Section’s response to public service requests is friendly, timely and effective.

Licences, Certificates & Registrations
Registered Professional Engineer in the Province of British Columbia.
Valid B.C. Drivers License.

Job Description:
Uponor is a leading international systems and solutions provider for safe drinking water delivery, energy-efficient radiant heating and cooling and reliable infrastructure. The company serves a variety of building markets including residential, commercial, industrial and civil engineering. Uponor employs about 4,100 employees in 30 countries, mainly in Europe and North America. In 2018, Uponor's net sales totalled nearly €1.2 billion. Uponor is based in Finland and listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. Uponor builds on you - www.uponor.com

Job Description Summary:
The top country management position responsible for planning, directing, coordinating and controlling Canadian Sales, Marketing and Customer Service, ensuring that through a market specific version of the global, UNA and Country strategy, in-market tactics are deployed to effectively and efficiently use the resources available to deliver top and bottom line targets through driving the Uponor customer experience, while developing a sustainable business model and team.

Oversees the sales team’s activities to ensure focus and deployment of resources are most impactful for the organization. Leads the team through the frequently changing marketplace by providing a clear unit vision that ties into the UNA and global visions.

Oversees the regional marketing ensuring that there is complete sales and marketing alignment, while driving UNA integration and collaboration in order for the market specific requirements to be delivered.

Works with the wider UNA management team and across levels to ensure that the Canadian specific market requirements are integrated into the planning and customer experience delivery.

This is the senior Uponor position in Canada and as such is required to be the face of the company across industry functions and activities, communicating the Uponor value proposition and developing relationships across all value chain members that will benefit the organization.

Job Description:
Develops the strategic business plan for Canada that achieves defined annual revenue and profit targets. Provides oversight to the implementation of the sales and marketing tactics derived from the strategy for each region that will focus on best opportunities for profitable growth.
Leads and coaches the team, to assist in delivering their commitment. Drives accountability and development through coaching and talent assessment.
Develops Canadian revenue and expense budget from Uponor UNA guidelines, monitors regional performance, suggests and takes corrective actions when required to deliver on the key metrics.
Ensure team alignment, collaboration and communication across the shared services environment of Uponor UNA in order to help and drive delivery of all metrics.
Champions Uponor Canada both in-market and internally across the broader UNA organization.

Qualifications

Required:
Requires a Bachelor’s degree coupled with ten (10) plus years manufacturing / construction industry experience, or equivalent.
Minimum of five (5) years successful sales management experience; preferably leading both manufacturer’s reps and direct sales organization.
Strong understanding of business profit and loss drivers; ability to manage a functional P&L.
Strong understanding of legal process and contract law pertaining to purchase / distribution agreements.
Excellent written, communication, and presentation skills.
Proven and demonstrated leadership ability; excellent coaching skills.
A self-starter with strong independent work skills, prioritizing activities, understanding opportunity costs.
Ability to thrive and work in a team environment.
Extensive national and international travel required (50% or more).

Preferred

Successful experience developing, leading, and executing commercial marketing initiatives.
Sound technical understanding of plumbing.
Prior experience working with plumbing contractors, mechanical contractors, builders/developers, wholesale distribution, industry associations, and regulatory bodies.

Job Title: Construction Superintendent
Reports to: Director of Operations and Project Manager
Company: Doran Contractors Limited
Location: Various project sites, Ottawa, Ontario
Date Prepared: January 14, 2020

About Doran Contractors

Founded over 100 years ago, Doran is an industrial, commercial and institutional construction general contractor that can tackle any job from multi-tenant condominiums, senior’s residences, retail plazas, transit stations and tunnels, office buildings, bridges and pump stations. From tender closing to substantial completion, Doran takes pride in staying on time and budget, with aspirations of exceeding the owner’s expectations at every opportunity. A proud part of the Taggart Group of Companies, we value integrity, quality and community.

We are now inviting experienced Construction Superintendents to apply to join our team!

Work Description

The Construction Superintendent is responsible for the overall supervision of construction projects, crews and sub-contractors. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality approach to all employees, customers, subcontractor, general contractors, tenants, managers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Doran Contractors vision, mission, and must comply with all company policies and procedures. The Superintendent in coordination with the Director of Operations and the Project Manager is responsible for identifying issues, designing and carrying out policies and procedures that support the projects and initiatives of the company.

Major Responsibilities:
Construction Superintendent
Oversee and manage the construction site from the set-up phase, including setting up structures and processes for the site office, access, site fencing., through to hand-over at the completion of the project.
Assist the Project Manager in developing and maintaining construction production schedule and site management plan.
Review and understand project drawings and specifications, and address any discrepancies by reporting them to the Project Manager.
Provide schedule updates to the Project Manager on a regular basis;
Schedule meetings with and manage subcontractors.
Establish and maintain quality control measures on site.
Participate in setting up the site safety plan with the Corporate Safety officer (CSO);
Provide guidance to employees and contractors on how to work in a more safe and efficient manner.
Participate in all Safety reporting functions. Ensure the timely delivery of safety reports to Corporate Safety Officer in order to maintain all legislative requirements.
Plan and prepare three-week construction schedule look a heads, including milestones, and monitor progress against established schedules.
Ensure accurate and timely project close date; adjust working schedules to ensure deadlines are met.
Identify and resolve conflicts within project teams and associated work; create contingency plans to mitigate risk.
Ensure inspections are completed periodically throughout the construction phases to ensure buildings meet specifications of clients.
Coordinates all activity between trades and suppliers.
Verify all onsite safety training for all new hires, including employees, trades and contractors. Ensuring all documentation is prepared and submitted as required in conjunction with Project Coordinators and CSO.
Conduct daily toolbox talks and ensure all sub-contracts submit daily hazard assessments.
Oversee performance of all trade contractors to ensure architectural and engineering drawings are being delivered with accuracy and to regulatory standards.
Recommending employee actions such as hiring, training, promotions, disciplinary and corrective measures to the Director of Operations and/or Project Manager.
Enforce all Doran Contractor policies and procedures.
All other duties as required.
Statement of Qualifications:
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Post-secondary Certificate in Civil Engineering Technologist, Engineering Degree or other formal Technical training that is relevant to the field.
A minimum of five years of work experience as a Construction Superintendent in the ICI sector, with demonstrated increased responsibility/supervisory work.
Prior experience with construction projects in ICI, such as condominiums, multi-story retirement homes, multi-unit apartment buildings, retail developments, large commercial turn-key buildings, commercial fit-ups or other similar projects is required.
Ability to professionally interact with design professionals, consultants and clients throughout the project.
Ability to read blueprints, schematics, field drawings and plans.
Strong communication, integration, problem-solving and interpersonal skills.
Ability to cope with high intensity and stressful environments.
Strong attention to detail.
Demonstrated success in project delivery and execution of project management methods.
Understanding fundamentals of contracts and experience in managing contractors under the terms of a contract.
A valid driver’s license is required as this requires travel to and from sites to the office.
Physical/Sensory Effort/ Work Environment
Loud and busy work environment
Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines
Standing and/or sitting for long periods of time.
Difficult weather conditions, working outdoors and on site.
Overtime as required.
Application

All candidates are asked to submit a resume and project list via the following link: taggartgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs. Any questions regarding the position can be directed to careers@taggart.ca.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

This position is also referred to as: site superintendent, site supervisor, site manager.

Accommodation/AODA:

The Taggart Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, physical or mental handicap, or financial ability.

In accordance with the Accessibility of Ontarian's with a Disabilities Act, we're committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation or special assistance, please sen an email to hr@taggart.ca with your request. Your information will be treated as confidential.

Company

The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Main Purpose & Function

The award-winning False Creek Neighbourhood Energy Utility (“NEU”) has a vacancy for a Project Engineer to assist with the expansion and operation of the City’s low carbon district energy system.

The NEU is an innovative low-carbon district heating system that provides space heat and domestic hot water to buildings in the False Creek neighbourhood. This system, which is owned and operated by the City of Vancouver, sources most of its energy from waste heat recovered from untreated sewage. It is the first of its kind in North America and has been the recipient of a number of awards. The NEU currently serves 5.7 million square feet of customer building floor area, and is forecast to grow to 22 million square feet by 2035. This system growth will require the addition of new sewage heat recovery capacity, boilers, hot water distribution pipes and energy transfer stations.

In addition, the NEU is working to transition to 100% renewable energy by 2030. This goal forms part of “Big Move 4” in the City’s Climate Emergency Response.

Reporting to a Senior Engineer, the Project Engineer provides the following key functions:
New Neighbourhood Energy Infrastructure Development:perform energy demand analysis, conceptual design, cost estimating, site services, design reviews, development and construction coordination, project management, and other related activities.
Neighbourhood Energy Operations: analyze system performance to improve efficiency and reliability, respond to customer issues, and other issues.
Specific Duties & Responsibilities

New Neighbourhood Energy Infrastructure Development
Supports the neighbourhood energy expansion planning including developing energy demand analysis, GHG forecasting, evaluating options for increasing low carbon energy generation capacity, performing extension tests and conceptual design of new systems, and updating and running scenarios in the NEU financial rate model.
Provides project management function with respect to capital expansions, including expansions of the energy generation capacity, pipe network and service connections.
Assists in the oversight of contractors and consultants and the management of contracts.
Reviews designs developed by consultants to ensure conformity to City standards and specifications; during construction, ensures new infrastructure conforms to designs/specifications and recommends design changes required to respond to field conditions.
Reviews building mechanical design by developer to ensure conformance to neighbourhood energy connection standards.
Estimates costs and schedule requirements of planned infrastructure, and analyzes costs of newly built infrastructure.
Analyzes energy demand and GHG emissions data from existing customers to inform infrastructure and business planning.
Coordinates infrastructure development with other Engineering Services infrastructure branches.
Neighbourhood Energy Operations
Collects system data and analyzes system performance, with a focus on improving efficiency and reliability.
Responds to technical issues that arise in day to day operations
Researches and suggests changes to equipment, control systems, operating protocols to ensure reliable, safe and efficient services.
Responds to customer/stakeholder inquiries regarding the system.
Engages in customer outreach to stratas, businesses, property managers, etc. to keep them informed regarding NEU services and value.
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned
Qualifications

Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, preferably with a focus on Mechanical, Civil, Environmental, Chemical or Process Engineering
Master’s degree in clean energy or sustainable energy considered an asset.
Registration or eligibility for registration as a P.Eng. or as an EIT with EGBC required
A minimum of 4 years of recent related experience
Experience in designing energy systems required; experience in hydronic heating/cooling systems and in green buildings would be an asset
Experience in utilization of SCADA systems and other analytical tools to evaluate and optimize system performance and efficiency
Experience in developing and managing budgets for infrastructure capital works.
Experience in procuring and managing technical consultants to deliver projects and studies
Experience in project and construction management; accredited project management training (e.g. PMP certification, tertiary qualification) would be an asset
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Engineering knowledge related to industry best practices for energy systems
Practical knowledge of infrastructure planning and asset management principles
Knowledge of standard office software applications
Strong analytical skills and a demonstrated ability to anticipate and manage multiple interacting and technically complex issues
Strong organizational and time management skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment with little supervision
Ability to build and maintain excellent working relationships with the public, outside agencies and other employees
Proactive/professional in addressing questions and concerns from stakeholders in a timely and effective manner
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a variety of interested parties
Business Unit/Department: Engineering Services (1300)

A high-visibility role in construction for a confident manager of people, resources and client expectations

Known for your accomplishments as a project manager related to the construction industry, and your ability to engage with senior executives and build credibility with clients, especially when dealing with mission-critical projects, you bring a breadth of skills, experience and emotional intelligence that inspires excellence and drives quality results. You are an exceptional communicator, able to manage relationships and performance, someone clients know they can count on to put in place the people, resources and processes required not only to deliver on project specifications but to meet their highest expectations.

Reporting to a Director, you will be responsible for planning, developing, delivering, and reporting on assigned projects within scope, schedule and budget, and in line with corporate and client procedural boundaries. Typically, projects, renovation projects, installations and/or new construction projects undertaken by you, such as new facilities and building additions, will be of high complexity and dollar value. As a Senior Project Manager, you may also be expected to work evenings and weekends, on occasion, and coordinate other project delivery team members in the delivery of programs, projects or large initiatives.

The diversity of projects carried out by the Design and Project Delivery Services group in a wide range of industries – retail, commercial, institutional and industrial – makes this position an exciting opportunity to be involved in different construction models, manage a variety of stakeholder interests, and continue to grow and deepen your knowledge base. You will be part of a Project Management team delivering services that span across all project phases, from workplace planning to pre-construction and design development, to management of construction. With 4,500+ projects managed per year, 160+ team members and $450M+ delivered annually, our group delivers projects across Canada, from small infrastructure upgrades to tenant fit-ups through to major consolidations and new builds, to energy retrofits and critical environments.

About the Company

For almost half a century, Van Horne has been serving as a general contractor in the construction industry. We have completed various sizes of projects of industrial, retail and office buildings, plants, banks, health care facilities, plazas and custom-built homes to renovations and additions.

The Position

The Quality Control Manager will assist the project’s Site Superintendent, Project Manager and Project Coordinator. It is essential for the position that they can multi-task, while maintaining complex schedules and managing administrative support. The ideal candidate for this job is resourceful, proactive, a good problem solver and organized. This position requires assuring a steady completion of workload in a timely manner.

Responsibilities Quality Control Manager

· Day to day execution of the Quality Plan

· Work with trade contractors to develop the Quality Plan and ensure quality workmanship on site.

· Maintain quality records on site.

· Facilitating quality inspections by the DCC Representative (Client)

· Report to the supervisor and the DCC Representative on the quality process for the project.

· The Quality Management Plan (QMP) structure shall have three phases of control as defined as:

o QMP Quality Planning

o QMP Quality Control

o QMP Quality Assurance

· Coordination of the Quality Planning process shall be the responsibility of the Quality Manager

· Maintain an effective shop drawing verification and approval system

· Coordination of the Quality Assurance process shall be the responsibility of the Quality Manager

· Verify maintenance instruction, maintenance materials, spare pmts, special tools have been assembled for transfer to the DCC Representative

· After the start of construction, conduct weekly QC meetings. The QC Manager is to prepare the minutes of the meeting and provide a copy to the DCC Representative within two working days after the meeting. The DCC Representative will typically attend these meetings. As a minimum, accomplish the following at each meeting:

o Review the minutes of the previous meeting

o Review the schedule and the status of work and rework

o Review the status of submittals

o Review the work to be accomplished in the next two weeks and the documentation required

o Resolved QC and production problems

o Address items that may require revising the QC plan

o Review the status of training completion

o Review QC Plan and Progress

· The QC Manager shall maintain current and complete records of on-site and off-site QC program operations and activities.

· Liaison between site and main office (documentation, health/safety, etc.)

· Post all Health & Safety and other important documents around the site

· Preparing and submitting daily/weekly time sheets, expense reports & document control

· Understand the project scope of work and all specifications

· Administers and maintains highly confidential and specialized information and records.

Candidate Requirements:
The QC Manager must be a graduate of a accredited degree or diploma program in one of the following disciplines: Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management, Engineering Technology or Building Construction, with work experience as a project superintendent, QC Manager, Project Manager, Project Engineer or Construction Manager on similar size and type construction contracts which include the major trades that are part of this contract. The individual must be familiar with the requirements and have experience in the areas of hazard identification and safety compliance.
Sound oral and written communication skills,
Proficiency in MS Office with expertise in Microsoft Word, Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel; and Lotus notes
Ability to analyze and revise operating practices to improve efficiency
Detail oriented and comfortable working in a fast-paced office environment
Superior organization skills and dedication to completing projects in a timely manner
Ability to learn new terms and skill sets
· Works in a team environment

As the JSS Market Manager for the Fort McMurray region, you will be responsible for developing key partnerships through driving in-field conversions, trial and brand awareness which directly impacts our market share in your region of responsibility. You will work closely with our Sales and Key Account Teams to facilitate end user conversions through partnering with Key End User Partners and distribution partners. You will also be tasked with the development and execution of a regional plan which targets and converts strategic users and enhances brand awareness in your territory. You will possess the passion, drive and charisma necessary to deal directly with end-users on jobsites, in tool cribs and training facilities. Job Title: Construction Superintendent (road construction and/or water and sewermain installations)
Job Description:
To supervise and oversee construction project(s) from start to finish, and provide direction and guidance to foreperson, subcontractors and workers to ensure a safe and productive workplace. The position is responsible for cost controls, completion of daily tasks/milestones, payment for work completed and ultimately the successful completion of the project.

Job Duties include, but not limited to:
Schedule, organize, and direct the construction activities in accordance with the OHSA, FCCL’s H&S Policy and project requirements.
Instruct all job personnel in a clear, concise manner on all construction and safety aspects of the job when directing work tasks.
Work with the Project Manager to plan the work sequence using specifications, drawings and site conditions for effective safety-conscious production.
Strive to maximize the profitability of each job by minimizing costs and motivating crew productivity.
Ensure that next day requirements for labour, equipment and supplies are ordered and communicated to the staff.
Complete work with attention to detail to produce a quality product.
Complete daily diary notes to document changes, direction and productions.
Maintain safe equipment operation on site.
Liaise with onsite inspectors, owners’ representatives, enforcement officers, and the public.
Complete the work in accordance to the applicable contract, contract drawings, specifications and budget.
Conduct yourself in a professional/mature manner.
Report on productions, payments and regular tracking on a daily basis to the Project Manager.

Qualifications:
2-5 years of experience working as a Construction Superintendent.
Professional designation (Gold Seal or P. Eng. or CET) is an asset, but is not a requirement.
Computer literate (Word, Excel, Project, etc…).
Strong organizational/analytical skills with clear oral and written communication abilities.
Exceptional organizational abilities with task prioritization, multi-tasking, use of timelines and time management techniques.
Strong work ethic and the ability to work cooperatively with other staff.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Must be able to work with little supervision; must be self-directed.
Maintain a valid driver’s license.

Work Conditions:
Travel to various sites will be required (vehicle will be provided).
Indoor and outdoor environments; various weather conditions.
Weekend and evening work may be required to meet the demands of the position.
Laptop and mobile phone will be provided.

About QuadReal

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company. QuadReal manages the real estate and mortgage programs of British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI), one of Canadas largest asset managers with a $153.4 billion portfolio.

QuadReal manages a $37.6 billion portfolio spanning 23 Global Cities across 17 countries. The company seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come.

QuadReal: Excellence lives here.

www.quadreal.com

The in-house development team at QuadReal is committed to advancing its development program while being guided by a long-term vision, focused on thoughtful and responsible execution. We focus on supporting and growing our relationships while being respectful, open, and transparent. We value key stakeholders (community, city staff, political, consultants/contractors/service providers) as our trusted partners.

Role Description

Based in Toronto, ON, the Manager, Development Construction will report to the Vice President, Development and will work extensively with all members of QuadReals eastern Canadian development team, with projects in Ontario and Quebec. Duties for this role include: supporting for the overall development project management and assistance with project conception to execution and closeout, coordinate with the necessary permitting authorities for the receipt of regulatory permits for these projects, preparing presentation materials (written and graphic) to support senior management, and coordinating with various third-party consultants. QuadReals projects encompass all asset types including multi-family residential (rental and condominium), industrial, retail, mixed-use, and office.

More specific duties will include:
Support the construction engineering, planning, and design for new or expansion projects;
Prepare reports, review specifications, conduct technical analysis to fully define the design requirements, equipment and services required on new, expansion and remodeling projects;
Responsible for soliciting the services of architects, engineers, and consultants, and then for developing, executing and managing those contracts;
Negotiate contracts with General Contractors and trade contractors and present formal documentation for approval when required;
Ensure that contracts are fit for purpose, cost effective and incorporate appropriate Service Level Agreements;
Have a thorough understanding of, overall site management, coordination, planning, specification of business proposals and coordination of subcontractors; for large scale construction projects.
Coordinate directly with Asset Management to conceive and execute the development strategies for our properties;
Work with construction and accounting to prepare and track budgets and schedules for each project and will manage each project within the approved project budget and schedule;
Complete ongoing analysis on key components of the development, including sensitivity analyses, and identifying key issues impacting profitability;
Track comparable and competing development activity across property types;
Coordination with project consultants including planning, architectural, legal, etc.; and,
Prepare regular progress reports on existing development projects.
Experience
A minimum of 5 years' experience within development and construction
Understanding and experience with permitting process in Toronto and the surrounding areas
Experience completing high end commercial and residential construction projects.
A bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering or Construction Management.
Demonstrable experience with essential development contracts such as contracts for architectural services, engineering services, and general contracting services.
Demonstrable experience with permitting agencies, either as an architect or owners' project manager.
Fluent reading architectural and engineering plans for residential real estate
Computer Skills Highly functional capabilities in utilizing Excel, Argus Enterprise, PowerPoint, and Word.
Communication and Collaboration Skills Superior English writing and oral communication skills; ability to develop and sustain collaborative and effective working relationships with all personalities; ability to exercise discretion and strict confidentiality.
Organizational Skills and Work Habits Ability to take initiative and own your responsibilities to produce high quality work product with minimal supervision; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fluid and dynamic work environment dedicated to excellence; ability to prioritize multiple demands, allocate time effectively, work under pressure, and meet tight deadlines; flexible and adaptive to new ideas and constant changes; ability to focus on the detail to produce accurate and reliable work product while also grasping the bigger picture; possess intellectual curiosity and a strong desire to learn and develop.
Embrace and pro-actively support QuadReals company values and culture of environmental sustainability, and corporate and social responsibility.

CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for a Senior Project Manager for an upcoming program in Windsor, Ontario.

As a Senior Project Manager, you will be called to provide expert level project and program management for a multi-billon dollar critical infrastructure program. The role will include providing senior project leadership under a Director of Project Management in an EPMO and construction team responsible for owner-side oversight.

Please note that the purpose of this job posting is to constitute an application bank for possible needs of our client.

Responsibilities

Initiate, plan, and execute the Project Agreement.

Prepare quarterly key milestones for the EPMO team to provide clarity and to monitor progress.
Develop a WBS, budgets (costs, forecasts, trends, etc), schedule (level I-V on MS Project and/or P6), month end reports;
Review, analyze, implement and maintain project controls in line with BNA and maintain an audit plan with content in KPIs.
Manage an effective change management processes within the project management governance framework.
Provide guidance to stakeholders in seeking solutions to for ensure the proper management and successful execution of projects based on the delivery method established in the contract;
Follow-up and control of project activities (forecasting dates, updating hours on tasks, earned value, percentage complete, resource management/over allocation);

Attend meetings, prepare correspondence, reports, presentations and such other contract documents as may be required.
There is a potential requirement for consultation with the client and its Owner’s Engineer, and the various Stakeholders on the project. The Sr. PM will support this interaction and facilitate discussion as needed.
Take part in and draft the minutes of meetings;
Other project management services as may be identified over time.

Profile

Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent.
Minimum of 15 years of experience in a project management leadership position with extensive demonstrated success of delivering large-scale infrastructure projects.
Excellent organizational, analytical and problem-solving abilities, with exceptional initiative and attention to detail.
Sound professional judgement, initiative and ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple priorities to meet deadlines in a fast passed, deadline oriented and dynamic environment.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
Solid, proven organizational, project management and leadership skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to successfully and collaborative work within a team environment and across disciplines as well as work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills that support building internal/external relationships including communication and interfacing with VP and C-suite.

Why join CIMA+?

The key to our delivery of quality services is being able to attract and maintain satisfied and engaged people. At CIMA+, employees are given the flexibility required to ensure a balanced life and fulfilling work experience in a motivating work environment. Our staff enjoy the diversity of projects and the extensive autonomy given to interact directly with clients. Such proximity is possible because of our flat corporate structure, and it translates into relationships of trust, and effective communications between team members and clients.

At CIMA+ we are committed to creating opportunities for all our employees so that they may develop, progress, and contribute to the business regardless of differences. We fully respect the principles of employment equity and encourage women, visible minorities, indigenous people, and persons with disabilities to apply. Alternative options are available upon request to facilitate participation in the recruitment process.

We are seeking an experienced Human Resources/Professional Development Manager for our Saskatchewan District offices located in Regina and Saskatoon. This is a single position that will support both offices with home location being either office.

Supervises, directs, coaches, trains, and mentors HRPD team, including direct and indirect reports.

Values, models, and coaches the solution provider and profitability culture.

Seen as a trusted advisor with superior relationship management skills and the ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders and decision makers.

Able to apply advanced HR knowledge to define HRPD best practices and procedures.
Strong business acumen, with an understanding of industry practices and new developments.
Able to use information and data to interpret, analyze, and recommend strategic solutions.
Able to work independently or in a team environment in a highly matrixed organization.
Able to effectively manage a team comprising of entry to mid-level seasoned human resources professionals.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to negotiate, influence, and present ideas and content that contribute to the district strategy.

Strong networking skills. Able to develop and maintain a HR networks.

TRIO (Translational Research in Oncology) is an academic clinical research organization that is dedicated to advancing translational cancer research by pursuing forward innovative and targeted therapeutic concepts in the clinical trial setting. We are committed to providing treatments of the future to the world of today.

TRIO's head office is in Edmonton, Alberta with operations all throughout Canada, the USA, France and Uruguay. TRIO is looking for a Senior Clinical Project Manager to join the Project Management team in the Edmonton office or home-based in Canada or the USA.

Responsibilities

A Senior Clinical Project Manager typically manages one trial and assists a Global Project Coordinator on another trial with the following responsibilities:

Define trial timelines and resources,
Coordination of the overall conduct of the trial,
Organization of regular teleconferences with other TRIO departments in order to ensure alignment on trial status, priorities and upcoming milestones,
Reporting to the Sponsor on trial progress (through phone conferences/reports),
Define operational trial documents/processes and preparation of global communications to sites/CRAs,
Preparation of training material and presentation to sites and CRAs on the trial/global calls,
Actively coaching direct reports to grow and achieve effective performance within their respective roles,
Oversight of trial activity performed by PM team members and follow-up on metrics associated with the activity performed,
Oversight of the activity performed by Third Party Organizations (TPOs) at the trial level and country level,
Quality Controls (QCs) of the files at the trial level and follow-up with other PM team members until resolution of any issue detected during these QCs,
Data QCs in order to guarantee adequate data quality prior to database lock/freeze,
Identify the need for performing Change Orders when the scope of activity changes on the trial,
Support to finance on-site fees payments questions and site fee reconciliation,
Participation in Sponsor audits, preparation of answers to audit findings at the trial level; support to the Study Managers in answering site audit findings.

Qualifications:
Minimum Bachelors degree with a scientific focus.
Minimum 5 years of experience in monitoring or coordination of clinical projects.
Strong oncology knowledge and trial experience
(at least 5 years' experience working on oncology trials).
Excellent knowledge of ICH/GCP
Experienced in managing staff, remotely and in the office.
Advanced proficiency in MS Office specifically in Word, Excel, MS Project and PowerPoint.
Excellent communication skills, both in written and oral.
Ability to present in public and to interact with Sponsors.

What we can offer you

Competitive salary
3 weeks of vacation
10 personal days
5% RRSP contributions by TRIO
Life, health, & dental premiums paid by TRIO.
Monthly transportation allowance or Internet Allowance

We thank all candidates for their interest; only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

JOB DESCRIPTION

JOB TITLE: EASTERN CANADA SALES SUPPORT ENGINEER

DEPARTMENT: CANADA EAST DIVISION

LOCATION: OTTAWA, ON

SUPERVISOR: MARKET MANAGER

SUBORDINATES: NONE

STATUS: FULL-TIME/EXEMPT

REVISION DATE: DECEMBER 12, 2019

THE MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES OF THIS POSITION INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:

• DEVELOP ESTIMATES, PROJECT SCHEDULES, AND PROPOSALS FOR CONSTRUCTION / ENGINEERING PROJECTS
• WORK WITH ESTABLISHED CLIENTS TO DETERMINE THEIR NEEDS WITH RESPECT TO STEBBINS LINE OF WORK. THIS CAN INCLUDE FORMAL REQUESTS FOR QUOTATIONS FOR REPAIR OR CAPITAL WORK FROM CLIENTS
• MAKE JOB SITE/CUSTOMER VISITS TO OBTAIN INFORMATION REQUIRED FOR PRICING WORK, INCLUDING SCHEDULE AND SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED AND TO OBSERVE CLIENT EQUIPMENT TO DETERMINE THE NEED FOR MAINTENANCE
• WORK WITH DIVISIONAL PERSONNEL TO PREPARE AND ISSUE PROPOSALS
• CORRESPOND WITH CUSTOMER WITH REGARDS TO THE PROPOSAL TO MORE SUITABLY DEFINE THE SCOPE AND PRICE WITH THE GOAL OF OBTAINING A CONTRACT
• RESPONSIBLE FOR PROJECT EXECUTION UTILIZING CORPORATE SERVICES INCLUDING THE ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT, PURCHASING DEPARTMENT, AND OTHER OPERATIONS GROUPS AS WELL AS THE CONSTRUCTION DEPARTMENT FOR LARGER JOBS
• WORK WITH THE SUPERINTENDENT AND/OR CONSTRUCTION MANAGER TO ENSURE THE PROJECT IS GOING WELL AND WITHIN BUDGET, THAT QUALITY IS MAINTAINED, AND ALL STEBBINS' SAFETY PROCEDURES ARE BEING FOLLOWED
• DEVELOP A POSITIVE RELATIONSHIP WITH AND ACTIVELY SEEK WORK WITH OUR CUSTOMERS
• COLD CALL ON POTENTIAL FUTURE CUSTOMERS AND ASSIST WITH COMPANY GROWTH
• OTHER TASKS AS ASSIGNED BY DIVISION MANAGER.

EMPLOYMENT STANDARDS: MUST BE ABLE TO FOLLOW PRESCRIBED OFFICE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND OBEY ALL SAFETY RULES. MAINTAIN CONFIDENTIALITY OF SENSITIVE AND CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION. MAINTAIN A BUSINESS-LIKE PROFESSIONAL APPEARANCE IN MANNER AND ATTIRE AT ALL TIMES.

EDUCATION NEEDED TO PERFORM JOB DUTIES: BACHELOR’S DEGREE, OR ASSOCIATE’S DEGREE WITH CONSTRUCTION EXPERIENCE OR AT LEAST 10 YEARS STEBBINS' EXPERIENCE.

SKILLS/EXPERIENCE NEEDED TO PERFORM JOB DUTIES: BILINGUAL (ENGLISH / FRENCH) IS ESSENTIAL; ABILITY TO TRAVEL THROUGHOUT CANADA (SOME INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL MAY BE REQUIRED); STRONG MATH BACKGROUND; COMPUTER LITERATE; DRAWING AND BLUE PRINT READING; STRONG COMMUNICATION SKILLS; ACCURACY; ESTIMATING; ABILITY TO MAKE DECISIONS ACCORDING TO POLICIES AND PROCEDURES; ABLE TO MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER EMPLOYEES AND CUSTOMERS; ABILITY TO UNDERSTAND AND CARRY OUT INSTRUCTIONS; THE ABILITY TO HANDLE RESPONSIBILITY WITH LIMITED SUPERVISION; STRONG INTERPERSONAL COMMUNICATION, AND ORGANIZATIONAL SKILLS.

SOFTWARE EXPERIENCE / SKILL REQUIRED:
MICROSOFT OFFICE (MS WORD, EXCEL, & OUTLOOK)
MICROSOFT PROJECT
ADOBE ACROBAT

EXPERIENCE NEEDED TO PERFORM JOB: ENGINEERING, SALES, AND CONSTRUCTION RELATED EXPERIENCE PREFERRED

EQUIPMENT USED: PERSONAL COMPUTER, TELEPHONE, COPIER, JOB SITE EQUIPMENT, SAFETY EQUIPMENT, COMPANY VEHICLE.

ANTICIPATED TRAINING PERIOD: 1 -2 YEARS

WORKING CONDITIONS: A REGULAR OFFICE ENVIRONMENT AND CONSTRUCTION / HEAVY INDUSTRY JOBSITE ENVIRONMENT. TRAVEL IS REQUIRED 30-50% OF TIME

LICENSES/CERTIFICATION REQUIRED: DRIVER’S LICENSE WITH CLEAN DRIVING RECORD, PASSPORT, ABILITY TO PASS A CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECK (REQUIRED FOR CANADIAN MINING SITES)

ACCOUNTABILITIES: RESPONSIBLE FOR TIMELY AND ACCURATE COMPLETION OF ALL ASSIGNED DUTIES AND SCHEDULES.

JOB DEMANDS: STANDING, WALKING, SITTING, TALKING, READING, LIFTING, BENDING, CARRYING, CLIMBING, REACHING, SPEAKING, SEEING, HEARING, PROBLEM SOLVING, ALERTNESS, MEMORY, FINGER/HAND DEXTERITY, WORKING IN EXCESS OF REGULAR WORK WEEK, DOMESTIC TRAVEL (POTENTIAL OF INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL), PHONE CONTACT, MEETING DEADLINES, INTERACTION WITH STAFF AND CUSTOMERS.

NOTE: THE COMPANY REALIZES THAT IT IS DIFFICULT TO LIST ALL THE COMPONENTS OF A JOB AND THAT THERE WILL BE A REVIEW OF THIS JOB DESCRIPTION PERIODICALLY IN AN EFFORT TO KEEP IT UP-TO-DATE AND COMPLETE
Company Description
Stebbins is a well-established, international corporation specializing in the specification, design and installation of protective linings for process and storage vessels, together with complete tank and chest installations of reinforced concrete/masonry for the storage and processing of corrosive liquids. Stebbins' business initially consisted of the supervision and construction of complete pulp and paper mills. Currently, Stebbins provides chemical resistant tanks and linings throughout the US and around the world for several industries: the power industry, coal industry, pulp and paper industry, mining industry and the chemical industry. Stebbins is the recognized leader in this field. Consisting of four offices across the US with the headquarters in Watertown NY and three offices in Canada, along with other foreign offices in Australia, South Africa, New Zealand, Chile, and South Korea.

STEBBINS provides a broad benefits package to it's full-time employees including a Defined Benefit Pension Plan, medical insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, travel accident insurance, and an employee assistance program.

At Sierra Pacific Industries, we understand our greatest strength is the people who choose to build a career with us.

And, what does it mean to be part of the Sierra Pacific family? It means you are a valued team member and part of a growing third-generation family-owned forest products company built on hard work, innovation, and wise investments.
With over 5,000 crew members in over 30 states, Sierra Pacific offers many opportunities for personal and professional growth; from entry-level to skilled trades, from truck drivers to sales managers, from foresters to engineers – for everyone! We invite you to learn more about our history, our 2 million acres of forestlands, and our state-of-the-art wood product and window manufacturing facilities at http://www.spi-ind.com/Home/AboutUs/.

Currently, we are seeking a qualified individual to serve as a Commercial Territory Manager to sell windows and doors to our customers, factory direct, within key markets of our Los Angeles sales area.

About the Position
• Sell factory direct wood/clad window and door products
• Prepare and deliver timely quotes
• Build and maintain business relationships
• Create and maintain a solid customer base
• Ability to identify potential customers
• Knowledge of territory construction activity
• Ability to successfully cold call
• Help the customers identify their needs
• Meet or exceed the customers’ expectations

Qualifications
• 2 to 4 years sales experience required, prior experience in construction and window sales a plus
• Working knowledge of residential construction practices preferred
• Window and door product knowledge a plus
• Construction Industry knowledge preferred
• Familiar with commercial/architectural community
• Ability to read and interpret construction blueprints and specifications
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Proficient computer and math skills
• Organized, self-motivated, attention to detail
• Must thrive in competitive environment

Why Join Our Team?
Because this is more than an invitation, it's a commitment to offer opportunities for personal and professional growth to everyone! We ask people to grow with us and make the company even better.

We provide an excellent benefit package including a full Health Benefits Plan with low cost premiums, a 401(k) with Company Match, additional Retirement Contributions, and company paid Life Insurance.

In addition, for over 38 years, the Sierra Pacific Foundation has provided scholarships to help the children of our crew members with education expenses. Each year, we give an average of $500,000 in scholarships.

How To Apply

If you are qualified and would like to join our team, please send a cover letter referencing this position and a resume to:

Sierra Pacific Windows
Nancy Jones, Human Resources
PO Box 8489
Red Bluff, CA 96080
(530) 527-9620
